Name: Fontbonne University
Overview:
Fontbonne University, situated in St. Louis, USA, is a renowned institute offering a range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs. These programs cater to various fields of study, including business, and the university also offers online degree options for distance education students. The institution's main campus is based in St. Louis, with a choice of 7 undergraduate programs and 17 postgraduate programs for students to choose from.

The tuition fees at Fontbonne University vary for international and domestic students depending on their chosen course of study. On average, the estimated cost of tuition and fees for international students is $13,998, excluding any additional expenses.

Fontbonne University is committed to providing financial assistance to its students, including scholarships, work-study opportunities, and other funding options. The university also has a dedicated Career Planning Service team that assists students with building their resumes and finding suitable jobs upon completion of their degree. This service extends to helping students secure part-time jobs, internships, and even summer jobs. 

Explore more about Fontbonne University and its offerings on Leap Scholar and find the perfect program to align with your academic and career aspirations.
Eligibility Overview:
The below are the requirements for gaining admission into the Eckelkamp College of Global Business and Professional Studies:

1) Applicants must hold a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting or an equivalent qualification.

2) A minimum undergraduate Grade Point Average (GPA) of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale is required, with a GMAT test score of at least 475 from a test taken within the past five years. However, this criteria may be waived if one of the following conditions is met:

(a) The applicant has completed an undergraduate degree from a program accredited by AACSB or ACBSP, with a cumulative GPA of 3.3 or higher within the last five years.

(b) The applicant has a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in a subject requiring significant analytical or quantitative work, such as business, economics, engineering, statistics, computer science, or law.

3) A self-statement of 300-500 words is required, explaining why the applicant needs to pursue a graduate accounting degree from Fontbonne University.

4) An updated resume should be submitted along with the application.

5) Applicants who are not native English speakers must provide proof of English language proficiency. This can be demonstrated by presenting TOEFL or IELTS exam results (or an equivalent that is accepted by Fontbonne University). A minimum TOEFL IBT score of 71 or IELTS score of 6.0 is necessary.

All applications will be evaluated based on the availability of the program. Complete applications must be submitted at least 14 days prior to the start of the first term in which the applicant wants to enroll.

Name: University of West Florida - Emerald Coast
Overview:
First founded in 1903, the University of Victoria is situated in British Columbia, Canada. Formerly known as Victoria College under the affiliation of McGill University, it gained full autonomy in 1963. The prestigious university holds accreditation from both AACSB (Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business) and EQUIS (EFMD Quality Improvement System). It caters to over 21,593 students at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels, enrolling a diverse population of international students. The university's impressive infrastructure and highly qualified faculty have made it a sought-after educational institution.

One of the distinctive features of the University of Victoria is its Division of Continuing Studies, which provides students with a variety of educational opportunities to pursue. Students can opt for a university degree, explore a new career path, or even obtain a professional designation. The division offers more than 200 credit and non-credit courses, including popular subjects such as Business studies, Environmental and Occupational Health, foreign languages, Ocean Acoustic Monitoring, teaching courses, Wound Management for Health Professionals, and others.

As per the QS World University Rankings 2022, the University of Victoria ranks at 236th position among all universities, holding a sterling 5-star rating. Currently, the university has a significant number of international students, which is testament to its global standing. To attract more students, the university maintains a competitive acceptance rate and constantly strives to enhance its academic offerings.

The university maintains a healthy student-faculty ratio of 16:1, ensuring that students receive personalized attention. With a high graduation rate of 65.9%, the university takes immense pride in its students' achievements. The international tuition fees may seem steep, ranging from $20,000 to $25,000, but the university ensures that it provides high-quality education and strong employment prospects.

The University of Victoria has a robust placement program, evidenced by its successful alumni and the consistent updates for relevant job opportunities on the college website. With a special section solely dedicated to placements, students stay updated on employment offers and get guidance throughout their academic journey.

Name: Central Washington University
Overview:
Established in 1891, Central Washington University (CWU) was originally known as the Washington State Normal School, and in 1937, it gained the prestigious status of a university. Accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities, this public institution is located in Ellensburg, Washington, and boasts an impressive acceptance rate of 85%, making it one of the top 25 public schools in the country. CWU comprises of eight campuses spread across various locations in Washington, apart from the expansive 380-acre main campus in Ellensburg. The university offers an extensive range of programs including 135 undergraduate, 34 postgraduate, online, and Summer programs through its four distinguished colleges, namely the College of Business, College of Sciences, College of Arts and Humanities, and College of Education and Professional Studies. With top disciplines such as Chemistry, Education, Physics, Criminal Justice, Health Sciences, Psychology, Social Sciences, Computer Science, Law, Business, and Mathematics, CWU has something for every student. 

On-campus housing at CWU is a popular choice among students, offering accommodation in 19 residential halls and four fully-equipped apartments with single, double, and triple occupancy rooms. The university provides a range of amenities such as Wi-Fi, laundry facilities, lounges, and study areas. CWU has several other facilities including a bookstore, library, Recreation Center, Veteran Center, dining options, and a radio station. With over 125 student clubs and organizations, 23 sports clubs, and 13 varsity teams, students at CWU have endless opportunities to explore their interests and passions. 

At Central Washington University, preparing students for successful careers is a top priority. This is reflected in the university's impressive graduation rate of 64% and the fact that 93% of graduates secure employment within two years of graduation, with an average annual salary of 44,900 USD. CWU offers several resources to help students kickstart their careers, such as mock interviews, career fairs, and workshops. 

For international students, the average undergraduate tuition fee at CWU is 23,262 USD. However, the university awards merit-based scholarships of up to 12,500 USD, easing the financial burden of studying abroad. CWU is committed to providing students with a well-rounded education and a transformative college experience, making it an excellent choice for students seeking an enriching academic journey.
Eligibility Overview:
According to the language proficiency requirements for the university, applicants must have a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 79 or above. This score can be obtained by taking the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) and registering through the TOEFL website at www.toefl.org. When registering, applicants can also request their scores to be delivered to the university. The designated school code for Central Washington University is #4044. Additionally, a TOEFL computer-based score of 213 or higher will also be accepted. For the internet-based TOEFL, applicants must have a score of 79 or higher. For online English programs, a minimum TOEFL score of 88 is required. Please note that the Graduate School does not accept photocopies or the "examinee copy" of scores, institutional TOEFL scores, or scores that are more than two years old. 

Other than the TOEFL, applicants may also submit an International English Language Testing System (IELTS) score of 6.5 or higher. The score should not be more than two years old at the time of application. Lastly, for the Duolingo English test, a minimum score of 105 is required. This information is important for applicants looking to apply to the university and must be taken into consideration during the application process.

Name: University of Alabama
Overview:
The University of Alabama, located in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, is a renowned public research institution that was established in 1831. Boasting an 83% acceptance rate, the university has a vast student body of over 37,842 students enrolled in various undergraduate, graduate, and professional programs offered by its 13 esteemed schools and colleges. These include the College of Arts & Sciences, College of Education, School of Law, and College of Engineering, among others. With its diverse range of programs (comprising of 70 undergraduates and 120 graduates), such as Accounting, Communicative Disorders, Geology, Hospitality Management, and Music Composition, the University of Alabama provides exceptional academic opportunities to its students. To cater to the needs of distance learners, the university offers over 70 online degree programs at all levels. It also has distinctive academic programs like the Emerging Scholars Program, UA Early College, and Academic Common Market. Another remarkable aspect of the university is its Education Abroad program, which affords students the opportunity to study in more than 60 countries worldwide. 

The estimated cost of attendance for undergraduate students is approximately USD 25,216 for in-state students and USD 44,686 for out-of-state students. Students seeking financial aid can apply for various funding options like loans, scholarships, grants, and work-study programs by submitting the Free Application for Federal Student Aid. Among these, some notable financial aid options include the Federal Direct Subsidized/Unsubsidized Stafford Loan, Federal Grad PLUS Loan, and Federal Pell Grant. The university also provides on and off-campus job opportunities for its students. By offering such diverse academic and financial opportunities, the University of Alabama remains committed to making quality education accessible to all deserving students.
Eligibility Overview: According to the admissions criteria at the University of Alabama, applicants are required to have a GPA of 3.71 or above and be above average in their high school class. It is recommended to have a combination of A's and B's, with a preference for more A's to demonstrate the ability to handle more challenging coursework than the typical high school student. If an applicant's GPA is below the 3.71 requirement, taking advanced courses such as AP or IB can help to compensate for this. However, for juniors or seniors, it may be challenging to improve their GPA in time for college applications. In such cases, a higher SAT or ACT score can be used to boost their application and stand out against other applicants with higher GPAs. While the University of Alabama claims to have no specific SAT score cutoff, their average SAT score for admitted students is between 1060 and 1280, with a score of 1060 placing an applicant below average and a score of 1280 indicating above-average performance.

Data for the university SEEK program eligibility requirements in New York State:

To qualify for the SEEK program, you must meet the following conditions: 
- Reside legally in New York State for at least one year before starting college 
- Hold a high school diploma or have completed a state-approved equivalent program 
- Be a first-time freshman or have previously been enrolled in either the Higher Education Opportunities Program (HEOP) or Equality Opportunity Program (EOP) 
- Be accepted into one of CSI's Associate degree programs at the time of application, with the exception of general baccalaureate programs; however, individuals who can demonstrate proficiency in reading, writing, and math may still be considered for the baccalaureate level via SEEK admission.

All applicants seeking admission to the Percy Ellis Sutton SEEK program must meet the economic requirements outlined by the state of New York.

Name: University of the Pacific - Stockton
Overview: Incorporated in 1851, the University of the Pacific (UOP) is a private Methodist university formerly known as the College of the Pacific and California Wesleyan College. Accredited by the WASC, UOP's Stockton campus offers students the opportunity to live close to prominent destinations such as Napa Valley, Sacramento, San Francisco, and Yosemite. The university is home to various schools including Benerd College, Thomas J. Long School of Pharmacy, Eberhardt School of Business, and the Conservatory of Music. In the fall of 2020, UOP had an undergraduate enrollment of 3,524 students. Operating on a semester-based academic calendar, UOP maintains a 71% acceptance rate and follows highly selective admission procedures. Half of all admitted students boast an ACT score of 22-30 or an SAT score between 1080-1340. UOP has a favorable student-to-faculty ratio of 14:1, with 44.4% of classes featuring fewer than 20 students. According to U.S. News & World Report, the university offers premier admission practices and received 13,545 freshman applications in 2018. However, only 8,598 candidates were granted admission, representing 65% of the total number of applicants. Tuition fees at UOP range between $50,000-$55,000. The university has a 2020 rank of 136 among National Universities according to U.S. News & World Report. Reportedly, 72% of full-time undergraduate students receive need-based financial aid averaging $30,000-$35,000. Notable alumni of UOP include Scott Boras, renowned baseball agent and founder of Boras Corp., and billionaire Alex Spanos. The median starting salary for alumni of UOP hovers around $55,000-$56,000.
Eligibility Overview:
The University of the Pacific (UoP) is currently seeking applications from students who demonstrate exceptional academic abilities, initiative, maturity, good character, and a genuine eagerness for learning through their previous accomplishments. Admission is highly competitive, and each candidate is evaluated based on a personalized assessment of various factors. The university aims to attract students from diverse ethnic, religious, economic, and geographical backgrounds.

For the most recent information on all policies discussed in the following section of this catalog, please refer to the Office of Admission website at www.pacific.edu/admission.html.

Name: American University of Health Sciences
Overview:
American University of Health Sciences, located in Los Angeles, USA, is a prestigious university that offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various fields. It also offers online degree programs for students pursuing distance education. The focus of the university is on Medicine, with its main campus located in Los Angeles. With over 2 undergraduate programs and 1 postgraduate program, the university provides quality education to its students. The estimated cost for international and domestic students may vary depending on the course they choose to study. The average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenses, is approximately 1572383 for international students. At American University of Health Sciences, financial aid options such as scholarships, work-study programs, and other funding opportunities are available for students. The university also offers the services of a Career Planning team that assists students in creating a strong CV and securing employment opportunities after graduation, including part-time jobs, summer internships, and full-time positions.

Spanning across 84 acres, American University of Health Sciences boasts a picturesque campus in Los Angeles, designed by renowned architect Frederick Law Olmsted. It features academic buildings, nine residence halls, and a beautiful outdoor amphitheater with a seating capacity of 5,000 students. As recognized by the American Public Garden Association, the campus is considered a public garden and arboretum, surrounded by lush greenery. On-campus facilities include comfortable student housing designed in the style of apartments, providing students with a homely environment. The campus is conveniently located near popular cafes and eateries, as well as general stores, ATMs, stationery shops, and pharmacies, making it easily accessible to students. American University of Health Sciences offers a serene and conducive learning atmosphere, equipped with all necessary amenities for students' convenience.
Eligibility Overview: The university requires applicants to meet certain qualifications before they can be admitted to their programs. These requirements include a minimum GPA of 3.0, standardized test scores (such as the SAT or ACT), and transcripts from previous education. In addition to academic requirements, international students are also required to provide proof of English proficiency through examinations such as TOEFL. Furthermore, certifications in finance are highly recommended for students interested in finance-related programs. All financial transactions, including application fees and tuition deposits, must be paid in US currency using money orders, cashier's checks from US banks, or international postal orders. These specific guidelines must be followed to ensure a smooth application process.

Name: Kaplan International Languages - Chicago
Overview:
Kaplan International Languages – the hub for Chicago’s prestigious shopping district, the Magnificent Mile, is ideally situated opposite the Tribune Tower. Students will find that this location is easily accessible due to its proximity to various transport links. The Metra, “L”-train, and water taxi stops are all within a walking distance of 10 minutes or less, while two bus stops are conveniently located nearby. The institute holds accreditation from the highly reputable Accrediting Council for Continuing Education and Training (ACCET) and offers a wide range of English courses, including Exam Preparation, Long-Term, Business, and Flexible courses. In fact, Kaplan International Languages – Chicago is the perfect place to enhance one's English skills, receive quality education, and experience the vibrant culture of Chicago. 

The Flexible English Courses are highly adaptive with short-term options ranging from one week to a whole year, allowing students to tailor their course to their specific needs. The Long-Term English Courses, on the other hand, span over 20 weeks and offer both General and Intensive programs. In addition to these, the institute also offers Business English Courses that are flexible in duration and tailored for professionals seeking to improve their language skills. And for those with an upcoming exam, look no further than Kaplan International Languages – Chicago's Exam Preparation Courses, which boast a success rate of high test scores.

What makes Kaplan International Languages stand out is its two well-equipped classrooms and inviting student lounges, where minds come together to study and socialize. With an average of 160 students and a staggering 96.5% recommendation rate, the institute is known for its excellent services and a friendly, multilingual team proficient in five languages including French, Italian, Russian, Turkish, and Arabic. Moreover, Kaplan International Languages – Chicago also organizes three social activities per week, giving students a chance to bond and explore the city.

In summary, Kaplan International Languages – Chicago offers top-quality language education in a prime location, coupled with a friendly, encouraging environment that helps students thrive. We invite you to come and discover for yourself why Kaplan International Languages – Chicago is a preferred choice among language learners.

Name: Northeastern Illinois University
Overview: Northeastern Illinois University, situated in Chicago, USA, provides undergraduate, graduate, and certification programs across various disciplines, as well as distance learning options for international and domestic students. The cost of attendance may vary depending on the chosen course. Scholarships, work-study opportunities, and other financial aid options are available to students. The university also has a dedicated Career Planning Service team to assist students in creating a CV and securing employment opportunities, such as full-time jobs, part-time jobs, summer jobs, and internships, both during and after completion of their degree.
Eligibility Overview: Northeastern Illinois University requires international applicants to demonstrate their proficiency in the English language. This can be done by receiving a passing score on either the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). The minimum required scores for admission are as follows: TOEFL-550, Computer-based TOEFL-213, Internet-based TOEFL-79, IELTS-7.0 on the composite score. If the applicant attended an English-medium high school or college/university in their home country, they may be exempt from this requirement. They can determine their eligibility by filling out the English Proficiency Waiver or contacting the Office of International Programs at international-programs@neiu.edu. If the applicant does not speak English and wishes to enroll in the university's Intensive English Program, they may still fulfill the English language competency requirement. They can receive assistance from the School for the Advancement of English Language and Learning (SAELL) at Northeastern Illinois University. For admission into the Master of Arts in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL) program, a minimum TOEFL score of 95 or an IELTS score of 7.0 is mandatory.
Placement: The NEIU Student Center for Science Engagement focuses on providing support and resources for science students. These include mentoring, tutoring, professional development opportunities, summer research programs, and scientific conferences specifically for students in the IT and Software department. On average, IT and Software department students earn an impressive annual salary of 98,000 USD. Graduates with a Bachelor of Science degree can expect to earn around 81,000 USD per year, while those with a BA typically earn 45,000 USD annually.
Accommodation:
Northeastern University offers student housing options for local, national, and international students on its campus. The Nest, which is the university's first residence hall, is situated west of the main campus. It provides a range of housing options, including two and four-bedroom units. Each room is outfitted with modern facilities and access to a shared bathroom. Extra amenities include a state-of-the-art fitness center equipped with both strength and cardio machines, a recreation center with arcade games and billiards, furnished apartments, private bedrooms and bathrooms, and a refreshing swimming pool.

Students are provided with fully-equipped kitchens complete with appliances, as well as on-site laundry facilities and essential utilities. As part of the application process, students are required to pay a non-refundable housing application fee of $50 and a security deposit of $250. However, students also have the option of seeking off-campus student housing in the United States if they so desire.

Name: Colorado Mesa University
Overview:
Colorado Mesa University was founded in 1925 as a public institution, offering a diverse range of undergraduate, postgraduate, certificate, and associate programs that emphasize professional, liberal arts, and technical education. Accredited by the Higher Learning Commission, CMU offers a variety of learning options, including online, full-time, evening classes, and distance education. With its main campus and two satellite campuses, the university offers 104 majors, 46 minors, and over 70 concentrations in a variety of academic divisions. These include health sciences, art and design, Kinesiology, mathematics and sciences, biological sciences, physical and environmental sciences, music, social and behavioral sciences, theater arts, and more.

At CMU, student success is a top priority, and as such, the university provides a range of student services. These include the University Center, Financial Aid department, campus recreation and safety, Student Health and Counseling services, and more. The university also offers various on-campus housing options, including suites, traditional halls, and semi-suites, to accommodate students at all levels of study.

CMU prides itself on offering high-quality education that combines strong liberal arts foundations with practical, hands-on skills to meet the needs of the regional workforce. By offering a diverse range of programs, CMU strives to engage students and prepare them for successful careers in their chosen fields.
Eligibility Overview: The admission process at Colorado Mesa University is selective, considering applicants with a 92 or higher index and successful completion of the Higher Education Admission Recommendations (H.E.A.R.) for baccalaureate programs. However, those with an index lower than 92 are considered for associate and certificate programs. When it comes to meeting Colorado Mesa admissions requirements, academic excellence is crucial. Obtaining a score of 980 or above on the SAT or a 61 on the ACT, along with maintaining a minimum GPA of 3.16, is key. With a 75% acceptance rate, admission to Colorado Mesa University remains competitive, with approximately half of the admitted students having a SAT score between 940 and 1170 or an ACT score between 18 and 25.

Name: Nebraska Wesleyan University
Overview:
Established in 1887 in Lincoln, Nebraska, USA, Nebraska Wesleyan University offers students a diverse and inclusive academic experience. With a focus on maintaining a low student-faculty ratio of 13:1, the university currently serves a student population of over 2,095 across undergraduate and postgraduate levels. The university's high student retention rate of 79% indicates a high level of satisfaction among students. 
For admission, applicants are required to have a minimum score of 5.5 in IELTS or 71 in TOEFL. With an acceptance rate of 70%, the university is moderately selective in its admissions process. International students can expect to pay a tuition fee between $35,000 and $40,000 USD. 
Nebraska Wesleyan University is committed to providing financial aid to ensure that 98% of its students have access to quality education. Its state-of-the-art facilities, including hi-tech laboratories, multimedia studios, and modern classrooms, make it a top choice among students. Additionally, the university offers a dedicated "Handshake" platform to help students stay updated on the latest employment opportunities.
Eligibility Overview:
University admission criteria require students to meet specific eligibility requirements. These include a minimum cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 and a composite ACT score of 20 or higher (equivalent to 1030 on the SAT). Demonstrating proficiency in the English language is also necessary.

The admission requirements for students include achieving a cumulative high school grade point average of 3.0 or above and obtaining a composite ACT score of 20 or higher (which is the same as a 1030 composite score on the SAT). In addition, students must demonstrate proficiency in the English language to be eligible for admission.

Accommodation:
The University of Nebraska Wesleyan offers various accommodation options for students, providing a convenient and enriching living experience on campus.

First-year residential living is an integral part of the residential liberal arts college experience. The university's residential facilities aim to foster a sense of community among students, enhance their life skills, and facilitate connections with others. The on-campus housing options include traditional residence halls, an all-women hall, and four coeducational halls. Each of these facilities is fully furnished and equipped with Wi-Fi internet. Additionally, there is a communal living space, laundry rooms, and kitchenettes available in each building.

Centennial Hall is a coed residence building that offers both single and double rooms, organized into shared lounge areas known as "pods." These spaces are available for students of all genders, including gender-neutral options. Centennial Hall is exclusively designated for first-year and international students.

Johnson Hall is a historic all-female residential hall that has been recently renovated. The building now features modern amenities such as air conditioning, a new elevator, and increased energy efficiency. The renovation was aimed at promoting accessibility and improving the living experience for its residents.

Pioneer Hall is a newly rebuilt residence building that encourages students to create strong bonds and supportive relationships with their peers. It is connected to Johnson Hall, and together they offer a large communal basement lounge with a TV, pool table, and other recreational activities. Pioneer Hall primarily houses first-year students and is generally co-educational, with some designated all-female floors.

Plainsman Hall is an air-conditioned coed residence hall located near the speech and theater center and the health and fitness center. It features built-in workstations, a communal kitchen, study rooms, and a basement lounge with a TV, pool table, and other amenities. Like Pioneer Hall, it typically houses first-year students, with a mix of co-ed and all-female floors available.

For sophomores and juniors, Heim and White Suites offer air-conditioned suite-style living. These suites have four bedrooms, a central living area with a kitchenette, and two bathrooms. Each floor also has access to a lounge with recreational activities and study spaces. The Townhouse Village provides similar self-contained living options for seniors, with fully equipped kitchens and four individual bedrooms in each apartment.

Students can also opt for single or two-person apartments, which are air-conditioned and reserved for juniors and seniors. These apartments offer additional privacy and include appliances such as refrigerators, stoves, microwaves, and washers and dryers.

Members of active sororities and fraternities can request to live in their respective chapter houses after completing two semesters in a residential hall. These houses are self-governing, with support from professional staff, advisors, and live-in chapter directors/parents. The university has specific guidelines and criteria for Greek chapter houses to meet to be considered as approved campus housing.

Overall, the University of Nebraska Wesleyan provides a robust housing program for its students, promoting a sense of community and enhancing their overall college experience.

Name: Marist College
Overview:
Founded in 1905, Marist College is a private liberal arts college located in Poughkeepsie, USA. It was established by the Marist Brothers and has two campuses, one in New York and another in Florence, Italy. The main campus covers a vast area of 180 acres and is a great place for students to study and live.

Marist College offers a diverse range of programs, including 47 undergraduate programs, 11 masters programs, one doctoral program, and two certificate programs. The graduate programs offered by the college include MBA, MPA, MS, MA degrees, and additionally provides a doctor of physical therapy and physical assistance programs. These programs are offered through six schools and colleges, namely the School of Communication and Arts, The School of Computer Science and Mathematics, the School of Liberal Arts, The School of Management, The School of Science, and The School of Social and Behavioral Sciences.

The undergraduate programs offered by Marist College cover diverse fields ranging from accounting, biology, cybersecurity, economics, to art history, and many more. Some of the popular majors provided by the college include business, management, marketing, communication, journalism, psychology, computer and information sciences, and biological and biomedical sciences. The college has a collaboration with IBM for conducting concept and application testing in the fields of business, communication, and education.

The tuition fee for each academic year is USD 45,430. On-campus housing facilities are available for undergraduate students in apartments, suites, and halls, providing them with a comfortable living experience. The college also has a thriving athletics program, with sports such as football, basketball, tennis, and swimming. The average cost of living is around USD 21,900. Marist College boasts state-of-the-art facilities, including study centers, academic buildings, gymnasium, and a library.

To help students with their financial needs, Marist College offers various forms of financial assistance, such as loans and scholarships. The Career Services Center provides valuable guidance and support to students for setting career goals and securing employment. The college also hosts career fairs to help students write effective resumes, improve their interview skills, and establish professional networks.
Eligibility Overview:

- Complete and submit an application form with all necessary information.
- Compose an essay focusing on the individual's personal background.
- Provide a recommendation letter from a credible source.
- Include certified transcripts from high school (evaluated and translated to English).
- Demonstrate proficiency in the English language.
- Present a comprehensive resume.
- Submit proof of financial support through an affidavit.

Name: University of Nebraska - Lincoln

With a strong focus on fields such as Engineering, it provides a diverse educational experience. The university boasts a main campus in Lincoln, along with 17 undergraduate programs and 21 postgraduate programs. The cost of attendance may vary for international and domestic students depending on the chosen program. The average estimated tuition and fees for an international student, excluding miscellaneous expenses, are around INR 36,06,441. In order to support students financially, the university offers scholarships, work-study opportunities, and other forms of funding. Its Career Planning Service team assists students in building a strong CV and finding suitable employment opportunities, whether it be after graduation, for part-time or summer jobs, or for internships. Name: Purdue University Northwest
Overview:
Purdue University Northwest (PNW) is a distinguished urban-based higher education institute with two campus locations, catering to around 8800 students including both graduates and undergraduates. PNW operates in Westville and Hammond. The institute holds accreditation from the Higher Learning Commission (HLC), a highly regarded organization for recognizing higher education institutions in the United States. PNW has consistently been listed among the best regional universities by the U.S. News & World Report Best Colleges rankings. The institute's seven colleges offer more than 70 specialized academic programs at both the graduate and undergraduate levels. The academic offerings at PNW cover a wide range of programs, including majors, minors, certificates, graduate, undergraduate, concentration, and combined (4+1) degree programs. The diverse list of colleges at PNW include the School of Education and Counseling, White Lodging School of Hospitality and Tourism Management, and the School of Engineering. Notable programs offered at PNW include Adult-Gerontology Clinical Nurse Specialist (Post-Master’s Certificate), Computer Engineering (BSCmpE/MSECE), Couple and Family Therapy (Master of Science), and School Counseling (MSEd).

The cost of attending PNW varies depending on the type of program and the student's state of residence. For example, the in-state tuition fee for a full-time undergraduate program (12-18 credit hours) ranges from $8,000 to $8,100 for spring 2022 and fall 2021. On the other hand, the out-of-state tuition fee for the same program is between $11,600 and $11,700. However, these figures are subject to change, and students must confirm the latest tuition fees with the institute. It is worth noting that domestic non-resident students who enrolled before fall 2018 are assessed at an international rate.

PNW offers various scholarships to recognize and support academic excellence and provide financial assistance to students. These scholarships are classified as Admissions scholarships and Specialty scholarships. Upon graduation, PNW alumni find employment in various industries, including manufacturing, education, and healthcare. Some of the top employers of PNW graduates include Michigan City Area Schools, Parkview Health, and La Porte Hospital. Additionally, PNW alumni hold positions in esteemed organizations such as Amazon and Microsoft.
Eligibility Overview: Purdue University Northwest evaluates applicants based on their demonstrated academic skills and achievements, including possession of a high school diploma or GED, completion of required coursework, grade average in relevant subjects, overall grade average, class rank, and scores on standardized tests such as SAT, rSAT, or ACT. For students who graduated from an Indiana public high school in 2011 or later, a Core 40 diploma is required. In addition, applicants must provide proof of English proficiency, with acceptable tests including a TOEFL score of 79 iBT or 550 paper-based, an IELTS score of 6.5, a Critical Reading score of 480 or above on the SAT, or a grade of A or B in Ordinary Level English Language Exam (GCSE/IGCSE) in the UK. It is important to note that all test scores must have been obtained within the past two years.
Placement: At Purdue University Northwest (PNW), a leading institution in Northwest Indiana, graduates find success in various industries, such as healthcare, manufacturing, and education. The university has deep roots in the local community and some of its top employers include La Porte Hospital, Michigan City Area Schools, and Parkview Health. PNW alumni also have the opportunity to work for renowned global organizations like Microsoft, Amazon, and Marriott.
Accommodation:
The Hammond campus offers housing options for 750 students with separate bedrooms, making it ideal for meeting new friends. The University Village has apartment-style living, allowing you to walk to various places on campus with ease. You can also take advantage of our fitness centre, which is only a few steps away. Plus, all buildings are less than a mile from each other, making it convenient for you to get around.

At University Village, social events are a regular occurrence. Movie screenings, ice cream socials, game nights, and pancake study breaks all take place in Peregrine and Griffin residence halls. You won't even have to leave the comfort of your home to attend these fun activities.

Our furnished apartments come in two sizes: 4-bedroom/2-bathroom and 2-bedroom/1-bathroom configurations. These living arrangements include a living room and a kitchen, providing you with a comfortable space to relax and study. We also offer free printing services in our computer laboratories for your convenience.

If you enjoy being outdoors, you'll love the patio and study spaces available for use outside. These areas are perfect for studying, group meetings, or just enjoying some fresh air.

At our university, we strive to provide the best living experience possible for our students. With a variety of housing options and amenities, you'll feel right at home at the Hammond campus. Plus, you'll have plenty of opportunities to socialize and connect with your peers. So why wait? Apply for housing today and experience all that our university has to offer!

Name: Concordia University Chicago
Overview:
Established in 1864, Concordia University was originally founded as a teachers' college but has since evolved into a comprehensive university. Located in River Forest, the Concordia University Chicago offers a variety of undergraduate programs leading to bachelor's degrees, as well as a wide range of graduate, master's, and doctoral programs. This university is affiliated with the Lutheran Church and is an important member of the larger Concordia University system. At Concordia University Chicago, students are encouraged to engage in applied research, internships, service activities, and other practical learning opportunities to enhance their education. These experiences help students develop the versatility necessary to thrive in the constantly evolving 21st-century workplace and beyond.

Concordia University Chicago aspires to be one of the most affordable higher education institutions in the Midwest region of America. The university provides financial aid to undergraduate, graduate, and adult students enrolling in specialized academic programs. With a 10:1 student-to-faculty ratio, students at Concordia University Chicago receive personalized attention in small class sizes. The knowledgeable professors, dedicated staff, and supportive advisors aid students in developing their skills and forging valuable connections. The university is currently ranked 74th by U.S. News & World Report. 

Concordia University Chicago offers practical benefits to its students, such as Optional Practical Training (OPT) and Curricular Practical Training (CPT) permits, allowing them to work in the United States for up to 12 months. The Career Center at the university also provides recruitment assistance, with over 60 companies offering internships to students. Scholarships are available for deserving international students. With an acceptance rate of approximately 75%, Concordia University Chicago is selective in its admissions process.

The main campus of Concordia University Chicago is well-appointed with all essential facilities and amenities to provide students with an enriching learning experience. Its convenient location, hands-on learning opportunities, and top-notch education make it an attractive choice for students pursuing higher education. Upon graduation, Concordia University Chicago students are well-equipped to enter the workforce and secure employment in reputable companies.
Eligibility Overview:
In order to apply, please ensure that you have the following documents:
- A fully completed application for admissions at Concordia University Chicago.
- Official transcripts from all previously attended colleges or universities.
- If you have foreign transcripts, please have them evaluated by a Concordia University Chicago-approved international credentialing service, such as Educational Credential Evaluators (ECE).
- A verified document that proves you have adequate financial support for your first year of education at Concordia University Chicago, and for the following years as well if there are no unforeseen circumstances.
- Proof of secondary school graduation.
- For students transferring from a school within the United States, please provide a transfer verification form.
- Proof of English proficiency, which can be demonstrated by achieving a minimum score of 72 on the internet-based Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), or a score of 6.0 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or successfully completing Level 112 at an ELS Language School or a certificate of completion from an English Language Institute (ELI) with a recommendation from the program director. 
We highly value the authenticity and accuracy of the information provided in your application, and look forward to welcoming you to our university.

Name: Western Washington University
Overview:
Founded in 1893, Western Washington University is a renowned public university located in Bellingham, Washington. With its distinguished colleges including the College of Business and Economics, College of Fine and Performing Arts, College of Humanities and Social Sciences, College of Science and Engineering, and Fairhaven College of Interdisciplinary Studies, the university offers a diverse range of academic programs.
One remarkable feature of the university is its emphasis on interdisciplinary studies, which enables students to design personalized degree programs at Fairhaven College. This reflects the university's commitment to inclusivity and academic innovation.
To qualify for admission at Western Washington University, students are required to obtain a minimum score of 86 iBT in TOEFL or 7.0 in IELTS.
The average annual cost for tuition and accommodation is approximately $35K, but the university offers scholarships and grants that can significantly lower the expense to around $26K.
Upon graduation, students can expect to earn an average salary of 54,976 USD.
Eligibility Overview:
The university requires prospective students to meet specific criteria in order to be considered for admission. These guidelines include a minimum TOEFL score of 86 iBT or an IELTS score of 7.0. 

Exceptions to these language proficiency requirements are if the student is a native English speaker, or if they are in the process of obtaining a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited university in the United States, Great Britain, Australia, New Zealand, or English-speaking provinces of Canada. 

Official IELTS or TOEFL scores must be submitted to the Graduate School office by the application deadline and should be no more than one year old at the time of submission. This is a crucial factor in the admission process.
Placement: Western Washington University offers opportunities for job placement and internship through its on-campus fairs during the winter and spring semesters. Graduates have found success in high-paying positions such as Software Development, Operations Management, Account Management, and Marketing Direction. According to PayScale, the average annual salary for Western Washington University graduates is approximately $69,130.
Accommodation: The main campus of Western Washington University is situated on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish Peoples, who have inhabited the Salish Sea for centuries in the San Juan Islands and the North Cascades region. Our Indigenous community holds immense gratitude for their ongoing stewardship and protection of our shared lands and waterways. Spanning across 215 acres of lush greenery, the university boasts a picturesque location overlooking Bellingham Bay and boasts a diverse range of amenities such as the Public Sculpture Collection featuring renowned artists like James Fitzgerald and Anthony Caro. The campus is equipped with top-notch resources such as libraries, residence halls, laboratories, student organizations, transportation facilities, and athletic centers. With a strong alumni network, students can expect a high rate of employment upon graduating. For more details, visit https://admissions.wwu.edu/visit/accommodations.

Name: Chemeketa Community College - Woodburn
Overview:
The Chemeketa Community College Woodburn Centre is situated in downtown Woodburn and works closely with a wide range of non-profit organizations, agencies, the Woodburn Chamber of Commerce, and local schools to provide English language learning, employment skills training, and continuing education opportunities. There is a diverse selection of programs and courses available to students at Chemeketa Woodburn, including GED preparation in both English and Spanish, English as a Second Language instruction, Business Technology programs, personal enrichment courses, Developmental Education, and courses for the Associate of Arts Oregon Transfer degree. Students can take advantage of many helpful resources and services at the Woodburn Centre, such as the Official GED testing facility, administrative services, academic advising, test placement and assessment services, textbook pick-up (for Woodburn campus delivery upon request), financial aid assistance, student clubs, and more.

Chemeketa Woodburn is committed to providing affordable education, offering low-cost textbooks and courses as well as a flexible schedule. More than 60% of students at Chemeketa receive financial aid and scholarships, and the Chemeketa Foundation offers over 100 different scholarships for students to apply for. Students looking to earn their GED or simultaneously earn college and high school credits can find a suitable program at Chemeketa Woodburn. The GED program offers individualized pacing in a college setting, preparing individuals for better job opportunities and providing free college credits upon completion. Additionally, the Early College Program at Chemeketa Woodburn allows students to work closely with an advisor to create an education plan tailored to their future goals.
Eligibility Overview: Chemeketa University provides students with comprehensive language and college-level studies, regardless of their proficiency level in English. International students are not required to submit TOEFL or IELTS scores during the admissions process. Upon enrollment, all students will take placement tests during orientation, which are used solely for advising purposes. This ensures that students are placed in the appropriate courses for a successful academic experience at Chemeketa University.
Placement:
Assessing Your Position
Chemeketa employs a range of methods to evaluate your reading, writing, and math abilities before enrolling you in classes. To get started, please complete the Placement Assessment Form and you will receive a response within 3-5 business days. This will provide you with information regarding your placement and what steps to take next. For more information, please visit: https://www.chemeketa.edu/admission/enroll/placement-assessment/
Accommodation: Data for a University concerning housing for international students suggest that during their first term, it is highly recommended for them to opt for homestay. This is a proven and efficient method for enhancing one's English language skills, as it provides the opportunity to communicate with a family while adjusting to the new area. Host families are spread across Salem-Keizer and ensure access to convenient transportation via nearby bus stops. Applying for homestay must be done promptly, as the availability of families is limited and cannot be guaranteed. Interested students will receive homestay forms via email upon completing their application. On-campus housing options can also be explored, which can be accessed through the university's website.

Name: Claremont Graduate University
Overview:
Located in Claremont, USA, the Claremont Graduate University offers an extensive range of undergraduate, postgraduate, certificate, and online degree programs for students who prefer or require distance education. The tuition fees for both international and domestic students may vary depending on the chosen program. On an average, the estimated cost of tuition fees for international students, excluding miscellaneous expenditures, is INR 44,68,580. To assist students with the cost of education, the university offers a number of scholarships, work-study, and other financial aid options.

Graduates from the Claremont Graduate University have an impressive average starting salary of 73,000 USD per annum. The university also has a dedicated Career Planning Service team that works closely with students to help them build a strong CV and find suitable employment opportunities, whether it is after completing their degree or for part-time, summer, or internship positions. This comprehensive support system ensures that students are equipped with the necessary skills and resources to achieve their career goals.
Eligibility Overview: Claremont Graduate University accepts applications from international students who must provide valid academic transcripts, a statement of purpose, a letter of recommendation for the United States, a CV, and proof of English proficiency. Some programs may require a portfolio and verifiable professional experience as part of the application process. Candidates with a TOEFL iBT score below 95 or an IELTS score below 7.0 must first complete the International Scholars Program (ISP). Once admitted, students must obtain an I-20 or DS-2019 visa and apply for an F-1 or J-1 scholar student visa to study in the United States. Paying the required non-refundable tuition deposits will confirm the admission to CGU.

These on-campus living quarters cater to both undergraduate and graduate students. While the former offers a choice between one-bedroom and studio apartments, the latter is exclusively reserved for graduate students. The Oasis Residential Commons boasts a range of amenities such as group meeting rooms, a gym, a swimming pool, study areas, and more. As for on-campus facilities, students have access to four libraries, five cafeterias, three gyms, health and counseling centers, athletic facilities, ethnic centers, an interfaith chaplaincy, as well as a performing arts complex with cafes and other amenities. Students and staff also have the option of living off-campus, with rental assistance in the form of housing and apartment listings, and roommate search options.

Name: University of South Florida
Overview:
The University of South Florida was founded in the year 1956 and serves as a distinguished public research university in Florida. Its main motive is to provide students with top-notch academic facilities for their education and research purposes. With its current position as the 4th largest university in the state, it offers a wide range of over 180 programs across multiple disciplines. The university offers undergraduate, graduate, doctoral degrees, and diplomas, which students can choose from as per their interests and career aspirations. Some of the highly sought-after courses at the University of South Florida include M.S. and Ph.D. in Nursing, B.A. in Language, Speech, and Hearing Sciences, and B.Sc. in Civil Engineering.

Situated in Tampa, the University of South Florida houses 14 colleges and offers doctoral programs. Additionally, there are two other campuses of the university - the University of South Florida St. Petersburg and the University of South Florida Sarasota-Manatee, located 45 minutes away from Tampa. The university strives to provide its students with a diverse range of academic opportunities and a conducive learning environment.

The average cost of completing a degree program at the University of South Florida is approximately USD 23,500. To support international students in their quest for higher education, the university offers financial aid in the form of scholarships, which can cover up to USD 12,000 per semester. This makes it easier for students to pursue their desired courses and fulfill their academic goals at the University of South Florida.
Eligibility Overview:
To be eligible for admission to this university, students are required to meet the following criteria:
1. Proficiency in the English language must be demonstrated.
2. A minimum GPA of 3.00, based on a 4.00 scale, is necessary for applicants who have completed either an Undergraduate or Postgraduate program.

Overview: The University of Cincinnati, located in Ohio, is a renowned public research institution. It is the second-largest university in the state and offers over 300 majors to its students. Known for its impressive contributions in the field of research and development, UC is estimated to have a regional economic impact of $4.2 billion. To be eligible for admission, applicants must have a minimum score of 6 in IELTS and 66 in TOEFL. However, the estimated in-state tuition and fees are approximately $12,138, while the out-state tuition and fees are $27,472. UC automatically considers all students for merit-based scholarships, eliminating the need for a separate application. The prestigious Cincinnatus Scholarship Program, valued at over $22M, provides renewable scholarships to deserving candidates. The university has a unique cooperative education model, which is integrated into its curriculum. As a result, graduates of UC earn an average salary of $30,000-$400,000. The university's location is a major advantage for its students, as it is surrounded by fortune 500 companies and over 300 foreign companies, creating an excellent job market for its graduates. Cincinnati, the city where UC is situated, has a thriving economy, making it a promising destination for individuals pursuing higher education.

The University of Cincinnati offers a wide range of programs to its students, making it one of the top public research universities in the US. It boasts a diverse student body of over 46,000 students and has a student-faculty ratio of 18:1, ensuring a personalized learning experience. Located in Cincinnati, Ohio, the university has a picturesque campus of 476 acres, spread across four branches - the main campus, Clifton Heights medical campus, and Blue Ash and Clermont branches. The university prides itself on providing ample opportunities for students to get involved in over 300 organizations and activities, creating a dynamic and engaging community. In fact, Princeton Reviews has recognized the University of Cincinnati as a Green College for its commitment to sustainability.

For freshmen, the university offers on-campus accommodation in ten residence halls, covering about 80% of the students. Graduate students can choose to live in the Bellevue Gardens University's residence halls. The university also offers reasonable meal plans for students living in the residence halls. For those looking for off-campus accommodation, there are options available within a reasonable price range. Monthly rent for one-bedroom apartments is around USD 700-800, for two-bedroom apartments is USD 900-1000, for three-bedroom apartments is USD 950-1050, and for four-bedroom apartments is USD 750-850. These apartments are fully equipped with amenities like wifi, laundry, cable, water, electricity, and more. Students can choose from one to four-bedroom apartments to suit their needs. Don't miss out on the opportunity to become a part of this thriving university community while pursuing your academic goals.

Name: Long Island University
Overview: Founded in 1926, Long Island University (LIU) is a private university located in Brooklyn, New York. LIU is accredited by the New York State Education Department and offers over 270 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees to an annual student body of more than 15,000. The university has been consistently ranked as the Best National University by the U.S. News and World Report and is also recognized as a Yellow School for Veterans, supported by the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs. With multiple campuses across New York including LIU Brooklyn, LIU Post, College of Veterinary Medicine, LIU Brentwood, LIU Hudson, and LIU Riverhead, LIU is a highly reputable institution. Furthermore, the university has received specialized accreditation by prominent bodies such as the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education, Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, American Psychological Association Commission on Accreditation, among others. With a student-faculty ratio of 11:1, LIU boasts a faculty of 480+ full-time members, comprising of esteemed scholars, award-winning professionals, and renowned journalists. LIU Brooklyn, the university's flagship campus, has also been recognized as the safest campus in New York City by the Daily Beast. Encompassing 11 acres, the campus is home to 12 schools and colleges offering degrees in fields such as veterinary medicine, pharmacy, liberal arts, education, and nursing. To ensure a comfortable and convenient stay for its students, LIU provides residential facilities at the Fulton Street Residential Hall and Richard N. Connolly Hall. As part of its commitment to provide a well-rounded college experience, LIU offers students participation in over 60 clubs, organizations, and athletic groups. The estimated undergraduate annual tuition fees range from USD 35,000 to USD 40,000. LIU has a vast alumni network of over 270,000 individuals across its various campuses, including notable alumni such as soccer player Peter Nelsson, actress Dina Meyer, philanthropist Raymon Dalio, and many more.
Eligibility Overview:
At LUI Brooklyn, you will have access to exceptional academic opportunities within the vibrant and trendy Fort Greene neighborhood, which is home to popular establishments such as the Barclays Center, stylish restaurants, cozy cafes, and unique boutiques. Our prime location at the heart of this alluring New York City neighborhood provides convenient access to a plethora of professional services, making it an ideal place to hone your skills and pursue your passions.

LUI Brooklyn boasts a sprawling 11-acre campus that boasts lush greenery and a lively, welcoming atmosphere. Our campus has been recognized as the third safest in the nation by The Daily Beast, and the safest in all of New York City, providing students with a secure and nurturing environment to study and thrive.

One of the unique opportunities offered at LUI Brooklyn is the English Language Institute, a specially designed program for non-native English speakers. This program not only helps students meet university requirements but also focuses on enhancing their conversational, reading, writing, and grammatical skills. Once you complete the program, we offer free coaching in all academic areas and ongoing English language support to help you excel in your studies.

Name: University of Colorado Boulder
Overview:
CU Boulder, also known as the University of Colorado Boulder, was established in 1876 as a renowned public research university. The institution boasts a vast academic catalog consisting of over 4,000 courses spanning 150 different fields. Every year, CU delivers a record-breaking 7,000 degrees to its students. With a focus on areas such as atomic physics, quantum physics, geology, ceramics, aerospace engineering science, and environmental law, CU has established itself as a top choice for students seeking these specialties. The university has nine distinguished schools and colleges, including those dedicated to humanities, health, society, architecture, global studies, law and policy, space, and visual arts. 
In terms of cost, the estimated tuition and fees for a Colorado resident is $28,478, while a non-resident can expect to pay $54,296 and an international student $60,156. However, CU offers various scholarship programs, even for smaller amounts, which can help students save up to $8.5 million per year in fees. Notably, 20 students from CU have received the prestigious Rhodes scholarship. 
The faculty at CU comprises renowned experts in their fields, including Nobel laureates, Mac Arthur genius grant fellows, and U.S. Professors of the Year. The university also encourages entrepreneurship and has supported the development of over 135 start-ups through its technology initiatives.

Accommodation:
At this university, there are a variety of options for undergraduate housing, with a live-on requirement for first-year students. To assist in the housing process, the university offers information for both prospective students and returning students. The Residential Experience (ResX) is designed to promote four key areas of student development: personal responsibility, academic responsibility, community responsibility, and social justice responsibility. Through living on campus, students will have access to resources that will help them grow and become globally-conscious members of both the CU community and the world. These resources include promoting self-reflection and personal well-being, forming academic relationships, finding academic support, honing interpersonal skills, learning about cultural diversity, and understanding socio-structural influences.

Undergraduate Housing options include various campus housing alternatives. The campus is committed to supporting students in their development of personal responsibility, academic responsibility, community responsibility, and social justice responsibility through the Residential Experience (ResX). Whether you are a prospective student looking for first-time housing or a current student reapplying for campus housing, the university is ready to assist you. The ResX will aid students in developing their commitment to learning and taking responsibility for both their CU community and the world at large. The educational priority includes four components: personal responsibility, academic responsibility, community responsibility, and social justice responsibility.

Living on campus will provide students with essential academic resources and services, such as laundry facilities, on-campus marketing, GradGuard Insurance, mail services, and housekeeping. Further details on the Graduate and Family Housing division of CU Boulder accommodation are also available on the university website. This division offers apartment options to graduate and post-doctoral students, visiting scholars, and CU faculty and staff. Unfurnished one and two-bedroom flats, as well as furnished studios, are available. First-year graduate students are eligible to live at Athens North, where fully furnished studio apartments are also available. For all apartments, the faculty, staff, and visiting scholars have access to one, two, and three-bedroom options, furnished or unfurnished.

The university's Off-Campus Housing & Neighborhood Relations office, overseen by CU Student Government (CUSG), is a resource for all students living off-campus. They provide assistance with finding an apartment, matching roommates, understanding Boulder housing options, reviewing leases at no cost with a staff attorney, assisting with conflict resolution, knowing Boulder ordinances, and advocating for student and tenant rights. This information is vital for students looking to live off-campus, and the office is there to support them.

Name: Concordia University - St. Paul
Overview:
Concordia University - St. Paul, located in Saint Paul, Minnesota, is a private university with a long history dating back to 1893. In 1997, the university was rebranded with its current name. With an enrollment of around 5,600 students, it offers a diverse range of programs including undergraduate majors and minors, adult degrees, education certificates, graduate programs, and licensure and discussion courses. Backed by the Higher Learning Commission since 1967, Concordia University - St. Paul has become known as one of the top private universities in Minnesota, with a focus on affordable education and numerous financial aid options for its students. According to the US News, the St. Paul campus is ranked 88th among regional universities in the Midwest and is also recognized in the QS World University rankings among the top 500 in the world.

There are 176 academic programs available at Concordia University - St. Paul, with popular undergraduate degree courses such as Management, Kinesiology, Marketing, Business Administration, and Psychology. The graduate degree courses include Bachelor of Arts in Business, Bachelor of Arts in Exercise Science, and Bachelor of Science in Nursing. A number of these programs are offered online, including the MBA degree. The university follows a semester-based academic structure and calendar with a 69% admissions acceptance rate. Successful applicants typically have an ACT score between 17 and 24. Concordia University - St. Paul also offers financial aid and scholarships to eligible students to help cover tuition costs. With a student-centric and responsive approach, the university provides its students with the necessary preparation to achieve their academic goals.
Eligibility Overview: Concordia University-Saint Paul accepts all applicants who meet the minimum requirements, making the admission process open to all. This open admissions policy allows for continuous new admissions throughout the year. If you would like more information about the specifics of Concordia University-Saint Paul's open admissions policy, please contact them directly. In order to be admitted to open admission colleges, students must meet specific minimum requirements. It is recommended to have proficiency in English in order to succeed at Concordia University-Saint Paul.

Placement:
Concordia University-St. Paul's Office of Career Development is dedicated to helping both students and graduates find fulfilling employment opportunities. Through a personalized approach, collaboration with faculty, and support from student groups, the office strives to empower students in their career advancement. However, Concordia recognizes that career growth is not limited to a workplace setting and therefore, integrates career components into its curriculum and provides networking opportunities through job fairs and on-campus events.

The university boasts an impressive overall placement rate of 94.57% for both undergraduate and graduate students, indicating the effectiveness of its career services. Upon graduation, 73.83% of undergraduate students secured full-time jobs, while 90.2% of all undergraduate students, including those in internships, part-time, full-time, continuing education, and the military, found employment. Similarly, 85.1% of graduate students landed full-time jobs, contributing to the impressive placement rate of 96% for all graduate students. Moreover, it has been noted that Concordia graduates earn 44% more than the national average and have an average income of $68,870, thus highlighting the university's commitment to producing successful and well-paid professionals.
Accommodation:
Concordia University provides on-campus housing options for its first-year students, with the majority of students (80%) choosing to live in these facilities. Four residence halls, including Wollaeger Hall, Luther Hall, Holst Hall, and Hyatt Village, offer various types of accommodation for students. Wollaeger Hall houses 100 male first-year students in two-person dormitories with communal bathrooms. Luther Hall, on the other hand, provides air-conditioned community areas, community toilets, and two-person rooms for 100 first-year students. Hyatt Village has 290 apartment-style housing units with separate bedrooms, a kitchen, a living area, and bathrooms. These apartments come equipped with amenities such as furniture, study tables, microwaves, and toasters, as well as communal areas and a television.

Holst Hall offers housing for 290 students, with separate bedrooms for two and four people, a kitchen, a living area, and bathrooms. And finally, Mary and Martha apartments provide one-bedroom accommodations for students with families, spouses participating in graduate school, or adults over the age of 24. These apartments come with private bathrooms, kitchens, and community laundry areas and have parking spaces and private homes available as well.

In addition to on-campus housing, students also have the option to choose off-campus accommodations, which are particularly popular for those looking for a more independent living experience. However, the university emphasizes the importance of living on campus to fully immerse oneself in the campus community. Over 500 students participate in more than 50 programs and events sponsored by residential life each semester, creating a vibrant and dynamic living environment for students.

Name: Jackson State University
Overview: Jackson State University is a renowned Historically Black Colleges in the heart of Jackson, Mississippi. Founded in 1877, it is proudly classified as an R2 institution, indicating its strong emphasis on research endeavors. With over 87 undergraduate programs spanning from Business Administration with a concentration in Accounting to a Bachelor's of Music in Jazz, JSU caters to a wide range of academic interests. JSU is home to five distinguished colleges including the College of Business, College of Education and Human Development, College of Health and Sciences, College of Liberal Arts, and the College of Science, Engineering and Technology. Moreover, the university boasts 13 graduate degree programs that cover a diverse range of disciplines from M.A., M.A.T, M.B.A., to Ph.D. levels.
Eligibility Overview:
The Jackson State University's undergraduate admissions office oversees the process of admitting new students. For any assistance with the admissions process, students are advised to reach out to the office.

The following documents are required to be submitted by students: High school transcripts with details like course work, graduation date, GPA, and class rank. ACT or SAT scores with the college codes 2204 and 1341, respectively. Vaccination records.

The graduate council at Jackson State University is entrusted with the task of managing admissions and devising rules and procedures for graduate programs. This ensures consistency in the admission criteria for all applicants.

The graduate admission requirements include a minimum GPA of 3.0 or a Master's degree at the undergraduate level. All transcripts must be officially submitted. International students must also provide proof of immunization.

International students must demonstrate proficiency in the English language by attaining a minimum score in one of the following exams: TOEFL (iBT: 69, cBT: 194, pBT: 525), IELTS (6.0), PTE-A (53), English (19 ACT), or Critical Reading (480 on SAT).

Name: Dartmouth College
Overview: Dartmouth College, located in Hanover, New Hampshire, USA, is one of the most established universities in the United States and is a proud member of the esteemed Ivy League. Founded in 1769, this private liberal arts and research institution commands extreme competition, boasting an acceptance rate of a mere 10.4%. The college has a healthy representation of international students, with 9% of its total population coming from various countries. Its diverse range of faculties include arts, sciences, and engineering programs for undergraduates, with four prominent graduate programs as well. Amongst its 56 undergraduate degrees, students can opt for diverse courses like Computing, Engineering, Biology, Psychology, and History in its arts and sciences department. Apart from its esteemed undergraduate courses, Dartmouth College houses reputable schools such as the Tuck School of Business, Thayer School of Engineering and Geisel School of Medicine, and Frank J. Guarini School of Graduate and Advanced Studies. Students availing the undergraduate program would need to pay USD 55,605 annually, not including room or apartment fees.
Eligibility Overview:
Dartmouth College has specific requirements for participation in its various courses and programs. In addition to program-specific criteria, applicants must also meet certain criteria to be considered for admission as an international student. This includes a minimum GPA of 3.0 and a high school diploma or certificate from an accredited institution. Standardized test scores, such as the SAT or ACT, are also required for undergraduate admissions. However, for the Class of 2026, only the SAT or ACT is mandatory.

For graduate and engineering admissions, individuals should have completed a bachelor's degree in engineering, science, chemistry, or computer science. Non-Dartmouth AB and Thayer School Dual Degree applicants will also need to submit GRE scores. MBA candidates must have a legitimate bachelor's or master's degree, in addition to GRE or GMAT results.

For MD admissions, applicants with a bachelor's degree and a strong foundation in health, human behavior, and society through humanities and science research are preferred. They must also have completed three years of post-secondary education at an accredited US or Canadian college or university. All applicants are required to have an MCAT score of at least 503, though most successful applicants have a combined median MCAT score of 515 and a median GPA of 3.65. While each application is reviewed individually, meeting these criteria greatly increases the likelihood of acceptance.

The main campus of the university is situated in New Paltz.

SUNY at New Paltz provides students with a wide range of opportunities to pursue their interests and academic goals. With over 20 undergraduate programs and four postgraduate programs, the university ensures that students receive a holistic education.
