Placement:
The Center for Academic Services (CAS) at SUNY New Paltz offers various internship programs for students seeking professional experience and academic credit. The highly competitive CAS Internship Stipend Program awards a limited number of $2,000 scholarships to students participating in semester-long internships or student teaching placements during the fall and spring semesters. Students may be eligible for a stipend of up to $3,000 if they complete a full-time summer internship of 20+ hours per week.

The Internship Program at SUNY New Paltz allows students to earn academic credit while working at businesses aligned with their major or minor. These internships can range from one to fifteen credits and are supervised by a faculty member from the student's department. The assigned professor will oversee the academic work and assign a final grade. Depending on the position, internships can be paid or unpaid.

The Office of Field Experiences at SUNY New Paltz facilitates student teaching placements in various regions, including the Mid-Hudson Valley, Lower-Hudson Valley, NYC, Long Island, Utica, and even Australia. These placements are selected based on proximity to the student's residence, long-standing collaboration, and accessibility of supervisors. If necessary, alternative placements can be arranged in consultation with education program advisers and chairs. Students are typically placed within a 45-mile radius of their residence and must provide their own transportation.
Accommodation:
At New Paltz campus, there are a total of 14 diverse residence halls available for students to choose from. These include both corridor and suite-style housing, as well as special interest group housing.

All of the residence halls are coed, ensuring a diverse and inclusive living environment for all students. Each hall offers a variety of student-oriented amenities and services, such as washing rooms, computer terminals, primary meeting spaces for hall government activities, and study lounges.

In addition, each hall also features at least one television lounge, a kitchenette space, and a microwave for residents to use. The three residence life complexes on the New Paltz campus are Parker Complex, Hasbrouck Complex, and South Complex.

Within the Parker Complex, there are six traditional corridor-style halls: Capen Hall, Bliss Hall, Bouton Hall, Gage Hall, Scudder Hall, and Shango/College Hall. These halls provide a sense of community and engagement with housemates, as well as convenient campus location and resources for physically challenged students.

Capen Hall, named after the second principal of New Paltz Normal School, offers a variety of amenities such as a large study lounge, laundry facilities, a bike rack, and a computer lab. Bliss Hall, named after the fourth principal, promotes community and tradition among its residents. It also has a study lounge, computer room, and laundry facilities.

Bouton Hall is named after the first principal of New Paltz Normal School and boasts a diverse student population and active Hall Government. Gage Hall, named after the third principal, is the largest residence hall on campus and offers a ten-month housing option for students in need. Scudder Hall is named after the fifth principal and has lounges and laundry facilities on each floor.

College Hall, a designated male and female residence hall, is conveniently located near academic buildings and has a close-knit community. Shango Hall, the first residence hall on campus, offers unique architecture and diverse student population. It is also home to the Scholar's Mentorship Program (SMP) and academic departments such as Music and Music Therapy.

In addition to providing comfortable living spaces, these residence halls aim to foster a sense of community and inclusivity among their residents. They also offer convenient amenities and resources to support students' academic and personal growth.

For more information on each residence hall, please visit: https://www.newpaltz.edu/reslife/halls.html.

Placement: In 2021, Baylor University excelled in terms of job placement, reporting an impressive 86% placement rate within six months of graduation (based on data from 99.6% of the graduating class). Recent graduates were able to secure full-time employment opportunities relatively quickly with this record. According to the National Association of Colleges and Employers' (NACE) statistics from November 2021, Baylor outperformed the national average for undergraduate job placement, which was only 50%. Within 90 days of graduating in fall 2020, 73% of Baylor students had either secured a full-time job or continued their education. Moreover, the number of students who opted for full-time employment, pursued further education, joined the military, or volunteered also increased. These achievements, as reported by Baylor's career center, show the university's commitment to shaping the future of its current and former students, both in and out of the classroom. The success rate for the 2021 graduating class was 88%, which was 5% higher than the previous year (83% in 2020). This reflects Baylor's dedication towards ensuring the success of all its students, both during and after their time at the university.

1

Baylor University offers both on-campus and off-campus accommodation options to its students. Numerous options are available for off-campus accommodation, such as studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments. These apartments are well-equipped with modern amenities like granite countertops, walk-in closets, private balconies, and TVs in the living area. Each bedroom also comes with a separate bathroom. The apartments are strategically located near popular shopping and dining areas, providing easy access for students. With a variety of options to choose from, Baylor University students can find the perfect off-campus housing that suits their needs and budget.

Name: Cameron University
Overview:
Cameron University, founded in 1908, is a renowned institution located in Lawton, United States. The university offers an array of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various fields of study. It also provides online courses for distance education students. One of the university's significant highlights is its business programs, which are widely recognized for their quality and excellence. Cameron University strives to equip students with the necessary skills and knowledge to excel in their chosen careers, whether it be in the corporate world or other job fields.

Aiming to prepare its students for the workforce, the university offers job-related resources, programs, services, and opportunities. These help students and alumni achieve their career goals by honing their skills, finding job openings, and providing employment support. For student convenience, the university has a dedicated Career Planning Service team that assists in building their CV and finding suitable employment opportunities. This could range from a job after completing their degree, part-time work, summer jobs, or internships.

Cameron University also offers campus housing for an immersive living-learning experience. The Shepler Center provides students with all the facilities of a typical apartment, making on-campus housing a comfortable option. The Cameron Village is an added convenience for students to socialize and build meaningful connections.

The university's commitment to its students extends beyond their academic journey. The Cameron University Alumni Association works towards building and supporting a strong network of alumni, former students, and friends. Its objective is to foster enduring ties with its members, promote interest and involvement in the university and its initiatives, and engage in philanthropy and community service.

For international students, the average cost of attendance may vary from that of domestic students. Estimated tuition and fees for an international student would amount to approximately Rs. 1,955,785, excluding other miscellaneous expenses. To aid students financially, Cameron University offers scholarships, work-study opportunities, and various funding options.

Plan your future with Cameron University and explore the range of programs it offers. Visit Leap Scholar for further details and find the perfect course to realize your aspirations.

Accommodation:
The main goal of the Office of Student Housing and Residence Life is to empower students and help them become responsible citizens, lifelong learners, and leaders by providing them with formative, comprehensive experiences. Our office strives to create an inclusive and safe environment that focuses on student success and supports their educational journey. We firmly believe that students who live on campus have a higher chance of achieving success, and our aim is to provide them with the tools and resources to excel not only in the classroom but also in their personal lives. 
At Cameron University, we offer two housing options for our students - the Shepler Center and Cameron Village. The Shepler complex consists of two towers - South Shepler Tower for all female residents and North Shepler Tower for all male residents. These towers offer single and double rooms, and freshmen can opt to live on an all-freshman floor. The community bathrooms at the Shepler Towers are cleaned daily by our professional custodial staff. Each level of the towers has a lounge area where students can socialize, study, and build relationships.
The amenities provided in our housing facilities are top-notch, including room essentials like beds, tables, chairs, etc. We also offer laundry services, on-campus cafeterias, 24/7 security, and mail services. 
Cameron Village, our other housing option, offers apartment-style accommodation with two and four-bedroom flats. Each resident has a private bedroom with a lockable door and a vanity, and two residents share a bathroom. The buildings in Cameron Village are coed, but individual apartments are not. Students living in Cameron Village also have access to a fully-equipped kitchen, laundry services, a recreation center, 24/7 security, and mail services. 
For more information on housing options, please visit our website: https://www.cameron.edu/housing. 
If you have any further questions, feel free to reach out to us. We are committed to providing our students with the best housing experience to support their academic and personal growth at Cameron University.

Name: The College of Saint Rose
Overview: The College of Saint Rose, located in Albany, USA, is a multidisciplinary university offering undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs to both on-campus and distance education students. The university is renowned for its academic excellence in various fields, specifically in Business. International students require a minimum IELTS score of 6.0 to be eligible for admission. The average cost of attendance for both domestic and international students varies depending on the program of study, with an estimated average tuition and fees of INR 30,11,904 for international students. Scholarships, work-study opportunities, and other financial aids are available for students who require financial assistance. Moreover, the university has a dedicated Career Planning Service team to help students build strong resumes, find part-time or summer jobs, internships, or permanent positions after graduation. On average, graduates from The College of Saint Rose earn an annual salary of USD 50,491. If you aspire to study at a prestigious university with vast academic offerings, then The College of Saint Rose is an excellent choice for you. Eligibility Overview:
1. A transcript from high school and college/university is essential as part of the application process. In some cases, World Education Services, Inc. (WES) or Educational Credentials Evaluators (ECE) may be required to provide an evaluation of the transcripts. The evaluation results will then be sent to the College.

2. Upon request, non-native English speaking students must take and submit either the SAT, ACT, International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) exam to the Admissions office. Attaining a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based TOEFL exam, 173 on the computer-based exam, or 80 on the Internet-based exam is necessary for admission to The College of Saint Rose. A minimum score of 5.5 is required for admission on the IELTS exam.

3. The Financial Certification form must be completed by all applicants. This form certifies the applicant's ability to fund their studies and is necessary for the issuance of the I-20 immigration form. The completed application and Financial Certification forms should be sent to The College of Saint Rose, located at 432 Western Avenue, Albany, NY 12203-1490, USA.

4. Applicants must also submit an essay on one of the suggested topics provided in the application.

5. All international students are required to undergo the Mantoux (PPD) skin test six months prior to arrival. If the results show a positive outcome, further x-rays will be necessary to determine if tuberculosis (TB) is active. If medication is needed, it should be started before entering the country. Necessary physician paperwork should be completed prior to arriving on campus.

Name: California State University Sacramento
Overview:
California's California State Institution, Sacramento (CSUS, Sacramento State, or Sac State), founded in 1947 as Sacramento State College, is a public university and the eleventh-oldest institution in the state. It has an annual enrolment of approximately 31,500 students and boasts over 250,000 alumni, awarding 9,000 degrees each year. The university offers doctoral, master's, and bachelor's degrees, as well as teaching certifications. Its main campus is located in Sacramento, the capital of California.
Moreover, the university collaborates with the Moss Landing Marine Laboratories, providing marine science programs. International and domestic students can pursue undergraduate and postgraduate programs at Sacramento State, with varying costs of attendance depending on their course choices. Notable figures such as Martin Luther King Jr. (1967), Genesis (1992), Sheryl Crow (1995), Woody Harrelson (2001), Oliver Stone (2006), John Kerry (2004), Wangari Maathai (2009), Maya Soetoro-Ng (2009), Jesse Jackson (1998), Jimi Hendrix (1968), and Chuck D (2010) have delivered lectures or performed at the university.
The university offers scholarships, work-study opportunities, and additional financial aid to students, equipping them with the skills and resources to secure employment after graduation, whether it be full-time or part-time, internship or summer job. The estimated average tuition and fees for international students is approximately 2413926 INR. This is achieved through a collaborative career development approach, where the institution actively engages, educates, and empowers its students and alumni. In order to attract and inform talented individuals, the university builds strong relationships with employers and the local community.

The Career Center at the university offers a wide range of services to assist students and alumni in their pursuit of career advancement. This includes workshops on various topics such as interviewing skills, job search strategies, resume and cover letter writing, pay negotiation, and building a targeted job search plan. By utilizing these resources, students and alumni can confidently navigate their way towards achieving their career goals.
Accommodation: This is some information about on-campus accommodation options at a university. The university prioritizes the safety and comfort of its students and strives to create an environment where they can form lasting memories. Housing is available on two different campuses, each offering a unique experience. One option is the North Village housing complex, which can house over 2,100 students. Here, students have the option of living in single or double rooms, as well as apartments. Each residence hall is equipped with study rooms, recreational rooms, lounges, kitchenettes, and laundry facilities. Wi-Fi access, computer labs, cable TV, and Xfinity On Campus with 120+ Digital and HD online channels with DVR service are also available. The North Village is situated near the American River, providing students with access to walking and bicycling trails. Residents can also enjoy the amenities provided, such as a gaming lounge, movie room, exercise center, pool, basketball and tennis courts, and a rooftop terrace. When it comes to dining, there are plenty of options available at The Servery at the Dining Commons and the Courtyard Market. The North Village has a dedicated full-time, live-in staff that includes post-masters and qualified Resident Advisors. These individuals plan educational events, offer academic advice, and act as mentors for the residents. Moving on to the second option, Hornet Commons is a pet-friendly community located on the university campus. It offers fully furnished individual and communal bedroom options, keeping students close to both fun and their classes. Residents have access to various amenities, including a resort-style swimming pool, community lounges, a yoga lawn, a basketball court, a sand volleyball court, a business center, a dog park, and a state-of-the-art fitness center. Each apartment is equipped with a washer and dryer, high-speed internet, cable, and all-inclusive rent packages that cover water, sewer, trash, and electricity. The kitchen is fully stocked with a stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, and ample cupboard space, providing students with the opportunity to save money on groceries. For more information, please visit the university's website.

Name: University of Tennessee
Overview:
The University of Tennessee, also known as Blount College since its establishment in 1794, is a renowned public research university located in Knoxville, Tennessee. As the flagship campus under the University of Tennessee System, it offers a wide range of academic opportunities through its ten undergraduate and eleven graduate colleges. With over 900 programs of study, the institute provides students with top-quality education and prepares them for successful careers in their respective fields. Among the popular programs offered at the University of Tennessee are MBA, MSc Mechanical Engineering, MSc Nursing, B.A. Sociology, and M.A. Women, Gender, and Sexuality Studies. 

The University of Tennessee offers its students valuable opportunities for internships and co-ops, facilitating hands-on experience in their chosen fields. The average tuition cost for students at the institute is CAD 19k. International students are also eligible for full merit-based grants, bursaries, and scholarships, ensuring equal access to quality education. With its diverse and extensive academic offerings, the University of Tennessee stands as a leading institution for students seeking a comprehensive and fulfilling educational experience.

Name: Long Island University Brooklyn (LIU Brooklyn)
Overview: Established in 1926, Long Island University (LIU) is a globally-recognized university located in 1 University Plaza, Brooklyn, NY, that places a strong emphasis on the quality of education and opportunities for both teaching and research. This university has been accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE) and is widely known for its prestigious programs. It has also received accreditation from renowned organizations such as the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) and the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (CCNE). Situated on a sprawling campus, LIU Brooklyn boasts of nine academic buildings, housing various facilities and amenities for its students. An outstanding program offered by this university is the four-year undergraduate program called LIU Global, which provides students the unique opportunity to study and live in eight different countries throughout eight semesters. The health care sector is also a focal point for this campus, with College of Pharmacy and Health Science and School of Nursing offering professional programs. LIU also offers more than 275 courses, which include graduate, undergraduate, and post-doctoral programs, through its 12 schools and colleges, enrolling approximately 15,000 students annually across its various campuses. These courses span a wide range of subject areas such as business, accounting, computer science, health science, psychology, arts, theater, science, journalism, and many more. With a student-faculty ratio of 12:1, LIU has assembled a team of 488 full-time professors to guide its students through their academic journey. The university offers a staggering amount of financial aid, with an annual disbursement of $100 million in scholarships alone. In the U.S. News & World Report - National University Ranking, Long Island University holds a strong position at 272. Its faculty body comprises of over 500 members, all of whom are highly qualified in their respective fields of expertise. This includes multiple Fulbright Scholars, Academy Award winners, and accomplished scientists whose research has significantly contributed to medical advancements. The Brooklyn campus of LIU has received accolades for being the best school and college in various disciplines, as stated by various ranking websites.
Eligibility Overview:
The criteria for eligibility may vary depending on the degree being pursued. The requirements for each degree are as follows: 
Undergraduate Students: Admission to the undergraduate program will be based on high school academic performance or standardized test scores such as SAT or ACT. Students must have completed their high school education and obtained a diploma or certificate in order to apply for an undergraduate program. 
Postgraduate Students: In order to gain admission to the university's postgraduate program, students must possess a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Some courses may also require a minimum score on the GRE or GMAT exams. 
English Language Requirements: Students are required to demonstrate proficiency in the English language, which may vary depending on their chosen program. This could include providing scores from standardized tests such as TOEFL or IELTS.

Name: Ashland University
Overview: Ashland University, established in 1878, is a private institution located in the city of Ashland, Ohio. Offering a wide range of courses, the university is organized into four academic colleges, including the College of Arts and Sciences, Richard E. & Sandra J. Dauch College of Business & Economics, Dwight Schar College of Nursing & Health Sciences, and Dwight Schar College of Education. Popular majors at Ashland University include Accounting, Business Analytics, Cybersecurity, English, Forensic Biology, History, Marketing, Education, Mathematics, and more. Students have the opportunity to select from a diverse range of programs that suit their interests and career goals. Financial aid is available for high-achieving students, with the average cost of tuition after aid being $19,758. An impressive 99% of students at the university receive financial assistance. According to Forbes, the average grant awarded at Ashland University is $12,432, with an acceptance rate of 74%. Graduates of Ashland University can expect a median salary of $80,000 after a decade of work experience.
Eligibility Overview:
Information regarding undergraduate and graduate admissions to Ashland University is presented below. The university offers a diverse range of programs such as Sports Communication, Public Relations, Spanish Education, Life Science, Forensic Chemistry, Toxicology, Business Management, and more.

To apply for admissions, international students must submit the completed application form along with the required documents and pay the application fee. The necessary requirements include transcripts of previous coursework, letters of recommendation (LOR), a valid passport, visa, IELTS/TOEFL ELP scores, and test results (SAT or ACT).

For students applying to graduate programs, a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required. Additional requirements may include scores from the English Proficiency Test, LORs, work experience, a portfolio, and GMAT or GRE scores.

Ashland University offers various graduate-level programs, including a Master of Business Administration (MBA), Master of Education, Nursing, Master of Fine Arts, and Master of Fine Arts in American History and Government. Each program is designed to provide students with the necessary skills and knowledge to excel in their chosen field.
Placement: Placements at Ashland UniversityThe mission of Ashland University's Career Center for Life Calling, or placement department, is to equip students with the tools to effectively manage their career-life journey through networking and honing their skills.Previously, the starting pay for graduates in full-time positions was an average of $63,089, showcasing the success of Ashland University's placement services in preparing students for the workforce.
Accommodation:
The university offers a variety of on-campus accommodation options for students. To secure a place to stay, please visit our Administration website and go to the Accommodations page at https://www.ashland.edu/administration/auxiliary-services/accommodations. 
For convenient and comfortable living, choose from our diverse selection of on-campus accommodation facilities. Our on-campus residence options cater to different needs, providing options such as single and double rooms, suites, and apartments. 
To make the most of your campus experience, we highly recommend staying on-campus. Living on campus will allow you to fully immerse yourself in the university's academic and social activities and develop meaningful connections with other students. 
To ensure that you find the perfect accommodation fit, please visit our Accommodations page for more information and to begin your application process. We look forward to welcoming you on campus.

Name: Washington State University
Overview:
The founding of Washington State University dates back to 1890, when it was established as a public university with a land-grant mission. Classified by Carnegie as one of the 115 doctoral universities with the highest research activity, WSU offers a diverse range of 95 undergraduate majors and over 100 in-major specializations. The university has a global student community with individuals hailing from more than 50 countries across all 7 continents. This highly regarded institution boasts 79 master's degree programs, 65 doctoral degree programs, and three professional degree programs.

WSU is comprised of 11 colleges and one graduate school, providing students with a plethora of opportunities to pursue their academic interests. The university offers over 700 scholarship programs, making it easier for students to fund their education. In addition, WSU facilitates diverse experiences for its students with over 565 Study-Abroad programs available. The university takes pride in its inclusive environment, with 30% of its student population of multicultural backgrounds. To further enhance students' university experience, WSU offers specialized programs such as the College Assistance Migrant Program, First Scholar Program, and Smart Start Program.

For students attending the Pullman - Campus Undergraduate course, the estimated Cost of Attendance (COA) is $28,520 for residents and $43,462 for non-residents. The cost is based on full-time enrollment, which entails 12-18 credits for undergraduate degrees and 10-18 credits for graduate courses.
Eligibility Overview: The admission process for international students at WSU requires submission of various documents. WSU accepts scores from the following exams, which can be sent to our office or included in the online international undergraduate entrance application. Please note that these scores must not be more than two years old. To learn more about the specific requirements for international students, please visit our website at https://ip.wsu.edu/future-students/requirements/.

Name: LIM College
Overview:
Founded in 1939, Laboratory Institute of Merchandising (LIM) is a prestigious institution located in Manhattan, New York. It offers a diverse range of undergraduate and graduate degrees specifically tailored for fashion students. LIM is committed to bridging the gap between practical experience and academic knowledge, making it a preferred choice for those who aspire to have a successful career in the fashion industry. The Middle States Commission approves the accreditation and the college's degree programs, including BPS and BBA, are certified by the Accreditation Council for Business School and Programs. Admission requirements typically vary based on the specific course, and may include GRE, GMAT, SAT, or ACT scores. Additionally, applicants must also demonstrate proficiency in English by providing scores for IELTS or TOEFL exams.

Students can avail of scholarships and grants offered by LIM to potentially reduce the cost of their education. Also, the college regularly organizes various competitive events where students get the opportunity to participate and showcase their talent, such as New York Fashion Week. Besides, LIM frequently invites renowned fashion professionals to share their industry expertise with the students. With a student-to-faculty ratio of 16:1, LIM ensures personalized attention and effective learning for its nearly 1781 students.

LIM boasts an exceptional graduate employment rate of 94%, which reflects the college's strong emphasis on preparing students for their future careers in the fashion industry. In 2020, Niche ranked LIM as the 44th best college location in America. Additionally, in 2019, the respected publication Business of Fashion recognized LIM as one of the Best Schools in the World.
Eligibility Overview:
To be eligible for admission to LIM College, international students are required to provide the results of an English language proficiency exam. This must be one of the following:

- TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)
- IELTS (International English Language Testing System)
- PTE (Pearson Test of English)
- CAE (Cambridge English: Advanced)
- CPE (Cambridge English: Proficiency)
- Duolingo English Test

The score obtained on the chosen English proficiency exam must meet the minimum requirements set by LIM College for admission consideration. This score will serve as a measure of the student's English language proficiency, ensuring that they have the necessary skills to succeed academically at LIM College.

As an international student, it is crucial to demonstrate strong proficiency in the English language in order to excel in the academic environment and participate in various activities on campus. Therefore, it is mandatory to submit the results of the English proficiency exam as part of the admissions process.

At LIM College, we value the diversity and global perspective that international students bring to our campus. We understand the challenges of studying in a different country and aim to provide our students with the necessary support and resources to thrive in their academic pursuits.

In order to ensure that all students are prepared for the rigors of academic coursework, we require international students to meet the English language proficiency requirement as stated by LIM College. We believe that this requirement is in the best interest of our international students, as it sets them up for success and helps them fully integrate into the LIM College community.

University Housing Reviews:

One of the greatest aspects of this college is its exceptional on-campus housing options. Located in the heart of the vivacious Upper Eastside neighborhood, the college provides students with the unique experience of living in a 90-story skyscraper. Just outside the residence hall, students will discover a vibrant community filled with restaurants, museums, and parks. 
The residence hall offers students a variety of options, including double and triple occupancy rooms. Each room comes equipped with individual temperature control, as well as convenient amenities such as refrigerators, microwaves, desks, drawers, and closets. Additionally, students have the luxury of having their own private washroom.
Moreover, the residence complex also provides a range of facilities, such as a workout center, laundry facilities, and WiFi access. Students can also make use of the community kitchen or head to the computer lab to complete their assignments. Detailed on-campus housing information can be easily accessed on the website.
This university truly understands the importance of providing a comfortable and convenient living environment for its students. Don't hesitate to take advantage of the exceptional on-campus housing options at this college.

Name: Brown University
Overview:
Brown University, situated in Providence in the United States, provides comprehensive undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various fields of study. The university also offers online degree programs, catering to distance education students. With an impressive list of academic offerings, Brown University presents opportunities for students to advance their education and career prospects.

At Brown University, students can choose from over two undergraduate and four postgraduate programs. These programs cover diverse areas of study, including engineering, liberal arts, sciences, medicine, and more. The university's reputed faculty comprises accomplished and experienced educators who ensure a high-quality education to students.

When it comes to the cost of attendance, the expenses may differ for international and domestic students depending on the chosen course. For international students, the estimated average tuition and fees for the yearly intakes stands at around $84,986. This amount excludes additional expenses such as housing, food, books, and personal expenses.

For students in need of financial aid, Brown University offers a variety of options such as scholarships, work-study programs, and funding opportunities. The university's Career Planning Service team also provides support to students in building a strong CV and finding suitable job opportunities after graduation, including part-time jobs, summer jobs, and internships. With a strong focus on academic and career development, Brown University equips its students with the necessary skills and knowledge to excel in their chosen fields.
Eligibility Overview:
Brown University considers applicants based on their academic abilities and performance. Students should have completed Grade 12 and obtained a certificate. The university has a set of minimum criteria, which are as follows: 

1. Age: Applicants must be at least 18 years old. 
2. English proficiency: As per the university's guidelines, students must meet the following requirements:

- TOEFL score of at least 100 or an IELTS score of at least 7.0
- Minimum score of 70 for the Duolingo English Test
- Completion of four years of study in an English-speaking high school or university 

 Please note that some courses offer an option for advanced placement credit transfer. For further information, please refer to the university's website for English proficiency requirements. 

Entry requirements for MBA programs are as follows: 

- Bachelor's or master's degree in Business or a related discipline 
- GMAT score of approximately 550 
- At least three years of full-time professional management experience 
- A valid English proficiency test score such as IELTS, TOEFL, etc. 

To learn more about the specific requirements for each course, please visit the relevant program page on the university website.

Accommodation:
Information about On-Campus Accommodation:

All first-year students, as well as 74% of all undergraduates, reside on campus. It is mandatory for all undergraduates, except for married students, those in the Resumed Education Program, and local students living with their parents, to live on campus for at least six semesters. Brown University offers 49 co-ed, smoke-free residence halls, fully equipped with furniture such as bed frames, mattresses, couches, chairs, desks and desk chairs, bookcases, closets, and Wi-Fi connections. Graduate students can opt for one-bedroom or two-bedroom apartments, but availability is limited. Meal plans are inclusive for both on-campus and off-campus residents, including graduate and medical students. There are two all-you-care-to-eat dining halls, three coffee carts, four campus restaurants, and two convenience markets on campus. Special interest housing enables students to live and study with peers who share similar interests. Undergraduates who have completed more than six semesters and graduate students must obtain permission to reside off-campus. For more information, visit https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/accessibility-services/accommodations-services.
Course Ranking: Brown University offers excellent programs in English language, literature, development studies, and economics and econometrics. An impressive 93% of the university's 2018 graduates found employment or attended graduate/professional school within six months of graduation. Popular degree programs at Brown University include computer science, biology/biological sciences, engineering, entrepreneurship, econometrics, and quantitative economics. PG Computers saw a drop in its rankings from 47th in 2017 to 86th in 2021, as per THE rankings. Meanwhile, its engineering and technology ranking also declined from 68th in 2018 to 83rd in 2021. Brown University also saw a drop in its engineering and technology ranking according to QS, falling from 141st in 2017 to 167th in 2020. The university's unique open curriculum allows students to choose their courses freely, with no mandatory prerequisites for general education. This experience sets Brown University apart and offers students unparalleled academic freedom.
University Ranking: Established in 1764, Brown University is recognized as one of the oldest research-based institutions of higher learning in the United States. It holds a prestigious position among the eight renowned universities that make up the Ivy League. Over the years, it has been consistently recognized by top-ranking services and esteemed academic institutions, placing in the top 100 universities globally by QS (Top Universities) and Times Higher Education. Shanghai Ranking's Academic Ranking of World Universities also ranks Brown University among the top 150 institutions, with a notable emphasis on the quality of its faculty, which includes Nobel Prize winners and influential researchers. With an admission rate of just 7.1%, getting into Brown University's undergraduate programs is highly competitive and requires exceptional academic achievements. Its focus on research has helped Brown University's academics and researchers to produce groundbreaking output with a significant impact on the community.

Name: University of the Pacific - San Francisco
Overview: The University of the Pacific, founded in 1851, is a privately owned university affiliated with the Methodist Church located in the United States. Initially known as the College of the Pacific, it is accredited by the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC). With four major campuses, it offers a wide range of degree and diploma programs. The university is divided into various colleges such as Applied Science and Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Film Studies, Graphic Design, Healthcare, Foreign Languages, Media, and others. There are over 80 undergraduate and 30 graduate and professional programs available. The facilities provided to students include a parking garage, central AC, Wi-Fi, mail services, service centers, and access to extensive libraries and resources. The San Francisco campus, situated on the west coast in San Francisco, focuses on clinical education, offering hands-on training in areas such as dentistry and audiology. The University of the Pacific is ranked 1001st in the QS World University Rankings. It maintains a moderately selective admission rate of 71%. The student-faculty ratio of 14:1 promotes individual attention, resulting in an impressive 84% retention rate. While the annual tuition fees may seem expensive for international students, ranging between $50,000 and $55,000, the university provides specialized training programs to equip students with critical employability skills. These programs ensure graduates are industry-ready and equipped to face potential employers within months of their graduation. With a balanced approach of theoretical knowledge and practical application, the University of the Pacific prepares students to excel in their chosen fields.

Name: American University Washington D.C.
Overview: Located in the heart of Washington D.C., American University is a prestigious research university that was established in 1893. It spans over 90 acres of land and is situated in a residential area, creating a close-knit community of students from all around the world. Along with its modern campus facilities, the university is also committed to sustainability by sourcing all its electricity from renewable sources. The university offers a wide range of graduate, undergraduate, doctoral, executive, and pre-college programs across various disciplines. In addition, students can customize their interdisciplinary bachelor's degrees according to their interests. American University also provides online courses at the bachelor's and master's levels for distance learning. The university is home to distinguished colleges and schools, including the Washington College of Law, School of Professional & Extended Studies, School of Communication, School of International Service, School of Education, College of Arts & Sciences, Kogod School of Business, and School of Public Affairs. With a wide array of academic options, American University offers 11 doctoral, 80 bachelor's, and 98 master's degrees. This includes the renowned JD, LLM, MLS, and SJD programs offered by the Washington College of Law. Moreover, the university houses more than 30 specialized research institutes and centers that provide students with valuable hands-on experience. American University proudly welcomes students from all 50 states and over 140 countries, offering them an opportunity to study abroad every semester and gain a global perspective. The university emphasizes combining theoretical knowledge with real-world experiences to prepare students to become future leaders in their fields. With over 250 student organizations and clubs, American University encourages its students to engage in performing arts, sports, and other recreational activities. The university boasts a highly qualified faculty with 94% of its members holding the highest degrees in their respective fields. This includes former diplomats, public representatives, and prestigious award winners such as Oscars, Pulitzers, Emmys, and National Book Awards. American University also promotes community service and strives to create a sustainable and progressive global society by nurturing its students to become future leaders.
Eligibility Overview: Academic success is valued at this university and the required Grade Point Average (GPA) falls within a range of 3.63 to 4.15, as reported by the school. The middle 50% of students have SAT scores ranging from 1310 to 1460 (critical reading and mathematics) and ACT scores between 29 and 33. To demonstrate proficiency in English, undergraduates and graduate students must attain a certain score on the English Proficiency Test.

Name: University of Hawaii at Manoa
Overview:
Located in the tropical paradise of Hawaii, the University of Hawaii at Manoa is a prestigious public institution which was established in 1907 with a focus on agriculture and mechanical arts. Situated in the lush Manoa Valley in the bustling city of Honolulu, the university has grown to become the flagship campus of the wider University of Hawaii program. Boasting cutting-edge research facilities such as the Hawaii Institute of Geophysics and Planetology and the Hawaii Institute of Marine Biology, the university offers students unparalleled opportunities for academic growth.

Composed of 17 schools and colleges, the University of Hawaii at Manoa offers a wide range of 200 bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees in diverse fields of education. Programs popular among students include the MA in Economics, Masters in Accounting, and MS in Civil Engineering. The university prides itself on its diverse student body, attracting students from all over the world. With more than 200 student organizations, students have ample opportunities to engage and collaborate beyond their academic pursuits, fostering an all-round development during their time here.

Some notable alumni of the university include US senator Daniel Inouye, former astronaut Ed Lu, and Richard Parsons, the former chairperson of Citigroup. The university's annual cost comes to an average of USD 30,000, with tuition fees varying depending on the chosen course and its duration.

However, the following additional standardized tests might be required:

• International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma's General Certificate of Education (GCE)
• Hong Kong Advanced Level Examination (HKALE) results
• National college entrance exams from your country (e.g., China Gaokao)
• Certificates of national qualifications (e.g., Australia HSC, India HSC, German Arbitur, New Zealand NCEA)

Name: Bowie State University
Overview:
Bowie State University (BSU), the first black university in Maryland, was established in 1865 by the Baltimore Association for Educational & Moral Development. Located in Bowie, Maryland, in proximity to Washington D.C. and Baltimore, BSU encompasses a main campus spanning over 988 square feet. Dedicated to academic excellence, BSU offers a wide range of programs including 22 undergraduate, 19 master's degrees, 2 PhDs, and 14 certificates in diverse and demanding fields such as Criminal Justice/Safety Studies, Business Administration & Management, Psychology, Biology/Biological Sciences, and Radio & Television Broadcasting Technology. With a student-faculty ratio of 15:1, BSU prioritizes individualized attention and personalized support for its students.

BSU boasts a variety of career options for students, including Internship programs, Fellowships, Co-op Jobs, Enterprise Management Training programs, and post-graduation placements. These opportunities aim to bridge the gap between classroom learning and real-world experiences, preparing students to excel in their chosen fields.

BSU's lively campus life offers students 50+ clubs and organizations to promote camaraderie, cultivate connections, and expand global networks. Moreover, the university offers on-campus residential accommodations across six fully-furnished halls, equipped with all essential amenities, for students to comfortably reside in during their academic pursuit.

The average annual in-state cost of attendance at Bowie State University is $8,444, while the out-of-state fee amounts to $19,136, barring additional expenses. However, the university offers several need-based financial aid and scholarship opportunities for full-time undergraduate students, with a maximum value of $7,535. This aids in making education at BSU accessible to deserving students who may require financial assistance.
Eligibility Overview:
An undergraduate degree from an accredited university with a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale is mandatory. However, conditional admission may be considered for those with a lower overall grade point average. Official transcripts can be assessed through any of the following methods:

- Accredited foreign educational credential evaluators, such as SpanTran, Pathways World Education Services, or World Education Services.
- Demonstration of strong English language proficiency through one of the following tests:
1. Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL)
2. International English Language Testing System (IELTS)
3. Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE)
4. Cambridge English: Proficiency (CPE)

International students are required to submit their scores from one of the above-mentioned tests to showcase their competency in the English language. This is to ensure that they can participate actively and fully in all academic activities. Our university places great emphasis on English proficiency to facilitate academic success and a seamless integration into the university community.

Accommodation: BSU offers traditional on-campus residential housing, which is available in six residence halls. Additionally, students can also choose to reside in the Christa McAuliffe Residential Community, or opt for off-campus housing affiliated with the university. Most of the residence halls offer double rooms, communal bathrooms, and kitchens. However, the Alex Haley Residential Complex offers suite-style accommodation. Students with disabilities can receive assistance in finding suitable housing and other necessary services through the Disability Support Services. The university dormitories are equipped with vending machines, laundry facilities, cable TV, lounges, kitchenettes, and air conditioning. All students, except freshmen, have the option of living in the Christa McAuliffe Residential Community, which offers fully furnished apartments with two, three, or four bedrooms and full kitchens.

Name: Bluffton University
Overview:
One of the prominent private Mennonite universities located in the peaceful town of Bluffton, Ohio is Bluffton University. It has acquired programmatic accreditation from the Higher Learning Commission for four of its programs, including dietetics, education, music, and social work. Operating since several decades now, the university boasts of a diverse selection of over eighty majors, minors, as well as interdisciplinary programs, with sixteen NCAA DIII athletic teams.

To gain admission, prospective applicants must fulfill certain criteria, including a minimum score of 6.0 in the IELTS or 61 in the TOEFL. While the cost of attendance may vary for international and domestic students across different courses, the average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenses, for international students rounds up to approximately 26,92,590 INR. However, these costs can be mitigated through the different scholarships, work-study programs, and other funding opportunities offered by the university.

Additionally, Bluffton University also provides its students with a dedicated Career Planning Service team that helps them build a strong CV and find suitable employment opportunities post-course completion, be it a full-time job, part-time opportunity, summer internship or any other form of career development. According to the recent statistics on the university's graduates, they earn an average of $72k, as reported by 6figr, which stands testament to the exceptional quality of education and practical skills imparted by Bluffton University.
Eligibility Overview:
The following are the admission requirements that must be met by students to be considered for enrollment at our esteemed university: 
- A high school GPA of 3.0 or above 
- A minimum score of 19 points 
- A high school GPA between 2.3 and 2.99 
- ACT/990 SAT scores 
- Consideration may also be given to class rank or participation in the College Credit Plus program 
- The ability to demonstrate proficiency in the English language through a designated test 

In order to be eligible for admission, students must meet all of the above criteria. Our university values academic excellence, as evidenced by a strong GPA and test scores. Students with a lower GPA falling between 2.3 and 2.99 may still be considered, but must have a minimum of 19 points and demonstrate potential for success. We also take into consideration class rank and participation in the College Credit Plus program, which can show a student's dedication to their education. Additionally, students must demonstrate proficiency in the English language through a designated test. This is important as our university values diversity and the ability to communicate effectively in a global setting.

Placement:
Bluffton University offers a unique academic experience that combines classroom instruction with hands-on learning opportunities. Our university strongly encourages students to participate in internships, research projects, and service-learning activities during their time here. By taking advantage of these opportunities, students can enhance their cross-cultural experiences and gain valuable real-world skills.

At Bluffton, we believe that service-learning is an essential part of education. This method combines classroom learning with community service, allowing students to apply their knowledge in a practical setting. Service-learning options are available through general education courses as well as major-specific classes. The May term also offers the chance for students to participate in short-term or semester-long service-learning activities. Completion of cross-cultural learning is a graduation requirement, and students often fulfill this requirement by embarking on foreign or domestic adventures. Our students also have the opportunity to share their cross-cultural experiences through Forum presentations and photo contests.

We understand the importance of practical experience in preparing our students for their future careers. That's why we strongly encourage students to participate in internships, research projects, and field placements. While some degree programs require these experiences, we encourage all students to consider them. We provide financial support through various grants, including Discovery Grants, Pi Delta Research Grants, Professional Enrichment Grants, and the Ministry Inquiry Program.

In sum, Bluffton University offers a diverse range of opportunities for hands-on learning, community engagement, and practical experience. We are dedicated to providing our students with a well-rounded education that prepares them for success in their chosen fields. Take advantage of our many internship, service-learning, and research opportunities to make the most of your academic journey at Bluffton University.
Accommodation:
At Bluffton University, we believe that building relationships is crucial. Our classrooms, The Commons, sports courts, and residence halls all provide opportunities for students to form lifelong connections.

On-Campus Accommodation is an important aspect of a college experience, which is why Bluffton expects traditional undergraduate students to reside in one of our residential halls if they do not live at home or within a convenient commute. Our Residential Life program oversees six residence halls and one set of apartments, with student support personnel such as hall directors, resident advisers, and ministry assistants residing in each facility.

Bren-Dell Hall, which can accommodate 95 students, is situated on the bank of Riley Creek. It is a gender-segregated residence, with separate floors for men and women. Each of the three floors has a kitchen, and the second floor has a spacious study lounge. In 2015, we renovated the hallway and main entrance to provide a more welcoming environment. Construction of Bren-Dell was completed in 1962.

Hirschy Annex, which houses up to 107 students, is also a gender-segregated residence. Similar to Bren-Dell Hall, the first floor contains a large lobby and kitchen, while the second and third floors offer rooms with a connecting hallway, a passageway, and a computer lab. Hirschy Annex was built in 1966.

Hirschy Hall, a residential hall for 97 men and women, has three floors, each with a kitchen. The main lobby on the ground floor is spacious and airy, with large windows. Hirschy Hall opened its doors in 1963, and its infamous bronze cast of Noah Hirschy, the university's first president, is believed to bring good luck to students who rub its nose before taking an exam.

Neufeld Hall, completed in 2003, is a divided hall with 108 men and women on separate wings. Seniors and juniors are given priority in residing in this hall. Each floor has a lobby, kitchen, and suite-style hallways, as well as a game room, conference room, and computer lab. The rooms are equipped with versatile furniture which can be reconfigured in 50 different ways, allowing students more freedom in arranging their living space. Each room has a bed, chest of drawers, desk and desk organizer, bookcase, and chair.

Ramseyer Hall can accommodate 109 students and also has segregated floors for men and women. Facilities such as air conditioning, an elevator, and kitchenette on every floor make living in this hall more convenient. There is also a fully equipped kitchen and a fitness facility for students to use. Ramseyer opened its doors in 1994.

Ropp Hall, the largest residence hall at Bluffton, can accommodate 231 students. A popular gathering area for students is "The Pit," located near the main entrance. The majority of its nine floors have study lounges and cooking facilities, and its annex has a bigger, fully equipped kitchen. The Bluffton Centre for Academic Excellence and Health Center are also located in Ropp Hall for the convenience of students.

Ropp served as the first women's residence hall in 1914. In 1958, an additional wing called Ropp Annex was constructed, and Ropp Addition was completed in 1967. Today, Ropp Hall houses both men and women on different floors.

All our residence halls offer various amenities, including a main lobby with cable TV, a kitchenette, and laundry facilities. Ironing boards are also available in designated areas. For more information on our residence halls, please visit our website.

Name: Stony Brook University
Overview: With a foundation dating back to 1957, Stony Brook University stands as one of the most distinguished public universities in the United States. Its location in Stony Brook, New York, has allowed it to make significant contributions to NASA. Its high standing is evidenced by the Universities Research Association's honorary membership. As a leading research institution, the university offers both undergraduate and graduate-level education to students. Its colleges and schools include the College of Business, College of Engineering and Applied Sciences, Renaissance School of Medicine, School of Health Technology and Management, School of Professional Development, School of Nursing, College of Arts and Sciences, Graduate School, School of Dental Medicine, School of Journalism, School of Social Welfare, and School of Marine and Atmospheric Sciences. Some of the most sought-after programs at Stony Brook University are Biomedical Engineering, Nursing, Computer Science, and Psychology. The institute also facilitates exchange programs like National Student Exchange, Study Abroad, SUNY Korea, and Semester by the Sea. The university's top programs include MBA, M.Sc in Finance, B.Sc in Business Management, M.Sc in Mechanical Engineering, and M.Sc in Computer Engineering. The cost of attending Stony Brook University is dependent on the chosen program; however, the minimum fee is USD 10,175.
Eligibility Overview:
The academic requirements for admission to this university are based on the level of secondary education completed by the applicant in their home country. Preference is given to those who have completed a rigorous secondary academic program with a focus on math, science, and English courses. 
Postgraduate applicants are expected to have a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0, or its equivalent, from their undergraduate studies. If the applicant has not yet completed their undergraduate curriculum, admission will be conditional upon providing a final transcript with the degree and date of completion included. 
For those applying for an MBA program, a minimum GPA of 3.0 is required from previous academic work. In some exceptional cases, a GPA below 3.0 may be considered for conditional admission to the College of Business, with the condition being to earn a 3.0 GPA in the first semester of studies. 
The admissions committee also requires a minimum GMAT score of 550, although scores exceeding this minimum will still be considered for admission. Applicants must submit an official copy of their GMAT score before their admission application can be processed. 
Proficiency in English is also necessary for all applicants, and evidence of this can be provided through standardized language tests such as TOEFL or IELTS.

Popular employers among alumni include Stony Brook University itself, as well as Stony Brook Hospital, J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. (JPMCC), Amazon.com Inc, and Lockheed Martin Corp. Hennessy (President of Stanford University), and Jeff Raskin, who is known for his work as an author and co-creator of the Macintosh at Apple Computer Inc.
Accommodation:
The university offers students a variety of accommodation options both on and off campus. Undergraduates can choose between two types of housing: corridor style and suite-style. For those who prefer a traditional dorm-style environment, the corridor style includes a double/single bedroom and a common bathroom, as well as a shared lounge area. Those in search of privacy and additional space may opt for the suite-style, which includes two or three rooms that can accommodate four to six people, a shared bathroom, and a common room. Popular residence hall options include West Apartment, Chavez Hall, Tubman Hall, Eleanor Roosevelt, H Quad, Kelly Quad, Mendelsohn Quad, Roth Quad, and Tabler Quad.

Graduate students and married/domestic couples with children can take advantage of the on-campus apartment-style housing. The university offers apartments at Schomburg, Chapin, and West for this purpose.

Name: Indiana University
Overview: Indiana University is a notable multicampus public research institute that holds high rankings in multiple districts within Indiana. As a leader in both liberal arts and science education, Indiana University has a long-standing legacy of academic excellence and notable research achievements that spans over two centuries. The institute strives to maintain this success as it sets its sights on greater heights. Its goal is to provide accessible education to students not only in Indiana, but also across the United States and beyond. Across its various campuses, Indiana University offers a range of undergraduate and professional graduate programs. Its flagship campus, Indiana University Bloomington, is home to esteemed academic departments including the Jacobs School of Music, Maurer School of Law, and Kelley School of Business. Purdue Campus also serves as a flagship campus, and there are seven extension campuses located throughout Indiana, such as Kokomo and Fort Wayne. The average tuition fee at Indiana University is CAD 13,428. International students are eligible for merit-based scholarships, making the institute more financially attainable for those seeking an education there. Embracing the principles of diversity and inclusion, Indiana University fosters a diverse campus community, and kicks off each academic year with a vibrant Welcome Week for all new students. With over 750 registered social clubs and societies, students are given ample opportunities to pursue their interests and passions outside of their academic pursuits. Furthermore, Indiana University provides extensive career resources to support students in securing valuable internships and placement offers. By encouraging students to follow their passions along with their ambitions, Indiana University sets its students up for success both during and after their time at the institute.
Eligibility Overview: To apply for admission to Indiana University, you must present academic records that reflect your achievements in high school. These documents must be issued by your school or the issuing organization and must be authentic and original. If the documents are not in English, you must also provide an English translation. You can submit photocopies or translations that have been notarized, if needed. Along with these documents, all international undergraduate applicants must demonstrate their proficiency in English as required by Indiana University. If you have not met this requirement within the past two years, you must provide additional proof of your English competency. Below, you can find the minimum scores needed for the various exams accepted by the university at the time of your application.

Housing is divided into three neighborhoods, each with unique programs, dining options, amenities, services, and academic resources.

All Indiana University students are eligible for on-campus housing, regardless of their race, color, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or national origin. The university is committed to providing equal housing opportunities to all its students.

The university also offers off-campus accommodation options for students who prefer to live outside the campus. The average monthly rent for off-campus housing ranges from $550 to $750, depending on the type of apartment. Students can choose from studio flats, 3-bedroom apartments, 4-bedroom apartments, or shared apartments. Basic services such as electricity, water, gas, and unrestricted internet access are included in the rent, making off-campus housing a convenient and cost-effective option for students.

All off-campus apartments are strategically located near major universities and utilities, making it easier for students to commute. These apartments also provide easy access to various student-friendly amenities and recreational areas.

Looking for off-campus housing near the Indiana University at Bloomington? You can easily find various options on websites like Apartments.com, College Student Apartments, and Rentcollegepads.com, which are specifically designed to help students find the perfect housing option near their university.

Name: Concordia University Irvine
Overview:
Concordia University Irvine, located in Irvine, USA, is a prestigious higher education institution offering undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs both on-campus and online. It offers a diverse range of academic options, with a strong focus on Business-related courses. The university boasts a sprawling campus in Irvine, and international and domestic students can choose from a variety of programs. However, the cost of attendance may vary based on the program of interest. 

The university prioritizes career development and provides students with resources through its Career Planning Service team. The team helps students prepare resumes, look for employment opportunities, and secure internships, summer jobs, or part-time positions upon graduation. The university offers scholarships, work-study programs, and other forms of financial aid to support students. The estimated tuition and fees for international students is approximately INR 2500948, excluding additional expenses.

With a strong emphasis on academic excellence, Concordia University Irvine values diversity and offers a welcoming and inclusive learning environment. For students looking for a fulfilling academic journey and career prospects, Concordia University Irvine is the ideal choice. For more information and a comprehensive list of available courses, visit Leap Scholar today.
Eligibility Overview:
Concordia University caters to prospective students through a diverse range of 26 undergraduate majors and 50 specialized courses. Business Administration and Management, Nursing and Health, and Physical Education are some of the highly sought-after programs offered by the university. International students must possess a minimum GPA of 2.8 in high school to be considered for admission.

Admission criteria include presenting official high school transcripts and evidence of financial plan to cover educational expenses. The high school transcripts must reflect a cumulative GPA of 3.42 or higher. Additionally, applicants are required to submit their official test scores from either SAT or ACT. A letter of reference and an affidavit of financial support are also mandatory for the application process.

All official high school transcripts must be directly emailed by the guidance counselor on behalf of the student. Only those with a GPA of 2.8 or its equivalent in the grading system of their respective country are eligible to apply. It is also necessary to choose one of the SAT/ACT scores and include it in the application. An affidavit of financial support must be included to demonstrate the student's capability to cover all educational costs, including tuition, accommodation, etc. A recent bank statement must also be submitted.
Placement: Concordia University Irvine boasts impressive placements with renowned companies actively recruiting its graduates, such as Adidas, KPMG, Disney, and Marriott Hotels.

Data for University Accommodation

The university offers on-campus housing options for its students. It is mandatory for all students under the age of 21 to live on campus. University housing is provided for undergraduate students, while graduate students may live on campus with permission from the Director of University & Residential Housing Services. The three student halls available are Chi Rho, Chi Sigma, and Upper/Lower Quads. For more information on on-campus housing, please visit the university's website.

Name: Old Dominion University
Overview:
Old Dominion University is a prominent public university situated in Norfolk, Virginia. It was established in 1930 by the College of William and Mary, and its name is derived from King Charles II of England who gave Virginia the nickname "Old Dominion" in recognition of its loyalty during the English Civil War. The university upholds the value of traditional as well as modern education to equip students with the skills and knowledge needed to become empathetic and critical leaders capable of making a global impact. It is divided into 8 colleges and one graduate school - the College of Arts and Letters, Strome College of Business, Darden College of Education and Professional Studies, Batten College of Engineering and Technology, College of Health Sciences, College of Sciences, Perry Honors College, School of Cybersecurity, and The Graduate School. Its acceptance rate is at an impressive 89%, making it one of the top educational institutions in the country.

Old Dominion University offers a diverse range of academic programs including over 90 undergraduate, 43 graduate, and 50 doctoral degrees. With courses such as Gender and Cultural Studies, Modelling and Simulation, and Social and Behavioral Sciences, the university emphasizes academic excellence and prepares students for success in various fields. The average cost of attendance, including on-campus living expenses, is approximately $40,000, but students can avail of numerous grants and scholarships to reduce this amount to $29,000. Its main campus spans over 251 acres of beautiful land and boasts top-notch facilities such as residence halls, recreational halls, libraries, athletic centers, laboratories, and conference halls.

Old Dominion University takes pride in its extensive alumni network, which includes notable graduates and successful professionals. It also maintains a high placement rate, ensuring that students achieve personal and professional success after graduation.
Eligibility Overview:
Refurbished version of university credential guidelines
 
To ensure a fair admission process, the Office of International Admissions carefully evaluates all foreign academic credentials. All documents submitted during the application process become the property of Old Dominion University and will not be returned.
 
Please note that official transcripts, translations, and standardized tests must be sent directly to the Office of International Admissions at Old Dominion University in a sealed envelope, with the stamp of the university or testing organization. The Registrar or the Principal/Controller of Examinations are examples of acceptable testing authorities.
 
If the language of instruction is not English, both English and native language transcripts and course descriptions are required. Academic documents, which are not in English, must accompany duly certified official translations by a licensed or professional translator. Student translations will not be accepted.
 
Make sure to follow these guidelines to avoid any delays or complications in the admission process. For further assistance, please refer to our website or contact the Office of International Admissions directly. We are looking forward to welcoming you to Old Dominion University!

Name: Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences (MCPHS University)
Overview:
MCPHS University, located in Boston, Massachusetts, is an esteemed private institute accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education. It offers a diverse range of accelerated and traditional programs in the healthcare and pharmacy field, preparing students for their professional careers. MCPHS has three campuses in Worcester, Manchester, and Boston, providing undergraduate and advanced opportunities in the healthcare industry. Its Boston campus hosts the Direct Entry Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm.D) program, which offers practical clinical experiences in laboratory settings.

At MCPHS, students can also take advantage of its part-time online programs, allowing them to work full-time while pursuing a certificate or degree. The university also offers various research, internship, and clinical placement opportunities, collaborating with prestigious healthcare organizations. Upon completing any full-time MCPHS degree, students can receive a 100% tuition scholarship for one of the six part-time, online master's programs, including Public Health, Regulatory Affairs and Health Policy, Health Sciences, Healthcare Management, Clinical Management, and Clinical Research.

In 2018, the Wall Street Journal/Times Higher Education College Rankings ranked MCPHS the #1 University for Earning Power, recognizing its excellence in preparing students for successful careers. With around 7,100 enrolled students and 826 faculty members (of which 90% hold terminal degrees), the institute maintains a low student-faculty ratio of 13:1. Notable alumni of MCPHS include Ronald A. Matricarian, Chairman of Systems Oncology LLC, and Robert Goforth, a politician from Kentucky.
Eligibility Overview:
Here are the required documents that must be submitted by all first-year applicants:
- High school transcript
- Official scores from SAT, ACT, TOEFL, IELTS, or EPE (English Proficiency Exam, the on-campus test at MCPHS)
- One recommendation letter

English proficiency requirements vary based on the level of admission:
- Bridge program: Minimum score of 69 on TOEFL iBT, IT 498, 5.5 on IELTS, or iTEP 3.7
- Undergraduate program: Minimum score of 79 on TOEFL iBT, 550 on TOEFL ITP, 6.5 on IELTS, or iTEP 4.0
- Graduate school (non-lab-based programs): Minimum score of 79 on TOEFL iBT, 587 on TOEFL ITP, 6.5 on IELTS, or iTEP 4.0
- Graduate school (lab-based programs): Minimum score of 90 on TOEFL iBT, IT 610, 7.0 on IELTS, or iTEP 4.5.
Placement: No text provided
Accommodation: On-campus housing is available for students at this university. For first-year students, the university provides options for housing and lodging. Information about on-campus housing can be found on the website. Off-campus housing is also available, with an average monthly rent of $1050-$1150. Rental options include studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments. Essential amenities such as on-site laundry, washer/dryer connections are included in the rent. Additionally, electric, water, cable, trash, and recycling fees are all included in the rent. Most apartments also provide towels, bed linen, and a free monthly cleaning service. The university offers a range of off-campus housing resources on their website.

Name: Clark University
Overview:
In Worcester, Massachusetts, a prestigious private research university was founded in 1887, becoming one of the first modern research institutions in the United States. With a rich history of over a century, Clark University is a world-class academic presence that strives to shape the future through its innovative and inquisitive approach to education. The institution values critical thinking and aims to mold students into inspiring global leaders.

Clark University offers a diverse range of academic programs, including Clark College, Adam Institute for Urban Teaching and School Practice, Strassler Centre for Holocaust and Genocide Studies, Frances L. Hiatt School of Psychology, Graduate School of Management, Graduate School of Geography, Gustaf H. Carlson School of Chemistry, and School of Professional Studies. This variety of departments allows students to choose from over 30 undergraduate majors, 19 postgraduate programs, 12 interdisciplinary concentrations, and 8 doctoral degrees.

The university has a 53% acceptance rate, making it a highly sought-after institution among students. Its physics, liberal arts, geography, psychology, biology, and entrepreneurship programs are consistently ranked among the best. Clark University provides a vibrant academic and cultural atmosphere for its students to facilitate a well-rounded college experience.

The average annual tuition and accommodation fee at the university is $58K, but the institution offers numerous scholarships and grants to help students afford their education, bringing the cost down to $28K. The university campus spans 50 acres of picturesque land and offers excellent facilities, including seven libraries, athletic centers, seminar halls, recreation centers, and residence halls.

With an impressive alumni network consisting of Pulitzer Prize winners and Emmy recipients who are leaders in various industries, the university also boasts a promising graduate placement rate. Clark University sets the bar for academic excellence and holistic development, making it a top choice for aspiring students.

Note: It is mandatory to take the GRE for all PhD programs, except for those in biology, chemistry (on a case-by-case basis), geography, history (Holocaust and Genocide history), genocide studies, and psychology. Additionally, applicants must meet the English language proficiency requirements.
