Placement:
As a prominent institution of higher education, Clark University offers a diverse range of academic programs to its students in a liberal arts environment. With over 1,600 undergraduate students, Clark University prides itself on providing a personalized education experience that emphasizes research, collaboration, and innovation.

From business and management to biology and psychology, Clark offers a wide variety of majors and minors to cater to different interests and career paths. Students have the opportunity to engage in hands-on learning experiences, work closely with professors, and conduct research in their field of study.

Outside of the classroom, students can take advantage of various resources and programs to support their academic journey. The Academic Advising Center provides students with guidance and support in selecting the right courses, managing their workload, and preparing for their post-graduation plans. Additionally, Clark offers a Writing Center and a Quantitative Skills Center to help students develop their writing and analytical skills.

In addition to academic resources, Clark University offers a variety of study abroad programs for students looking to expand their global perspective and cultural competency. The Office of Intercultural Affairs also provides support and resources for international students and promotes diversity and inclusion on campus.

Whatever your professional interests may be, Clark University encourages students to gain hands-on experience through internships. These internships can be paid or used for academic credit and will aid in career exploration, skill development, and building a professional network. Students can find internships and job opportunities through the university's Career Connections Center and connect with alumni for mentorship and networking.
Accommodation:
The University offers a wide range of accommodation options for students. With eight traditional resident halls and ten houses, including three designated for graduate students, the campus currently houses 1,665 graduate and undergraduate students. The goal of the Office of Residential Life & Housing is to ensure a welcoming, secure, and inclusive living community for all Clark students. Our campus partners work towards fostering a sense of belongingness among students through various initiatives.

Clark University residents have access to a variety of housing choices. First-year students can bond with each other in three coed housing halls, one of which is exclusively for women. Two mixed-class halls offer both Traditional Lifestyle and Suite Lifestyle living options. Suites in these halls have private bathrooms and most have a kitchenette. Our residential setup also includes three gender-inclusive houses designated solely for graduate students.

First-year halls include Bullock Hall, Dana Hall, Dodd Hall, and Wright Hall. Conveniently located in the centre of the campus, Bullock Hall is perfect for students looking to make new friends, with a variety of social spaces like fully-equipped kitchens, lounges, and study rooms. Bullock Hall offers a traditional dorm setup with communal restrooms on each floor.

Dana Hall, situated in the South side of the campus offers similar amenities, with shared, coed living spaces. The Johnson Sanford Center, Higgins University Center, Kneller Athletic Center, Goddard Library, and Residential Halls like Maywood Street, Hughes, and Bullock, are all easily accessible from these residence halls.

Dodd Hall is perfect for women-identified students, with single and double rooms configured in a quad arrangement. Students from all class years live in Dodd Hall, fostering a sense of community and camaraderie. Close to other campus amenities like Kneller Athletic Center, Goddard Library, and Wright Hall, Dodd residents have everything they need at their doorstep.

Mixed-class Halls include Maywood Street Hall and Blackstone Hall. Maywood Street Hall houses 225 students in both single and double rooms, with suites accommodating either 4 or 6 students. Blackstone Hall, a modern apartment-style residence hall, is ideal for upper-class students. Most of the apartments can house 4 to 6 students in single and double rooms.

Eight houses are available for undergraduate residence and two for graduate students. These offer a mix of shared apartments and communal living spaces. Typically, co-ed houses are arranged according to the preferences of the residents after the housing lottery. With plenty of amenities such as fully equipped kitchens, communal living space, washers, dryers, and high-speed internet access available in each house, students can find the perfect home away from home.

For more information on the various residence halls and houses, visit the Clark University website.
Course Ranking:
The Global MBA program at Clark University has been placed at number 251+ in the latest rankings by QS for 2022. In comparison, the Masters in Business Analytics course at the university is positioned at number 101+ in the same QS rankings.

For 2022, Clark University's Psychology program has been ranked between 251 and 300 by Times Higher Education. It should be noted that in 2021 and 2020, the same course was ranked between 201 and 250 according to THE's rankings.
University Ranking: Clark University was established in 1887 and was among the first institutions in the United States to focus solely on graduate studies. Today, it is recognized as one of the top 1000 universities in the world by leading ranking publishers. The Times Higher Education WUR 2022 places Clark University in the range of 501-600 globally. This is a slight decrease from the university's position in the 2021 rankings, where it was placed between 400-500. You can find more information about the university and its admissions process on Clark University Admissions 2022 page. Similarly, in the QS WUR 2023, Clark University is ranked between 751-800 overall. In comparison to the QS 2022 ranking, the university has slipped in its position from 601-650. As per the U.S. News & World Report for 2023, Clark University holds the 97th spot in the country. These rankings are constantly changing and Clark University continues to strive for excellence in education and research.

Name: Oklahoma City University
Overview:
Oklahoma City University is an esteemed institution situated in Oklahoma City, USA, offering a diverse range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs, along with online degree options for distance learning students. The university boasts a wide array of academic disciplines, particularly in the field of Business. Its main campus is located in the heart of Oklahoma City, providing students with a vibrant and conducive learning environment. With over three undergraduate programs and four postgraduate programs to choose from, students are spoilt for choice. The cost of attendance may differ for domestic and international students, but the average tuition and fees, not including miscellaneous expenses, comes to around INR 29,99,456 for an international student.

At Oklahoma City University, students have access to ample financial assistance, including scholarships, work-study programs, and other funding options. The university also has a team dedicated to Career Planning Services, helping students build their resumes and secure jobs after graduation, be it full-time employment, part-time work, internships, or summer jobs. For more information about Oklahoma City University and its programs, check out Leap Scholar, and discover the perfect course that aligns with your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview:
As part of our admission requirements, applicants must meet one of the following criteria: 
- A minimum TOEFL score of 79 
- An overall IELTS score of 6.5, with no sub-scores below 6.0
- Completion of ELS 112 
Note that conditional admission may be available for students who do not meet the required English proficiency levels. In this case, students must apply to ELS Language Centers for the I-20. However, please note that not all graduate programmes offer conditional admission. 
Our evaluation process takes into consideration various factors, with a minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale. Keep in mind that satisfying one or more of the minimum requirements does not guarantee acceptance. 
For our MBA program specifically, the minimum prerequisites include a 3.0 GPA, TOEFL score of 79, IELTS score of 6.5 (overall), with no sub-score below 6.0, or completion of ELS 112 (strongly recommended).
Placement: No text provided

With over 60 organizations and activities available, OCU students have plenty of opportunities to get involved. Please note that all students at Oklahoma City University are required to reside on campus until they reach the age of 21, except for those who have chosen to live at home with a parent or legal guardian. We have made sure to offer a diverse range of housing options to accommodate this rule. For more information, please refer to our website at https://www.okcu.edu/campus/residencelife.

Name: Hawaii Pacific University
Overview:
Hawaii Pacific University is a leading private educational institution located in the beautiful city of Honolulu, Hawaii. Founded in 1965, the university has a moderate acceptance rate of 75% and an impressive student enrollment of over 5,000. The university offers a wide range of programs, including Cinematic Multimedia Arts, Psychology, Business Administration, Criminal Justice, and Nursing Practice, which are highly sought after by students.

One of the main highlights of Hawaii Pacific University is its extensive Study Abroad and International Exchange Programs that allow students to broaden their horizons by studying at partner institutes or participating in affiliated programs and internships in countries such as Austria, Brazil, and Turkey. In order to be eligible for admission, students are required to have a minimum score of 6.0 in IELTS.

The estimated annual cost of attendance for undergraduate students at Hawaii Pacific University is USD 49,774- USD 57,554 for Hawaii residents and USD 54,154- USD 59,554 for students from outside Hawaii. The university offers various financial aids and assistance programs, such as Graduate PLUS Loans, Federal Pell Grant, Federal Work-Study, and Phi Theta Kappa Scholarship, to help students cover their educational expenses.

Hawaii Pacific University provides on-campus accommodation for students, including the Waterfront Lofts, Hawaii Loa Residence Halls, and Park Shore Waikiki Hotel. The university also offers a wide range of academic, professional, cultural, recreational, and special interest clubs and organizations, such as the Neuroscience Club, Black Student Union, Hiking Club, and Gameshark, to ensure a well-rounded and enriching university experience for its students.

Upon graduation, Hawaii Pacific University students have a strong earning potential, with a median salary ranging from USD 35,600 to USD 49,900. This is a testament to the high-quality education and opportunities provided by the university. With its picturesque location, diverse student body, and excellent academic programs, Hawaii Pacific University is truly a top choice for students seeking a fulfilling and rewarding university experience.

Additionally, you must submit additional documents such as resumes, purpose statements, and recommendation letters that are of high quality. HPU is not known for its strict selection process; therefore, international students who have strong academic backgrounds and involvement in extracurricular activities have higher chances of being accepted into Hawaii Pacific University.

Placement:
Handshake is an innovative career platform exclusively designed for the students of HPU. It aims at providing students a superior online job search experience along with additional benefits. Some of the key advantages offered by Handshake are as follows:

- Accessibility to Federal Work-Study opportunities and other campus job openings
- Access to both part-time and full-time job listings outside the campus
- Availability of internships and co-op programs
- Opportunities for volunteering and engaging in community service projects
- Connections with potential employers
- Online registration for professional development workshops
- Booking slots for on-campus Employer Info Sessions

This platform is an excellent resource for students to explore diverse career options, apply for suitable job opportunities, and connect with potential employers. By providing a wide range of options and seamless connections with employers, Handshake offers a comprehensive solution for students' career needs.
Accommodation: Data for an Hawaiian university shows that for both the spring and fall semesters, students can avail on-campus accommodation. The university provides six living halls on its Hawaii Loa campus, which offer well-equipped rooms with facilities like laundry services, 24/7 internet access, security, common areas, etc. Students can opt for single, twin, triple, or quad sharing options. The Waterfall Lofts, a 370-bed residential community hall, is also available for students. In addition, the university offers the Waterfront Lofts, a residential complex on the second and third floors of the Aloha Tower Marketplace, with rooms in various sharing configurations. Students planning to live on campus must also select a meal plan. The university also provides recreational opportunities like basketball, tennis, a Fitness Center, Student Center, common lounges, and laundry services. To avail on-campus housing, students need to submit an Intent to Enroll, a USD 200 Enrollment Deposit, and a Residence Application along with a USD 400 Housing Deposit. Alternately, students can explore off-campus housing options available in the United States, such as Keauhou Lane, Hala Mahana, Executive Centre Apartments, LLC, Waikiki Vista, College Student Apartments, Apartments.com Honolulu, and other rental websites that the university recommends. The university advises students to start looking for off-campus housing at least a month before their planned move-in date. They can use rental websites to research and explore their options and schedule viewings one to two weeks before their arrival. Off-campus rental units offer a variety of living arrangements, with some providing hotel-style services like weekly room cleaning and many amenities. Other private rental units/apartments offer apartment living with fewer amenities but may have residential managers. Off-campus options available in the Honolulu area include Keauhou Lane, Hale Mahana, Executive Centre Apartments, LLC, The Residences at Bishop Place, and Six Eighty.

Name: New York Tech - Long Island (NYT)
Overview:
Founded in 1955, the New York Institute of Technology (New York Tech) is a prestigious private research university. It is affiliated with the National Association of Independent Colleges and Universities (NAICU) and is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE). With campuses located in New York, Long Island, Jonesboro, China, and Vancouver, New York Tech provides students with diverse learning opportunities. The Long Island campus, located only an hour away from New York City, boasts of being one of the safest campuses in the country. At this campus, students can pursue a variety of programs such as Adolescent Education (Master of Arts in Teaching), B.S. in Applied and Computational Mathematics, and B.S.A.T. in Architectural Technology. The campus is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities including a fitness center, WIFI-enabled lounges, a parklet area, an on-campus café, a library, and a bookstore. Additionally, students can access academic support services like tutoring, Supplemental Instruction (SI) sessions, and the First-Year Guide Program. Financial assistance is also available to eligible students through various scholarships and awards such as the New York State Scholarships and Awards. Students can also avail themselves of healthcare services at the Riland Health Care Center on campus. 

According to the U.S. News & World Report, New York Tech has an acceptance rate of approximately 75% as of 2020. It also ranks between 151 and 160 among all universities in the country in the QS World University Rankings 2021. The Times Higher Education (2022) ranks New York Tech at 253 in the United States. Notably, the university has been recognized as a "College of Distinction" for the academic year 2021-22. It also holds the 6th spot for hosting the highest number of international students, as reported by the U.S. News & World Report 2022. Furthermore, it is ranked 4th for promoting ethnic diversity on campus in the U.S. 

Apart from its on-campus programs, New York Tech also offers online programs in fields such as M.S. in Clinical Nutrition and Energy Management. Its graduates have an impressive employability rate of 94%, with leading companies like Apple, Citi, and Microsoft scouting for New York Tech alumni. Apart from academics, the Long Island campus offers students the opportunity to join over 60 student clubs and organizations. Moreover, campus organizations host various events throughout the academic year, providing students with ample opportunities to participate and engage.
Eligibility Overview:
The conditions for participation are as follows: Applicants must meet the following requirements to be considered for admission to NYIT: 

Undergraduate students must submit their results for AP, IB, and A-Level exams, transcripts from any previous college coursework, and proof of graduation from all previous schools and colleges. 

Postgraduate students must present their GRE, GMAT, or MAT scores. They must also hold a recognized undergraduate or bachelor's degree to be accepted into the university's postgraduate programs. 

All applicants, for both undergraduate and postgraduate courses, must fulfill the following minimum English language proficiency criteria:

English Language Requirements for International Students:

The language qualifications for international students are as follows: 

A TOEFL (iBT) score of 79 or higher 

A PTE score of 53 or higher on the Pearson scale 

An IELTS score of 6.0 or above 

A Duolingo score of 105 or above

Placement: The New York Institute of Technology is renowned for its excellent placement record, having successfully assisted numerous deserving candidates in securing positions at esteemed companies like Google, IBM, Leviton, and HBO. With a staggering placement rate of 94%, the university continues to strive towards providing promising career opportunities to its students.
Accommodation: The New York Institute of Technology (NYIT) offers a variety of on-campus housing options to its students. These housing facilities are located near the university's two campuses, one in Long Island and the other in New York City. The residential buildings offered by NYIT include suites with single and double rooms, shared bathrooms, and a communal living space. Students can find more detailed information about on-campus housing options on the university's official website. This gives them the convenience of living near the campus and enjoying all the facilities and opportunities provided by NYIT. Explore the various housing options available, such as individual rooms and shared accommodations, and choose the one that best fits your needs. Living on campus will not only save students time and effort commuting but also allow them to be immersed in the university's vibrant community and make lasting connections. To apply for on-campus housing, students can visit the Residence Life page on the university's website. Enjoy the convenience and advantages of living on campus at NYIT.

Name: Musicians Institute
Overview: Musicians Institute is situated in the city of Los Angeles, California and used to be referred to as Guitar Institute of Technology and Musicians Institute of Technology. This university operates as a for-profit institution and is a certified member of the National Association of Schools of Music. It is also accredited by the US Department of Education and the Council of Higher Education Accreditation. With over 500 programs available, this institute focuses on areas such as Music Performance, Music Production, and Recording, among others. The university offers a range of degrees, including Bachelor of Music, Master of Music, Associate of Science in Music, and Associate of Arts. Students can also choose from a variety of certificate and non-certificate courses based on their personal preferences. The university boasts state-of-the-art studios equipped with advanced technology. Students have 24/7 access to more than 75 private practice labs, 12 rehearsal rooms, and 30 recording studios. The institute provides an environment conducive to learning, with small classroom sizes, open counseling, and private lessons, ensuring each student receives individualized support and guidance from their instructors. Scholarships such as Musicians Foundation Scholarships and Mi Online Scholarships are available to assist eligible students with financing their education. In 2020, the average acceptance rate was 68.7%. The tuition fees at Musicians Institute vary depending on the program chosen. For instance, students pursuing a Master of Music degree will pay approximately $27,540, while those enrolled in Bachelor of Music degree in Composition can expect to pay between $80,820 and $82,512. The institute was ranked 14th on the Hollywood Reporter's annual list of the top music schools for television and film in 2019. Furthermore, students can access MI Online from anywhere, offering the opportunity to earn degrees in Associate of Arts, Associate of Science, and various certificates. The university's partnerships with renowned companies like Serato, Sony BMG Music Entertainment, and Virgin Records allow graduates to have access to promising opportunities in the music industry. Notable alumni of Musicians Institute include Bishop Briggs, Antonio Geary, Gaby Moreno and Mark MacKay.

Name: Grand Valley State University
Overview: Grand Valley State University, established in 1960, is a publicly owned institution that accommodates 21,112 undergraduates on a 1391-acre campus. It is positioned just beyond Grand Rapids, the second-largest metropolitan region in Michigan, and claims the 28th spot in the list of Regional Universities Midwest by US News and World Report 2021. The university comprises a total of eight colleges, namely, F.E. Seidman College of Business, College of Community and Public Services, College of Education, College of Liberal Arts and Sciences, Seymour and Esther Padnos College of Engineering and Computing, College of Health Professions, Kirkhof College of Nursing, and Brooks College of Interdisciplinary Studies. Students have a range of majors to choose from, the most sought-after being Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Support Services; Health Professions and Related Programs; Communication, Journalism, and Related Programs; Psychology; and Parks, Recreation, Leisure, and Fitness Studies. There is a variety of housing options available to students, both on and off-campus. Options include traditional-style, suite-style, or apartment-style living centers, as well as on-campus apartments equipped with all essential amenities. Campus dining is also provided with reasonable meal plan options. The university offers over 400 student organizations to engage in extracurricular activities. Popular clubs include Advertising Club, Alcohol Drug and Awareness Courses, American Red Cross Club, Arab Culture Club, and Baseball Club, among others. In-state students are required to pay a total of 24,460 USD, whereas out-state students are charged 29,896 USD for tuition fees, cost of room and board, books and supplies, transportation, and personal expenses. The university provides both need and merit-based scholarships and financial aid. Need-based assistance is determined based on the family's capacity to pay for college, as calculated by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Eligibility Overview:
Requirements for international applicants to a university include: 
- Original and attested academic records from all secondary schools and universities, translated to English by a certified translator if necessary 
- Scores on standardized exams such as TOEFL, IELTS, and PTE 
- Proof of English proficiency through TOEFL, ESL, and/or SAT scores 
- A two-page essay discussing the impact of personal experiences and cultural heritage on the applicant's identity and how these experiences can contribute to the university community 
- For applicants from the United States, a written essay and/or statement of purpose is required 
- Letters of recommendation to support the application 
The university places high importance on English proficiency, therefore international applicants must meet the minimum TOEFL, ESL, and SAT scores. The university is particularly interested in learning about the applicant's personal background and how it has shaped their identity, and how these unique experiences can enrich the university community.

Placement: Grand Valley State University boasts an outstanding post-graduate career potential. A substantial 75% of students secure full-time employment shortly after graduation, while the remaining choose to pursue further studies. A mere 7% opt for part-time work. The university chalks up this success to its career-focused initiatives, including career expos, CV consultations, remote and technological interviews, education recruitment fairs, and plentiful internship prospects. On average, 57% of GVSU students tap into job opportunities before they earn their degrees, while 33% do so within three months post-graduation and 8% succeed within 3 to 6 months thereafter. According to the institution, the median salary alumni receive is $58,000 per annum. As per the Pay-Scale, the highest paying careers in Grand Valley State University yield an average of $59,371 to its graduates annually. Notably, Bachelors of Arts holders pocket the most with average annual earnings of $63,000 per annum, followed by their Bachelor of Science counterparts earning a respectable $54,000. Would you like to know the secret of your university's impeccable job placement record? Refer to GVSU's unparalleled career support services.

Living on campus provides students with the chance to make connections, discover opportunities, and gain valuable experience. The Allendale and Grand Rapids campuses of the University of Michigan boast excellent housing choices. These include traditional, cluster, suite, and apartment styles of living. Various living arrangements are offered at the Allendale campus, including the Grand Valley Apartments, Laker Village Apartments, Murray & Vansteeland Apartments, Niemyer, as well as off-campus and family housing. Meanwhile, two residence halls are available at the Grand Rapids campus, in addition to the winter hall and Secchia Hall. On-campus residents also enjoy access to a variety of amenities, such as sports clubs and social activities.

Name: University of South Alabama
Overview:
The Mobile, Alabama based University of South Alabama is a prominent educational institute established in 1963 by the Alabama state government. The university prides itself in nurturing bright young leaders who embody the core values of diligence, knowledge-seeking, and innovation. The university boasts of four prime campuses, namely Baldwin County, Gulf Shores, USA Health Locations and the principal Mobile location, each of which provide state-of-the-art infrastructure for its students' academic growth.

There are ten accredited colleges functioning under the university's umbrella - Pat Capps Covey College of Allied Health Professions, College of Arts and Sciences, Mitchell College of Business, College of Education and Professional Studies, College of Engineering, College of Medicine, College of Nursing, School of Computing, Honors College, and the Graduate School. With an acceptance rate of 79%, the university ranks amongst the top higher education institutions for students seeking quality education.

The university offers more than 50 undergraduate, 38 postgraduate, and 13 doctoral degree programs. Some of its most coveted and highly acclaimed courses belong to the disciplines of Medicine, Business, Finance, and Dramatic Arts. Owing to its inclusive and vibrant academic and cultural environment, the university serves as a second home to its diverse student population hailing from various corners of the globe.

While the average annual tuition and lodging expenses can sum up to $30K, the university offers a multitude of scholarships and grants to reduce the cost burden, bringing it down to approximately $21K. It spans an impressive 1,200 acres of land, showcasing a green and eco-friendly campus adorned with lush trees.

The university bestows its students with a plethora of resources to support their academic and cultural growth, including libraries, dormitories, laboratories, cultural centers, and athletics facilities. Moreover, with a strong and influential alumni network, the university ensures a promising placement rate for its graduating batch.

Name: University of Dallas
Overview: The University of Dallas is a well-regarded private Catholic university situated in Texas, with its establishment dating back to 1965. The university is best known for its interactive learning approach, and its academic excellence has gained international recognition in programs, such as undergraduate, graduate and doctoral degrees in Business, Liberal Arts, and Ministry. It is also proud to hold the distinction of being the youngest university to have been granted the prestigious Phi Beta Kappa chapter. The university boasts an extensive range of academic offerings, which includes 50 undergraduate courses, 26 graduate programs, as well as doctoral degrees and continuing education opportunities in fields such as business, arts, sciences, humanities, nursing, and education. Among the many esteemed programs offered, some of the top-rated ones are B.A. in Biology, Economics, English Language Social Sciences, Psychology, M.S. Cyber Intelligence, Business Analytics, and M.A. in Theology, and MBA. Spread across a sprawling 215-acre campus, the University of Dallas features state-of-the-art facilities, like the award-winning Church of the Incarnation, the Cowan-Blakley Memorial Library, and the J.M. Haggar University Center. Furthermore, students can take advantage of the 50 diverse student clubs, 80 student organizations, and participate in numerous events ranging from arts and music to cultural, athletic, fundraising, social service, and more. On-campus accommodation options are available for undergraduate students below 21 years of age or those with less than 90 credit hours. However, students aged 25 or above do not qualify for on-campus housing. The traditional halls feature comfortable living spaces with amenities like lounges, shared bathrooms, showers, laundry rooms, and can accommodate a varying number of students ranging from 31 to 96. The annual expenses for on-campus housing, including meals, would amount to approximately USD 16,137. The tuition fees for different programs and courses at the University of Dallas range from USD 24,709 to 44,477 per year. Moreover, the university also offers the benefit of Handshake, a comprehensive online database functioning as a platform for over 250,000 job opportunities posted by employers. With over 50 years in the education industry, the University of Dallas actively integrates traditional teaching methods and perspectives to provide students with a truly transformative learning experience.
Eligibility Overview:
International students must meet the eligibility criteria equivalent to US academic standards to be admitted to the University of Dallas. This includes completing Grade 12 and obtaining a certificate of completion. SAT and ACT scores may be required, depending on the desired major. However, for the 2021-2022 academic year, the university is waiving this requirement.

For graduate programs, applicants must have a bachelor's degree (US equivalent) and a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0 from a regionally accredited institution. For international applicants, this is equivalent to good academic standing at their previous university or college. A 3.0 GPA is required for any graduate-level program, and all previous schools attended must also have a good academic standing.

International students whose native language is not English must provide proof of English proficiency through standardized tests. This ensures that they can successfully navigate the English-language curriculum at the university.

With a focus on SEO, the University of Dallas requires international students to meet US academic standards to be accepted. This involves completing Grade 12 and obtaining a certificate of completion. Depending on the preferred major, SAT and ACT scores may be necessary, although this requirement has been suspended for the 2021-2022 academic year.

For admission to graduate programs, applicants must have a US equivalent bachelor's degree and a GPA of 2.0 from a regionally accredited institution. This GPA requirement is equivalent to maintaining good academic standing at previous schools. A minimum GPA of 3.0 is needed for graduate-level courses, and all previous academic institutions must have good academic standing.

Students whose first language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency through standardized tests. This guarantees their ability to successfully participate in the university's English-language curriculum.
Placement:
At the University of Dallas, a high percentage (96.65%) of graduate students successfully secured employment within six months of completing their studies. Graduates holding a master's or higher degree from the university can expect to earn a respectable average salary of $78,244. The university boasts a strong professional network and notable employers such as AT&T, Citi, T-Mobile, Verizon, CHRISTUS Health, and Southwest Airlines have hired a significant number of its graduates.

Even in the undergraduate program, the numbers are equally impressive with an overwhelming 97.8% of the class of 2021 either securing employment or pursuing further education. The university's bachelor's degree holders garner an average salary of $51,929 per year, highlighting the value of a degree from this institution.

According to Emolument, an MBA is the best-paying degree from the university with an average salary of over $145,000 per year. On PayScale, University of Dallas graduates earn an average salary according to their job profiles, with specific numbers being:

- $76,670 for an Executive Director
- $66,890 for a Senior Tax Accountant
- $62,070 for a Registered Nurse
- $56,530 for a Mechanical Engineer
- $49,380 for a Marketing Coordinator
- $48,670 for a Human Resources (HR) Manager
- $47,620 for an Administrative Assistant
- $45,970 for an Operations Manager
- $45,660 for a Financial Analyst.

Name: University of Wisconsin-Eau Claire
Overview: Founded in 1916, the University of Wisconsin is a highly acclaimed public university located in the heart of the Midwest. With a diverse and dynamic community, this university offers students a plethora of opportunities for career, personal, and academic growth. It holds the approval of both the NCAA's Division III and the Wisconsin Intercollegiate Athletic Conference (WIAC). The Eau Claire campus is home to four prestigious colleges - the College of Arts and Sciences, the College of Nursing, the College of Business, and the College of Nursing. Students can choose from 109 undergraduate majors, 66 minors, 11 graduate degrees, and 48 undergraduate certificates. Name: Quinnipiac University
Overview:
Quinnipiac University, located in Hamden, Connecticut, is a renowned private university with a 70% acceptance rate. Founded in 1929, it boasts three campuses: Mount Carmel, North Haven, and York Hill Campus. The university offers over 140 programs, including more than 100 undergraduate and 30 graduate options, and has a diverse student body of over 6,800 undergraduates and 3,000 graduates. From the College of Arts and Sciences to the School of Law and Health Sciences, Quinnipiac University is comprised of nine academic schools, each offering unique programs such as Applied Business, Civil Engineering, History, Biomedical Sciences, and Instructional Design.

Students at Quinnipiac can take advantage of a variety of opportunities, including dual degree programs that allow them to earn both their bachelor's and master's degrees at an accelerated pace. Some notable options include Computer Science/Cybersecurity, Theater/Accounting, and Business Administration. The university also offers a range of online degree and certificate programs, such as Business Analytics, Cybersecurity, and Occupational Therapy, providing flexibility and convenience for students.

Quinnipiac University also prepares students for professional programs through its pre-professional programs, such as Pre-Dental Studies and Pre-Law Advising. Additionally, the university offers several summer programs and courses for high school and college students, such as Medical Microbiology, Fundamentals of Digital Photography, and Interactive Communications.

Motivated students can also take part in the university's Honors Program, which includes rigorous coursework and extracurricular activities. For those wanting to expand their horizons, Quinnipiac University's Study Abroad program offers semester and short-term options, as well as service programs, in 32 countries, including Barbados, Belgium, Kenya, and Thailand.

The estimated cost of attendance for undergraduates at Quinnipiac University ranges from USD 56,800 to USD 69,760. The university offers various financial aid options, such as the Multiple Sibling Award, Athletic Scholarships, Federal Direct Loan, and Resident Assistants Stipend. Furthermore, with a graduate employment rate of 97.4%, Quinnipiac University sets students up for success even after graduation.

For more details, please visit our website.

Name: Mercy College
Overview:
Founded in the 1950s by the Sisters of Mercy, Mercy College is a prestigious private co-educational institution located in Dobbs Ferry, New York. The College offers an extensive range of over 90 undergraduate and postgraduate programs, including online courses, across its five renowned faculties. Some of the popular majors available at Mercy College are Business, Management, Marketing, Psychology, Health Professions, Social Sciences, and Homeland Security, Law Enforcement and Firefighting. The College is segregated into five prominent schools, namely the School of Liberal Arts, School of Business, School of Health & Natural Sciences, School of Social & Behavioral Sciences, and the School of Education, providing students with a diverse range of academic options to choose from. 

The estimated cost of attendance at Mercy College is an average of $20,378 per year, in addition to any supplementary expenses for undergraduate courses. However, the College offers an average financial aid or scholarship of $10,698 per student, making it an accessible institution for students from different financial backgrounds. As an added advantage for international students, Mercy College allows them to work while studying as a form of financial assistance, through avenues like On-Campus Employment, Economic Hardship, Curriculum Practical Training (CPT), and Optional Practical Training (OPT). 

Moreover, Mercy College is renowned for its nationally recognized program, Personalized Achievement Contract, which provides students with academic guidance and mentorship throughout their college journey. This program also assists students in navigating their career paths with flexibility and support.
Eligibility Overview: All candidates must have either completed high school with a minimum grade point average (GPA) of 2.0 or have received a GED with a score of at least 500 (or 53 if taken before 2002). In order to be eligible for admission, all students under the age of 24 must take the ACT or SAT and achieve an ACT composite score of 21 or a SAT combined score of 990. (Please contact Admissions for exam codes). Applicants who are aged 25 or above and have not attended a college or university are not required to submit ACT or SAT scores, however, they must satisfy the program's other requirements. Non-ACT or SAT score holders may be accepted into a Mercy College pre-program or certificate program that does not require these scores. Students with SAT or ACT math sub-scores below the set requirement are welcome to take the math placement assessment to determine their appropriate math course level. Individuals who do not meet the minimum criteria in Algebra, Biology, or Chemistry for admission to their desired major are strongly advised to begin as a pre-major at Mercy College in order to fulfill the admission requirements for their major.

Eligibility Overview:
ADVANTAGES FOR ENROLLMENT
In order to be eligible for first-year international students who have no previous experience at another college or university, the following qualifications must be met:
- Submission of transcripts showing a minimum GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale or an equivalent score.
- Transcripts with a GPA of 2.25 or higher and an ACT score of 18 or an SAT score of 960 or above will also be accepted.
- A minimum cumulative GPA of 2.3 is required for transfer students after a thorough review of their credits by the Registrar's Office. Detailed information on credit transfer can be found under "Transfer and Re-Admit Students."
- Proficiency in the English language is necessary, and a score of 61-79 on the TOEFL, 6.0 on the IELTS, or 60-80 on Duolingo can be used to demonstrate this.
- If any of the aforementioned requirements cannot be met, our admission counselor will contact you to discuss alternative options for admission to C-SC.

TRANSCRIPTS PROCESSING
All transcripts from high schools, colleges, or universities outside the United States must be evaluated by a reputable company such as InCred or Educational Credential Evaluators (ECE). Please note that these services may charge a fee for their evaluation.

Name: University of Charleston
Overview:
The University of Charleston, located in Charleston, West Virginia, is a private academic institution that was established in 1888. Originally known as the Barboursville Seminary, the university was renamed to its current name in 1978. In addition to its main campus situated on the banks of the Kanawha River, the university also has satellite campuses in Beckley, West Virginia. The University of Charleston offers full-time, part-time, and online programs in a variety of disciplines, including English, Biology, Chemistry, Business Analytics, Management, Nursing, Psychology, Political Science, Data Analytics, and Digital Marketing. 
According to Niche.com, the University of Charleston ranks 71 out of 326 in Best Online Colleges in America and 206 out of 1,422 in Best College Athletics in America. With an acceptance rate of 50%, the university is highly sought-after by students across the country. Additionally, an impressive 90% of graduates secure employment within two years of graduation. 
The tuition fees at the University of Charleston are lower than the national average at $31,400. Despite this, the university offers various scholarships to deserving students. In fact, all students at the university receive some form of financial aid. This aid may include work-study programs, WV State Grant and Scholarship Programs, Federal Grant programs, loans, and scholarships. Some of the most popular scholarships offered by the university include the Innovation Scholarship, Presidential Scholarship, Student Ambassador Scholarship, Band Scholarship, and IDEA Scholarship.

Name: Midwestern State University
Overview:
Midwestern State University is a state-funded institution situated in the state of Texas, United States. Established in 1922 as the Wichita Falls Junior College, it has progressed into a full-fledged university, which makes it the sole public university in Texas dedicated to the liberal arts. The university comprises seven colleges that offer undergraduate and graduate programs in various fields of education. The best programs at Midwestern State University include MA in Psychology, Bachelors in Business Administration and BS in Dental Hygiene (BSDH). The main campus of the university is located in Wichita Falls, Texas, covering an area of 255 acres. The architectural design of all the buildings on campus includes red brick walls, arched entrances, and tiled roofs. 
Moffett Library, the university's academic hub, provides students with necessary literature and books to fulfill the curriculum requirements of various subjects. One of the highlights of the university is the Dalquest Desert Research Station, which was generously donated by former professor Dr. Dalton Dalquest to encourage scientific research by educators and scientists in the fields of geology and biology. 
The approximate annual cost of studying at Midwestern State University is around USD 22,000. The university has a close-knit student community, which stays active through numerous events held on campus. With over 100 student clubs and organizations, students have a platform to showcase their talents and skills in fields beyond academics. Additionally, fraternities and sororities at the university help students build professional networks with alumni and peers. The Mustangs, the university's sports teams, represent the institution at various national-level tournaments, producing several notable athletes over the years. Some of the renowned alumni of Midwestern State University include popular TV personality Phil McGraw, American footballer Marqui Christian, and former mayor of Wichita Falls, Lanham Lyne.
Eligibility Overview: A complete application is required in order to be considered for admission at Midwestern State University. Depending on the program, a referral letter and GMAT/GRE scores may also be required. SAT/ACT scores are necessary for undergraduate programs, while graduate programs may require a bank statement as proof of financial ability. To prove proficiency in English, a minimum test score for one of the accepted exams must be met. These specific English proficiency requirements vary depending on the program you are applying for. Rest assured, our admissions team will carefully review all components of your application before making a decision.

Name: University of Redlands
Overview:
Established in 1907, the University of Redlands is a prestigious private liberal arts university situated in Redlands, California, United States. The sprawling 160-acre campus accommodates more than 3,200 students and houses five schools, including the School of Education, School of Continuing Studies, College of Arts and Sciences, and the Graduate School of Theology. Offering a diverse range of academic programs, the University of Redlands boasts over 50 undergraduate, graduate, and bachelor's degrees across a multitude of disciplines such as biology, business, computer science, chemistry, health, literature, and many more. According to the university's claims, 90% of its graduates secure lucrative job opportunities with an average salary of $51,200 per year, landing esteemed positions in reputed companies like Cisco, Nike, IBM, Disney, and countless others.

The on-campus facilities at the University of Redlands are top-notch, consisting of 15 residential halls and 23 apartment complexes. The undergraduate students have access to modern residential halls such as Anderson Hall, East Hall, Williams Hall, Melrose Hall, Grossmont Hall, and more. Meanwhile, the graduate students can choose from some of the finest apartment complexes like Student Village, Central Avenue, and many others. For the convenience of first-year students, the university provides a variety of options, including apartments, air-conditioned halls, and single rooms, at an average rent of $6,000.

To be eligible for admission, prospective students must meet the requirements for IELTS (minimum score of 6.5), TOEFL (minimum score of 80), and SAT (minimum score of 550). They can apply for the spring and fall intakes through the online portal, with a high acceptance rate of 75%, alongside a nominal admission fee of $50. With a yearly tuition fee of $32,000 for postgraduate programs and $51,000 for undergraduate programs, the cost of education at the University of Redlands may seem steep. However, the university provides financial aid to around 84% of its students in the form of grants, awards, and scholarships. These include the Art Award ($3,500), Music Award ($10,000), Achievement Award ($30,000), Pell Grant, Cal Grant, and many more, making higher education accessible for students from all walks of life.

This score is based on the average score achieved by students at the university. On a 1600-point scale, the average SAT composite score for the University of Redlands is 1210.

Name: Webster University
Overview:
Webster University, founded in 1915, is a renowned private institute located in Webster Groves, Missouri. It has a decent acceptance rate of 57%. This university offers more than 200 undergraduate and 50 graduate programs through its five schools and colleges, including the School of Communications, School of Education, and College of Arts & Sciences. With a diverse range of courses such as Legal Studies, Cybersecurity, Journalism, Music Composition, and European Studies, Webster University caters to the diverse academic interests of its over 12,000 students. The university has a main campus in Webster Groves and additional 50+ campuses and sites across the US, including Texas, Kansas, Washington D.C., and Virginia. 
Webster University Library is a treasure trove of resources for students, housing a vast collection of books, journals, articles, media, and online resources. It also offers more than 70 undergraduate and graduate certificate programs, including Data Analytics, Marketing, Corporate Entrepreneurship, and Environmental Sustainability. Moreover, there are several online degree and certificate programs such as Criminology, Educational Technology, and Gerontology. The university also offers Pre-Professional courses such as Pre-Law, Pre-Dentistry, and Pre-Veterinary to help students prepare for their professional programs. 
Outstanding undergraduate students who meet credit and course requirements and maintain a current semester GPA of 3.80 are eligible for the Dean's List. Webster University offers a Study Abroad program enabling students to participate in exchanges or study programs at more than 50 locations worldwide. 
The estimated undergraduate tuition fee is USD 28,500 per year, whereas graduate students need to pay USD 650 per credit hour and above. The university provides various financial aid options, including scholarships, loans, grants, and student employment opportunities such as the Access Missouri Grant, Direct PLUS Loans, Leadership Scholarship, and Proud to Serve Scholarship.
 On-campus accommodation options include East Hall, Maria Hall, Big Bend Apartments, Glen Park Apartments, and shared or private suites and one/two/three/four-bedroom apartments. The university boasts over 50 student organizations, such as Anime Club, Commuter Council, and Green Fuse, and offers various sports teams, including soccer, tennis, and volleyball for students to participate in. Webster University has an excellent employment rate of 90%.

Chemeketa Community College at Eola, located just west of downtown Salem, is home to the Northwest Wine Studies Center, which is accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. Accreditation allows Chemeketa to receive federal financial aid, making it an ideal place for students seeking higher education opportunities. This location also offers facilities for hosting meetings, conferences, and special events.

The Northwest Wine Studies Center, situated in the Eola-Amity Hills, was established with the support of pioneers in the Oregon wine industry. Its main purpose is to provide a leading resource for the wine industry and respond to the educational demands of the growing industry. With a focus on hands-on training, Chemeketa Eola boasts an 8-acre test vineyard, a winery and tasting room, and an on-site laboratory for students to gain practical experience in the production and marketing of wine.

As a major player in the Oregon wine industry, Chemeketa Eola offers students a wide range of career opportunities. From winemakers and vineyard managers to tasting room managers and cellar masters, there are numerous positions available for individuals looking to work in this field. The college is overseen by a seven-member Board of Education, who are responsible for directing and hiring the district president to ensure the college operates in accordance with its policies.

Name: East Tennessee State University
Overview:
The University of East Tennessee State, situated in Johnson City, USA, was founded in 1911. The university provides a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various fields, along with online degree programs for distant education students. The curriculum includes diverse study streams such as Engineering, Accounting, Animation, Architecture, Arts, Business & Management, Medicine, and Science. With over four undergraduate programs and six postgraduate programs, students have plenty of options to pursue their desired major.

Additionally, the university has a dedicated Career Planning Service team to assist students in building their CVs and finding job opportunities after completing their degree. This includes assistance with part-time jobs, summer jobs, internships, and full-time employment.

During the application process, students are required to submit their academic transcripts, certificates, resumes, and scores for tests like IELTS, TOEFL, GMAT, UMAT, etc. International students must also provide proof of their English language proficiency. The tuition fee for international students is $14,428. However, the university provides financial aid to the majority of students, with 84% of students receiving some form of funding. ETSU offers institutional funding of $24 million for the academic year 2020-21, and most students graduate debt-free. Furthermore, students with exceptional academic achievements are automatically considered for scholarships of up to $5,000 based on their GPA and ACT/SAT scores.

To know more about East Tennessee State University, visit Leap Scholar and explore the diverse range of courses available that can help you achieve your academic and career goals.
Eligibility Overview:
The following is information about undergraduate and postgraduate admissions at East Tennessee State University (ETSU). ETSU offers a wide variety of undergraduate courses in over 100 academic departments, such as English, Media and Communication, and Engineering Technology. To apply for an undergraduate degree program, applicants must submit official high school transcripts and ACT/SAT test scores. An English proficiency test score is also required, with a minimum score of 2.3 on a scale of 4.0.

For postgraduate courses, ETSU offers more than 130 different programs. International graduate applicants must submit a $65 application fee, official transcripts, and a personal essay explaining their reasons for choosing the program. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is also required.

International students who do not speak English as their first language must submit their English proficiency exam results. This requirement can be met by obtaining a score of 61 on the TOEFL iBT, a score of 500 on the TOEFL PBT, a score of 5.5 on the IELTS, or a score of 43 on the PTE.
Placement: East Tennessee State University offers internship opportunities for students interested in working in the area. All students must fill out an Internship Planning Form which includes their current CV, driver's license, and self-profile. The Director of Field Instruction begins the internship preparation process based on this information. It is important to note that internships are not mandatory, and students can arrange them on their own. Upon completion of the internship, students must attend a departmental field orientation before being assigned to a position within the agency. This ensures proper training and preparation for students before entering their internship position.

Eligibility Overview:
The following information outlines the requirements for admission to our university:

Applicants must be enrolled in a rigorous college preparatory program and have successfully completed the following: four years of English, three years of mathematics, including algebra 1, algebra 2, and geometry (or their equivalents), and at least three years of social science or history.

Additionally, depending on their desired degree, applicants are expected to have completed two to three science courses that include lab components.

While not required, it is highly recommended that students have completed at least two years of foreign language instruction and have taken a statistics course or have experience with speech and public speaking.

Please note that the above guidelines must be adhered to as plagiarism is not tolerated.

Explore Bay Path's internship program to see the impact it has on shaping students into professionals.

The room and board fee includes sufficient local phone service, basic TV, and access to computers and the Internet. Students can also take advantage of free laundry, WiFi, and cable television facilities on campus. Explore the various residential life opportunities at our university!

Name: Northeast Wisconsin Technical College - Green Bay
Overview: North Island College was founded in 1975 as a community college, situated in Vancouver Island, British Columbia. It boasts four campuses and three learning centers. The Comox Valley campus is the largest, with the remaining three located in Port Alberni, Campbell River, and Port Hardy. This esteemed institution offers over 100 courses and 80 programs across diverse fields, such as fine arts, healthcare, business, university trades, technical trades, tourism, and hospitality. Every year, approximately 4,000 students are enrolled, drawn to its exceptional academic offerings. The Tebo Vocational Centre at the Port Alberni campus provides lectures on Early Childhood Care & Education, University Transfer, and Nursing, to name a few. Additionally, NIC features a comprehensive library and bookstore, catering to the needs of its students. International students can pursue various undergraduate programs, including Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting, Marketing, and Management. Financial aid, scholarships, and grants are also provided to eligible students, further promoting a diverse and inclusive academic environment. NIC holds numerous placement services that equip students with the necessary skills to ace interviews, such as career central resources. The college boasts distinguished faculties, holding Ph.D. degrees, who are dedicated to nurturing students' academic growth. With small class sizes, students and lecturers share close bonds, fostering an ideal learning atmosphere. Moreover, the applied research facilities at NIC offer students and staff exclusive opportunities to tackle real-world challenges posed by local businesses, community groups, and industries. The college continually strives to expand domestic and international education pathways, providing students with unparalleled opportunities for their academic advancement.

Name: Clarkson University
Overview: Clarkson University, located in Potsdam, New York, is a prestigious private national research university, established in 1898. Its main campus spans over 540 acres and offers undergraduate, masters, and Ph.D. programs. The university comprises eight schools and institutes, including the School of Arts and Sciences, Reh School of Business, Lewis School of Health Sciences, Coulter School of Engineering, Beacon Institute for Rivers and Estuaries, and Institute for a Sustainable Environment. Clarkson University provides a diverse range of degrees, such as bachelor of science, master of business administration, master of engineering, master of science, bachelor of professional studies, master of arts in teaching, doctor of philosophy, and doctor of physical therapy. Some of the most sought-after graduate programs are basic science, bioethics, computer science, and data analysis. Apart from academic excellence, the university is also renowned for its advanced research programs. With a tuition fee of approximately USD 53,100 per annum, the university emphasizes on sports and offers a variety of options, including baseball, basketball, skiing, hockey, swimming, etc. to its students. The university has a global faculty that engages in interdisciplinary research, aiming to solve real-world problems for a more promising future. To accommodate students, Clarkson University provides on-campus residence facilities for four years. Its nine halls are fully-equipped with basic amenities like beds, desks, parking, TV, etc. The cost of living is around USD 17,614 per annum. The university also boasts 200+ clubs, professional societies, 182 intramural teams, greek life, and leadership opportunities for its students through its student government. Financial assistance in the form of awards and scholarships is also available for international students, ranging from USD 5,000 to 30,000. Moreover, the university has a notable record of producing highly qualified and well-paid graduates.
Eligibility Overview:
Here are the facts and figures for an American university:

- Admissions are highly competitive, with an acceptance rate of only 14 percent.
- The average GPA for incoming students is 3.7, and the majority of students have completed rigorous high school curricula.
- For the fall 2019 class, the most commonly represented states were California, New York, and Texas.
- The top three most popular majors among accepted students are business, social sciences, and biology.
- Out-of-state students make up 68 percent of the total accepted class.
- To be considered for admission, applicants must have a SAT score between 1160 and 1350, or an ACT score between 23 and 30.
- Of the fall 2019 class, 89 percent submitted SAT scores while 32 percent submitted ACT scores.
- Two letters of recommendation are required from academic sources, such as counselors, principals, or teachers.
- Some graduate programs may require GRE or GMAT scores, but these may be waived for applicants with sufficient work experience.
- International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English, unless they come from an English-speaking country or have completed at least two years of study in an English-medium college.

Placement:
Hood College students are able to secure positions in a diverse range of industries. Many choose to enter the workforce immediately after graduation, while others pursue advanced studies in graduate school or law school. For instance, the U.S. State Department has a Spanish major from Hood serving as their liaison for Latin American Cultural Affairs. Additionally, one alumnus is currently teaching in France, while another works for the National Park Service creating bilingual brochures and other materials. 
Several international corporations, such as IBM, Marriott, and COMSAT, have also hired language majors from Hood College. Recent graduates with a French or Spanish major have been employed by various organizations including an urban social work agency, the Organization of American States, international hotel chains, airlines, the Bureau of Indian Affairs, and AT&T. Others have landed positions at prestigious institutions like the U.S. Senate Subcommittee on Investigations or the World Bank.  
Moreover, Hood College students also have unique opportunities to serve in organizations like the Peace Corps, gaining valuable international experience while making an impact in the world. The skills acquired through a French or Spanish major equip students to excel in various career paths, making them valuable assets to any organization.
Accommodation: Hood College offers exceptional on-campus housing options for 840 students. These six halls provide diverse living experiences: Memorial, Smith, Coblentz, Meyran, Shriner, and the New Residence Hall. Availability is subject to space and seniors and selected juniors may have the option of living in single rooms. Freshmen and sophomores are required to have roommates, but exceptions are made for older students and those with approved housing accommodations. Every residence hall has four computers (three PCs and one Mac) available for student use, along with free local and campus calls and vending machines for snacks and drinks. All rooms are equipped with wired and wireless internet access and the New Residence Hall offers a computer on each level. Laundry facilities are conveniently located in all accommodation areas at no extra cost. Hood College is committed to assisting disabled students and provides accommodations through the Office of Accessibility Services, however this office does not handle non-disability related housing requests. For more information, visit: https://www.hood.edu/campus-community/housing-residence-life/housing-options/residence-halls and https://www.hood.edu/academics/josephine-steiner-center-academic-achievement-retention/accessibility-services/housing-accommodations.

Name: Emory University
Overview: Founded in 1836, Emory University is a prestigious private research institution located in the thriving city of Atlanta, Georgia. The university boasts a beautiful campus in the charming neighborhood of Druid Hills, providing students with easy access to the diverse cultural and business opportunities in the bustling metropolis. With a student population of approximately 15,500 from over 100 countries, Emory University is a highly international community. The university stands out for its renowned graduate and professional schools, world-class liberal arts college, and top-notch health care services. Emory University offers a wide range of academic programs, including 70 undergraduate majors, 40 Ph.D. programs, and professional courses in business, law, health sciences, nursing, and theology. The undergraduate programs are divided across three schools: arts and sciences, business, and nursing. On the other hand, the graduate program offerings include MA, MS, MBA, MDP, and more. Some of the most popular majors at Emory University are business administration and management, biological sciences, registered nursing, economics, and psychology. Focusing on top-performing students, the university also offers an exclusive honors program across many areas of study. The annual tuition fee for undergraduate students at Emory University is approximately USD 53,804, while the tuition for graduate programs ranges from USD 43,800 to 60,000. The university provides financial support for international students, including scholarships and merit-based aid. Among the various scholarships offered, the Liberal Art Scholarship stands out for its prestigious recognition of academic excellence. Emory University is dedicated to providing its students with a supportive and enriching community. The university offers a range of services to its students, such as an online platform to connect with fellow students and alumni, library research assistance, and essential business services like banking and insurance options. Moreover, the Emory travel program is an added advantage for international students looking to explore the vibrant city of Atlanta. The cost of living for students is estimated to be around USD 15,000 per year. The campus life at Emory University is vibrant and accommodating, with 14 residence halls offering comfortable living spaces for students. The campus also features multiple dining options to cater to diverse palates. In addition to academic excellence and community support, Emory University also assists its students with job placements. The university holds career fairs and networking events, along with providing students with valuable resources like resume guides and document critique services to help them build a strong portfolio. Emory University is committed to creating an inclusive and dynamic learning experience for its students, providing them with endless opportunities for growth and success.

Along with these opportunities, students can also access helpful tools like Handshake, Resume Guide, and Document Critique Resources to assist them in creating impressive portfolios. Emory graduates have reported a median salary of 59,200 USD, highlighting the success and value of the university's program guides.
Accommodation:
Emory University offers a diverse range of living options for its students, including both on-campus and off-campus accommodations. Through collaboration between students, faculty, staff, and the community, the university strives to create an environment that fosters personal growth and development.

The university's on-campus housing options offer a variety of living-learning environments for students. Each residence is carefully maintained and thoughtfully designed to provide a comfortable and conducive space for learning. These options include themed halls, single and double rooms, gender-inclusive accommodation (limited availability), suite-style living, and fully equipped apartments.

For students who prefer to live off-campus, Emory University also provides resources to help them find suitable accommodation. The university works closely with local landlords and property managers to identify safe and affordable housing options for students. Resources like Student.com, Apartments.com, and College Student Apartments can help students find off-campus housing in the city of Atlanta.

By offering a variety of housing options, Emory University strives to create an inclusive and supportive community for its students. Whether living on or off-campus, students can find a comfortable and conducive living environment that supports their academic and personal growth.
Course Ranking: The Goizueta Business School of Emory University offers management courses at the undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral levels. It is highly renowned for its courses such as BBA, MBA (1 year), MBA (2 years), Executive MBA, and PhD. This prestigious Business School has been ranked #12 by US News & World Report - UG Business for 2021, a significant jump from its previous rank of #15 since 2018. Additionally, Emory University has been consistently ranked at #22 by US News & World Report for its Graduate Business School since 2020. The Business Analytics programme offered by Emory University has been gaining popularity in recent years, and it has been ranked #18 by US News & World Report's MBA Business Analytics rankings for 2021. The university has also been making strides in global rankings, with its QS Global MBA ranking rising irregularly since 2019, and currently placed at #60 in 2021. The key factors considered for this ranking include academic reputation (62.1), employer reputation (52.9), citations per paper (90.1), and overall score (63.9), making it a highly reputable choice for MBA programmes.
University Ranking:
Emory University, a prestigious private research institution located in Atlanta, has been ranked as the 71st best global university by US News & World Report in 2021. This is the same ranking it has held since 2011, with the exception of 2018 when it was briefly ranked at #73. Admission to Emory University is highly competitive, and the acceptance rate for 2020 was only 16%, with consideration given to a candidate's GPA, letters of recommendation, and performance on standardized tests. The university's rank is determined based on a variety of factors and the highest standards of admission criteria. In recent years, US News & World Report has consistently ranked Emory University at #21, placing it among the top 100 universities in the United States.

The latest QS University and THE rankings for Emory University show an improvement in its rankings for 2021. It is now ranked #158 in the QS Universities Ranking, up from #156 in 2020 and #148 in 2019. This drop in rankings is due to a decline in scores across all assessment categories, including academic reputation (25), citations per faculty (66.7), faculty students per 1,000 faculty (99.4), international students per 1,000 faculty (33.1), and overall score (48.6). However, for THE 2021 rankings, Emory University has moved down only slightly from #80 to #85, as a result of its high acceptance rate and research output. The university has received favorable scores for citations (98.7), global outlook (59.2), teaching (53.9), and overall score (63.7), making it an attractive destination for international students.

Emory University has continued to uphold its strong reputation among top universities, with its rankings consistently improving over the years. Its high standards of admission and impressive academic offerings make it a desirable choice for students seeking a top-notch education. The university's significant impact in the fields of research and teaching has helped to maintain its position as a globally recognized institution.

Name: University of New Mexico - Albuquerque
Overview:
Albuquerque's University of New Mexico was established in 1889, covering nearly 800 acres of land. This prominent university is located at the heart of Albuquerque, close to the historic Route 66. Offering over 200 degree programs to choose from, including 96 undergraduate degrees and 27 certificate programs, the University of New Mexico – Albuquerque provides a diverse educational experience. 94% of its students receive financial aid, amounting to an average of $6,943 per year. 
With an ideal SAT score range of 1030 to 1250 and an ACT score range of 17 to 25, the university is seeking applicants who excel academically. Apart from undergraduate programs, the university offers graduate programs, including doctorate studies. Some of the prominent schools and colleges under its umbrella include the College of Fine Arts, College of Arts and Sciences, Anderson School of Management, and the School of Engineering. Graduate programs are offered in various subjects, such as Economics, History, Earth and Planetary Sciences, Computer Science, Nutrition, Public Health, and Statistics. 
Given its selective admissions process, the university has an acceptance rate of 54% for fall 2020. After accounting for financial aid, studying at the University of New Mexico – Albuquerque costs $11,638 per year. 
Additionally, the university maintains a healthy student-to-faculty ratio of 11:1, with an average freshman retention rate of 77%. As per recent data, its graduates earn a median salary of $36,400 per annum within 6 months of graduation. Moreover, 85% of the students are successfully employed within 2 years of completing their degree.
Eligibility Overview:
The below information pertains to a prestigious university and includes the necessary requirements for admission for international students.

What are the eligibility criteria for participation? International students must meet the following requirements and English language proficiency:

Undergraduate Admissions: SAT or ACT scores are not mandatory for international students during the application process. It may, however, be considered for scholarship selection if the student has a GPA between 3.0-3.5. The prerequisites for undergraduate students are as follows:

-A high school diploma from an accredited institution
-Certificates for secondary (X) and higher secondary (XII) education
-English language proficiency requirements for international students are:
• IELTS score of 6.0 or higher
• TOEFL iBT score of 68 or higher
• A score of 95 or higher on DET (Duolingo English Test)
• A score of 500 or higher on the SAT (Reading/Writing)

Postgraduate Admissions: Applicants must have an undergraduate degree from a recognized university. The English language proficiency requirements for graduate students are:

• An IELTS score of 6.5 or higher
• TOEFL iBT score of 79 or higher
• A score of 105 or higher on DET
• A score of 105 or higher on DET

What documents are required for the application process?

In order to apply, international students must provide their academic transcripts and secondary school/college certifications. The transcripts must bear the original stamp, signature, and seal of designated officials from the institution. Other essential documents for international students include:

• SAT or ACT scores (optional)
• Proof of English language proficiency
• A copy of passport
• Financial records
• A portfolio, audio or video files (if required by the course)
• Resume
• Statement of Purpose (SOP)
• Essays
• Letters of Recommendation (LORs)

Name: University of Maryland
Overview:
Established in 1856, the University of Maryland is a public research university situated in Central Park, Maryland and is the largest in the Washington metropolitan area. The university boasts a sprawling suburban campus spanning over 1,340 acres adorned with iconic red-brick Georgian buildings. A prominent feature of the campus is McKeldin Mall, one of the largest academic lawns in the United States.

The university has been ranked 24th among public universities, garnering an impressive acceptance rate of 44.2%. Prospective students must submit their TOEFL/IELTS scores along with their academic GPA for consideration.

Tuition and fees for undergraduate programs at UMD are priced at an average of 36891 USD, while graduate programs cost approximately 19,500 USD. The university also offers generous scholarships such as the Banneker Scholarship which covers a significant portion of the tuition fees.

Living on campus is a convenient and enriching experience, with accommodation options available at North Campus and South Campus. These residential areas offer fully furnished single, double, triple, and quad occupancy rooms, along with meal plans, at a cost of 13,315 USD. The Department of Resident Life manages all residential halls and offers a wide array of student programs to enhance the living experience.

UMD is renowned for its exceptional MBA, Masters in Finance, Masters in Management, B.Sc., and Engineering programs which boast a high placement rate. Graduates from these programs are presented with lucrative job opportunities, with an average starting salary of 77,900 USD.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility prerequisites vary for each course. However, for non-native English speakers, proving English language proficiency is mandatory.
