Placement: The University Career Center and The President's Promise are determined to develop comprehensive recruitment strategies for companies. University of Maryland has a diverse range of career fairs to connect students with potential employers and enhance their brand recognition on campus. Virtual career fairs are conducted for the School of Public Health Career Expo, Smith School of Business Undergraduate, Fall Career & Internship, Computer Science Career & Internship, and Language Career & Internship Fair. Suite rooms are available for on-campus interviews for graduates seeking full-time, part-time, or internship opportunities. The interview process takes place twice a year, in the spring and fall semesters. Our alumni have secured positions at prestigious government, non-profit, and international organizations such as the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, World Bank, International Monetary Fund, and Inter-American Development Bank. They have also been successfully employed in the private sector at companies like Bates White and the Brattle Group.
Accommodation:
3. Do not change sentences that do not need to be changed.

Here is some information about the housing options available on campus for students at this university. These accommodations are specifically designed for students with disabilities, and the Department of Resident Life (DRL) is committed to providing suitable housing for them. All requests for reasonable accommodations are handled by the University Counseling Center's Accessibility and Disability Services (ADS), which follows the university's best practices for evaluating requests and ensuring that all students receive the same level of care. In order to determine the appropriate accommodations, students must first register with the Accessibility and Disability Services office. This may include having air conditioning, a single room, access to a private or single-use bathroom, a kitchen-equipped apartment, a wheelchair-accessible room, or an emotional support animal.

For more information, please visit the DRL website: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/housingaccommodations/

In addition to these on-campus accommodations, there are also apartment-style living options available. Each apartment comes fully furnished and equipped with a kitchen, living and dining area, one or more bathrooms, and typically four bedrooms for six students. The Leonardtown Community, located behind Fraternity Row and a short walk from most classes, can house approximately 625 students in garden-style apartments. The South Hill Community, near the Chapel and South Campus dining hall, offers apartments for an additional 350 students. In addition, the Language House living-learning program has 100 student apartments available in St. Mary's Hall.

Apartment residents are not required to participate in the campus dining plan, as all units have their own kitchens. However, many students do choose to purchase a Terrapin Express membership or dining plan.

For more information, please visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/aptsuites/

Although priority for housing in residence halls is given to full-time undergraduates, graduate students may also apply for on-campus housing. However, there are limited spaces available for graduate students and their spouses, partners, or families. The residence halls do not have accommodations specifically tailored for postgraduate students, and opportunities to reside in them are limited.

For more information, please visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/graduate/

The Department of Resident Life is committed to creating a welcoming environment for all students, regardless of their identity or orientation. It is our belief that every person has a valid place in our community and should be treated with respect and dignity. Discrimination, harassment, intimidation, abuse, assault, or any form of threat (whether direct or indirect) towards any individual or group will not be tolerated. We strongly believe that such actions are detrimental to our community and will be dealt with promptly and seriously.

For more information, please visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/lgbt/

A large number of the rooms in our residence halls are triples and quads. Of the total 9,180 beds available in 37 residence halls, 1,201 beds (roughly 13%) are located in these shared rooms. The majority of rooms are designed for two students to share, and during the room selection process, upper-division students are able to select approximately 14% of the available single rooms.

For more information, please visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/triplequads/

If you have any further questions or inquiries, please visit: http://reslife.umd.edu/housing/housingaccommodations/

Name: Oakland University
Overview: Oakland University, situated in Auburn Hills and Rochester Hills, Michigan, is a prestigious doctoral research institution globally. It was established in 1957 and is known for its student-centered approach and international outlook. The university offers a wide range of graduate programs and postgraduate certificates, including doctoral degrees, with over 130 programs and 138 certificates to choose from. Some of the top programs at Oakland University are B.S. in Biomedical Sciences, B.A. in Criminal Justice, and M.S. in Information Technology Management. To support students in their academic and professional journey, the university has dedicated internship resources and career services. The Career Services Team helps students explore unique opportunities that pave the way for their future success. For international students, there are options to apply for Oakland University Scholarships, Tuition, and Financial Aid, making education more accessible. The average tuition fee at Oakland University is CAD 12k, making it an affordable option for aspiring scholars looking for a world-class education.
Eligibility Overview:
Participation in the university's undergraduate programmes requires a minimum cumulative high school GPA of 3.2. Those with a GPA between 2.5 and 3.2 may also be accepted if their academic background is deemed sufficient. For the incoming class of 2021, submitting SAT or ACT scores is no longer mandatory, although it may be required for future admission cycles. Applicants are also expected to meet all state graduation requirements and are strongly encouraged to pursue a college-preparatory curriculum that includes four years of English, three years of math (including intermediate algebra), three years of social sciences, and two years of foreign language. 
For graduate admissions, each programme has its own specific criteria, but generally, applicants must hold a four-year bachelor's degree from a recognized college or university. Some programmes may ask for GRE or GMAT scores. 
In terms of English proficiency, international applicants must provide a TOEFL score of 79 or higher, an IELTS Academic score of 6.5 or higher, a PTE score of 53 or higher, or a Duolingo English Test score of 100 or higher. These scores serve as confirmation of adequate English language abilities.
Placement: No text provided
Accommodation:
The university offers both on-campus and off-campus accommodation options. There are various housing facilities such as on-campus residence halls and apartments available for students. On-campus accommodation can be arranged through the university's housing department. Alternatively, students also have the option to explore off-campus housing options near the university.

Students can choose to live in residence halls or apartments provided by Oakland University. These housing options are designed to provide students with a comfortable and convenient living experience. On-campus housing is highly recommended for students as it allows them to be in close proximity to campus facilities such as libraries, dining options, and recreational facilities.

Furthermore, living on-campus also gives students the opportunity to be part of a vibrant and diverse community. This fosters personal and academic growth, helping students to make the most out of their university experience. On-campus housing also offers several amenities such as laundry facilities, study rooms, and organized activities for residents.

For students who prefer more independent living, off-campus housing options are also available. Students can choose to rent apartments or houses in the surrounding areas of the university. These accommodations offer the flexibility for students to live off-campus while still being in close proximity to the university.

Name: INTERLINK at Seattle Pacific University
Overview:
INTERLINK is located in Seattle, Washington, and is a well-respected, small private university. Its safe residential surroundings just north of downtown Seattle make it an ideal location for students. The city of Seattle is known for being highly educated and is home to some of the biggest companies in the world such as Boeing, Amazon, Microsoft, and Starbucks. With its bustling shopping districts, prominent high-tech industries, charming coffee shops and music scene, Seattle is a popular destination for students from all over the world. Its efficient public transportation system makes it convenient for students to travel around the city.

At INTERLINK, students have access to a challenging curriculum which is taught on the university campus. The program includes both classroom and out-of-class assignments such as research in the library, community involvement, interviews, group discussions, presentations, and writing projects. Our institute provides intensive English as a Second Language (ESL) training, academic preparation, and cultural orientation to students who are non-native English speakers and are interested in studying at an American university.

With an average class size of 8 to 12 students, our in-person and online programs are designed to give individualized attention to each student. These programs run for 5-week sessions, with 10 or 20 hours of instruction per week. INTERLINK is accredited by the Commission on English Language Program Accreditation (CEA), making it one of only 13 programs globally to receive this prestigious recognition.

Upon satisfactory completion of our program, students are not required to take the IELTS or TOEFL exams for university admission. INTERLINK's English language programs also conform to the standards set by reputable organizations such as the Association of Teachers of English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL), English USA (formerly known as American Association of Intensive English Programs), and NAFSA: Association of International Education.

Additionally, INTERLINK offers a variety of scholarships for students. These include scholarships for alumni family members as well as students who have received scholarships from our affiliated institutions or partner universities. We are committed to providing accessible and quality education to students from all over the world.
Eligibility Overview:
Ways to Meet English Proficiency Requirements for Undergraduate Admission to the University: 

To be considered for general undergraduate admission, you must attain the minimum score on the English proficiency test listed below: 

- An internet-based TOEFL score of 79
- A paper-based TOEFL score of 550
- An overall band score of 6.5 on the IELTS Academic test
- A Pearson Test of English (PTE) score of 56
- A pre-level 1 EIKEN score
- A score of 105 on the Duolingo English Test
- Completion of level 6 at Interlink Language Center with a full recommendation 

If you are applying as a first-year student, please ensure that official transcripts from all high schools or secondary schools attended during grades 9, 10, 11, and 12 (or the equivalent in your country) are sent directly to the university. This should also include grade 9, regardless of whether it was considered part of middle school or junior high school in your country. Additionally, if you have completed secondary school examinations (such as A levels, HKCEE, WAEC, or SMA), please provide an official copy of your final exam certificate or diploma that reflects completed coursework and grades.
Placement: The Career and Calling Center at Seattle Pacific University offers a variety of services to help students and alumni achieve career success. Through career counseling, mock interviews, networking, job search assistance, internships, and experiential learning opportunities, the center provides comprehensive support to its students. Students can take advantage of the center's services to develop crucial skills such as resume and cover letter writing, as well as negotiation techniques.
Accommodation:
In regards to housing options at our university, there are two types available: on-campus and off-campus. Our on-campus housing is ideal for students who prefer to live in close proximity to their classes and other campus resources. Our off-campus housing, on the other hand, offers more flexibility and independence for students who prefer to live off-campus.

For those interested in on-campus housing, our university provides various options for students. Information on the available on-campus housing can be found on our university's website. Students can choose from a variety of residential types, including studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal living spaces. In addition, all basic services such as power, water, and unrestricted internet access are included in the housing fees.

Alternatively, our university also offers off-campus housing options for students. The average monthly rent for off-campus housing typically ranges from 850 to 1050 dollars. Our off-campus housing options include studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal living spaces. Similar to on-campus housing, all basic services are covered in the rent, such as power, water, and unlimited internet access. Additionally, many off-campus apartments also provide on-site laundry facilities and bike storage. Some units also offer amenities like a gym and exercise area.

For more information on off-campus housing options, students can visit our university's website or explore other external websites that cater to student housing in Seattle. We recommend using resources such as apartments.com, student.com, and collegestudentapartments.com to find off-campus housing that meets your preferences. Discover a comfortable and convenient living space while being a part of our university community.

Name: Valencia College - West Campus
Overview: The prime institute, Valencia College, lies within the state's college system and serves both Orange and Osceola counties in Central Florida. Taking up 180 acres, Valencia College West Campus is situated in West Orange County. There are over 60 courses available at the Valencia College West Campus including two-year degree programs for Associate in Science (A.S.) and Associate in Arts (A.A.). In addition, Continuing Education Programs are also offered. Aiming to facilitate the transfer of students to public universities in Florida, the Associate in Arts (A.A.) degree requires 60 eligible college-level credit hours, out of which 24 credits must be electives. The remaining 36 credits can be acquired through general education courses. Moreover, for those pursuing Associate in Science degrees, Valencia College offers a choice of 30 or more degree programs. Financial assistance is available through multiple options such as loans, grants, work study programs and scholarships. Some of the grants include Pell Grant, Florida Student Assistance Grant (FSAG) and Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grant (SEOG), each with its own set of eligibility criteria. Additionally, students may avail subsidized and unsubsidized Stafford loans as well as Parent PLUS Loans. The institute also offers various scholarships that include the Valencia Honors Scholarship, Valencia Advantage Scholarship, Valencia Foundation Scholarships and many more. In 2012, Valencia College was selected as one of the top 50 community colleges in the nation by Washington Monthly. The alumni community, consisting of more than 196,000 former students, stay connected with the college. The average starting salaries for Valencia College graduates in 2018-2019 varied between $39,000 and $63,000.
Eligibility Overview:
Academic Prerequisites - To apply, a high school degree or equivalent from the United States is required. Proof of this must be submitted. Official transcripts, graduation certificate, and/or exam results must be in English or have a certified translation. If you have attended college or university, official transcripts from all schools must be submitted. Degrees from non-US schools must be evaluated by a NACES member. 

English Competency - English proficiency can be demonstrated in several ways: 
1. The applicant's country is exempt from the requirement. 
2. A minimum official TOEFL score of 45, using school code 5869. 
3. A minimum IELTS score of 5.5. 
4. A minimum score of 86 on the LOEP (offered by Valencia College). 
5. A grade of C or better in English Composition or its equivalent. 
6. Minimum scores on the SAT (25 on Writing and Language, 24 on Reading) or ACT (17 on English, 19 on Reading). 
7. A Duolingo English Test score of at least 75 (for admission purposes only, not for placement).

Financial Proof - Applicants for an associate degree must provide a bank statement in English or a certified translation showing proof of finances of at least $23,338. Up to three sponsors may be listed. Details can be found on the Tuition Costs page.

Documentation - A copy of a valid passport is required. SEVIS Transfer Eligibility, copy of visa, copy of I-94 card, and copies of previous I-20s are necessary for F-1 Transfer Students only.

Overview:
Johnson and Wales University, located in Rhode Island, is a renowned private university with a strong student population of over 13000 spread across different campuses. Johnson in 1914. With almost 95% of students eligible for financial aid, this university offers over 15 scholarship programs for its undergraduate students, taking into considerations their SAT scores, rankings, and overall academic performance. Popular disciplines of study offered here include Communication, Accounting, Business Management, Biology, Criminal Justice to name a few. Accredited by the esteemed New England Commission of Higher Education (NECHE), Johnson and Wales University is well known for its unique study programs and scholarship opportunities.

The annual tuition fee at Johnson and Wales University is approximately 37,736 USD, making it an exclusive affair. Nested in an urban area, the campus incorporates modern facilities, making the study experience convenient and luxurious. Encompassing an area of 126 acres, the campus is home to several academic and residential buildings. The university is proud to house over 100 student clubs that cater to students' needs and passions, providing them a platform to engage in various activities and rejuvenate.

What sets Johnson and Wales University apart is its first-in-class culinary lab, which is LEED certified in the United States. The university houses a splendid and top-notch on-campus facility, allowing students to experience premium hospitality. According to records, a majority of students opt for on-campus accommodation, which consists of well-designed and fully-equipped residential buildings. The accommodation amenities include recreational centers, creating a comfortable environment for students to thrive.

Offering a wide array of programs such as Culinary Arts, Hospitality Management, Food Safety, Global Tourism, Marketing Management, Johnson and Wales University is a one-stop destination to fulfill your academic aspirations. For non-resident and non-citizen individuals who are interested in applying to our university, the same admissions requirements apply. However, there are additional documents that must be provided.

The submission must include a comprehensive, accurate, and legible international application. This should include the names and dates of all schools attended.

For international students, a certified high school transcript, including completed topics and grades as well as the date of graduation, must be submitted. For students who have yet to finish high school, a transcript with all completed work and anticipated graduation date must be provided. Non-English documents must be translated word-for-word and certified.

All applicants who have attended a post-secondary school must submit transcripts, mark sheets, diplomas, or certificates with course descriptions and credit values for assessment purposes.

For English proficiency, applicants must provide test results (if available), or take an English Language Proficiency test (please refer to our English Proficiency Requirements). These documents should be uploaded to the applicant portal.

For I-20 processing, a copy of the applicant's current passport must be included. Proof of financial support, such as a certified bank statement or government sponsorship letter, for one academic year is also necessary. Bank statements should be issued within three months of submission. Both the applicant and sponsor must sign a financial declaration. For F-1 visa holders currently enrolled in the US, a transfer verification form may be required, if applicable. All I-20 documents should be uploaded to the applicant portal in order to be reviewed.

To ensure a smooth application process, all documents and information should be legible and clear. If information is not accessible, there may be delays in the admissions process.

Name: Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) - Melbourne (CBD)
Overview: The Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) offers comprehensive training and education programs designed to advance the careers of individuals in the healthcare sector. With campuses located in major Australian cities such as Melbourne, Sydney, and Perth, as well as a campus in Cochin, India, IHNA has been providing industry-specific training since its establishment in 2007. Boasting a faculty of over 250 highly qualified medical professionals, IHNA is committed to providing quality education to its students. The Melbourne (CBD) campus, situated in the heart of the Central Business District, offers students convenient access to various tourist attractions, including the Yarra River, Great Ocean Road, Yarra Valley, Melbourne Zoo, and Crown Casino. Furthermore, the campus is conveniently located just 25 minutes away from Melbourne Airport. With renowned laboratory facilities and diverse learning opportunities, students at IHNA are equipped with real-world experience and the skills necessary for a career in the healthcare industry. The institute is divided into five schools, each specializing in a particular field, including Management, Community Services, Education, Allied Health, and Nursing. Recognized for its excellence in education, IHNA has received multiple awards, including being a finalist at the Victorian Training Award 2016 and winning the McMillan Woods Global Award 2018 for "Nursing & Healthcare Training Excellence" and the Victorian International Education Award in 2016. In line with its mission to advance the healthcare industry and accommodate the financial needs of students, IHNA has introduced the 50 over 50 initiative, which offers students a 50% discount on the tuition fee for any course.

Name: Western Carolina University
Overview:
Established in 1889, Western Carolina University is a public university located in Cullowhee, North Carolina. As a member of the University of North Carolina System, it is the fifth oldest institution out of sixteen universities. The university is dedicated to providing higher education opportunities while highlighting the significance of community involvement, academic knowledge, and collaboration. It strives to nurture students into responsible and compassionate global citizens who have the potential to become leaders.

With an above average acceptance rate of 69%, the university has become a popular and sought-after choice for higher education. It offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs, with over 120 undergraduate and 40 postgraduate options in various fields of study. Some of the university's most prestigious and highly ranked programs include literature, business, chemistry, engineering, criminal justice, and forensic science.

Western Carolina University boasts a welcoming, sustainable, and lively academic environment that also encourages extracurricular activities. This attracts a diverse student body from different parts of the world to the university. The institution encompasses two campuses spread across 589 acres of land, equipped with state-of-the-art facilities, including libraries, residence halls, research facilities, auditoriums, laboratories, organizations, counseling centers, recreation halls, and athletic centers. It also offers an extensive alumni network, resulting in a fair placement rate for graduates.

The average annual tuition and accommodation fee come to approximately $19,000. However, the university offers various scholarships and grants to reduce this cost to around $15,000, making it an affordable option for many students.

If you are taking the IELTS test, the minimum overall score required is 6.0, with no individual score below 5.0. Our school code for the SAT test is 5897 and a minimum score of 880 is required. For the ACT test, our school code is 3172 and the minimum score required is 18. These scores will help determine your eligibility for our institution, so be sure to prepare accordingly to increase your chances of acceptance. Thank you for considering our university, and we wish you the best of luck in your studies.

Name: Chemeketa Community College - Salem
Overview: Chemeketa Community College-Salem, located in Oregon, is a renowned public educational institution that offers a diverse range of courses and programs, which includes workforce training as well. It was established in the 1960s and is accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. The college prides itself on its experienced faculty members, who are highly knowledgeable and are experts in various fields such as liberal arts, sciences, and nursing. With a student-to-faculty ratio of 22:1, the college has an average enrollment of over 7,000 full-time equivalent students every year. In recognition of its academic excellence, Chemeketa Community College has secured the 3rd position in the Best Associate Degree Schools in Oregon Rankings. As part of its open admission policy, the college boasts of a 100% acceptance rate and does not require students to submit their SAT or ACT scores. The college not only focuses on providing quality education but also ensures that students have a fulfilling campus experience by offering various facilities such as a well-equipped library, remedial services, and career counseling services. It is also equipped with specialized resources for international students from more than 30 different countries, offering over 70 technical-vocational fields and transfer programs, along with English language classes ranging from beginners to advanced levels. The college also offers a generous scholarship of $1,200 to its students through the Chemeketa Foundation. In addition to this, students have the option to take online classes, minimizing any inconvenience. The out-of-state tuition fees for international students are approximately $35,150. However, to help students cover the costs of their education, the college offers financial aid to 86% of its students every year. Students also have access to a range of other facilities such as optional practical training, accommodation assistance, internship opportunities, and a conditional offer letter. International students at Chemeketa Community College also benefit from resources such as healthcare assistance, cultural excursions to various locations in Oregon, and leadership and training opportunities, along with volunteer opportunities to enhance their overall college experience.

Name: Brandeis University
Overview:
Brandeis University is a prestigious private research institution that was founded in 1948. Situated west of Boston in Waltham, Massachusetts, the university is renowned for its focus on liberal arts. It offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral programs across its five campuses. Covering an impressive 235 acres, the campus boasts 100 academic and residential buildings. The university is committed to fostering academic excellence, communication, creativity, collaboration, and critical thinking through its state-of-the-art labs and research facilities. 
At the undergraduate level, Brandeis University's School of Arts and Sciences offers 43 majors and 47 minors. In addition, it has 40 master's and 17 doctoral programs in various fields including sciences, social sciences, humanities, and creative arts through its graduate courses. The international business school at Brandeis offers undergraduate programs in fields such as anthropology, American studies, and classical studies, as well as a variety of graduate programs, including an MBA and MS in Finance.
The University offers an extensive array of resources to support the academic and personal growth of its students. The robust library system provides access to a vast array of study and research materials. The university also prioritizes the well-being and health of its students, providing resources for mental health, physical fitness, and counseling services. With over 200 student clubs and organizations, including service groups, cultural awareness teams, performing groups, game clubs, student leadership and activism groups, publications, and radio stations, the university offers a vibrant campus experience.
The cost of living at Brandeis University, including housing and meals, is approximately USD 16,000 per year. Tuition fees for international students total around USD 57,360 annually. On-campus housing options include 19 residential halls, apartments, and suites. The university provides convenient amenities such as internet services and a laundry facility to its residents. Furthermore, the university hosts multiple career and industry fairs, such as the Technology and Innovation Career Fair, Government and Public Services Fair, and Business, Consulting, and Finance Career Fair, to help students secure internships and job opportunities. Brandeis University also offers merit scholarships and need-based grants for international students looking to study in the USA.
Eligibility Overview:
"When evaluating applicants' transcripts, admissions officers at Brandeis University will be looking for clear evidence of an ability to take on new challenges. To be deemed eligible for first-year admission, you must be enrolled in a college-preparatory curriculum or an equivalent homeschooling program.

This should include, as a minimum, four years of English, three years of Mathematics, three years of laboratory science, and three years of social sciences. It is also recommended that applicants have two to three years of foreign language experience.

The majority of students who are accepted at Brandeis have taken higher-level courses such as honors, advanced placement, or international baccalaureate classes if offered at their high school. While there is no set minimum GPA for admission, over 75% of accepted applicants have graduated in the top 20% of their class."

Late requests will experience delays in the processing of their requests. Incoming first-year and transfer students will also receive information and deadlines for accommodation requests after they have been officially enrolled at the university. Eligibility Overview: International students who have completed high school in the United States are not required to submit English proficiency verification documents. However, applicants with F-1 visas and/or foreign academic qualifications must demonstrate English language ability before being admitted. There are four ways to verify English proficiency, including a degree from a country with a significant English-speaking population, a standardized examination, successful completion of SIUE's Intensive English Pathway program, or high academic achievements. For standardized examinations, scores must be submitted within the last two years and official reports must be sent directly from the Testing Service to the Office of Graduate and International Admissions. SIUE's institutional code is 001759 and no departmental code is required. Copies are not accepted. The minimum scores required for each exam are: 6.5 on the IELTS (with no component score below 6.0) for graduate students, 79 on the TOEFL, 53 on the Pearson PTE, and 110 on the Duolingo (with no component score below 90). For undergraduate students, the minimum scores are: 6.0 on the IELTS (with no component score below 5.5), 72 on the TOEFL, 50 on the Pearson PTE, and 105 on the Duolingo (with no component score below 85). This information is important for international students to know to ensure their successful admission to SIUE.

Name: Yale University
Overview:
Founded in 1701, Yale University is the third-oldest higher education institution in the United States. Originally established as a collegiate school in Saybrook, Connecticut, it was later moved to New Haven and officially renamed Yale College in 1718. In 1861, it became the first American university to award a Doctor of Philosophy degree. As a prestigious member of the Ivy League, Yale is recognized for its academic excellence worldwide, with approximately 5,200 undergraduates, 10% of whom are international students.

Comprising of fourteen schools including the Undergraduate Liberal Arts College, Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, and multiple professional schools, Yale offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and professional courses in various fields. The university boasts over 50 bachelor's degrees and certificate programs, as well as online learning and non-degree courses. In addition, Yale also provides opportunities for study abroad and university exchange programs, catering to deserving candidates. Notable alumni include Indra Nooyi, Hillary Clinton, George H.W. Bush, and Alexei Navalny.

Yale has a strong track record in terms of placements, with students securing positions in various industries such as consulting, investment banking, private equity, venture capital, government, e-commerce, and media/entertainment. However, the most notable feature of Yale is its commitment to providing financial aid to meet 100% of demonstrated financial need without requiring any loans. According to statistics from the university, 100% of first-year students from families with an annual income of less than $65,000 received financial assistance in the class of 2023.
Eligibility Overview:
The necessary requirements for admission to Yale University include achieving test scores within the 25th to 75th percentiles range for the following exams: 
- SAT Reading & Writing Test, with scores between 720 and 780
- SAT Mathematics Test, with scores between 740 and 800
- ACT Composite, with a range of 33 to 35 
There are no set cutoff scores, but the university values academic performance over standardized testing. A solid academic record in a rigorous college preparatory program can make up for lower standardized test scores. However, high test scores alone are not likely to compensate for a lackluster performance in secondary school. 
Non-native English speakers are required to take a proficiency test if they have not completed at least two years of secondary education in an English-speaking institution. The following are the accepted proficiency tests, with the minimum required scores: 
- TOEFL (internet-based): 100, with a minimum of 25 on each of the three sections on the paper-and-pencil TOEFL Paper-delivered Test 
- IELTS: a score of 7 or higher 
- PTE: a score of 70 or higher 
- DET: a minimum score of 120 
It is crucial for non-native English speakers to meet one of these requirements as Yale values strong language skills for academic success.
Placement: Yale University conducts placement assessments to ensure students are placed in appropriate courses. An estimated 75% of Yale University graduates secure jobs in full-time, part-time, or temporary roles with an average starting salary of approximately $76,359. Students can explore potential career paths by securing internships at the university and participating in placement and career fairs. MBA, English, management, history, economics, and law programs have a high rate of placement success. Yale University provides students with opportunities to be placed in well-known organizations. Accommodation:
The Yale Student Housing Office handles the search for graduate accommodations in the vicinity of the Yale campus. Yale Housing offers a range of housing options for students, including dormitories, suites, and apartments with one, two, or three bedrooms, based on their preferences and budget. Types of on-campus housing available at Yale University include the following:

On-campus Accommodation:
The office provides a limited number of on-campus accommodations for graduate and professional students, which are owned and maintained by Yale. Each room comes equipped with essential amenities such as a bed, mattress, wardrobe, desk, bookcases, curtains, window screens, fire screens, and chairs. These accommodations also cater to the needs of physically challenged students with wheelchair accessibility.

The average cost of living in these on-campus accommodations ranges from 7.07 to 11 lakhs per year. To apply for on-campus housing, students can visit the Yale Accommodation Service website.

Off-campus Accommodation:
Yale Housing also maintains a secure online database that offers off-campus housing options for all Yale students and faculty. This database lists various rental properties and properties available for sale in the greater New Haven area.

To apply for off-campus housing, students can visit the Yale Housing website and browse through the available options. This alternative housing is located in close proximity to the campus, making it convenient for students to commute.

Course Ranking:
Yale University is highly focused on delivering excellent education to its students, with a particular emphasis on undergraduate education. It is a top choice for students seeking a quality college experience. The university has a reputable drama, art, and music program. Its freshman retention rate is at an impressive 99%, highlighting the high level of student satisfaction.

Yale offers a variety of well-regarded majors, including social sciences, history, mathematics and statistics, and biological and biomedical sciences. The university's business programs have consistently ranked in the top 20 by Bloomberg, QS, and US News & World Report, making it a popular choice for those interested in business education. However, its engineering programs have not achieved the same level of recognition and are not as prominent as its business schools.

In comparison to its engineering programs, Yale is renowned for its highly regarded MBA and other business school offerings. This makes it a top choice for students interested in pursuing a career in the business world.
University Ranking: Yale University, founded 300 years ago, holds the distinction of being the first university in the United States to confer Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees. Over the past five years, Yale has maintained its position among the top five universities, making it a desirable choice for those seeking a reputable research institution. According to prestigious ranking companies QS and Shanghai, Yale has not featured in the top 10 universities in the past five years, lagging behind other Ivy League institutions such as Harvard and MIT. However, Yale's research output continues to be highly valued by professionals, considered a significant factor contributing to its overall influence. As evident from its fourth position in the 2021 US News & World Report rankings, research carries immense weight at Yale University. Despite being overshadowed by other Ivy League universities in terms of reputation, Yale has shown consistent improvement in teaching standards, as recognized by a steady rise in its rankings according to Times Higher Education.

Name: Sterling College
Overview: Sterling College was established in 2001 as a private college situated in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. It was previously known as Stewart College, which primarily focused on offering English language training to both domestic and international students to elevate their English proficiency. However, in 2016, the college underwent a transformation and became a part of Canadian Tourism College. Sterling College boasts a diverse range of academic disciplines including Writing and Editing, Sports Management, Theatre Arts, Mathematics, Psychology, Music, Health Science, History, Independent Interdisciplinary, Health and Human Performance, English, Communication and Media Arts, Education, Criminal Justice, Business Administration, Christian Thoughts, Chemistry, Christian Missionaries, Interdisciplinary Studies, Biology, Biblical Studies, and Art and Design. The college also offers two prestigious master's programs in M.S. in Athletic Training and M.A. in Sports Ministry. The average expense per year at Sterling College is CAD 17,785 while the approximate cost of living for a student is CAD 12,960. As of 2021, the tuition fee for M.S. in Athletic Training is $495 per credit hour and for M.A. in Sports Ministry, it is $400 per credit hour. Sterling College provides several financial aid options for its students such as scholarships, grants, employment opportunities, and loans. The college offers a personalized Sterling College Scholarship exclusively for full-time on-campus students where 100% of them receive the scholarship which can be awarded based on their academic performance, artistic and athletic excellence. The student's potential, background, and talent are taken into account while determining the Sterling College Athletic Scholarship awardees. Some of the other prestigious scholarships offered at Sterling College include Knight Family Scholarship, Park Presbyterian Grant, Evelyn Phinney Make a Difference Scholarship, and John Knox Presbyterian Church Endowed Scholarship. Sterling College is a proud member of the Council for Christian Colleges and Universities which also offers various unbeatable international travel opportunities to countries like Russia, Oxford, Latin America, Australia, and others. Being a wireless campus, Sterling College provides its students with high-speed internet facilities all over the campus allowing them to access study materials and other resources remotely.

Name: Arcadia University
Overview: Arcadia University, formerly known as Beaver College, is a well-respected private university located in Glenside, Pennsylvania. Founded in 1853, the university is situated on a sprawling 76-acre suburban campus. With a moderately selective admissions process, Arcadia boasts an acceptance rate of 74%. The university has been recognized as the "Best in the Northeast" by the prestigious Princeton Review. Arcadia offers a wide range of academic programs through its five schools: College of Global Studies, College of Arts and Sciences, School of Education, College of Health Sciences, and the School of Global Business. Students can choose from 35 undergraduate programs, 15 postgraduate programs, and ten doctoral programs across 65 diverse fields of study. The College of Global Studies also offers an impressive 130 programs in 15 different countries, and the university has administrative centers in eight countries. Interested applicants can apply for the Fall and Spring semesters through either the Arcadia Application portal or the Common Application. The application process follows a rolling admission policy, with academic transcripts, letters of recommendation, essays, CVs, and standardized test scores (TOEFL, SAT, ACT, GMAT, GRE, etc.) required. There is also a non-refundable application fee of 30 USD. With a high graduation rate, the average salary of Arcadia graduates is 66,053 USD. On-campus housing options include four residential halls with fully furnished rooms, lounges, dressers and complimentary laundry services, and social spaces. Students can also opt for apartment-style living at the Oak Summit Apartments. The university campus is equipped with various facilities, including dining options, shops, the Benton Spruance Art Center, and the Boyer Hall of Science. The average undergraduate tuition fee at Arcadia University is 43,740 USD (which varies depending on the program), while postgraduate programs have program-specific fees. The university also offers a range of need-based and merit-based scholarships, such as the Campus Achievement Award and the Arcadia University Distinguished Scholarship. On average, these scholarships are worth 31,065 USD.
Eligibility Overview:
Here are the revised instructions for international students who are applying as undergraduates at our university. These instructions must be followed carefully in order to ensure a successful application. Please note that any plagiarized content will result in the rejection of your application.

1. Undergraduate Applications - For students applying to our university at an undergraduate level, it is important to provide the following documents as part of your application. It is crucial to note that the information provided must be your own, and any copied or unoriginal content will not be tolerated.

- Official secondary school diploma or certificate 
- Official national comprehensive examinations (e.g. GCE, SSSCE, and CXC exams) 

2. English Language Proficiency - As an international student, it is imperative that you demonstrate a strong command of the English language. Therefore, you must provide evidence of your English language skills, such as a passing score on an approved English proficiency test. To ensure your application is not rejected, please refrain from using any unoriginal content in this section.

3. Submitting Translated Documents - If your documents are not in English, you must provide both the original document as well as a certified English translation. Please ensure that the translation is accurate and authentic.

4. Proof of Finances - In order to receive a student visa, international students are required to provide proof of sufficient funds to cover their educational and living expenses. Therefore, it is important to provide any supporting documents, such as bank statements or scholarship letters, as part of your application.

5. Copy of Passport - As an international student, you must also provide a copy of your passport showing your name, photograph, and date of birth. Please note that this is a mandatory requirement for all international applicants.

6. Admissions Interview - In some cases, an admissions interview may be required as part of the application process. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted with further instructions.

We look forward to receiving your application and welcoming you to our international community of students. Should you have any questions about the application process or the requirements, please do not hesitate to contact our admissions office for assistance.

Accommodation:
Arcadia University offers a comprehensive residential program for all undergraduate students, with over 1,200 students currently residing on campus. While living on campus is not mandatory, it is highly encouraged. The university provides various housing options to cater to the needs of different students.

Students living in the resident halls can choose to live alone or share a space with four or five other students. Each housing space is also coed, either on a floor or wing basis, based on request. Students can opt for a coed living arrangement in Kistler, Dilworth, and Heinz Halls. The CastleGrey Tower Castle offers a coed living arrangement where shared restrooms are available on each wing and additional facilities such as a washing machine and microwave in the communal sitting area.

For traditional first-year students, the university houses them in Kistler, Dilworth, and Heinz Halls. The CastleGrey Tower Castle is exclusively for first-year students. Knight Hall offers suite-style dorms for both new and returning students. Each suite can accommodate 5-8 upper-class students and comes with shared amenities like a spacious closet, a communal area with furniture, and a bathroom for convenience.

For more information on on-campus housing, please visit the link provided below.

Name: Western Michigan University
Overview: The Western Michigan University, located in Kalamazoo, Michigan, is a renowned public research institution that was founded in 1903. The university boasts five stunning campuses in the vicinity of Kalamazoo. The core belief of the university is to foster a culture of passion and research, aiming to empower its students to become forward-thinking, intellectual, and global leaders. The university comprises nine prominent colleges, including the College of Arts and Sciences, College of Aviation, Haworth College of Business, College of Education and Human Development, College of Engineering and Applied Sciences, College of Fine Arts, College of Health and Human Services, Lee Honors College, Graduate College, Thomas M. Cooley Law School, and the Homer Stryker M.D. School of Medicine. The university maintains a favorable student-teacher ratio of 16:1, with exceptional facilities in its many departments. It offers a range of over 150 undergraduate, 73 postgraduate, and 30 doctorate degrees. The university takes pride in its reputable programs, such as Aviation, Theatre, Art History, Cybersecurity, English, and Music. The university has an acceptance rate of 80%, making it a popular and easily accessible educational institution. The annual tuition and on-campus accommodation cost approximately $32,000, but students can avail several scholarships and grants offered by the university to reduce the cost to around $23,000. The university spans across 1,200 acres of land, and its five campuses are home to a diverse and inclusive student community. These campuses are equipped with state-of-the-art resources, including libraries, residence halls, cultural centers, and sports facilities. Additionally, Western Michigan University boasts a strong network of successful alumni, ensuring that 93% of its graduating students secure employment upon completion of their studies.
Eligibility Overview: The most essential information we require from you is your transcript. It contains a comprehensive record of your academic performance, including the courses you have taken and the grades you have received. This allows us to thoroughly evaluate your readiness for college. In order to ensure that you are prepared for the rigors of higher education, we recommend a strong academic foundation in the following areas:* Four years of English courses* Three to four years of math courses (covering at least second-year algebra or pre-calculus)* Three years of natural science courses (with a lab component for at least two of those years)* A minimum of two years of study in the same foreign language The acronym GPA stands for Grade Point Average. We also consider your grading pattern, particularly your most recent academic performance. If your high school does not provide official transcripts for your application, you may submit unofficial transcripts in the meantime. However, please note that federal regulations require us to receive official final high school transcripts before issuing any financial aid. Failure to provide these transcripts may result in a registration hold on your account for the upcoming spring semester. At Western Michigan University, we offer superscoring for both ACT and SAT scores. This means that we consider the highest section scores from multiple test attempts, providing you with the best chance of showcasing your academic potential. In 2020, we implemented a test-optional policy for both admission and scholarship consideration. This means that you have the option to submit your test scores, but it is not a requirement. If you do choose to submit your scores, you can self-report them on your application. Rest assured that we take all aspects of your application, including your testing information, into consideration when making our admissions decisions.

Course Ranking:
At Western Michigan University, rankings for various courses have been released, including business, computer, and engineering. For 2021, the PG Business and Economics courses at Western Michigan University have gained a 601+ subject ranking from THE (Times Higher Education). This is a significant increase from the previous years, as in 2020, the course ranked at 195 and in 2018 and 2019, it was at 199. However, it is important to note that while THE ranks courses based on various factors such as the curriculum and job prospects, US News & World Report also considers student selection (25%), opinion of business school leaders (25%), and employment outcomes (21%).

The UG Business course holds a 2021 subject ranking of 201, according to US News & World Report. This is also an improvement from the previous years, as it ranked at 195 for 2020. Both courses have consistently been ranked among the top 200 in recent years. It is worth mentioning that US News & World Report takes into account various factors while ranking courses, such as graduation rate, student debt, and starting salaries.

In terms of engineering courses, Western Michigan University's PG Engineering and Technology course is ranked between 401 and 500 by THE (Times Higher Education) for 2021. Moreover, US News & World Report has also released rankings for various engineering courses, with PG Civil Engineering (137), PG Electrical Engineering (178), and PG Mechanical Engineering (160) being included in the list for 2021. Furthermore, the PG Computer Engineering course holds a ranking of 146 for 2021 by US News & World Report.

In conclusion, Western Michigan University has consistently performed well in terms of course rankings, with business, computer, and engineering courses standing out in particular. These rankings serve as a testament to the quality of education offered by the university, as well as the success of its graduates in their respective fields.
University Ranking: Western Michigan University (WMU), a public research university located in Kalamazoo, Michigan, was founded in 1903 by Dwight B. Waldo. WMU offers a vast range of academic programs, including 147 undergraduate degree programs, 73 master's degree programs, 30 doctoral programs, and one specialized degree program. According to US News & World Report's 2021 list of global universities, WMU is currently ranked 1232 overall, a slight decrease from its previous rankings of 1176 for 2019 and 2020. In the US News & World Report's National University Rankings, WMU is placed at 258. This ranking is determined by various factors, such as the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation, each accounting for 12.5% of the final score. Additionally, WMU received a ranking of 1001+ for 2021 from THE (Times Higher Education) University Rankings, which equally considers teaching, research, and citations, with each factor given a weight of 30%.

Name: Southeast Missouri State University
Overview: The State University of Missouri, established in Cape Girardeau in 1873, is a public institution in the United States. This institution prioritizes offering high-quality education through the efficient use of technology, innovative teaching methods, and other advancements. With over 200 programs, including 75 graduate and 145 undergraduate majors, and 100 minor programs, Missouri State University provides a diverse array of academic options. The cybersecurity team at the university has strong connections with industry leaders, allowing them to effectively prevent cyberattacks. Additionally, the university has partnered with Apple to integrate the latest technological practices into its K-12 education curriculum. The most popular majors at Missouri State University are business, biology, liberal arts, and humanities. The campus also features the River Campus, which focuses on dance, music, visual arts, and theatre. Located in an urban setting on a 400-acre campus, this mid-sized university is home to approximately 12,000 students. Students have access to a wide range of academic and extracurricular opportunities. Most majors also offer hands-on learning experiences and internships. The university also encourages students to explore their global perspectives by offering study abroad programs ranging from two weeks to a full year. Notable alumni of Southeast Missouri State University include Steven Tilley, Joe Tuineau, Peter Kinder, Linda Godwin, a NASA astronaut, Neal E. Boyd, the 2008 America's Got Talent champion, and Antonius Cleveland. Southeast Missouri State University competes in the NCAA Division I sports, including cross-country, football, basketball, and baseball for men, and soccer, tennis, basketball, cross-country, gymnastics, softball, track (indoor/outdoor), and volleyball for women.

Placement:
The university prides itself on providing valuable career resources for its students, including the highly useful Career Development Center. This resource helps students to explore and secure internships and job opportunities. In addition, the university offers REDHAWKjobs, a robust online recruiting system that effectively matches students with suitable job and internship placements while providing employers with a convenient platform to connect with potential candidates.

To further support student career success, the university offers guidance in CV writing and prepares students for job interviews. Regular career fairs are held, both in-person and online, providing opportunities for students to network with potential employers. Alumni also play a crucial role in the university's career services, assisting with student recruitment and job placements.

The university's career resources have led to a high rate of success for its graduates, with 93% securing employment within two years of graduation. On average, these graduates earn an impressive median wage of 39,000 USD per year, surpassing the national average of 34,000 USD. The university's dedication to preparing students for successful careers is evident in these remarkable statistics.
Accommodation:
The university provides both on-campus and off-campus housing options for students. They have access to Towers East and Towers South, the on-campus residence halls. However, according to the Board of Regents, Southeast Missouri State University full-time students are required to live on campus for the first two years of their academic journey, with some exemptions available.

There are ten dining halls and ten housing halls available for students to choose from. These include Towers East, Towers North, Towers West, Towers South, Vandiver, and LaFerla. Merick Hall offers suite-style rooms that are shared by two students, with a common entryway and bathroom. Additionally, there are small living areas, a game room, a laundry room, and a large fireplace room for students to enjoy.

Myers provides four-person suites and a few triple rooms, each with an attached bathroom. Students have to share the sitting area, kitchenette, and laundry facility. Pets are allowed in all residence halls.

The university offers various amenities, such as banking services, computer access, laundry facilities, vending machines, mail service, microfridge rental, cable TV, and shuttle services. Students can also manage their on-campus housing through a dedicated portal.

For those interested in off-campus housing, there are fully-furnished apartments available at an average monthly rent of $500 to $700. These include studio apartments, three-bedroom, four-bedroom, and communal apartments. Most units come with standard domestic appliances, such as stoves, refrigerators/freezers, and dishwashers. These apartments are also conveniently located near bus stops and offer easy access to shopping, dining, and entertainment options.

To learn more about off-campus housing options, visit the provided link.

Name: Pratt Institute
Overview: The Pratt Institute is a prestigious private university established in New York in 1887. It is a hub for academic pursuits in art, culture, business, and design. With accreditation from the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, it has affiliations with the American Collegiate Athletic Association and the Hudson Valley Intercollegiate Athletic Conference. Courses offered include AAS in Building and Construction, AOS in Illustration, BFA in Writing and Photography, BFA in Game Arts, and PLAB in Poetics Lab. The institute ranks 227 in the TIMES Higher Education University Ranking 2021 and boasts an alumni network of approximately 62,000 graduates across 83 countries. International students can also apply for scholarships provided by the institute. The acceptance rate is 56%, and the maximum tuition fee is around CAD 46,000. The beautifully landscaped campus features various facilities, including the Library Rose Garden, Newman Mall, Canon Court, and the Engineering Quadrangle. The institute also offers accommodation in six residential houses equipped with student lounges and fitness centers, housing a total of 1600 students.
Eligibility Overview:
Pratt University expects its prospective candidates to fulfill certain eligibility requirements in order to be considered for admission to the university. These requirements include submission of proof of taking Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT 1) or the American College Testing Program (ACT). Candidates may choose to submit their SAT or ACT scores, while the optional essay section of the SAT and the ACT writing test will not affect the admission chances. Students who have taken these exams should send the results to the university. 
Additionally, international students and those whose first language is not English are required to demonstrate English language proficiency by submitting results from exams such as TOEFL, TOEFL Home Edition, TOEFL ITP Plus, PTE, IELTS, IELTS Indicator or Duolingo. For students who have English as their first language, SAT or ACT scores can be submitted instead of the above-mentioned language exams. The university accepts the minimum score requirement for these exams.
To ensure the authenticity of these test results, they must be sent directly from the testing company. International students should also familiarize themselves with the criteria set by the university for admissions. By following these guidelines, students can enhance their chances of getting admitted to Pratt University.

Name: Fairfield University
Overview:
Located in Fairfield, Connecticut, Fairfield University is a private Catholic university known for its excellent education and diverse student population. The university was founded by the Jesuits in 1942 and is currently run by The Society of Jesus. Every year, around 5,000 students enroll for admission, choosing from a wide range of bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degree programs. Fairfield County, where the university is situated, is considered one of the most desirable places to live in the United States, with a population of 62,105.

Fairfield University is comprised of five colleges and schools: the Charles F. Dolan School of Business, Mariam Peckham Egan School of Nursing and Health Studies, Fairfield School of Arts and Sciences, Graduate School of Education and Allied Professions, and the School of Engineering. These schools offer renowned courses in subjects such as Psychology, Accounting, English, Communication, Finance, Nursing, Biology, and Marketing.

Covering an area of 200 acres, Fairfield University boasts world-class facilities and amenities near the bustling city of New York. This includes a wide array of theaters, shopping centers, and restaurants. The university also hosts over 100 student clubs, providing ample opportunities for students to engage in extracurricular activities.

Fairfield University offers top-notch hostel accommodations, with options for shared rooms and residential halls. However, the cost of studying at the university can amount to around 60,000 USD per year. To offset these expenses, the university provides various on-campus work and part-time job opportunities for its students.

To prepare and groom students for the corporate world, Fairfield University has a dedicated career center. This center offers various useful resources such as career workshops, internship opportunities, and training programs, helping students develop crucial professional skills. Renowned companies like Ralph Lauren, NBC, NFL, and Disney regularly visit the university for campus placements, with the graduates earning an impressive average salary of 58,000 USD.
Eligibility Overview: Fairfield University has a strict admissions process, accepting only 56% of applicants and giving early acceptance to 57.9% of them. In order to be considered, students must have a SAT score between 1190-1340 or an ACT score of 27-30. Although there is no set requirement for SAT scores, the university prefers applicants with at least a 1190.

The university was founded in 1964 and has a strong academic reputation, particularly in the field of business studies. The main campus of Southwest Minnesota State University is conveniently located in Marshall, providing students with easy access to essential amenities and services. Eligibility Overview:
Admissions for International Freshmen
This category is applicable if you are not currently studying in the United States or if you do not have a permanent resident or citizenship status in the country. Majority of international students applying from outside the US fall under this category. This means that you will have to complete your entire application online and submit your documents through mail or electronically. Applicants must be able to provide evidence that they have completed their secondary education (usually 12 years) in their home country and are qualified to attend institutions in their respective countries. Due to the varying educational systems across different countries, admission standards may differ depending on the applicant's origin. Additionally, you will be required to complete the visa application process in your home country. Although this may seem daunting at first, we are here to assist you throughout the entire application process.

In order to be considered for admission, applicants must have a minimum cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 2.0 (out of 4.0). Those who have completed less than 24 credits must also submit official transcripts from their secondary school.

Name: Auburn University
Overview:
Auburn University is an esteemed public research institution situated in Auburn, Alabama, USA. It is spread over a sprawling 1841-acre area and offers a diverse range of 140 courses and 40 majors across 13 colleges and schools. The student population at Auburn University stands at 30,440, with students enrolled in undergraduate, postgraduate, and professional programs. The university follows a semester system for its academic calendar and boasts of top programs in agriculture, architecture & design, business, engineering, forestry & wildlife, human sciences, liberal arts, nursing, pharmacy, sciences, and veterinary medicine.

The university is renowned for its master's program in computer science and software engineering, M.B.A, M.Sc. in biosystem engineering, and B.Sc. in computer engineering. It is also recognized for its commitment to providing financial aid to deserving students. The Office of University Scholarships offers an array of scholarships, including opportunities for international students, on an annual basis. About 60% of incoming freshmen receive some form of scholarship from the university. The total tuition cost at Auburn University is approximately USD 30,524. The institution has been consistently ranked as one of the best places to live for students and hosts over 300 organizations on its campus.

Apart from academic excellence, Auburn University also offers a vibrant campus life with opportunities in sports, including a variety of athletic teams in basketball, volleyball, soccer, and more, for both men and women. The university is a member of the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics (NAIA). It actively promotes student involvement through its 70 clubs and organizations, which include Greek life and student government.

On-campus, Auburn University provides a comfortable living space for its students, with 32 residence halls accommodating around 4800 residents. These residence halls come equipped with study lounges, meeting rooms, and laundry facilities. The estimated cost of living at Auburn University is around USD 15,000.

As a top-ranked university, Auburn University continues to attract students from all over the world with its renowned academic programs, generous financial aid opportunities, and dynamic campus life.
Eligibility Overview:
The admission process for all majors at Auburn University is highly competitive and selective. International students must have a strong academic background to be considered for admission, just like any other applicant.

As an international student, you must take either the ACT or SAT if you have less than 30 semester credit hours. In addition, you must complete the following core curriculum requirements by the end of your final year of high school: four years of English, three years of social sciences, three years of math (Algebra I and II, Geometry, Trigonometry, Calculus, or Analysis), and two years of science (including a laboratory component).

For admission into a Professional Golf Management (PGA) bachelor's degree program, you must have earned a bachelor's degree or its equivalent from an accredited college or university.

For certain graduate programs, such as Management, Finance, Master of Business Administration (MBA), and Master of Accountancy, the GMAT is required. The GRE is optional.

If English is not your native language, you must demonstrate proficiency in English by meeting one of the following requirements: a total score of 79 or higher on the TOEFL (interactive version), a score of 213 or higher on the computer-based TOEFL (CBT), a score of 550 or higher on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT), or a score of 5.5 or higher on the IELTS.

In summary, to be considered for admission to Auburn University, international students must have a strong academic record and meet all required criteria for their chosen major. Meeting language proficiency requirements is also necessary for non-native English speakers.
Placement: The Harbert College of Business promises a successful future for students pursuing a PhD in Business, Management. Our aim is to assist students in securing positions at similar or exceptional institutions, and our efforts have paid off: our alumni have achieved faculty positions at prestigious universities across the nation. Take a look at their destinations: For More: https://harbert.auburn.edu/degrees-programs/doctoral/phd-business-management/placements.html

Name: University of California, Davis
Overview: The University of California, Davis is an esteemed institute located in Davis, USA. It has a wide range of offerings for students, including undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various fields, along with online degree programs for distance education students. Additionally, this university offers opportunities for students to engage in study abroad programs, with approximately 1,300 students participating on an annual basis. UC Davis boasts an extensive list of academic departments, such as engineering, agriculture, sciences, mathematics, anthropology, social sciences, media, design, computer science, arts, economics, languages, environment, pharmacy, philosophy, medicine, and psychology. The university has a strong track record of placing students in top companies, with a high rate of success. Scholarships, work-study programs, and other forms of financial aid are available to students, with the option for a Career Planning Service to assist in building a CV and finding a job upon completion of a degree, including part-time jobs, summer jobs, and internships.
Eligibility Overview:
The eligibility requirements for undergraduate courses at this university are as follows: 
1. Academic Background: To be considered for a bachelor's degree, an applicant must have completed 2 years of formal education in science and history, 4 years of formal schooling with English as a teaching language, 3 years of formal education in math (recommended 4 years), and 2 years of formal schooling in a language other than English (recommended 3 years). Additionally, 1 year of formal schooling in Arts of Seeing and Acting is required, and preschool with options counts as one academic year. 
2. Grade Point Average (GPA) Requirements: California residents must have a GPA of 3.00 or above, while students from other states must have a GPA of 3.40 or above. 
3. Qualifying Exams - SAT/ACT Scores: For the Fall Semesters of 2021 through 2024, no standardized test will be required for freshmen applicants to this university. However, test results may be used for achieving minimum eligibility requirements or course placement after enrollment. 

The requirements for graduate courses are as follows: 
1. Academic Background: Candidates must hold a bachelor's degree or its equivalent from an institution with a minimum 3.0 GPA (or equivalent). The coursework and financial aid must be comparable to those for a University of California degree. For US colleges, regional accreditation is required, while foreign institutions must be approved by a national higher education body at the time of earning the degree. 
2. Indian Graduates: Indian students must possess a postgraduate or master's degree in addition to a four-year or three-year bachelor's degree. They must have completed 12 years of education, including the 10th and 12th grades, from state or central boards that are approved. 
3. GMAT/GRE Scores: Some programs may require GMAT/GRE scores, as well as other standardized exam results. 
English Language Requirements for International Students: All international students must demonstrate proficiency in English.

Accommodation:
UC Davis provides a variety of housing options for students, including on-campus accommodations and off-campus residences. These options include residence halls, student apartments, campus apartments, and cooperatives. All of these housing facilities are located on the university campus to promote a cohesive community for students. Some private residences and cooperative societies are also located near the campus and managed by their own contracts with UC Davis. 

The residence halls are divided among three neighborhoods: Segundo, Tercero, and Cuarto, with a total of 23 halls. Segundo is situated on the northwest corner of the central campus, while Tercero is located on the southwest corner. Cuarto is just a block away from the central campus to the northwest. The University Housing and Dining Services oversees the campus apartments, which include Solano Park. Additionally, there are other housing options available for students, both on and near the campus.

Off-campus housing is also available for students, with an average monthly rent ranging from USD 600 to USD 700. These options include studio flats, 3-bedroom apartments, 4-bedroom apartments, and shared apartments. The rent for these accommodations includes essential services such as electricity, central heating, and internet access. The kitchen appliances, such as the dishwasher, refrigerator, gas burner, and microwave, are all energy-efficient. 

You can find information about on-campus housing here, and off-campus options through this link.

Name: Johns Hopkins University
Overview:
With its establishment dating back to 1876, Johns Hopkins University in Maryland is a distinguished private research institute. It boasts an impressive 11% acceptance rate and a substantial student body of over 24,000 full-time and part-time students. The university comprises nine schools, including Business, Education, Arts & Sciences, Medicine and Nursing, offering a diverse range of more than 260 disciplines in undergraduate, graduate, doctoral, certificate and non-degree programs. Some of the most sought-after majors at Johns Hopkins University include Africana Studies, Biology, Computer Music, Anthropology, and Anatomy Education, among others.

Although the university is situated in Baltimore, it has ten campus divisions across three continents. The campuses in Baltimore are strategically located in Homewood, East Baltimore, Harbor East and Peabody, while several satellite campuses can be found in Montgomery County, Columbia, and Laurel, all in Maryland. Additionally, the university has a prominent presence in Washington, D.C, Italy, and China. The university also offers a variety of online programs, including for-credit courses that are offered through platforms such as Coursera. Furthermore, students can take advantage of the university's study-abroad program, which enables them to spend a semester or year in cities such as Paris, Tokyo, and Barcelona. The university also organizes several summer programs for high school students.

The estimated cost of undergraduate education at Johns Hopkins University is approximately USD 57,000. Prospective students can avail the university's need-blind financial aid system, which offers various financial aid programs such as the JHU Grant, Clark Scholarship, National Fellowships Program, Federal Pell Grant, Private Scholarships, and Federal Work-Study, among others. The university also provides on-campus housing options for undergraduate students, particularly for the first two years. Students can choose between residence halls with double occupancy (with a few single occupancy options) or suites with single, double, or triple occupancy, along with access to a wide range of dining services. Furthermore, the university boasts a thriving campus life, with over 400 clubs and organizations, 24 varsity sports teams, and more than 50 events organized each year. The university also takes immense pride in its impressive placement record, with 96% of its graduates securing jobs with competitive compensation packages.

In terms of English language proficiency, applicants are required to take a language proficiency test. The university expects students to meet its English language requirements. This means that applicants must demonstrate their proficiency in English through the test.
