Placement: The English graduate program at Johns Hopkins University plays a crucial role in helping students find fulfilling employment opportunities that utilize their unique skills. The university's smaller size allows for personalized guidance and support in the job search process for each student. Additionally, the department hosts various guest speakers who provide insights on potential career paths, both within and outside of academia. Students are also provided with assistance in publishing their works, preparing for applications and interviews, and tapping into the extensive Hopkins alumni network. The university's Office of Integrative Learning and Life Design is an invaluable resource available to all students for career planning. Since 2009, 17% of PhD graduates have secured jobs in fields such as publishing, speechwriting, law, and professional editing, while the remaining 83% have gone on to post-doctoral fellowships or academic positions at prestigious institutions such as Stanford University, Cornell University, City College of New York, Case Western Reserve University, St. Mary's College of Calgary, and the University of Rochester. Some notable companies where students have been placed include the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Bates White Economic Consulting, Bank of Mexico, Amazon, University of North Texas, Federal Reserve Board, Ernst & Young, and the Singapore Monetary Authority.
Accommodation: The Hopkins undergraduate experience is not truly complete without the added experience of residing on campus. Majority of the undergraduates at the Homewood campus live in residence halls during their first two years, and some choose to stay longer. As a first-year student, you have two options to choose from for on-campus accommodation. Traditional residence halls offer mostly double rooms shared with a roommate, along with a few single rooms and common bathrooms. Alternatively, there are suite-style accommodations available, providing private bathrooms, double, single, or triple rooms, as well as central heating and air conditioning. In some of these suites, there are also small kitchenettes available. If you prefer living off-campus, you will find a wide variety of rental homes and apartments within walking distance from any of the four Baltimore locations. The Off-Campus Housing Office at JHU assists students by posting ads for vacant properties, if needed. For more detailed information, please visit: https://www.jhu.edu/life/housing-dining/

According to US News, the average freshman retention rate, which reflects student satisfaction, stands at an impressive 98%. Therefore, it is evident that the quality of education and academic life at JHU is unsurpassed. In terms of subject-specific rankings, JHU's master's program in biomedical engineering has been ranked number one by US News since 2018. In 2020, QS Rankings also recognized the JHU Nursing program as the third best in the world. As for its computer engineering program, JHU has received accolades from prestigious ranking providers. US News consistently placed it at 22nd position in 2019 and 2020, while THE moved it up from 30th in 2019 to 27th in 2021. Given its reputation as a top research university, JHU is a fantastic option for those seeking higher education. However, with an acceptance rate of only 11.2% in 2020, JHU is undoubtedly one of the most selective institutions for admissions. Prospective students with excellent academic credentials and strong test scores are encouraged to apply and experience the exceptional academic environment at JHU. For more information about the admission process at John Hopkins University, please refer to the frequently asked questions section on their website.

Name: Chicago State University
Overview: Chicago State University (CSU), located in Illinois, USA, is a notable public institution established in the year 1867. It comes under the Thurgood Marshall College Fund and holds accreditation from the Higher Learning Commission. The university offers an impressive set of 56 degree programs across diverse fields such as Business, Education, Health Science, Pharmacy, Arts, Sciences, Design, Psychology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Social Work, Languages, Engineering, Communication, and Philosophy. Furthermore, CSU also provides a wide range of graduate programs, including Master's in Teaching, Fine Arts, Occupational Therapy, Public Health, Science in Education, and Doctoral Degrees in Education (Ed.D) and Pharmacy. These programs are available in various sessions throughout the year - Spring, Summer, and Fall - thus affecting tuition fees and program-related expenses. Consequently, a detailed budget must be planned before enrolling for any program. Additionally, the university has a single campus that caters to education and on-campus accommodation. This residential hall is a three-story building with a capacity for around 330 students. On average, the annual hostel and meal expenses are estimated to be 6,028 USD. This entails a cost of approximately 3,000 USD per semester for a single room, while meals could range from 1,256 USD to 2,453 USD (10 to 19 meals). The accommodation is assigned for an eight-month academic period. CSU's campus offers various other facilities, such as a gym, fitness center, three swimming pools, dance studio, and an auxiliary gymnasium, to name a few. The athletic department is housed in a separate building. Additionally, Chicago State University, in conjunction with Chicago State Foundation, organizes a scholarship gala annually to provide financial assistance to deserving students.
Eligibility Overview:
Given below is the information to be provided by applicants for admission at our university. We highly recommend that you follow these instructions carefully to ensure that your application is accurately and efficiently processed.

If you have previously attended a university or have received the equivalent of a United States high school diploma, you must submit the following documents in order for your application to be considered: 
- Completed online application (either CommonApp or CSU) 
- Official transcripts from all previously attended institutions 
- Proof of English proficiency (only if English is not your first language) 

If you are currently enrolled in high school or have obtained the equivalent of a US high school diploma but have never attended college, you must provide the following documents for your application to be considered: 
- Completed online application (either CommonApp or CSU) 
- Letter of recommendation 
- Optional: ACT or SAT score (for Spring 2022, this is not required) 

For applicants who have not completed education in one of the countries listed on page 31 of our Academic Catalog, a valid score from one of the following organizations, taken within the last two years, must be submitted with your application: 
- 68 on the TOEFL (iBT) 
- 6 on the IELTS (Academic) 
- 47 on the PTE-A (Academic) 
- 3.7 iTEP (Academic Plus) 
- 18 ACT 

For the SAT, a minimum score of 960 is required. All documents in languages other than English must be accompanied by a certified translation from a NACSE accredited credit evaluation company. Additionally, all transcripts from universities outside the US must be evaluated by an organization approved by NACES. 

We wish you the best of luck with your application and hope that you abide by all the necessary guidelines to ensure a smooth and efficient admission process. Thank you for considering our university for your higher education goals.

Name: Pacific Lutheran University
Overview: Founded in 1890 by Norwegian settlers, Pacific Lutheran University is a privately owned Christian university located in the Parkland neighborhood of Tacoma, Washington. This prestigious institute is sponsored by the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America. Offering a wide range of minors, majors, and professional and graduate programs in fields such as creative writing, finance, marketing analytics, marriage and family therapy, nursing, education, and business administration, PLU has a total student enrollment of approximately 3100. An impressive 38% of these students are international, hailing from 28 countries and 38 states. With a student-to-teacher ratio of 13:1, the focus is on personalized education and individual attention. It's noteworthy that the university has an acceptance rate of over 80% in the past five years. The average GPA for the Class of 2024 stands at an impressive 3.0 out of 4.0. Notable alumni include Connor Trinneer, a well-known American actor, and William Herbert Foege, an esteemed American epidemiologist. Additionally, former Olympic gold medalist Megan Jendrick is also an alumnus of this revered university. PLU takes pride in its contributions to society and has produced 100 Fulbright Scholars since 1975. Furthermore, an impressive 90% of PLU students gain employment or admission into graduate school within six months of graduating. In terms of finances, the tuition fees for the academic year 2021-2022 range from $45,000 to $50,000, with an additional $10,000 to $12,000 for room and board. The estimated total expenditure for the year 2021-2022 is between $55,000 and $60,000. A vast majority (98%) of PLU students receive financial aid, with the average financial assistance offer for the year 2020-21 being $37,197.
Eligibility Overview:
The university sets a high standard for language proficiency in order to ensure the academic success of its students. In order to be eligible for admission, applicants must meet one of the following criteria:

- A minimum TOEFL score of 79 or a CEFR level of C1
- A minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS exam
- A minimum score of 56 on the PTE exam
- A score of 105 or above on the Duolingo English Test
- Completion of a college-level English course with a grade of B or better (semester system)
- Completion of two college-level English courses with a B or better (quarter system)
- A minimum score of 500 on the SAT's English section
- A minimum score of 21 on the ACT
- A grade of B in GCE O-Level English
- Completion of the PLU International Pathway Program
- Completion of a pre-approved English as a Second Language program with a CEFR level of B2
- Official proof from the applicant's secondary diploma-granting institution (if not located in one of the countries listed above) confirming that the language of instruction is English for at least two years.

Acceptable documentation may include a letter from the school principal, guidance counselor, English teacher, registrar, or controller of examinations, or official transcripts, mark sheets, or diploma statements indicating English as the medium of instruction.

Name: University of Nevada, Las Vegas
Overview:
The University of Nevada, Las Vegas (UNLV), located in Las Vegas, USA, is a prestigious educational institution offering various undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs both on-campus and online to distance education students. It has a diverse curriculum, with Mechanical Engineering as one of its major fields of study. The main campus of UNLV is situated in the bustling city of Las Vegas, making it a convenient choice for students from all over the world. With a wide range of courses, UNLV provides a unique blend of academic excellence and practical experience. The university boasts of 5 undergraduate programs and 7 postgraduate programs, catering to the diverse interests of its students. The cost of attendance may vary depending on the course and the student's nationality.

UNLV strives to make education accessible to all and offers scholarships, work-study opportunities, and various funding options to assist students financially. The university also has a dedicated Career Planning Service team that guides and supports students in building a strong CV, preparing for job interviews, and finding suitable employment post-graduation. Whether it's a full-time role, a part-time job, a summer job, or an internship, UNLV equips its students with the necessary skills and resources to succeed in their chosen careers. For more information about the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, visit Leap Scholar and explore the various courses offered to fulfill your academic and professional goals.

Name: University of South Carolina Upstate
Overview:
The University of South Carolina Upstate, situated in Spartanburg, USA, is renowned for its academic excellence and offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs. With its dynamic curriculum and the provision of online degree courses for distance learning students, the university caters to the diverse educational needs of its students. The popular field of study at the university includes Computer Engineering among others. The main campus of the University of South Carolina Upstate is located in the vibrant city of Spartanburg, known for its lively academic environment.

Name: Bowling Green State University
Overview:
The Bowling Green State University, located in Ohio, was founded in 1910. As a public university, it boasts a variety of research programs and facilities. In addition to the main campus in Bowling Green, there are several other campuses located throughout the state. The university's oldest campus is situated in the southwest corner of the city and covers an impressive 1,338 acres of land. With over 19,000 students enrolled, including 900 international students from diverse countries, BGSU offers a dynamic and diverse learning environment.

Comprising of four schools and 21 departments, BGSU offers a wide scope of academic programs, including undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees, as well as short-term courses. The university is renowned for its programs in Musical Arts, Human Development, Engineering, Education, Business Management, and many other areas. It also provides opportunities for endorsement and certification through its online courses, along with 16 master's degree programs offered online.

BGSU's library, which has been in operation for 50 years, houses an impressive collection of over seven million books for its students. The university also hosts various sports competitions, festivals, and cultural events regularly. Its campus amenities include a spacious running track, exercise rooms, squash courts, cafeteria, labs, swimming pools, theatre rooms, and more. BGSU also offers financial assistance such as awards, grants, and scholarships to support its students. Additionally, on-campus accommodation is available to students, with options for furnished and unfurnished rooms, along with laundry and meal plans.

Situated in a safe and student-friendly city, the estimated cost of living and studying at BGSU is around 10,000 USD. Graduates from BGSU are highly sought after by multinational companies worldwide, making it a top choice among students.
Eligibility Overview:
Below are the admission requirements for applying to studies at Bowling Green State University (BGSU) in the United States:

- Official transcripts from all previously attended universities must be submitted.
- Applicants must provide scores for standardized tests such as GRE, GMAT, PRAXIS, or OAE for undergraduate programs, and GRE, GMAT, PRAXIS, or OAE for graduate programs.
- Proof of English proficiency must be provided through scores from exams like TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or MELAB.
- Additional documents, including a statement of purpose and a resume, may be required for graduate programs at BGSU.
- Letters of recommendation are also necessary for admission to BGSU.
- A copy of the applicant's passport is required.
- Non-English speaking applicants must demonstrate their English language skills through standardized exams.
- Accepted English language tests and their minimum score requirements are TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, and MELAB.

Note: Please note that all information provided above is specifically related to admission requirements for studying at Bowling Green State University. Applicants should provide all relevant documents and meet the minimum score requirements for English proficiency to be considered for admission. International applicants must also provide proof of their English proficiency.

Name: Northern Illinois University
Overview: Established in 1895 by Governor John P. Altgeld, Northern Illinois University is located in Dekalb, Illinois. It has multiple campuses in Chicago, Naperville, and Rockford and is divided into seven colleges: business, education, law, health, human science, engineering and technology, liberal arts and sciences, and visual and performing arts. According to the US News and World Report 2021, it is ranked 298 in the National Universities Ranking and 703 in the Global Universities category. It is also recognized as one of the best business colleges, holding a position of 157 in the UG Business ranking. As accredited by the Carnegie Foundation, the university is renowned for its extensive research programs, with a classification of Ru/H for high research activity. The main campus spans across 765 acres in Dekalb and offers a wide range of programs, including 100+ undergraduate and 80+ graduate programs, minors, certificates, pre-professional studies, integrated programs, specialist degree programs, doctoral and research programs, and off-campus programs. Its seven degree-granting colleges consist of 42 schools and departments. NIU is a member of the Association of Public and Land-Grant Universities and Universities Research Association. With a student-faculty ratio of 13:1, the university focuses on providing individual attention to its students for better performance. It offers over 300 student organizations, clubs, and community services, along with cultural resource centers and sports clubs, for a vibrant campus life. NIU also provides on-campus residential facilities in its six residence halls - Gilbert Hall, Grant Hall, Neptune Hall, Stevenson Tower, Northern View Community, and Residence Hall. These halls offer a variety of room types, such as single rooms, suite rooms, and double rooms, with mixed co-ed floors, public workstations, in-hall laundry, and Wi-Fi. The estimated cost of attendance for full-time undergraduate students ranges from USD 27,000 to USD 35,000.
Eligibility Overview:
Below are the guidelines for international students seeking to apply for undergraduate and graduate programs at Northern Illinois University:

1. Undergraduate Requirements:
- Applicants must have a high school diploma or certificate from an accredited institution.
- The high school curriculum should include:
  - Four years of English
  - Three years of Mathematics
  - Three years of Science
  - Three years of Social Studies
  - Two years of Art, Music, or a Foreign Language
- A minimum GPA of 3.0 is required for admission.
- Some programs may also require submission of SAT or ACT scores (with a minimum ACT score of 21).

2. English Language Proficiency:
- International undergraduate students must provide one of the following scores as proof of English proficiency:
  - TOEFL iBT score of 71 or higher
  - PBT score of 527 or higher
  - IELTS Academic score of 6.0 or higher
  - Grade C or above in IGCSE/GCSE or GCE O-level English
  - IB score of 4 or better in English (Standard Level)
  - A standard level ELS score of 11 or higher
  - DET score of 105 or higher in Duolingo.

3. Graduate Requirements:
- Applicants must have a four-year bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university.
- A minimum GPA of 2.75 on a scale of 4.0 is required for admission.
- Some programs may also require submission of GMAT or GRE scores.

4. English Language Proficiency:
- International graduate students must provide one of the following scores as proof of English proficiency:
  - TOEFL score of 80 or higher
  - IELTS Academic score of 6.5 or higher
  - PTE Academic score of 53 or higher
  - DET score of 105 or higher.

Name: Grantham University
Overview: Grantham University was founded in the year 1951 and is situated in Lenexa, USA. It is well-known for providing undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various fields and offering online degree courses for students interested in distance education. The university has a specialized team called the Career Planning Service, which assists students in creating a curriculum vitae and in securing jobs upon graduation, including part-time work, summer internships, and even full-time employment. The average cost of attendance may vary for both international and domestic students, depending on the chosen program. It is estimated that the average tuition and fees for an international student, excluding other expenses, amount to approximately $4,800. Grantham University also extends various opportunities to students, such as scholarships, work-study options, and different forms of financial assistance. Discover more about Grantham University through Leap Scholar and select the ideal course to fulfill your academic goals.
Eligibility Overview:
This is a collection of English proficiency and admission exams that are commonly required for international students who wish to study in the USA. These exams are used by universities to assess a student's readiness to study in an English-speaking environment and their academic abilities. Listed below are the different exams and their minimum scores needed to be considered for admission:

- For English proficiency, students can take the IELTS with a minimum score of 5.5 to 6.5, depending on the university. The TOEFL iBT requires a minimum score of 78 to 100, while the Cambridge English Language Assessments (CAE) requires a B2 to C1 level. The PTE has a minimum score range of 54 to 58, and the Duolingo test requires a score of 100 or above.
- For admission to specific programs, students may also need to take admission tests such as the GMAT (with a required score of 600 to 770+), GRE (with a score range of 270 to 310), SAT (with a minimum score of 900 to 1500+), ACT (with a range of 23 to 30), LSAT (with a score range of 150 to 170+), or MSAT (with a score range of 490 to 510+).

If you are an international student considering studying in the USA, it is vital to research the specific exams required by your desired university and aim to achieve the minimum scores needed for admission. These exams will not only demonstrate your language and academic abilities but also greatly increase your chances of getting accepted into your chosen program.

Accommodation:
The University of Arkansas Grantham adheres to the American with Disabilities Act, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, and state and municipal guidelines for students with disabilities. The university is committed to providing appropriate accommodations and services to eligible students with disabilities, aligning with federal and state regulations.

Grantham University will evaluate each accommodation and service request based on the following criteria: it must be founded on verified needs of the individual, it cannot compromise critical course or program requirements, it must be within the university's reasonable financial and administrative capability, and it must be feasible for the university to implement.

At Grantham, a qualified student is someone who can meet the crucial requirements of a program or course, with or without necessary adjustments. The university is willing to modify academic courses or programs to support individuals with disabilities, as long as it does not impact the primary objectives of the course or program. Additionally, the necessary accommodations must be manageable and fall under the university's control.

Name: NewSchool of Architecture and Design
Overview:
The NewSchool of Architecture and Design is a university located in San Diego, USA. It offers a diverse range of undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs as well as online degree programs for distance education students. With a strong focus on architecture, the university provides education in a variety of fields.

For international students, admission to the university requires a minimum of 6.0 in IELTS and 71 in TOEFL. Tuition fees may vary depending on the chosen course of study, however, the estimated average cost, excluding miscellaneous expenses, for an international student is approximately 19,34,737 INR.

NewSchool of Architecture and Design offers a range of financial aid options including scholarships, work-study programs, and other funding opportunities. Additionally, the university provides career planning services to assist students in building their resumes and finding jobs upon graduation, including part-time work, internships, and summer jobs. According to 6figr, the average employee at this university earns a salary of $91k annually.

For more information on NewSchool of Architecture and Design and to explore your options for education and career advancement, visit Leap Scholar today. Our platform offers detailed insights and resources to help you find the perfect program for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview:
The university requires international students to demonstrate proficiency in English as all coursework is taught in English. Upon admission, official documentation must be submitted to support this requirement. This can be achieved by obtaining a minimum score of 6 on the IELTS (with a minimum sub score of 5.5) or a score of 70 on the TOEFL iBT (with specific minimum sub scores for reading, listening, speaking, and writing). 
Additionally, international students must provide a certified financial statement showing proof that they have the necessary funds to cover tuition, fees, and living expenses for one academic year. This can be done by completing the Financial Verification Form provided by the Enrollment Department. 
International students must also provide translated transcripts from their previous educational institution, verified by either Spantran or a member of the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES) or the Association of International Credit Evaluators (AICE). 
Proof of health insurance and immunization records must also be provided prior to registration. 
Transfer students from a SEVIS-approved school in the United States must also complete a Transfer of Schools Form in addition to the above requirements. These measures are in place to ensure the academic success and well-being of our international students.
Placement:
NewSchool of Architecture and Design offers Career Services with the goal of helping students, recent graduates, and alumni to strategically plan, assess, and execute their job objectives while ensuring that they achieve their academic goals at the highest level. The department constantly provides job opportunities, both on and off campus, in the fields of design and architecture, in order to promote professionalism and growth throughout the development of a design thinker during their academic years. During the 2018-19 academic year, 92% of the graduating class successfully secured employment in their specific field of study or a related area within six months of graduation.
If you are a NewSchool graduate seeking placement opportunities, our Career Services department is committed to helping you find the best fit for your skills and experience. Our extensive network of design and architecture job openings ensures that you have access to a diverse range of opportunities that align with your goals. With our assistance, you can kickstart your career in your chosen field and join the 92% of our graduates who have successfully entered the workforce within six months of graduating. To learn more about our placement services, please visit the link provided.

Name: Columbus State University
Overview: Columbus State University, located in Columbus, Georgia, is a reputable public institution founded in 1958 and accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission (SACSCOC). The university offers a variety of over 75 high-quality undergraduate and graduate degree programs, including online options. With a total of approximately 100 courses available, students can choose from a diverse range of disciplines, such as business, education, humanities, computer science, and more. Columbus State University has four distinguished undergraduate colleges, namely the College of the Arts, Education and Health Professions, Letters and Sciences, and D. Abbott Turner College of Business. These colleges offer programs at the bachelor's, master's, and doctoral levels in fields such as education, arts, business administration, music, public administration, public health, public safety administration, science, organizational leadership, and nursing. In terms of tuition, the average cost of attendance at Columbus State University is approximately $30,848 per year, while the estimated living expenses amount to $15,360. The university also offers financial aid to its students in the form of scholarships, grants, and loans. At Columbus State University, students are given numerous opportunities to gain practical experience through internships, clinical experiences, cooperative education, and field research. The Center for Career Development provides valuable services in terms of professional and employment guidance, including job shadowing, internship and externship placements, preparation for career fairs, resume and interview assistance, and career counseling.

Name: Plymouth State University
Overview:
Plymouth State University is a prestigious university located in the quaint town of Plymouth, nestled in the beautiful state of New Hampshire, USA. Founded in 1871, this esteemed institution offers an array of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various fields of study, as well as distance education courses for online learners. Whether you are a local or international student, Plymouth State University caters to all, with its diverse and inclusive community.

The university is primarily based in the picturesque town of Plymouth, which not only provides an ideal environment for learning but also offers numerous opportunities for recreational activities. The cost of attending Plymouth State University may vary for different programs and students. However, on average, the tuition and fees for international students are approximately 23,34,263 INR, excluding additional expenses. 

At Plymouth State University, students have access to various financial aid options, including scholarships, work-study programs, and other funding opportunities. Most of these scholarships are merit-based and can range up to $10,000, depending on the academic achievements of the students.

According to payscale, Plymouth State University graduates have an average starting salary of 63,517 USD, which is proof of the excellent education and career opportunities provided by the university. The Career Planning Service team at the university assists students in building their profiles, finding suitable job prospects, internships, and summer jobs, enabling them to jumpstart their careers after graduation. 

Discover more about Plymouth State University on Leap Scholar and find the perfect course to fulfill your educational and career goals. Whether you aim to pursue a degree in business or any other field, Plymouth State University is your ultimate destination for academic excellence and success.
Eligibility Overview:
Potential students who attain specific levels of proficiency in the English language will be granted admission to their chosen academic program. These proficiency levels include achieving a minimum TOEFL score of 530 on the paper-based test or 71 on the online version, a minimum IELTS score of 6.0 with no individual band score below 6.0, or a minimum PTE score of 52. Alternatively, a Duolingo English Test score of at least 95 may also be accepted.

In order to secure admission, students must also provide certified translations of their high school and/or college transcripts in English. They must also submit a Notarized International Financial Certification Form along with copies of bank statements or other verification that demonstrates their ability to cover the expenses of attending the university. Additionally, a certified copy of their passport and visa must be provided.

Please note that the university requires all applicants to demonstrate proficiency in the English language in order to ensure their success in their academic program. Therefore, it is essential that potential students fulfill these language requirements before applying.

Name: Eastern Michigan University
Overview:
Eastern Michigan University, EMU for short, is a renowned public university located in Ypsilanti, Michigan. It was established in 1849 and currently offers over 200 majors and minors in 5 colleges, as well as 42 study abroad programs each year. EMU's diverse range of majors includes popular fields such as Business, Health Professions, Psychology, Marketing, Social Sciences, Management, and Education. The university's vast campus spans over 800 acres, housing 122 buildings. Its schools and colleges consist of the College of Arts & Sciences, College of Education, College of Business, College of Engineering & Technology, College of Health & Human Services, Graduate School, and Honors College.

Conveniently located near Ann Arbor and only a short 45-minute drive from Chicago, EMU is highly recognized for its nationally acclaimed programs such as the Master's in Clinical Research, MBA in International Business, Teacher Education Program, and Animation & Gaming Program. With an average in-state cost of attendance of USD 13,698 per year for undergraduate students (excluding additional expenses), EMU boasts a student-faculty ratio of 14:1. The university's main focus is on practical skill development rather than theoretical learning, which is reflected in its state-of-the-art smart classrooms, computer and IT labs, and well-stocked libraries.

EMU is dedicated to providing students with a wealth of career opportunities, including industrial workshops, State of Michigan Internship Programs, remote internships, and full-time and part-time job options. The university also offers a wide range of online programs, in addition to its graduate and degree programs. Students can also take advantage of short-term summer courses in various subjects such as Abnormal Psychology, Financial Markets & Institutions, Accounting Principles, and Adult Health Nursing.

For students looking to reside on campus, EMU offers plenty of housing options and 18 on-campus dining locations, as well as meal-plan facilities. The university's experienced faculty is committed to helping students discover their true potential and find their ideal careers through personalized guidance and support.
Eligibility Overview:
The following are the minimum required test scores for full admission at this university: 
- TOEFL: Minimum score of 79 on IBT (TOEFL Home Edition is also accepted)
- TOEFL Essentials: Minimum score of 9 
- IELTS: Minimum score of 6.5 (IELTS Indicator is also accepted)
- Pearson English Language Test (PTE): Minimum score of 53 
- Michigan English Test (MET): Minimum score of 57 
- Duolingo: Minimum score of 105 
We are looking for candidates who have met these minimum scores in order to be considered for full admission. Meeting these requirements demonstrates proficiency in the English language and ensures academic success at our university. These scores play a vital role in our admission decisions and we encourage applicants to aim for these minimum scores to increase their chances of acceptance.

Name: Louisiana State University
Overview:
Louisiana State University is a public land-grant research institution located in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. The school was founded in 1853 and established as the flagship university of the Louisiana State University System. It is dedicated to providing a comprehensive and high-quality education and offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctorate degree programs. The university boasts highly ranked programs in Theatre, Engineering, Business, Law, Architecture, Fine Arts, Library and Entrepreneurship. Admissions to these programs are competitive, but with the help of numerous scholarships available at the college, it is possible to bring down the average annual tuition and accommodation fee from $33,000 to $15,000. The university's emphasis on academic excellence has produced a strong network of notable alumni who hold prominent positions in various industries. As a result, graduating students can look forward to promising placement opportunities and attractive salaries.

Through its commitment to providing top-quality education and nurturing leaders of tomorrow, Louisiana State University continues to fulfill its mission of creating a brighter and better future for its students and the community.

Name: The University of Findlay
Overview: UF is a distinguished Christian institution located in Findlay, Ohio that offers flexible course options including part-time, full-time and online courses. There are a total of 86 Undergraduate degrees, 11 Master's degrees, and 5 Doctoral degrees offered at UF through its various schools such as College of Education, College of Business, College of Health Professions, Humanities, and Social Sciences, College of Arts, College of Pharmacy and College of Sciences. International applicants are required to have a minimum of 6.0 in IELTS or 61 in TOEFL to be eligible for admission. Among the most popular programs at UF are the MBA, BS in Computer Science, and BS in Chemistry with tuition fees ranging from 21,289 USD to 32,343 USD. For a full-time course load (12-18 credit hours), the tuition cost would be approximately 35,174 USD, and other student fees and general service fees would amount to 1,310 USD. Merit-based scholarships from 8,000 to 15,000 USD per year are offered to incoming first-year undergraduate students based on their academic performance. High-paying jobs are often secured by graduates from Business Administration and Management (salary 43,000 USD), Pharmacy (salary 121,200 USD), and Animal Sciences (salary 30,300 USD) programs.
Eligibility Overview:
The admission process for The University of Findlay's undergraduate program includes a combination of high school grades, class rank, standardized test scores, letters of recommendation, and an interview with a university representative. Due to COVID-19 closures, students are unable to take the ACT or SAT, so alternative criteria will be used.

For those who cannot take the ACT or SAT, the minimum requirements include a 2.5 cumulative grade point average, a minimum composite score of 20 on the ACT, or a minimum composite score of 950 on the SAT. In place of standardized test scores, students can provide a letter of recommendation from a professor, a sample of their graded academic work, and conduct an interview with a university representative.

International students are required to have a minimum score of 61 on the TOEFL (iBT), 6.0 on the IELTS, 50 on the Pearson Test of English (academic), or 3.5 on the International Test of English Proficiency (iTEP) for admission. However, exceptions can be made for international students who have completed their secondary and/or post-secondary education in English. These students can enter the university's Intensive English Program (IELP) prior to beginning their academic studies, thus waiving the TOEFL, IELTS, Pearson Test of English (academic), or iTEP requirements.

These on-campus accommodations are available in various formats, including residential halls, apartments, and Greek housing. Students can avail of these facilities for approximately USD 4,800 per semester, which includes the cost of meals. Moreover, the Office of Accommodation and Inclusion caters to the needs of students with permanent or temporary disabilities or impairments. For more details regarding this, please visit https://www.findlay.edu/offices/student-affairs/accommodation-and-inclusion/.

Name: University of Arkansas
Overview: With a founding date of 1871, the esteemed University of Arkansas reigns as one of the top-ranked institutions in the United States. Located in Fayetteville, Arkansas, this university boasts a student body of over 27,500 individuals, hailing from diverse academic backgrounds such as business, communication, agriculture, architecture, creative writing, and law. Notable alumni from the University of Arkansas include John Boozman, Joe Johnson, and Ricardo Martinelli. A testament to its remarkable academic programs and the quality of education it imparts, the University of Arkansas is also renowned for its excellent placement opportunities.

Name: University of Central Missouri
Overview:
The University of Central Missouri, located in Warrensburg, USA, is a reputable higher education institution that offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs to both domestic and international students. The university also offers online degree programs to cater to the needs of distance education students. With a variety of academic disciplines available, students can choose to study fields like Computer Engineering to prepare for their career paths. The cost of attendance may vary for different courses, taking into account the different levels of study and fee structures for international and domestic students.

At the University of Central Missouri, students can leverage a range of financial assistance options, including scholarships, work-study programs, and funding opportunities, to support their education. The university also takes pride in its Career Planning Service team, providing students with professional guidance and resources to help them succeed in the job market. The team assists with CV building, job searching, part-time or summer jobs, and internships, ensuring that students are well-equipped for their future endeavors after graduation.
Eligibility Overview:
To be considered for the courses of your choice, you should meet the academic requirements outlined below. These eligibility criteria are mandatory and your application will only be accepted if you fulfill them: 

For undergraduate students: Candidates must have a minimum high school Grade Point Average (GPA) of 2.0 to be considered.

For postgraduate students: Candidates must have completed a bachelor's degree from a 4-year educational institution that is recognized by the United States. Alternatively, the degree must be equivalent to a 4-year academic program from an institution that is recognized by the United States. This determination will be based on an evaluation of your transcripts. Furthermore, applicants must have a minimum GPA of 3.0. 

English language proficiency requirements are also an essential part of the admissions process. Candidates must submit evidence of the below-listed requirements:

- Academic requirements
    - High school GPA of 2.0 or above for undergraduate students
    - Bachelor's degree from a regionally recognized 4-year institution, with a minimum GPA of 3.0 for postgraduate students
- English language proficiency requirements
    - Acceptable proof of English language proficiency

Placement:
The professional outcomes of The University of Missouri draw in applicants from all over the United States and the world. The institution's motto, "Education for Service," is reflected in its multi-disciplinary education that prepares students for successful careers in the business world. Graduates of this program have opportunities to secure lucrative professions with respectable salaries, while also leveraging their education for the benefit of the business community. Many continue their studies at the graduate level, while others secure employment in government organizations, the US military, and various enterprises across the country. Additionally, numerous students are offered job opportunities by corporations in other countries. 

One aspect that sets The University of Missouri apart is its dedicated Career Services Center, which assists students and alumni in finding impactful internships and job opportunities. Through this accessible facility, students can enhance their job-search skills and cultivate relationships within their desired industries. The center offers a variety of resources including pre-booked appointments, resume help days, face-to-face and virtual job fairs, interviews, and hall tables to connect with potential employers. 

The Career Services Center also offers personalized counseling sessions where students can receive guidance on career options, explore internship opportunities, and receive assistance with documents such as applications and cover letters. Additionally, students can enroll in the one-hour credit "Career Readiness Course" which provides training on how to effectively navigate the job market and interact with potential employers. Upon completion, students receive a certificate of career preparedness from the UCM Career Services Center. 

The institution has a successful history of producing employable graduates, with companies such as Dell, Infosys Limited, Tesla Motors, Tata Consultancy Services, the United States Army Cyber Corps, Delta Airlines, Deloitte & Touche LLP, Commerce Bank, and Amazon recruiting from The University of Missouri.
Accommodation: UCM offers housing options for students, including five on-campus apartment complexes (Todd, Foster-Knox, and Nickerson) and two near-campus options (Greenwood Park and Central Village). These apartments are fully furnished, however, students will need to provide their own furniture if they choose to live off-campus. Housing fees are charged to the student's account at the beginning of each semester, and it is recommended to reserve your desired housing as early as possible to secure your top choices. A deposit is required for on-campus housing and varies depending on the apartment chosen. This deposit is partially refundable at the end of the housing contract. It is important to note that students will not be able to move into UCM housing until all necessary paperwork has been completed. International students have three options for housing at UCM: Student Apartments, Residence Halls, and off-campus lodging. For more information on housing options, including fees and application processes, please visit the Graduate and International Student Services website.

This marks a slight decline from its previous ranking of 380 in 2020 and 405 in 2019. The ranking process takes into account various factors including, but not limited to student selection (25%), opinions of business school leaders (25%), and employment outcomes (21%). This data pertains specifically to the University of Central Missouri (UCM) and its undergraduate business program.

Name: Victory Institute
Overview: The inception of the Victory Institute dates back to 1993, when pioneering LGBTQ activists and generous philanthropists identified the dire need to equip and educate aspiring LGBTQ candidates for government positions across the country. In an era when there were only about 50 openly LGBTQ officials at all levels of government in the United States, our founders aptly recognized the consequential role of boosting our numbers in public service for the advancement of equality. The establishment of Victory Institute furthered their vision of grooming and supporting LGBTQ leaders running for office. Along with coaching future candidates and campaign personnel, the organization launched the Presidential Appointments Project, which paved the way for Roberta Achtenberg's historic appointment as the first openly LGBTQ individual in a Senate-confirmed position as Assistant Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. The Foundation's efforts also extend to the academia, catering to a diverse group of students and empowering them in their pursuit of government careers.
Eligibility Overview: The Victory Congressional Internship opens its doors to undergraduates from all backgrounds, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ability, ethnicity, or political affiliation. We strongly encourage women, people of color, transgender individuals, persons with disabilities, and those from low-income families to apply. Eligibility for this opportunity requires the applicant to be a member of the LGBTQ+ community, a U.S. citizen, legal permanent resident, or work permit holder (F-1 visa holders are not eligible). All applicants must be 18 years old by the time they arrive in Washington, D.C. and have completed at least one year of an undergraduate degree program. Full-time enrollment is required, with a minimum of one full semester remaining after the program ends for summer participants. Participants in the spring and fall programs must not graduate before the program concludes. The Victory Congressional Internship welcomes applicants from all fields, as long as they have demonstrated involvement in community service or public projects. Please note, individuals who identify as "allies" of the LGBTQ+ community are not eligible for this program.
Placement: The renowned Victory Institute has introduced an extraordinary educational opportunity, known as the Victory Congressional Internship, to educate and empower the next generation of LGBTQ public leaders. This programme aims to bring highly talented LGBTQ students to Washington, DC for an intensive leadership training programme that includes a rigorous eight- or ten-week Congressional internship. The interns will have the privilege to work with members of the LGBTQ+ Equality Caucus or LGBTQ-friendly Congress members to gain valuable insights into the federal legislative process. Apart from this hands-on experience, the interns will also participate in an educational and leadership development programme that will provide them with in-depth knowledge about policymaking careers and allow them to interact with experts from diverse industries in the District of Columbia. Moreover, the interns will be granted the opportunity to attend the biennial International LGBTQ Leaders Conference, where they will engage with prominent openly LGBTQ leaders in government, politics, activism, business, and community organizations for three whole days. This transformative internship is designed to equip young LGBTQ individuals with the necessary skills, expertise, and network to become influential decision-makers and create a positive impact in their communities and beyond.
Accommodation: The university does not offer any housing options for its students, whether on or off-campus. This means that it is up to the students to find their own accommodations, which can be challenging for those unfamiliar with the area. However, there are plenty of available housing options in the surrounding area for students to choose from.

Name: University of Wisconsin - Superior
Overview: The University of Wisconsin - Superior (UWS) is a public institution located in Superior/Duluth, Wisconsin, with a founding date of 1893. It boasts a diverse student body of 2,559 undergraduates and 364 graduates, who can choose from a wide range of programs such as Business, Elementary Education, Liberal Arts and Humanities, offered both on-campus and online. The university operates on a semester-based academic calendar and prides itself on maintaining a low student-to-faculty ratio of 17:1, ensuring personalized attention for all students. UW-Superior has a competitive acceptance rate of 77% and offers bachelor's, master's, specialist degrees, as well as grants and certificate programs to its students. The institute is home to four regional research centers and the Small Business Development Center, which mentor and guide aspiring entrepreneurs. UW-Superior has achieved global recognition by securing prestigious titles. Aside from academic support, the university provides various student services and resources, including financial aid, career services, counseling sessions, veteran services, and a well-stocked library to support students in their academic and personal growth.

Eligibility Overview: The guidelines for admission to Northeast Ohio Medical University include meeting specific eligibility criteria. These criteria encompass a student's Overall Grade Point Average (GPA), College Biology, Chemistry, Physics and Math Grade Point Average (GPA), Medical College Admission Test (MCAT) score, and English language proficiency. The required GPAs range from 3.51 to 3.86 for the overall GPA, and 3.40 to 3.82 for the college GPA in the specified subjects. An MCAT score between 505 to 515 is also required for consideration. In terms of English language proficiency, students must achieve at least 60% in English 30-1 or 65% in English 30-2 (or its provincial equivalent) to be eligible for admission. Additionally, a minimum of 60% in three other Grade 12 courses is also necessary. These criteria are essential for admission to Northeast Ohio Medical University and must be met by aspiring students.

Name: Sonoma State University
Overview:
Sonoma County's public institution, Sonoma State University, was established in 1961 and has a high acceptance rate of 91%. The university sits on a sprawling 269-acre campus in the city of Rohnert Park. It boasts a comprehensive University Library that houses an impressive collection of 670,000 volumes, 35,000 periodicals, and 160 databases, as well as state-of-the-art study spaces and computer facilities. Its academic offerings include a diverse range of undergraduate and post-baccalaureate programs, including popular options like Audio and Recording Production, Business Administration, and Compassion Cultivation Training. Other notable courses include Anthropology, Counselling, Global Studies, Spanish, and Women's and Gender Studies.

The university also has a School of Extended and International Education, catering to the needs of international students. This department offers a variety of academic and professional development programs, summer and winter sessions, and international study opportunities. Housing options on campus include six residential villages, such as Verdot Village, Tuscany Village, and Beaujolais Village, offering single, double, and triple occupancy rooms. Off-campus housing options include various privately rented apartments, houses, and shared living spaces.

With over 120 student clubs and organizations, including the French Club, K-Pop Club, Hillel, and the Feminist Coalition, Sonoma State University provides students with numerous opportunities to engage in academic, professional, cultural, spiritual, and political activities. Upon graduation, alumni of Sonoma State University earn an average salary of $41,000.

For the estimated tuition fee, undergraduate students can expect to pay between $2,788 and $3,994 per semester, while post-baccalaureate students can expect to pay between $3,205 and $4,711 per semester. The university offers various financial aid options, including scholarships, loans, grants, and student employment opportunities. Some of these include the Federal Pell Grant, Federal PLUS Loans, Federal Work-Study, Athletic Talent Awards, and the University Scholarship Program.
Eligibility Overview:
The required documentation for applicants to Sonoma State University includes all relevant government documentation. Along with the application, all academic records (transcripts) must be evaluated by a third party. Official transcripts must also be immediately sent to Sonoma State University. For assistance with third party evaluation services, please refer to the How to Submit Transcripts to Sonoma State page and the Foreign Coursework Evaluations section. Instructions on submitting both official and unofficial documentation can be found on the admissions webpage.

English language proficiency is a necessary requirement for all international student applicants to Sonoma State University. This is in addition to meeting the general admissions standards. International applicants must demonstrate their English competency by meeting one of the following criteria: studying for at least three years full-time at a secondary or post-secondary institution where English is the primary language of instruction or holding an education background from a country that qualifies for an English waiver (listed below). Another option is to submit an official verification of English ability through an exam. Lastly, completing GE Area A2 (Written Communication) with a grade of C- or higher at a US university is also acceptable.

Name: Florida National University
Overview:
The Florida National University is an esteemed higher education institution situated in the vibrant city of Hialeah, USA. The university offers a wide array of interdisciplinary undergraduate and graduate degree programs as well as online courses to cater to the diverse needs of its diverse student population. The cost of attendance for both local and international students may vary depending on their chosen course of study. On average, the tuition and fees for an international student, excluding other miscellaneous expenses, is expected to be around 1.3 million rupees.

At Florida National University, students are given access to scholarships, work-study programs, and other forms of financial assistance to help them achieve their academic goals. The university also boasts a dedicated Career Planning Service team that offers students support in creating an impressive CV and securing employment opportunities upon graduation. Whether it's a full-time position, part-time job, summer employment, or internship, the university's career services team will guide students to the right path for their future career. For more information about Florida National University and the range of programs it offers, please visit Leap Scholar.
Eligibility Overview:
At Florida National University, all qualified applicants are welcomed regardless of their ethnicity, gender, religion, national origin, age, or physical disability. This is because the university has an open-door admissions policy, which ensures equal opportunity for all aspiring students. Furthermore, the university offers enrolment at any time, making it convenient for students to begin their academic journey.

According to the university's admission guidelines, any student who has attained a high school diploma or a GED certificate can attend the university. This means that the policy of open admission is all about granting access and opportunity to those who are keen on pursuing a college degree. Unlike other universities, Florida National University does not require SAT or ACT test scores for admissions. Nevertheless, prospective students must take a diagnostic test to assess their academic abilities. This test will determine if they need to complete remedial or developmental courses before enrolling in college-level courses.

It is essential to note that while the university's open admission policy ensures equal opportunities for all students, it does not imply that entrance to specific programs is unrestricted. Students must meet specific prerequisites and co-requisites to be eligible for certain programs. To do so, new students must provide relevant transcripts and undertake placement tests to determine their academic standing. Once they meet the entry requirements for a particular program, they can be enrolled in it, provided they make satisfactory progress and maintain continuous enrollment as required by their curriculum.

Name: Valparaiso University
Overview: Valparaiso University was founded back in 1859 in Valparaiso, Indiana, making it one of the earliest co-educational universities in the US. Originally named Valparaiso Male and Female College, its operations were temporarily halted during the Civil War. The institution was reopened in 1871 with a new name, Valparaiso University. Its sprawling campus spans 350 acres and is home to over 60 academic and residential buildings. Located in a scenic suburban area, the university is conveniently located an hour away from Chicago. Valparaiso University attracts over 4000 students annually, including a significant number of international students. The university offers both part-time and full-time courses. It has state-of-the-art research labs, computer labs, a well-stocked library, an indoor track, a swimming pool, and a gym. Valparaiso University provides a variety of undergraduate and graduate programs, covering subjects such as Physical Education, Engineering, Sports Media, Accounting, Business, Greek and Roman Studies, and Data Science. On-campus housing options are available for students, with several apartment complexes providing furnished and sanitary rooms. The housing facility can accommodate up to 2000 students. The average tuition fee at Valparaiso University is approximately 40, 500 USD per year. Additionally, students should budget for miscellaneous expenses such as books and other facilities, which brings the total annual cost of living to approximately 59, 000 USD. The university also offers various scholarships and grants to students. Valparaiso University assists students in finding suitable off-campus accommodations as well. Therefore, the average cost of living for a student at Valparaiso University is around 50, 000 USD per year.
Eligibility Overview:
The following statistics pertain to a university's student eligibility requirements, with a focus on international and Indian students seeking graduate studies:

International Students' Eligibility Requirements:
In order for international students to pursue graduate studies at Valparaiso University, they must meet certain criteria, the most important being a valid English Language Requirement score. This can be obtained through a variety of tests, including but not limited to the ACT, SAT, IELTS, TOEFL, IGCSE A and O Levels, iTEP, and the International Baccalaureate (IB). It should be noted that due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, online testing options, such as the Duolingo Test, are now being accepted. Additionally, students who are permanent residents of either Australia or the United Kingdom are exempt from providing English test scores.

Points to Consider for PG Students:
Prospective students interested in pursuing a postgraduate degree at Valparaiso University must fulfill certain prerequisites. One such requirement is the possession of a valid undergraduate degree from an accredited institution or college. Furthermore, a minimum GPA of 3.0 (equivalent to a B-average) in both undergraduate and graduate studies is necessary to be considered for admission. 

Eligibility Criteria for Indian Students:
In order to be eligible for enrollment in any undergraduate or postgraduate program, Indian applicants must also clear an English proficiency test. Some options include the ACT, SAT, IELTS, TOEFL, IGCSE A and O Levels, iTEP, and the International Baccalaureate (IB). In addition, two letters of recommendation from professionals in their field must be submitted electronically.
Placement: Upon completion of their studies, Valparaiso University proudly reports an impressive 97% employment rate for its graduates. The university's career center offers abundant opportunities for students and alumni to secure internships and jobs throughout the United States upon graduation. Graduates from Valparaiso University work across a diverse range of industries including healthcare, management, manufacturing, accounting, engineering, and marketing. Opportunities for internships have been particularly prevalent at prestigious organizations such as NASA, Adidas, Caterpillar, and Paramount Studios, providing invaluable hands-on experience for university students.
Accommodation: On-campus housing is available for international students attending Valparaiso University. The university offers a variety of options for students to live in, with the majority of undergraduate students residing in one of the nine university residence halls or apartment buildings. In addition, there are six fraternity homes that students may choose to live in.
Course Ranking:
The ranking for the University's UG Business program for 2021, as published by US News & World Report, is at position 201. The program's previous rankings were at 195 for 2020 and 179 for 2019. US News & World Report follows a comprehensive approach to rate subjects, considering factors like student selection (25%), feedback from business school administrators (25%), and employment outcomes (21%).

 The University has been evaluated and placed at 201 by US News & World Report for its UG Business program in 2021. In the past, the program ranked at 195 in 2020 and 179 in 2019. US News & World Report's ranking methodology comprises various aspects such as student selection (25%), input from business school authorities (25%), and post-graduation employment results (21%).
University Ranking: The university has consecutively achieved a 1001+ position in the University Ranking of THE (Times Higher Education) for the past two years. The criteria used in THE's ranking methodology place equal weight (30% each) on Teaching, Research, and Citations. Moreover, the university has also secured a place in the list of Global Universities by US News & World Report, currently ranked 1108th in 2020. The university also appears in US News & World Report's rankings for the best national universities and top regional universities in the Midwest, ranking 160th (2021) and fifth (2018), respectively. US News & World Report considers several factors for their rankings, including the number of cited publications, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each).

Overview:
The University of Texas at EL Paso, situated in El Paso, USA, is a highly reputable institution. It offers a wide range of programs including undergraduate, graduate, and certificate programs, as well as online courses for distance learning students. The university provides education in multiple fields of study, with Business being one of its notable streams. Located in El Paso, the main campus of the university offers an ideal learning environment for students.

Students interested in enrolling in graduate programs at the university need to meet certain eligibility criteria, including a minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS or 79 on the TOEFL exam. The cost of attendance may vary depending on the course chosen and whether the student is an international or domestic candidate. However, the university offers scholarships, work-study programs, and other funding options to help students ease their financial burden. Eligibility Overview:
To be considered for admission into the Alternative Certification Program (ACP) at this prestigious institution, candidates who have not been enrolled in a Texas accredited Educator Preparation Program (EPP) must fulfill the following conditions: 
1. Obtained a Bachelor's degree from an institution accredited by a recognized regional body 
2. Achieved a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.75 or 2.75 GPA in the previous 60 semester credit hours
3. Passed the Pre-admission Content Test (PACT) for their desired certification area. The detailed registration process for PACT can be found here.
4. International students must submit their scores for the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) available through https://www.ets.org/toefl/test-takers/ibt/take/. As per the TEA, the minimum passing scores are 24 for speaking, 22 for listening, 22 for reading, and 21 for writing.
5. Attend a scheduled interview with renowned faculty and leaders from the College of Education, who will evaluate the candidate's potential for the ACP. 
For more comprehensive details, kindly visit: https://www.utep.edu/education/css/programs/alternative-certification/admission-requirements.html

Name: University of Massachusetts Boston (UMass Boston)
Overview: UMass Boston is a public university located in Boston, Massachusetts. It was established in 1964 and is the second university in the UMass system. Originally known as Boston State College, it was incorporated into UMass Boston in 1982, merging duplicate programs. This institution offers a diverse range of 207 undergraduate, graduate, and certificate programs across 8 schools and colleges. With over 50 interdisciplinary research centers, UMass Boston is at the forefront of academic, public service, and research excellence. In 2020, UMass Boston saw approximately 4000 graduates, while its current student enrollment for fall 2020 stands at 16,259. The university is renowned for its expertise in health, biomedical and life sciences, sustainability, and inclusion. It has partnerships with leading organizations such as Dana-Farber/Harvard Cancer Centre, Sanofi and Genzyme, IBM, Boston Public Schools, and New England Aquarium. With a diverse student community representing 136 countries, UMass Boston is truly a global institution. The university has consistently ranked among the top universities in the world, currently holding the rank of 651-700 as per QS World University Rankings 2022. It also has a research output categorized as ‘Very High’. In 2019, UMass Boston received $62 million in research funding for natural and social sciences. Its graduate programs in education, nursing, clinical psychology, and public affairs have been recognized as among the top 100 programs by U.S. News and Report's 2022 Graduate School list. The university's Ph.D. program in Gerontology has had the highest number of graduates in the world. In 2019, Forbes ranked UMass Boston at No.247 in the 4th Annual Ranking of 300 Best Value Colleges, further solidifying its reputation as a globally recognized university.
Eligibility Overview:
Uxbridge University Admissions Criteria

International students must demonstrate proficiency in English to be considered for admission. There are several exams that can be taken to demonstrate this proficiency:

1. The TOEFL is a recognized test that assesses English language abilities. A score of 79 or above is required.
2. Similar to the TOEFL, the IELTS is another test that measures English communication skills. A score of 6.0 or higher is needed.
3. The SAT exam includes a component specifically for reading and writing in English. A minimum score of 480 is required on this part.
4. TAKE ACTION is another assessment that measures proficiency in reading and English. The scores from these sections need to total 34 or higher.
5. Duolingo offers an English Test that requires a score of 100 or above.
6. Official test scores must be sent directly to Uxbridge University from the testing agency. This can be requested at the time of registration or by contacting the College Board, ACT, TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo if the test has already been taken.
7. The SAT/TOEFL and IELTS code for Uxbridge University is 3924 and the ACT code is 1925.

Eligibility Overview:
The admissions process at Colorado Technical University offers access to more than 35 undergraduate degrees onsite and online in subjects such as accounting, business administration, computer science, healthcare management, and information technology.

To apply, students must meet the following requirements: provide official translations of high school transcripts and proof of high school diploma, take a standardized English proficiency test (optional), provide proof of financial support, complete an interview with the admissions counselor, and submit an essay detailing their goals and objectives.

For those interested in graduate degrees, Colorado Technical University offers over 44 master's programs in various fields. To be eligible, applicants must hold a baccalaureate degree from a recognized US university with a minimum CGPA of 2.0 (equivalent to 75%) on a scale of 4.0. Interested students can apply online through the university's graduate application page.

The requirements for admission to graduate programs include providing official transcripts from an accredited university, demonstrating proficiency in English, showing proof of financial support, submitting an essay, and participating in an interview with a representative from the university. Optional letters of recommendation can also be included in the application process.

Name: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
Overview:
The University of North Carolina at Charlotte is an esteemed public research institute situated in North Carolina, US. It was originally founded in 1946 as the Charlotte Centre of the University of North Carolina and eventually grew into a full-fledged university after its merger with the Consolidated University of North Carolina in 1965. From then on, it has established itself as a top academic institution renowned for its active research initiatives. With nine colleges offering 79 undergraduate, 66 graduate, and 24 doctoral programs covering a diverse range of fields, UNC Charlotte is committed to providing an excellent education to its students. Its in-demand courses include the MS in Mechanical Engineering, MS in Electrical Engineering, and Bachelors in Business Administration (BBA).

The campus of UNC Charlotte spans over 1000 acres and boasts of several academic buildings, classrooms, and administrative offices. To support student learning, the campus is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities such as the J. Murrey Atkins Library, advanced laboratories, and spacious lecture theatres. Additionally, the university also has a Center City Campus located in Uptown Charlotte, offering a variety of programs, including its highly ranked MBA program.

At UNC Charlotte, students can engage in a vibrant social life through participation in various student organizations, fraternities, and sororities. Furthermore, the university has a robust alumni network, which provides valuable support and networking opportunities to current students in their future endeavors. Charlotte being the official sports team of the university, represents UNC Charlotte in various college sports tournaments.

With varied program structures, the tuition fees for each course at UNC Charlotte may differ depending on their duration and type. On average, it costs around USD 25,000 per year to attend this prestigious university.
Eligibility Overview: In order to gain admission to UNC Charlotte, it is necessary to fulfill specific academic requirements in high school, including completing particular courses and achieving a competitive cumulative GPA in these courses. Name: The Ohio State University
Overview: Ohio State University is a well-regarded public research institution located in Columbus, Ohio. This renowned university was established in 1870 as the Ohio Agricultural and Mechanical College, and has since become the flagship of the University System of Ohio. It is highly recognized for its exceptional faculty and top-tier academic programs, with a strong emphasis on research. The campus is comprised of 18 distinguished schools and colleges offering a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degrees across various disciplines. Some of the most popular and highly-regarded programs at Ohio State University include the MS in Welding Engineering, Doctor of Philosophy in Political Science, and Masters of Business Administration (MBA). As a leading university, Ohio State has produced an impressive number of Fulbright Scholars, as well as notable alumni who have gone on to achieve great success in diverse fields such as Nobel laureates, Rhodes scholars, Pulitzer Prize winners, and Olympic medallists.
Eligibility Overview:
The success of your admission at Ohio State is largely dependent on your proficiency in communication, writing, and comprehension of English. As a result, applicants are required to submit official TOEFL or IELTS Academic scores to the university if they fall under any of the following categories: non-native English speakers, those who received their education primarily outside of the United States, or individuals who have held permanent resident, asylee, or refugee status in the US for less than a year prior to their intended start date.

These score results must come directly from the testing agency (ETS or IELTS) and be received by the application deadline to be considered authentic. However, it is important to note that many graduate programs may require a higher score than the minimum requirements listed below.

Minimum Scores:
Note: Please be advised that some programs may have higher score requirements.

TOEFL: 
Paper-based test: Minimum score of 19 on each section 
Internet-based test or TOEFL iBT Home Edition: Minimum score of 79

IELTS: 
Minimum overall score of 7.0 on the IELTS Academic test or IELTS Indicator 
Minimum score of 6.5 for Moritz College of Law applicants

Duolingo: 
Minimum score of 105 or higher on the Duolingo test

Note: Admitted students who receive an exemption from the English placement exam or the Oral Proficiency Assessment for Graduate Teaching Associates cannot use their Duolingo test score for exemption purposes.

We strive to match you with the most suitable candidate possible for your living arrangements. First-year and upperclass students are given the opportunity to share campus housing. All unmarried, full-time students who have graduated high school within the past two years are required to live on campus, unless they have been excused, there is no more space available, or they are residing with relatives. Here are a few of the perks of living on campus: classes are situated in a convenient location, each floor is supervised by a resident advisor who can assist with the transition to college life and having roommates, every housing complex is managed by a full-time professional staff, and it allows for meaningful friendships to be formed and unforgettable experiences to be created. Additionally, being on campus makes it easier to participate in student life and all it has to offer.
