Name: Washburn University
Overview: Washburn University, situated in Topeka, USA, is well-known for offering a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs, including online degree courses for distance education students. The university offers an impressive selection of programs, with over 100 undergraduate courses and three postgraduate programs to choose from. International and domestic students may have different tuition and fees to bear, depending on their selected courses. For an international student, the estimated average cost of attendance, excluding various expenses, is approximately INR 2277851. Students at Washburn University can apply for scholarships, work-study opportunities, and other forms of funding to better support their education expenses. Additionally, the university has a dedicated Career Planning Service team to help students create an attractive resume and find suitable job opportunities upon graduation, be it a full-time, part-time, or internship position. For further details on the course offerings, tuition, and other essential information, visit Leap Scholar to find the perfect program that aligns with your career goals.
Eligibility Overview:
Washburn University offers admission to undergraduate students just a week before the enrollment deadline. Therefore, applicants are advised to apply as early as possible. The university requires submission of valid SAT or ACT scores, except for candidates above 21 years of age who are exempted from submitting ACT scores. Homeschool students are also welcome to apply, and the admission criteria are the same as that for regular applicants.

Admission Requirements for Undergraduate Students:
- Completely filled application form 
- High school transcripts 
- SAT or ACT scores 
- English Proficiency Test scores (for international candidates) 
- Written essay 
- Letter of recommendation 

Admission to Washburn University Graduate Programs:
Washburn University is renowned for its graduate programs. Applicants have the option of enrolling in full-time or part-time courses. The university also offers three dual enrollment graduate degree programs. To be eligible for these programs, candidates must hold a bachelor's degree from a recognized university, with a minimum GPA of 3.0/4 (83-86%). 

English Proficiency Test Scores for International Students:
International students must submit English Proficiency Test scores if their first language is not English. Washburn University accepts scores from IELTS, TOEFL, and PTE. The minimum score requirements are as follows:
- TOEFL (iBT): 72-80
- IELTS: 6.0-6.5 
- PTE: 49 
- Duolingo: 95
Placement: Washburn University boasts a robust career services department, dedicated to helping students, graduates, and alumni secure job opportunities within the United States. With the rise of virtual career services, the university offers a range of online resources, strategies, and tools for a successful career. Students can benefit from career counseling sessions, where professionals provide valuable insight and guidance on various fields and career options. Additionally, the university offers assistance with resume writing, cover letter preparation, and mock interviews to prepare students for their first job interview. Washburn University also organizes career-related activities, events, workshops, and seminars, providing opportunities for students to network and build connections with potential employers. Through payscale.com, we can see the university's successful alumni, working in diverse industries, and hired by reputable companies and corporations.
Accommodation: The university offers various options for on-campus accommodation, with the Living Learning Center, Washburn Village, Kuehne and West Halls, and the Phi Delta Theta Faternity House being among the popular choices. All students have the opportunity to live on campus, as basic amenities such as twin beds, desks, dressers, chairs, mini-blinds, and wall-to-wall carpeting are provided in residence halls. For more on on-campus housing options and information, please refer to the university's website.

Name: University of Utah
Overview:
The University of Utah, founded in 1850, is a prominent educational institution located in the heart of Salt Lake City. It is also commonly referred to as the U of U or simply The U. It holds accreditation from the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities (NWCCU) and is comprised of 17 highly regarded colleges and schools covering a vast range of disciplines, including business, social transformation, architecture and planning, engineering, fine arts, dentistry, education, health, humanities, and pharmacy, among others.

Recognized as the top university in the nation for technology commercialization, as per the rankings by the Milken Institute, the University of Utah has a strong emphasis on cutting-edge research and innovations. According to the 2022 rankings released by U.S. News & World Report, the university was ranked 99 among National Universities. It houses about 100 academic departments and offers a wide variety of interdisciplinary programs.

The University of Utah takes great pride in its low student-to-faculty ratio of 17:1, which is the lowest among all public institutions in Utah. It has also established a remarkable record of having the highest graduation rate among public universities in the state, with around 70% of first-year students graduating within six years.

One of the university's major strengths lies in its research commercialization process. In 2019, it received a whopping 547 million dollars for research spending, which is a testament to its dedication towards promoting innovation and technology. The university also boasts a remarkable number of 69 start-ups and has generated a staggering $212 million in licensing income.

With a median starting salary range of $50,000 to $55,000 for its alumni, the University of Utah provides its students with excellent opportunities for career growth and success.
Eligibility Overview:
According to the University of Utah, a GPA of 3.66 or higher is expected from applicants, along with an above average standing in their high school class. It is essential to have a combination of A's and B's, with a higher number of A's compared to B's. One can also compensate for a lower GPA by taking more rigorous courses, such as AP or IB.

To be considered for admission, prospective students must have a transferable GPA of 2.6 or higher with a completion of 30 semester hours or a GPA of 2.35 or higher with an Associate of Arts or Associate of Science degree successfully achieved.

Name: Drexel University
Overview:
Founded in 1891, Drexel University is a prestigious private research institution located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Originally known as Drexel Institution of Art, Science, and Industry, it was later renamed Drexel Institute of Technology. The university offers over 120 online programs including doctorate, master's, bachelor's, and certificate programs that offer the same curriculum as the on-campus equivalents. These programs are designed to cater to professionals who seek to further their education in a convenient online format without compromising on quality.

Drexel University offers a range of exceptional accredited degrees and certificates in a cooperative education format. These include master's programs in computer science, business analytics, information systems, quantitative finance, electrical engineering, and mechanical engineering, as well as a bachelor's degree in business administration and mechanical engineering. These programs provide students with the opportunity to advance their education while gaining valuable industry experience.

For international students, the course fee is USD 54,766 per year. On-campus housing options are available for students, with an average cost of about USD 16,488 for accommodation and meals. The university offers a variety of scholarships to full-time students, including federal, state, and institutional aid. Additionally, Drexel University offers professional employment experiences to students, allowing them to work and gain future career benefits. Students can participate in up to three different co-op experiences, equivalent to 18 months of professional work.

Drexel University is renowned for its world-class research programs and invests over USD 110 million annually towards research. The university has established major research initiatives in medical and health sciences, with a focus on basic sciences, biotechnology, and information science. It has also made significant contributions in engineering innovation, including research on cities, plasma medicine and biology, and neuro-engineering.
Eligibility Overview: Drexel University requires a minimum GPA of 3.73 and an above average ranking in your high school class. Achieving a combination of A and B grades, with a larger number of As, will bolster your chances of being accepted. Taking Advanced Placement (AP) or International Baccalaureate (IB) courses, which can boost your weighted GPA, will also demonstrate your readiness for college. We encourage students with a SAT score between 1190-1390 or an ACT score of 25-31 to apply. A 3.73 GPA is considered above average in your high school class, so maintaining a strong mix of A and B grades, with a focus on excelling in your academic performance, is crucial.

Name: Rush University
Overview:
Rush University is a prestigious educational institution situated in the bustling city of Chicago in the United States. It offers a wide range of programs including undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate courses in various fields of study. Additionally, the university also provides online degrees for students seeking distance education opportunities. With Unassigned as one of its many areas of focus, Rush University covers a diverse range of subjects to cater to the academic needs of its students.

At the core of Chicago, Rush University's main campus is the epicenter of academic excellence and opportunities for students. The university boasts over 1 undergraduate program and 2 postgraduate programs, allowing its students to choose from a wide variety of courses. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may vary according to their chosen program. For a ballpark figure, the estimated cost of tuition and fees for an international student lies around INR 24,68,521. Rush University also offers scholarships, work-study options, and various funding opportunities to assist its students in achieving their academic goals.

One of the standout features of Rush University is its dedicated Career Planning Service team, which aids students in building their CV and finding suitable job opportunities. Whether students are seeking employment after completing their degree, looking for part-time or summer jobs, or seeking internships, this team is committed to helping them kickstart their professional career. To learn more about Rush University and to find the perfect course to match your aspirations, visit Leap Scholar for exhaustive information and guidance.
Eligibility Overview:
The College of Health Sciences at Rush University offers a limited selection of undergraduate programs, totaling to three unique options for students to choose from. To be considered for admission to these programs, applicants must have successfully completed a minimum of 60 credit hours of coursework. This coursework should include topics such as algebra, English writing, humanities, and various sciences (physical, life, and social). The admissions process is highly competitive and considers multiple factors when determining acceptance.

Potential students must meet various requirements in order to apply for admission to Rush University. This includes having successfully completed at least 60 credit hours of coursework at the lower-division undergraduate level. Additionally, a minimum overall GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale is expected. Applicants must also have completed the prerequisite courses with a grade of at least "C". In order for the admissions committee to consider the applicant, official transcripts must be submitted from all previous institutions. Furthermore, three letters of recommendation from experts in the field are required. Along with these materials, a statement of purpose, a current resume or curriculum vitae, and proof of English language proficiency are also necessary. Finally, an interview with faculty from the department of interest will be conducted on an individual basis.

Name: University of Albany, The State University of New York, Albany (SUNY Albany)
Overview: The University at Albany, founded in 1844, is a state-funded institute that has been actively involved in research. In 1905, it underwent a reorganization of its academic structure and was the first institute of higher education in New York to offer a bachelor's degree. It is ranked 172 in the 2022 edition of U.S. News & World Report Best Colleges rankings for National Universities. It also placed #751-800 globally in the QS Global World Ranking 2020. The institute's campus is divided into two areas - the Downtown Campus and the Uptown Campus. The former, established in 1909, houses renowned colleges like the College of Information Technology, Rockefeller College of Policy and Public Affairs, School of Social Welfare, and School of Criminal Justice. The main campus, known as the Uptown Campus, is located on 1400 Washington Avenue in Albany and spans over 610 acres. The institute follows a semester-based academic calendar and offers over 50 undergraduate majors and 120 master's programs, including those in the schools of business and education. UAlbany boasts several highly-ranked graduate programs, including social work, criminal justice, and specialties offered in the Rockefeller College of Public Affairs and Policy. The in-state tuition and fees range from $10,000 to $10,500, while the out-of-state tuition and fees range between $28,000 and $28,500. As of fall 2020, the institute had a total undergraduate enrollment of 13,182. Notable alumni of University at Albany include Nobel Prize in Chemistry winner Joachim Frank, Turing Award winner Richard E. Stearns, Wolf Prize winner Omar Yaghi, renowned chemist Alanna Schepartz, actress Carolee Carmello, gay rights pioneer Harvey Milk, and Pulitzer Prize winner William Kennedy.

Name: College at Cortland
Overview:
The College at Cortland, situated in Cortland, USA, is a distinguished university offering undergraduate, graduate and certificate programs in a variety of fields. For students who are unable to attend classes on campus, the university also provides online degree programs for distance education. The versatile curriculum of the university encompasses numerous streams, including Unassigned. The college's prime campus is ideally located in Cortland. The courses offered at the College at Cortland encompasses associate’s, bachelor’s, master’s, and doctoral degrees. While tuition fees may differ for international and domestic students for different courses, the average cost of attendance is estimated to be approximately 15,54,292 INR, exclusive of miscellaneous expenditure.

College at Cortland strives to assist its students in achieving their academic goals by providing various financial aids, including scholarships, work-study options, and other funding opportunities. Additionally, the university's Career Planning Service team is devoted to helping students develop a noteworthy resume and secure suitable employment, be it after graduation or while studying, by connecting them with potential employers and offering guidance for part-time jobs, summer jobs, and internships. Get accurate and detailed insights on The College at Cortland from Leap Scholar and choose the most suitable path for your academic and career aspirations.
Eligibility Overview:
The admission requirements for undergraduate and graduate students at SUNY Cortland are outlined below: 

1. Eligibility criteria for undergraduate applicants: As an international undergraduate student at SUNY Cortland, you must complete a two-step application process. First, your academic background will be evaluated to determine if you meet the university's academic standards. If you do, your application will then be assessed to determine if you are eligible for a Form I-20, which is required for a Student F1 Visa. If you meet both requirements, you will be accepted to SUNY Cortland.

2. Eligibility criteria for graduate applicants: If you hold or will soon earn a bachelor's degree, you may apply as a graduate student. All graduate admissions are evaluated on an individual basis. Decisions are based on various factors and may vary depending on the program you choose.

You must also meet the following English language requirements:
-	A minimum score of 550 on the paper-based TOEFL exam, or 79 on the internet-based exam
-	An overall band score of 6.5 on the IELTS exam
-	A reportable SAT Critical Reading score of at least 520 or a reportable ACT English score of at least 20, for undergraduate applicants
-	For graduate applicants, a score of 23 on the TOEFL Speaking section or 6.5 on the IELTS Speaking test

These criteria are crucial for your successful admission to SUNY Cortland, so be sure to meet them before applying. This university is committed to providing a high-quality education to international students, and we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

The minimum GPA for full admission is 71. This means that students with a GPA of 71 or above will be automatically granted admission to the university, with the exception of the nursing program. For this specific program, a higher GPA may be required due to the competitive nature of the field.

Name: Oklahoma State University
Overview: Oklahoma State University, situated in Stillwater, is a public higher education institution in the United States. It was founded in 1890 as Oklahoma Agricultural and Mechanical College by the university and has since remained committed to its mission of increasing accessibility to college education. The university boasts a diverse range of academic programs, with over 200 undergraduate programs, 79 masters programs, and 45 doctoral programs. Along with its main Stillwater campus, OSU has four additional locations, including a research-focused campus in Tulsa and a technical college in Oklahoma City. The university provides both on-campus and off-campus library access for its students. The undergraduate programs available cover a broad range of fields such as agriculture, engineering and technology, veterinary medicine, and business. The most sought-after courses at OSU include the masters program in MSc management, M.Sc. computer science, MS mechanical and aerospace engineering, and MS business analytics and data science. The tuition fee for undergraduate programs is fixed at USD 28,220, whereas it is USD 18,903 for most postgraduate courses. Students living on campus have the option of choosing from a variety of accommodation facilities, which include 31 different residential halls offering suites, deluxe suites, and apartments. The housing fees are priced between USD 9,340 and USD 11,310, depending on the type of residence, room, and amenities. The central campus, spanning across 700 acres, features a recreation room equipped with training areas, basketball and volleyball courts, and plenty of other sports facilities. With over 500 student clubs and organizations, OSU offers an extensive range of extracurricular opportunities. The university's community engagement and extension service programs help students cultivate leadership skills and manage resource facilities. To support students financially, OSU offers various forms of financial aid, including grants, loans, and scholarships. The scholarships are mainly based on academic performance, leadership abilities, community service, written essays, and interviews. To facilitate career development, the university provides career services that help students find relevant internships and job opportunities within their area of study.
Eligibility Overview:
Please find below the admission criteria for various undergraduate and postgraduate programs offered by OSU: 

1. Undergraduate Students:
- Applicants must maintain a minimum GPA of 3.0 and rank among the top 33.3% in their high school. 
- The SAT score should range from 1060 to 1280, and the ACT score should range from 22 to 28. (Note: Students can submit either SAT or ACT scores)
- An overall IELTS academic score of 5.5 or higher and a minimum Duolingo English Test score of 85 are required for non-native English speakers. (Note: Due to the ongoing pandemic, the Duolingo English Test is currently accepted as an alternative to IELTS.)

2. Postgraduate Candidates:
- Applicants must possess a bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college. 
- Official transcripts from all previously attended institutions must be submitted. 
- GMAT and GRE scores are required. 
- Non-native English speakers must provide proof of English proficiency, which can be fulfilled by achieving one of the following scores: 

• TOEFL (iBT): 79
• IELTS (Academic): 6.5 (minimum score of 6.0 in each section)
• PTE (Academic): 58
• Duolingo English Test: 105 (Note: Due to the ongoing pandemic, OSU is currently accepting Duolingo English Test scores as well.)

We welcome international students from non-English speaking countries, but we require them to meet the above-mentioned language proficiency criteria. Please note that the length of our intake criteria is as follows.

OSU offers on-campus accommodation for its students with a choice of 32 residence halls, including traditional halls, suites, deluxe suites, and apartments. The housing options are considered to be very safe and students can enjoy amenities such as wireless internet and cable television in their rooms and living spaces. For those who prefer to live off-campus, OSU also provides housing options such as apartments, dorm-style, studios, condos, duplexes, cottages, and suites. These accommodations still allow students to utilize the university's meal plan options. The rent for these off-campus options ranges from approximately $600 per month and includes amenities such as laundry facilities, furnished rooms, and central heating. Most of the housing options require a lease tenure of either 6 or 12 months. Due to the university being the only institution in the city, the majority of the housing options are located within a 5-mile radius.

Name: George Mason University
Overview:
Founded in 1972, George Mason University is located in Fairfax, Virginia and is the largest public research university in the area. Headed by President Gregory Washington, the university offers 211 degree programs, including master's, doctoral, professional levels, and graduate-level certificate courses. Students from more than 130 countries are enrolled in the ten colleges and schools of the university, making it a diverse and global community. Mason has built a strong reputation in fields such as law, economics, and research, earning the highest rank among doctoral universities. Students at Mason have access to a wide range of opportunities, including 500 student organization groups.

In addition to its impressive academic offerings, Mason is also known for its budget-friendly education. The estimated Cost of Attendance (COA) for a full-time in-state undergraduate student is approximately $13,000, while for an out-state student it is $36,474. Graduate students can expect to pay slightly less, with a full-time in-state student's COA averaging at $ 9,446 and a full-time out-state student's at $25,430. However, more than half of Mason students receive some form of financial aid through grants, scholarships, and loans.

The university also prioritizes practical and hands-on learning experiences for its students. With an extensive database of over 4,000 internship opportunities available through the HireMason platform, students have had the chance to intern at notable organizations such as the White House Internship Program and ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex. This focus on real-world experience has resulted in 80% of Mason students securing employment within six months of completing their degrees. With its excellent academic programs, affordable education, and emphasis on practical learning, it's no wonder that George Mason University has established itself as a highly reputable institution.

Placement: George Mason University (GMU), located in Fairfax, Virginia, is committed to equipping students with the necessary skills for lucrative employment opportunities in an increasingly globalized world. Internships offer valuable practical experience and allow students to apply their classroom knowledge to real-life situations. It is highly recommended that all GMU students complete at least one internship before graduation to improve their chances of securing a job and a higher salary. By working in their field of interest before graduating, students can define their professional goals, gain valuable experience for their resumes, and enhance their competitiveness when applying for full-time employment or graduate school. Furthermore, experiential learning through internships can create pathways for future job opportunities. GMU students have the opportunity for transcript recognition for a paid internship or co-op, even if it does not count for academic credit. Some renowned companies that recruit from GMU include Nestle, Amazon, World Bank Group, Disney, Apple, Marriott, Microsoft, and Accenture.
Accommodation:
The university offers a secure and serene environment for its students to have a fulfilling college experience. There are a total of 40 residential halls, including regular rooms, suites, and apartments, catering to the diverse needs of the students. While some students choose to reside in suites, the majority of freshmen opt for standard rooms. Upper-class students have the option of living in suite-style or apartment-style halls. These halls are segregated into three neighborhoods - Aquia, Rappahannock, and Shenandoah, with both professional and student personnel ensuring that students have access to the necessary amenities required for a comfortable stay. Each community, along with the Mason Global Center, has a service desk that operates 24 hours, seven days a week.

The Housing department also offers various services such as complimentary laundry, Wi-Fi, and TV. There are eight available suite-style halls, each with a unique layout. Some suites have bedrooms accessible from the main corridor, with shared bathrooms with other rooms. Other suites have hallway entrances and consist of two to four bedrooms, accommodating up to four individuals with a shared bathroom. The bedroom options include doubles, singles, and triples. Only a few units provide kitchenettes that include a sink, microwave, and a small fridge. However, if you live in a suite, it is mandatory to purchase a meal plan.

The suite-style buildings include Piedmont, Tidewater, Blue Ridge, Sandbridge, Eastern Shore, Hampton Roads, Angel Cabrera Global Center, and Whitetop. Around fifty percent of upper-class students reside in one of the five apartment-style buildings, which offer a variety of floor configurations. These fully furnished apartments comprise of a kitchen, dining area, living room, bathroom, and a combination of bedroom options ranging from two singles to two doubles and two singles. Most units can accommodate four individuals, while some offer the option of two, five, or six. All bedrooms can house one to three students. It is not mandatory to purchase a meal plan for students living in apartments.

The apartment-style buildings include Liberty Square, Northern Neck, Potomac Heights, Rogers, and Townhouses. For more in-depth information, please visit https://housing.gmu.edu/.

Name: University of Toledo
Overview: Founded in Toledo, Ohio in the year 1872, the University of Toledo is a public research institution. As the northernmost campus of the University System of Ohio, it remains dedicated to shaping the present of its students and guiding them towards a successful future. The university is structured into multiple colleges such as Aon College of Adult and Lifelong Learning, College of Arts and Letters, College of Business and Innovation, School of Healthcare Business Enterprise and Innovation, College of Health and Human Services, Judith Herb College of Education, College of Engineering, College of Graduate Studies, College of Health Sciences, College of Law, College of Medicine and Life Sciences. With an impressive acceptance rate of 96%, the university offers over 300 undergraduate and graduate degree programs. Highly ranked programs include Occupational Therapy, Engineering, Business, and Law. The university prides itself on providing a nurturing academic and cultural environment, which promotes inclusivity and diversity for its numerous students. On average, the annual tuition and accommodation fee amount to $29K, however, with several scholarships offered by the university, the cost can be lowered to $16K. Covering 1,423 acres of picturesque land, the university campus boasts of libraries, visual art centers, museums, parks, athletic centers, health centers, recreation centers, and residence halls. It boasts of an impressive alumni network, with notable alumni holding top positions in leading industries. This in turn results in a promising placement rate for graduating students.
Eligibility Overview:
Admission Criteria for Direct Admission:
Unconditional direct admission is granted to applicants with a minimum GPA of 2.5 and a score of 15 on the ACT or a corresponding score of 830-870 on the SAT. Similarly, test-optional applicants must have a minimum GPA of 2.0. 

Criteria for Subject to Reconsideration:
Applicants with a score of 15 on the ACT or 830-870 on the SAT and a GPA of 2.75 or higher may be reconsidered for admission. Similarly, applicants with a score of 15 on the ACT or 830-870 on the SAT and a GPA between 2.0-2.49 may also be reconsidered. Additionally, applicants with a score of 16 on the ACT or a corresponding score of 889-910 on the SAT and a GPA below 2.0 may be reconsidered. For test-optional applicants, a GPA of 2.0-2.99 is required for reconsideration.

Name: Bryant University
Overview: Bryant University, once known as Bryant College, is a prestigious private university that was established in 1863. It is located in Smithfield, Rhode Island, USA, and its campus spans an impressive 428 acres. With two exceptional colleges - the College of Arts and Sciences and the College of Business - it is a preferred university for students seeking degrees in the field of business. Popular courses offered at Bryant University include Finance, Accounting, and Marketing, with certificates programs also designed to help students succeed in their chosen fields. The university is an accredited member of the New England Association of Schools and Colleges and AACSB International, with academic affiliations with the Space Grant. Its annual fee comes to USD 46,885, with a Student-Faculty ratio of 13:1. Bryant University offers numerous financial aids, including need-based scholarships, making it an accessible choice for many students. The university offers extensive opportunities for sports, with club sports and intramural teams available throughout the academic year. It is a proud member of the Northeast Conference, with 22 intercollegiate varsity athletic programs available - 11 for men and 11 for women. Students can engage in various clubs and organizations to enhance their college experience further. On-campus housing options, including dormitories, suites, and townhouse apartments, come equipped with all basic amenities and high-speed internet. The students get to participate in the annual housing selection process every Spring. With students from over 60 countries, including India and China, Bryant University offers a truly diverse and inclusive environment for learning. The university's Office of International Students and Scholars provides support to students regarding immigration and visa issues. Through its partnership with the Amica Centre for Career Education, Bryant University offers an excellent track record of placements, with 99% of graduates securing employment within six months of graduation, with an impressive starting salary of USD 57,600. The university also offers internships with global firms such as BBC Worldwide, Coca-Cola, among others, providing valuable experience and exposure to its students.

- Completed undergraduate application form

As part of Bryant University's admission requirements, international students must demonstrate excellent proficiency in English. We accept the following minimum scores as proof of language proficiency:

More than 400 organizations visited the campus to recruit for full-time positions. On average, the class of 2019 received a starting salary of $60,000. Even after two years of graduation, 97% of alumni are successfully employed, while six years after graduation 95% have secured employment. The university has a robust alumni network, and the Career Center is highly active in helping students find job opportunities and internships. Many services are offered by the career center, including advising, workshops, mock interviews, and more, to assist students in achieving their career goals.

Name: State University of New York at Plattsburgh (SUNY Plattsburgh)
Overview: Located in Plattsburgh, New York, the State University of New York at Plattsburgh was established in 1889. It is a publicly funded institution that has been approved by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education and certified by the Board of Regents of the University of the State of New York. Known for its high-quality education, it is ranked as one of the top universities in New York. With a student population of approximately 4,870 undergraduates and 387 graduates, this university offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate courses. It currently offers around 60 baccalaureate degrees and a variety of minor programs. All courses are taught by a team of highly qualified faculty members with top-tier post-doctoral degrees. Originally known as Plattsburgh State Normal and Training School, the university has now become a hub for international students from over 70 countries. The university’s diverse course offerings include expeditionary studies, human development and family relations, biology, broadcast journalism, music, nutrition, environmental studies, criminal justice, medical technology, and more. In addition to its extensive academic programs, the State University of New York at Plattsburgh offers various internship opportunities at reputed organizations in the United States and abroad. To assist non-native English speaking students, the university also provides an English Bridge Program designed to improve their language skills and prepare them for full-time academic study. Prospective students are required to pay an application fee of approximately 50 USD, and the international graduate and undergraduate fees are in the range of 35,979.28 USD to 42,099.28 USD respectively. The university also offers a wide range of scholarships for international students, ranging from 2,000 USD to 1,000 USD. In the 2021 US News & World Report ranking, the university was placed 75th in Regional Universities. It also ranks in the 501-600 range in the Times Higher Education ranking.

MODERN

The following information pertains to the admissions requirements for SUNY Plattsburgh:
Admission Criteria:
- High school diploma or GED equivalent.
- Minimum GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale.
- Completion of required coursework with a satisfactory grade (Math, Science, Social Studies, English, Foreign Language and Electives).
- Academic achievements, including extracurricular activities and leadership roles.

Proof of English Language Competency:
- Submission of scores from an English language proficiency exam.
- TOEFL: Minimum score of 79 (Internet-based); 550 (Paper-based).
- IELTS: Minimum score of 6.5.
- Duolingo English Test: Minimum score of 95.
- PTE Academic: Minimum score of 58.

SAT/ACT Results:
- Submission of SAT or ACT scores is optional.
- SAT: Minimum score of 480 for Evidence-Based Reading and Writing, and 530 for Math.
- ACT: Minimum score of 18 for English, and 22 for Math.

Recommendation Letter:
- One letter of recommendation from a counselor, teacher, or mentor.
- The letter should discuss the candidate's academic abilities, personal qualities and potential for success at SUNY Plattsburgh.

Goals and Objectives:
- A written statement of 250 words outlining the candidate's goals and objectives for their academic and personal growth at SUNY Plattsburgh.

Statement of Accounts:
- A detailed statement of accounts showing the candidate's financial ability to cover tuition and living expenses for the duration of their studies at SUNY Plattsburgh.

English Language Proficiency Exam Scores:
- TOEFL: Minimum score of 79 (Internet-based); 550 (Paper-based).
- IELTS: Minimum score of 6.5.
- Duolingo English Test: Minimum score of 95.
- PTE Academic: Minimum score of 58.

The Career Development Centre (CDC) is dedicated to helping students prepare for their future after graduation. The CDC offers support in the following areas:

In order to select sophomore or junior housing, students can form groups based on a chosen theme. Upon submitting a $250 admission deposit through the housing website, incoming freshmen can apply for housing. Name: Babson College
Overview: Babson College, founded in the year 1919, is a premier private business institution located in Wellesley, Massachusetts. It boasts of four significant campuses spread across different regions, including Wellesley, Boston, San Francisco, and Miami. The primary campus at Wellesley has a plethora of essential facilities like a well-equipped student center, a cafeteria, a library, a fitness center, and an art center. The second campus at High Street, Boston, has an impressive ambiance with state-of-the-art classrooms, event spaces, the college office, and top-notch resources. It is also home to the renowned Graduate Center for Career Development, offering an array of premier graduate programs. Apart from this, the college provides MBA programs at the San Francisco campus, while the Miami campus in Florida offers a wide range of degree programs in MBA, Master of Science in Business and Analytics (MSBA), and Certificate in Advanced Management (CAM). Babson College is quite renowned for its stellar offerings in the form of Bachelor's degrees in Accounting & Law, Economics, Entrepreneurship, Finance, History & Society, Management, Marketing, Mathematics & Science, and Operations and Information Management. Furthermore, the college provides a range of professional Master's programs such as the full-time and part-time Master of Science in Business Analytics, Master of Science in Finance, and Master of Science in Management in Entrepreneurial Leadership. Some of the popular courses offered by Babson College include Business & Management, Applied & Pure Science, Humanities, Creative Arts and Design, and of course, the prestigious MBA. The college takes immense pride in its well-crafted infrastructure and student-friendly atmosphere, providing an array of top-notch facilities such as 22 varsity sports programs and a diverse range of intramural sports based on the students' level of interest, facility space, and equipment needs. The college has over one hundred thriving student clubs and organizations, allowing students to engage with like-minded individuals who share the same passions and interests. The average tuition fee hovers around USD 54,600 to 89,550 per annum, while the college offers 18 campus residence halls and housing facilities that are equipped with modern amenities like Wi-Fi connectivity, electricity, and regular cleaning services. For students looking for off-campus housing options, the college also provides a comprehensive range of options. At Babson, research is given utmost importance, and the college regularly showcases the faculty's research projects, curriculum development initiatives, and case-writing activities. The college has a well-established career services center that prepares students to develop an action-oriented, entrepreneurial mindset, making them employment-ready. With a highly proficient placement cell, Babson College regularly provides its students with excellent placement opportunities, making it a top choice for students looking for a holistic college experience.
Eligibility Overview:
A minimum of 12 years of high school education is required for prospective students to enroll in undergraduate programs. Applicants must hold a bachelor's degree or equivalent certification for postgraduate programs. Additionally, international students must provide SAT or ACT scores along with the aforementioned academic criteria. Non-native English speakers are required to take English proficiency tests such as TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE.

Name: Florida State University
Overview: Established in 1851, Florida State University (FSU) holds the honor of being the oldest educational institution in the state of Florida. With its main campus located in Tallahassee, FSU also has a global presence with branches in Panama, London, Italy, Europe, Latin America, Asia, and Spain. FSU has a vision to enhance and promote education in various fields, including arts, science, technology, and profession. It is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACS). The average tuition fee ranges from USD 18,799 to 20,043, making FSU an affordable option for students. The university boasts of a vast campus area of 1,428 acres, offering a range of athletic services such as a recreation center, intramural sports, sports clubs, bowling arena, and various outdoor opportunities. Additionally, the campus provides top-notch facilities like a well-stocked library, high-speed internet, and IT services. As for housing, FSU offers 18 residential halls with accommodation options like suites, apartments, kitchens, living rooms, and well-equipped facilities like furniture and wifi services. The annual living expenses for students are approximately USD 16,890, making it a budget-friendly option. The Office of Distance Learning at FSU is dedicated to supporting students, educators, and administrators in achieving excellence in online course development, teaching, and learning. The university also offers financial aid to international students, including national merit finalists, presidential scholarship programs, and out-of-state tuition waiver scholarships. Furthermore, the career center at FSU provides guidance at every stage of career development through services like counseling, career fairs, and networking events for students. By choosing FSU, you are setting yourself up for academic excellence and a promising future.

Name: Princeton University
Overview:
Princeton University, situated in New Jersey, is a renowned private Ivy League research university. It was first established in 1746, making it the fourth oldest higher education institution. With a selective acceptance rate of only 6%, this prestigious university boasts an average undergraduate enrollment of 5,267 students, a graduate enrollment of 2,946 students, and a faculty of 1,100 members. The university consists of 42 departments that offer various degree programs, including a Bachelor of Arts (A.B.) or a Bachelor of Science in Engineering (B.S.E.) with 37 concentrations to choose from, such as Anthropology, Molecular Biology, Economics, and Politics. 
The magnificent 600-acre campus of Princeton University is centrally located in the metropolitan area of New Jersey. Almost all its students, equaling to 96%, reside on the campus. Additionally, for the first two years, students are required to live in one of the six residential colleges. These residential colleges, namely Forbes, Rockefeller, First College, Mathey, Butler, and Whitman, are renowned for organizing engaging events such as freshman seminars, excursions, dances, movie nights, barbecues, and inter-college sports competitions. 
The estimated cost of attendance for undergraduates at Princeton University is USD 77,690, which includes tuition fees, accommodation charges, meal expenses, and miscellaneous costs. For graduate students, the tuition fees are USD 56,470. 
Princeton University has a unique financial aid system that solely provides financial assistance based on need, with no provision of merit-based scholarships. However, to make education more affordable, even for international students, the cost of attendance is reduced to USD 13,450, thanks to generous financial aid. 
The university is home to over 300 student organizations, 17 chaplaincies, and 37 sports clubs, offering a plethora of extracurricular activities. Students can also take advantage of various resources available on campus, such as The Pace Center for Civic Engagement, Davis International Center, and the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender (LGBT) Center, for support and empowerment.

Accommodation:
The University of Princeton is known for its exceptional academic programs and prestigious reputation. With a total enrollment of over 8,000 students, the university offers both on-campus and off-campus accommodation options.

On-Campus Living: Princeton University prioritizes providing on-campus accommodation to its students, with 98% of undergraduates and postgraduates living on campus. A variety of residential facilities are available for students, including six residential colleges named Butler, Forbes, Mathey, Rockefeller, Whitman, and Wilson. These colleges offer an on-campus dining package, ensuring that students have access to food at all times. The campus also provides eight residence halls for postgraduate students, equipped with various amenities such as laundry facilities, TV lounges, communal kitchens, and fully furnished rooms.

Off-Campus Housing: Due to Princeton University being the only university in the city, all housing options are in close proximity to campus. Student apartments are widely available off-campus, with various options for the number of occupants, including two, three, or more beds. These apartments have an average rental cost ranging from $1,200 to $1,600 per month and provide amenities such as laundry facilities, fully furnished rooms, kitchens, security, and shared spaces, including pools and TV lounges.
Course Ranking:
Located in the United States, Princeton University is a renowned educational institution that offers a wide range of programs in various fields such as social sciences, management, life sciences, medicine, and natural sciences. Its programs in Social Service, Public Administration, Computer and Information Sciences, Biological and Biomedical Sciences, Engineering & Technology, and Social Sciences are particularly popular. As part of their undergraduate education, students are required to complete an independent project or write a senior thesis.

Princeton University has a reputation for providing affordable and high-quality education. It has consistently ranked among the top universities in the US. The university is well-known for its engineering and technology courses, as evident from its subject rankings. In fact, its engineering program has been ranked outside of the top 10 by THE since 2018, and its programs in civil, electrical, and aerospace engineering have been consistently ranked among the top 10 by US News in the past four years. With an acceptance rate of only 5.8%, getting into Princeton University is extremely competitive.
University Ranking: Princeton University, a prestigious institution founded over 250 years ago, is consistently ranked among the top universities in the world. Located in Princeton, New Jersey, this private Ivy League university is highly regarded for its cutting-edge research and exemplary teaching methods. Its faculty members are known for their high research citation rates, placing it among the elite group of universities with top-notch academic reputation. In fact, several reputable ranking agencies have consistently placed Princeton University within the list of top 10 universities in the world. Name: Clayton State University
Overview:
Clayton State University, located in Morrow, Georgia, is a publicly funded university that was established in 1969. It is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commissions as well as the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business. Situated in Clayton County, which is part of South Metro Atlanta, the university boasts a sprawling 214-acre campus. It also has multiple instructional sites, making it the 13th highest ranked university in Atlanta. CSU offers a variety of programs through its five colleges and one graduate school, including 35 undergraduate, eight postgraduate, six associate, and 40 baccalaureate degrees. Popular fields of study include arts, humanities, psychology, nursing, hospital management, business, engineering, paralegal studies, health sciences, accounting, finance, and communications. 

The university has a moderately competitive acceptance rate of 54%, so students are encouraged to submit their applications through the university's website. CSU also offers unique, specialized programs such as PACE and EDGE, which are focused on workforce development. Additionally, the university has an online study abroad program and a veteran program that cater to the needs of these specific groups. 

New students and upperclassmen can opt for on-campus accommodation in Laker Hall and Laker Village. The residential halls offer fully furnished single occupancy rooms with access to a kitchen, social spaces, Wi-Fi, dining table, refrigerator, washing machine, dishwasher, lounge areas, study rooms, shops, and recreational facilities. 

Compared to other universities, CSU is known for its affordability, with an annual tuition fee of 6,312 USD for undergraduate students and 16,744 USD for graduate students. International students can also take advantage of various scholarships and financial aid opportunities offered by the university.

Name: Albany State University
Overview: Albany State University is a publicly funded institution founded in 1903 by Dr. Joseph Winthrop Holley in Albany, Georgia. Albany presents 40 exceptional undergraduate programs, divided into 29 specializations across 19 broad fields of study. Some of the renowned majors at Albany include Biological & Biomedical Sciences, Communication & Journalism, Computer Sciences, Education, Business, Marketing & Management, and Health Professions. In addition, the university has a central campus located in Albany, along with a branch campus in Cordele. Moreover, the university is home to three colleges, namely The College of Professional Studies, with versatile divisions for Business, Criminal Justice, Social Work, Education, and MBA. The second college, The Darton College of Health Professionals, provides specialized degrees in Nursing, Health & Human Performance and Health Sciences. The third and final institute, The College of Arts & Sciences, offers a diverse range of disciplines, including English, Chemistry & Forensic Sciences, Communication, Sociology, Biological Sciences, and interdisciplinary studies. Albany maintains a student-faculty ratio of 18:1, promoting an interactive learning environment. Also, students can opt for on-campus accommodation to experience a lively campus life. The university also prides itself in offering multiple career opportunities to students, such as part-time jobs, full-time jobs, work-study options, and experiential learning opportunities. It also has a renowned sports program, providing coaching to students who compete in various games across the nation. The average cost of attendance for in-state students is around $6,950 per year, while for out-of-state students, it is approximately $20,352 annually. Furthermore, Albany State University welcomes international students and offers different courses and programs through online learning platforms. International students can also avail themselves of merit-based financial aid, including federal loans, work-study opportunities, and talent-based scholarships to pursue their educational goals at Albany.
Eligibility Overview:
Admission Criteria

In order to be considered for admission as a first-year student, applicants must meet one of the following entrance requirements:

1. A grade point average (GPA) of 2.0 or higher on an unweighted scale, with a minimum score of 17 in English or Reading and 17 in Math on the SAT.

OR

2. A weighted GPA of 2.0 or higher, with a minimum score of 480 in Evidence-Based Reading and Writing and 440 in Math on the SAT.

Prospective students who have a 2.0 GPA or better in high school may be accepted into our entry route programmes.

The university specializes in various fields of study, specifically, Computer Engineering. Eligibility Overview:
Eligibility for International Graduates at the University
International graduates are eligible to apply as graduate students if they have a degree equivalent to a bachelor's degree in the United States. To meet this requirement, individuals must meet the following criteria:

- Possess a degree equivalent to a bachelor's degree from a recognized university
- Demonstrate above average academic standing with a recommended GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
- Fulfill any additional prerequisites set by the graduate program, such as letters of recommendation, portfolios, auditions, or exams like GMAT, GRE, or MAT. These requirements may vary by program and should be confirmed by the applicant.
- Please note that for programs in engineering and computer science, the application process may differ. It is recommended to visit the relevant department's website for further information.

Transfer coursework from previous education may be accepted, but it is subject to the policies of the graduate studies office. The applicant will need to provide their academic record, which is known as a "transcript" in the United States. Other terms for this document may include mark sheets, leaving certificates, or maturity certificates. This information will be required as part of the master's program application.

Name: Santa Ana College
Overview:
Santa Ana College, also known as SAC, is a public community college located in Santa Ana, California. It was established in 1915 and has since become a renowned institution, serving a student body of approximately 5,110 undergraduate students. The college has a wide range of academic programs, offering a total of 136 associate and degree programs, and is known for its top-notch student services. With an enrolment of about 40,000 credit and non-credit students each semester, SAC follows a semester-based academic year structure.

This college is highly acclaimed for its academic offerings, with popular courses such as Fire Protection and Prevention, Liberal Arts and Humanities, and International Business. SAC boasts a diverse student body of over 28,425 students, with 29 different fields of study to choose from for achieving degrees and certificates. The highest degree offered by the institution is an associate degree, and it is one of the 15 community colleges in California that offers a Bachelor's degree in Occupational Therapy.

SAC also prides itself on its comprehensive sports programs, with 18 different sports on offer. The tuition fees for in-state students range from $1,000-$1,500, while out-state tuition fees are $8,000-$9,000. The college caters to the education needs of students from all backgrounds, offering academic transfer and career programs, specialized professional and personal development courses, customized training for businesses and industries, and professional training for firefighters, nurses, and law enforcement personnel.

Graduates of SAC are highly sought after by various industries, including manufacturing, healthcare services, digital media, information and computing. The college boasts an impressive graduate employment rate, with students receiving excellent job opportunities upon graduation. To help eligible students pursue their courses without interruption, the college offers financial aid and scholarships.

With an acceptance rate of almost 100%, Santa Ana College is a highly reputable institution that provides quality education to students from all walks of life.

The following requirements are needed for individuals who are interested in attending this university: 
- Minimum age of 18 years old. 
- Completed high school education. 
- Achieved a Grade Point Average (GPA) of at least 2.0, equivalent to a C grade average. 
- Proficiency in English, with a TOEFL score of 175CBT / 61iBT or an IELTS score of 6.

Name: Adler university
Overview:
In 1952, Rudolf Dreikur founded the Adlerian Psychology institute, known as Adler University, in Chicago. It is named after pioneer psychiatrist Alfred Adler and is the oldest independent psychology school in North America. Recently, in 2015, it was renamed as Adler University. The institution has a strong presence in the field of teaching psychology and is recognized by the Ontario Ministry of Advanced Education and Skill Development. It is the only university in Ontario that offers a Master's degree in Psychology. Additionally, Adler University has established partnerships with other Adler institutions, including The Graduate School in Minnesota, Adler University in Vancouver, and Adler University in Chicago. 
Adler University is a private organization offering degrees in Psychology, Professional Coaching, Psychotherapy, and Mental Health Counseling. It was created to foster critical thinking and drive positive change in society. The university offers programs such as a Master's in Counseling Psychology, Counseling Psychology in Art Therapy, Counseling Psychology in School and Youth Concentration, Industrial and Organizational Psychology, Public Policy and Organizational, and a Doctorate in Clinical Psychology (Psy.D). 
The university also provides accommodation facilities on campus, and the duration of stay for students varies depending on their course requirements, allowing them to improve their learning experience. Regarding fees, the average cost for program tuition and administration at Adler University is $46,800, subject to the chosen course.
Eligibility Overview: Admission to the university is based on certain eligibility criteria that students must meet. These requirements include obtaining a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, or an equivalent degree from an international institution, by the time of admission. Additionally, students must have earned a minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale in their baccalaureate degree. For non-native English speakers, a proficiency test is required to demonstrate English language proficiency. This proficiency test is crucial in assessing a student's ability to understand and communicate effectively in English. Our university values diversity and encourages students from all backgrounds to apply. Hence, fulfilling the above criteria will ensure a strong chance of admission into our esteemed institution.

Eligibility Overview:
ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS REQUIRED FOR EVALUATION, INCLUDING DEGREES, DIPLOMAS, LEAVING CERTIFICATES, AND EXAMINATION CERTIFICATES

To receive a professional assessment, individuals who have graduated from a non-accredited university in the US should contact a NACES.org evaluator or Lisano International. A professional evaluation of each course must be requested, which must also include a GPA calculation.

SAT/ACT SCORES:

Applicants whose first language is not English are required to submit SAT or ACT results. The minimum accepted SAT scores are 490 for math and 400 for English. As for ACT scores, the minimum accepted is 20 for math and 20 for English.

TOEFL TEST:

If the candidate's native language is not English, they must take the TOEFL test unless they have satisfied the English proficiency requirement at a recognized US university. The minimum accepted TOEFL scores are 72 for internet-based, 203 for computer-based, and 537 for paper-based tests.

NCAA SPORTS ELIGIBILITY:

Individuals wishing to compete in NCAA sports must provide SAT or ACT scores if they have not been granted NCAA eligibility clearance. In addition, an Educational History Form will also need to be submitted.

Overview: Westcliff University, which was founded in 1993, is a private educational institution located in Irvine, California. The university also has branches in Los Angeles and Miami, Florida. According to Best Value Schools, Westcliff University has been recognized as the top provider of graduate marketing programs. The university is comprised of the College of Business, the College of Education, Technology and Engineering, and the Western State College of Law. These colleges offer various academic programs including bachelor's and master's degrees, as well as doctorates and certificate courses. In terms of tuition fees, Westcliff University is competitively priced at $13,560. Additionally, the university offers scholarships to individuals with strong academic backgrounds. Unlike many other universities that focus primarily on theoretical knowledge, Westcliff University emphasizes the practical skills needed to succeed in the job market. The university also provides full-time students with the opportunity to enroll in affordable online or hybrid distance education courses. Furthermore, the university has a CPT internship program available to its students, providing them with valuable hands-on experience. At Westcliff University, students are guided by highly qualified faculty members, as well as the Program Advisory Council and Board of Trustees. These individuals include experts from reputable companies such as Google, Kia, Hyundai, Hewlett Packard, Deloitte, Asurion, Hitachi Capital, Cox Communications, and CATESOL.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission at this university, international students must submit the following: an assessment of English language proficiency, such as TOEFL, and transcripts, as required. Non-English transcripts must be translated by an appropriate third party or evaluated by a trained transcript evaluator fluent in the language on the transcript. To successfully gain admission, candidates must submit all necessary documents and follow these sequential steps: Fill out the application form, provide test results for English proficiency, submit high school or secondary school transcripts, and pay the application fee.
Placement: For non-US students, the university offers the option to apply for CPT (curricular practical training) while completing their coursework. This allows international students to gain practical experience off-campus. Additionally, STEM-related program students are eligible for an extension of their OPT (optional practical training) internship after they graduate, extending it up to 36 months. The university's Career Services department offers personalized guidance to students, hosts frequent workshops, and facilitates professional networking with industry experts.
Accommodation: Westcliff University does not offer any on-campus accommodation to its students. International students are required to arrange for their own housing, such as a homestay, or to contact REXidence Residential Services, the designated agency for managing Westcliff student housing.
University Ranking: Westcliff University, located in Westcliff, California, is widely recognized as one of the leading higher education institutions in the United States. Founded in 1887, this private, non-profit university has built a strong reputation for academic excellence and a rigorous curriculum. Offering more than 200 undergraduate and graduate programs in fields such as business, education, engineering, law, medicine, and the sciences, Westcliff University stands out as a top choice for students seeking a well-rounded education. With a strong commitment to research, both faculty and students are actively engaged in a wide range of research initiatives. Its stellar performance has consistently placed it among the top-ranked universities in the country. In fact, in the 2020 rankings by U.S. News & World Report, Westcliff University secured the impressive position of #43 among national universities. This credible source also listed the university as #20 in its list of best-value schools and #32 in its rankings for the most veteran-friendly colleges. Additionally, Westcliff University made a lasting impression in other highly-reputed publications as well. Forbes, in its exclusive 2020 list of best colleges, positioned Westcliff University at #36 among all private universities in the country. In another prestigious ranking of top universities conducted by the Wall Street Journal/Times Higher Education, this highly-regarded institution held the impressive spot of #46 among all universities in the United States. Westcliff University is also a highly inclusive and diverse institution, ranked #10 in U.S. News & World Report's list of best colleges for diversity, and an astonishing #3 in its list of top colleges for international students. With a solid commitment to excellence, a strong focus on research, and a deep-rooted dedication to diversity and inclusivity, Westcliff University stands tall among the best universities in the nation, offering a world-class education that cultivates leaders of tomorrow.

Name: Rutgers University
Overview:
Rutgers University, established in 1766, is a prominent public land-grant research institution situated in New Brunswick, New Jersey. With three campuses located in New Brunswick, Newark, and Camden, Rutgers offers a diverse range of academic programs, including 150+ majors and minors for undergraduates and 400 graduate programs. Renowned for its research and development, Rutgers houses over 300 research centers on campus. The university's academic section comprises 175 departments that offer state-of-the-art research opportunities, top-notch technology, and exceptional teaching. With 17 schools and colleges specializing in various fields such as medicine, health care, business, education, and social work, Rutgers is highly esteemed nationwide.

Some of the most sought-after courses offered by Rutgers include Master of Information, MSc Computer Science, MS in Data Science, Masters in Human Resource Management, and Master of Communication & Media. The university boasts a vibrant campus life, with over 700 student clubs and organizations fostering social and leadership opportunities. Students can engage in co-curricular activities, athletic sports, and politics, making for an intercultural lifestyle. With a student body of over 50,000 international students, Rutgers is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive environment.

The university has an annual fee of USD 25,000 to 29,012 and a total living cost of around USD 15,000. To make education more accessible to international students, Rutgers offers various scholarships and fellowships. The main campus houses the renowned Rutgers Business School in Newark, which boasts cutting-edge classrooms and meeting spaces, along with a full range of services.

Rutgers values inclusivity and accessibility for all its students. The university's Access and Disability Resources serves as the central unit that works closely with the Offices of Disability Services (ODS) at each Rutgers campus, providing reasonable accommodations and services for students with disabilities. As part of its commitment to equipping students for the workforce, Rutgers offers on-campus recruitments and employment workshops, along with individual virtual career advising and group meetings for both students and alumni.
Eligibility Overview: For international students applying for undergraduate programmes, it is mandatory to submit their Grade 12 scores as well as the scoring requirements for the selected major/subject. These scores will also be used to assess the student's English language proficiency, depending on the campus. The following criteria must be met for MBA programmes:The student should have a GPA of 3.3 on a scale of 4 TOEFL/IELTS/PTE The student should have a four-year bachelor's degree or a master's degree equivalent to a US bachelor's degree, with a minimum GPA of 3.3 on a scale of 4 TOEFL/IELTS/PTE The student should have a GMAT score of 680On average, applicants have 5 years of work experience required for the MBA programme.
Placement: Rutgers University-New Brunswick boasts a remarkable 84 percent graduation rate, with an impressive 93 percent of graduates securing employment within two years after completing their studies. On average, first-year earnings for RU-New Brunswick graduates are $57,600, with a six-year average salary of $57,900. The university's alumni from the IT & Software Development program are top earners, with an annual income of $140,000. Notably, these are some of the most lucrative degrees offered at the university.

The following information pertains to the accommodation facilities available at Rutgers University. Students have a range of options when it comes to choosing housing on or near campus.

On-campus housing options are available, as well as off-campus options for those who prefer to live in a nearby area. Each residence hall offers essential amenities, such as a refrigerator, microwave oven, dishwasher, and a table with chairs in the kitchen. Additionally, all rooms have access to high-speed internet (both wired and wireless), digital cable, and a telephone.

Off-campus housing typically costs between $750 and $950 per month. Students can choose from studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, or communal living spaces. These apartments come fully equipped with necessary amenities, including central air conditioning and free internet access. Laundry facilities are also available on-site. The apartments are also equipped with modern kitchens that feature microwaves and dishwashers for convenience. Short-term lease options are also available for students.

For three consecutive years, Times Higher Education (THE) has ranked Rutgers University between 126 and 150 for its PG program in Engineering and Technology. In the field of computer science, the PG program at Rutgers University has scored between 101 and 125 on the rankings by Times Higher Education over the years 2019 to 2021.

This is due to the university's high level of academic research and the number of Nobel Prizes won by its faculty. Name: Murray State University
Overview:
Murray State University, situated in Murray, Kentucky, is a public university that has been providing quality education since 1922. With multiple campuses in Madisonville, Paducah, Henderson, and Hopkinsville, this university covers an extensive area of 258.3 acres and has a faculty of 406 members. Every year, this university enrolls around 9,500 students for its graduate and undergraduate courses, making it a preferred choice for local as well as international students. In fact, in a recent survey, it was ranked as the 11th best public school in the US.

One of the highlights of this university is its scenic outdoor campus, which offers various opportunities for adventurous activities like hiking, camping, and fishing. With its rural setting and robust security measures taken by the local area police, the university ensures the safety of its students at all times. Murray State University offers a diverse range of educational programs, including 37 masters, 60 bachelors, 3 PhD programs, specialist degrees, and associate programs, all designed to meet the needs of its students.

This university is well-known for its exceptional programs in subjects like Animal Health Technology, Agricultural Science, Occupational Safety, Biology, Nursing, and Business Administration. The cost of living for students is estimated to be around 25,436 USD per annum, which includes on-campus facilities like 60 buildings equipped with all basic and recreational amenities. These facilities include theatres, study areas, gaming zones, cable television, and much more, providing students with a refreshing experience.

In addition to its excellent academic programs, Murray State University also offers ample financial assistance to its students through scholarships, grants, and educational loans. These financial aids are awarded based on students' academic performance and other skills, making education more accessible for all. The university also provides various benefits to its graduates, such as tickets for university bookstores, concerts, recruitment events, and more, giving them a competitive edge in their careers.
Eligibility Overview:
The data for this university includes information on the admissions requirements for incoming students. It is important to note that for admission, you will need to submit your cumulative high school GPA on the application. However, it is essential to submit your official high school transcript after graduation.

For those with a GPA between 3.0-2.99, you must also include your ACT or SAT test scores on your application. These scores must be submitted before participating in Racer Nation Orientation and enrolling in courses.

To be eligible for admission, applicants must have a high school GPA of 3.0 or above. No ACT or SAT test scores are required for this category. Alternatively, if your high school GPA falls between 2.0 to 2.99, you must have an ACT aggregate score of 18 or higher (or SAT score of 960 or higher) to be considered for admission.

Name: Hodges University
Overview: Hodges University, located in Fort Myers, Florida, is a private, nonprofit institution. Originally named International College, the university was renamed after receiving a generous $12 million endowment in 2007 from Earl and Thelma Hodges, local residents. In 2021, the university shifted its operations and classes to Fort Myers from its previous campus in Naples, Florida. Offering a variety of degree programs, including associate, bachelor's, master's, and other certificate programs, Hodges University also features specialized centers such as the Dr. Peter Thomas Veterans Services Center, the Frances Pew Hayes Center for Lifelong Learning, and the Center for Diversity, Inclusion, and Cultural Competency. Over its three decades of existence, Hodges University has awarded more than 10,000 degrees. The university consists of five colleges: Fisher School of Technology, Johnson School of Business, Nichols School of Professional Studies, School of Health Sciences, and School of General Studies. The cost of attending Hodges University may vary for international and domestic students, depending on the course they choose to pursue. The average tuition and fees for an international student, excluding miscellaneous expenses, is approximately 13,26,285 INR. In order to make education accessible, Hodges University offers various scholarships, work-study programs, and other funding options to its students. Moreover, the university's Career Planning Service team assists students in creating a comprehensive CV and finding employment opportunities, including full-time jobs, part-time jobs, internships, and summer jobs, upon graduation or during their studies.

Accommodation:
Hodges University does not offer housing on its campus. Students have the option to rent apartments that are strategically located near the university's vicinity. This article will provide you with more information about accommodation near Hodges University and how to secure a place to live during your time at the university.

At Hodges University, housing is not provided for students. However, there are numerous apartments available that are close to the university grounds. These apartments are suitable for students looking for a convenient and affordable place to live while attending classes at Hodges University. Whether you prefer to live on your own or with roommates, there are plenty of options to choose from. Many of these apartments come fully furnished and offer amenities such as a fitness center, swimming pool, and laundry facilities.

The apartments near Hodges University are strategically located to ensure students have easy access to essential places like grocery stores, restaurants, and public transportation. This makes it easier for students to get around and take care of their daily needs without having to travel a long distance. Additionally, living near the university makes it convenient for students to attend any on-campus events or make use of the facilities offered by the university.

To secure an apartment near Hodges University, it is recommended that students start their search early on to avoid any last-minute rush. Many apartments have waiting lists, so it is beneficial to start looking as soon as you decide to attend Hodges University. You can get in touch with the housing office at the university, which can provide you with a list of apartments near the campus. It is also helpful to search for apartments online and contact the rental office to schedule a visit.

In conclusion, Hodges University does not have on-campus housing, but students have plenty of off-campus housing options to choose from. These apartments are close to the university, making it convenient for students to navigate and attend to their daily needs. Start your housing search early and make use of the resources provided by the university to secure a comfortable and suitable place to live during your time at Hodges University.
