Name: University of Texas at Arlington
Overview:
The University of Texas at Arlington, located in Arlington, Texas, is renowned for its outstanding academic programs and diverse fields of study. The university prides itself on delivering quality education in a multitude of areas, with a special focus on Business. It boasts a comprehensive range of programs, including undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate courses, as well as online degree programs tailored to suit the needs of distance learning students. Occupying a vast campus spanning 420 acres, the university provides a conducive living and dining environment for its students, and strives to offer all necessary amenities to facilitate their education and personal development. As the student population continues to grow, the university has undertaken development projects with the aim of expanding its campus infrastructure. Today, the campus is home to several buildings such as Nedderman Hall, Arlington Hall, the CAPPA Building, Texas Hall, the Common Room, the Engineering Research Building, and the College of Business.

The university offers an extensive academic curriculum, featuring diverse courses and programs, offered through various colleges and schools including the College of Education, the College of Science, the College of Nursing and Health, and the School of Social Work. Other schools include the College of Engineering, the College of Business, the College of Liberal Arts, the College of Architecture, Planning & Public Affairs, and the College of Education. With a staggering 180 undergraduate and graduate courses on offer, the university leaves no dearth of options for students to pursue their academic passions. The institution also hosts industry experts for interactive sessions, guest lectures, and hands-on seminars that enrich the students' learning experience.

The Career Planning Services team at the University of Texas at Arlington assists students in building strong resumes and securing jobs, both during their degree program and after graduation. Their support extends to finding part-time jobs, summer jobs, and internships, ensuring that students are well-prepared for their professional lives upon completion of their studies. The university also offers scholarships, work-study opportunities, and various funding options to help students achieve their academic goals and aspirations.

Discover more about the University of Texas at Arlington on Leap Scholar, and pave your path to a successful future with the right course for your dreams and passions.
Eligibility Overview: The SAT score is determined by adding the highest evidence-based Reading, Writing, and Math scores. Similarly, the ACT composite score is calculated by taking into account the results for English, Reading, Math, and Science components. UT Arlington (UTA) does not require applicants to submit an essay. However, the university may consider test scores when evaluating applications for admissions and financial aid opportunities. It should be noted that high school grades, including GPA, class rank, and courses completed, also play a significant role in the assessment of an application. Nevertheless, results from standardized tests can have an impact on the admissions decision-making process and financial aid options. UTA accepts IELTS, TOEFL, and Duolingo as official English language proficiency test scores from non-native English speakers. Therefore, applicants must submit one of these test results along with their application to the university.

Placement:
The career advancement center at our university is dedicated to enhancing the employability skills of our students. Our institution is proud to offer a subscription to the popular "Handshake" online platform, connecting employers with students seeking various career opportunities, ensuring that both parties have access to the best options available. Our alumni are also actively involved in the hiring process, providing valuable insights and connections for current students.

In addition, we regularly host workshops to educate our students on the most up-to-date resume formats, how to write compelling cover letters, and how to prepare for interviews. This thorough preparation has led to an impressive 92% of our graduates finding employment within two years after graduating. On average, these employed graduates earn an annual salary of $48,800, significantly higher than the national average of $33,000.

Our university is committed to providing our students with the necessary resources and opportunities to achieve their career goals. By staying current with industry trends and connecting our students with top employers, we are proud to have a track record of success in launching our graduates into the workforce.
Accommodation:
The university offers both on-campus and off-campus accommodation options for all its students, including both undergraduate and postgraduate students. On-campus housing is mostly in the form of residence halls for undergraduate students and apartments for postgraduate students. For students living on campus, the institution also provides meal plans. The residence halls and apartments are in close proximity to the university buildings, making it convenient for students to access their classes and facilities.

For students looking for off-campus housing, the average monthly rent falls in the range of USD 650 to USD 850. Considerable changes have occurred in the University of Texas at Arlington's (UTA) rankings for its courses. In 2022, UTA's placement on the list for PG Business and Economics by THE (Times Higher Education) significantly declined from 301–400 to 501–600. However, according to US News & World Report, the university has climbed to the 125th spot for UG Business in 2022. With aerospace engineering at #44, mechanical engineering at #83, and biomedical engineering at #89, UTA also scores well in four other specialized engineering courses.

In THE's rankings for computer-related studies, UTA's position for PG Computers has dropped to 401-500 in 2022 from 301-400 in 2021, while computer engineering is ranked at #83 in the US News & World Report for 2022, a slight decline from its previous spot of #86 in 2021. Besides these mentioned placements, additional courses have been ranked by THE for 2022 as follows: between 601-800 for Life Sciences, between 301-400 for Psychology, between 401-500 for Arts & Humanities, and at #600+ for Clinical and Health. Overall, UTA continues to be a reputable institution with a varied range of courses that consistently rank among the top universities, making it an ideal choice for students seeking a high-quality education.

The University of Texas at Arlington (UTA) is a distinguished public research university in Texas, America with a rich history spanning over a century. Despite fluctuations in its ranking, the University of Texas at Arlington continues to be recognized as a leading institution worldwide.

Name: University of Bridgeport
Overview: The University of Bridgeport is an esteemed private university with a non-profit structure. It was established in 1927 and is situated in Bridgeport, Connecticut, USA. Accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education and the Connecticut Department of Higher Education Board of Governors, the University of Bridgeport has three distinguished colleges - the College of Health Sciences, Engineering, Business and Education; and the College of Arts and Sciences. The university follows a semester-based academic calendar and is renowned for its undergraduate majors in Business, Education, Engineering, Acupuncture and Nutrition. It also holds a strong reputation for its graduate programs in Education and Naturopathic and Chiropractic Medicine. The tuition fee for the University of Bridgeport is approximately 35,000 USD, with additional expenses of around 17,000 USD for room and board. With an exceptionally high percentage of students receiving financial aid, academic scholarships and need-based awards, and the possibility of additional merit-based scholarships of up to 20,000 USD, the cost of living would amount to an average of 6,600 USD per year.

The University of Bridgeport offers a variety of housing options for students, both on-campus and off-campus. For on-campus accommodation, the university partners with Sara's Homestay to match students with host families. This option provides a unique opportunity for students to immerse themselves in American culture while also having convenient access to campus. Sara's Homestay carefully pre-screens host families and individually matches them with students based on location, public transit availability, and room size.

For more information on off-campus housing, please visit the University of Bridgeport's website.

Name: Western Kentucky University
Overview:
Bowling Green is the main campus of Western Kentucky University, a public university founded in 1906. In addition to Bowling Green, the university has three regional campuses located in Elizabethtown-Fort Knox, Glasgow, and Owensboro. Covering 200 acres of land, the university is home to five academic colleges - the Gordon Ford College of Business, Ogden College of Science And Engineering, Potter College of Arts and Letters. With over 170 undergraduate programs and 125 graduate programs, the university offers a diverse range of courses. These programs are mainly focused on areas such as accountancy, arts, education, business administration, health & public administration, sciences, social work, physical therapy, and psychology for graduate and certificate students, and arts, fine arts, interdisciplinary studies, music, science, nursing, and social work for undergraduate students. The tuition cost for all these programs is USD 24,496 per year. 

Western Kentucky University has both men and women athletic teams participating in basketball, swimming, and football. The university also aims to promote social responsibility and civic engagement among its students by offering 33 active organizations on campus. Moreover, the students are encouraged to contribute towards community service in Bowling Green, Warren County, and the surrounding areas, with several departments sponsoring programs for the same. 

Students at Western Kentucky University can choose from a variety of on-campus housing options, including hotels, suite-style residence halls, and community living. The university boasts 18 residence halls, providing all the basic amenities, such as a fully-equipped kitchen and dining area, private washer and dryer, and wifi access. Notably, there are also three residence halls available only for female students. 

Moving on to the cost of living, the average calculation for meals and accommodation is USD 11,467. Western Kentucky University utilizes a specialized career system called Handshake to assist its students in securing job opportunities with multinational companies and other organizations. This system enables students to browse and apply for various jobs online, enhancing their employability skills.
Eligibility Overview:
The following criteria must be fulfilled by individuals seeking admission to our university: 
1. Official transcripts for high school diploma, college diploma, or equivalent must be submitted. The transcripts must be certified by the granting university or Board and must reflect a minimum GPA of 2.5 and a CAI score of 60. 
2. For undergraduate applicants under the age of 21, a minimum score of 460 on SAT or 20 on ACT is required. Graduate applicants must provide their GMAT or GRE scores. 
3. Non-native English speaking undergraduate applicants must have a minimum score of 6.0 on IELTS and 71 on TOEFL iBT. Graduate applicants must have a minimum score of 6.5 on IELTS and 79 on TOEFL iBT. 
4. An international certification of finances must be submitted. 
5. A purpose statement must also be included in the application. 
Our university takes these requirements very seriously and only admits candidates who meet all of these criteria. This ensures that our students are well-prepared and equipped for academic success. Our admissions process is thorough and competitive, and we strive to maintain the highest standards of excellence. Thank you for considering our university for your academic journey.
Placement: Handshake, a system utilized by the university, serves as a platform for career placement, connecting students with multinational and other eminent firms. This innovative career system enables students to browse and apply for employment opportunities online, while also aiding in enhancing their employability skills. Additionally, the institution provides students with the opportunity to secure internships with various organizations. In contrast to the national average salary of USD 33,028 per annum, 91% of university students successfully find employment within two years of graduation, with an average earning of USD 34,700 annually. The university's career services are dedicated to empowering students and equipping them with the necessary skills to obtain desirable job opportunities. Notably, prestigious companies such as Fulbright, Ohio Republican Party, Heaven Hill Distillery Brookings, and Run Switch Public Relations frequently hire from the university's pool of talented students.
Accommodation: The university offers various options for on-campus lodging, including Community, Hotel, and Suite-style residences. The estimated yearly cost ranges from $5,000 to $6,000 in US dollars. The ratio of first-year and second-year students staying on campus is 52 percent and 26 percent, while only around 8 percent of seniors reside on the premises. The university has allocated three residence halls exclusively for female students, one of which is designated for senior students. The campus is highly secure, with documented alcohol law violations declining by 41% from 2016 to 2018. The 18 residential halls provide students with all the necessary amenities, including complimentary laundry facilities.

Name: Aurora University
Overview:
Aurora University was established in Aurora, Illinois in 1893, offering a comprehensive education to students through its four campuses – the main campus in Illinois and satellite campuses at Orchard Center, George William College, and Woodstock Center. George William College, one of its campuses, provides 16 bachelor's and master's degree programs while also offering doctoral programs in leadership in educational administration and leadership in curriculum and instruction. The university boasts a wide range of academic programs, with over 50 majors and minors available to students. Among the popular courses are business administration, accounting, communication, finance, and nursing. 
In terms of accommodation, the university offers six residential halls that are fully-furnished and equipped with modern amenities such as fitness rooms, laundry areas, common spaces, vending machines, and elevators. The residential halls are co-ed and ensure 24-hour security for students' safety.

For students looking for part-time jobs, the university provides on-campus employment opportunities. Additionally, students have access to various career services, including career advising, resume and cover letter resources, interview assistance, and career resources.

Name: Western New England University
Overview:
Located in Springfield, USA, Western New England University provides a rich academic experience for both domestic and international students. With a vast campus spread across 215 acres, the university is home to 3,825 students from 26 different nations.

The tuition fee for various programs may vary between international and domestic students. The university boasts of an impressive range of undergraduate, postgraduate, certificate, and online degree programs, with 50 majors and 30 minors to choose from across its five colleges.

To be eligible for admission, prospective students must score a minimum of 6 and 6.5 in the IELTS exam for undergraduate and postgraduate courses, respectively. Western New England University offers a variety of scholarships, work-study options, and other funding opportunities to assist its students in their academic pursuits.

The university also has a dedicated Career Planning Service team to help students with building their resumes and finding suitable job opportunities, whether it is a full-time position after graduation, a part-time job, summer job, or an internship. At Western New England University, students are encouraged to explore their passions and prepare for a successful future.
Eligibility Overview:
Listed below are the language proficiency requirements for international students who wish to apply for admission at our university:

- International students must provide proof of English language proficiency by submitting one of the following test scores:

1. IELTS (International English Language Testing System) with a minimum score of 6.5
2. TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) with a minimum score of 79
3. PTE (Pearson Test of English) with a minimum score of 58
4. CAEL (Canadian Academic English Language) with a minimum score of 70

Please note that we do not accept any other language proficiency tests other than the ones mentioned above. Additionally, international students may also be exempt from this requirement if they have completed their previous education in an English-speaking country or if their country of origin has English as an official language.

We highly value the importance of English language proficiency in academic success, and therefore, it is a mandatory requirement for all our international applicants. We believe that a strong grasp of the English language will not only enhance your academic experience but also prepare you for your career in an increasingly globalized world.

Our university is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive learning environment for all our students, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds and cultures. We are confident that with our rigorous academic standards and supportive faculty, you will thrive in our university and achieve your academic goals. Join our international community and embark on an exciting journey towards a successful future!

Placement: The connectivity among students, alumni, and employers remains a crucial aspect for Western New England University. The Kevin S. and Sandra E. Delbridge Career Center is a wellspring of vital information and comprehensive services designed to support students and businesses in their quest for career opportunities. Some notable partners include Clean Water Action, The Hangover Insurance Group, Monsoon Savings, ISO New England, Autism Care Partners, and more.
Accommodation:
One of the key aspects of student life at Western New England University is the opportunity to live on campus. With a variety of housing options available, students can create lifelong connections and memories while staying at the university. From traditional double occupancy halls to more advanced housing options, the university offers something for every student as they progress through their studies. Whether you are a graduate, law, pharmacy, or doctoral student, you can continue to live on campus in the Gateway Village Apartments, as long as there is space available.

1. First-Year Student Housing
As a first-year student, you will have the chance to experience the classic residential halls at the university, such as "The Quad" (Berkshire, Franklin, and Hampden Halls) and Windham Hall. These halls offer double occupancy rooms and shared bathrooms on each floor. Depending on their interests and housing needs, some freshmen may also choose to live in Commonwealth Hall. Priority is given to first-year students for premium single rooms, which are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Each housing option at the university offers access to facilities like lounges with TVs, kitchenettes, and entertainment options. The rooms are equipped with movable furnishings and tiled floors, and the halls are air-conditioned.

2. Sophomore Year Housing 
Sophomores have the option to live in Commonwealth Hall, Evergreen Village, the LaRiviere Center, Gateway Village, or Southwood Hall. 
Commonwealth Hall is a popular choice among students at various stages of their education, including sophomores, juniors, seniors, and transfer students. First-year students can also opt to live in a Commonwealth learning interest community. Each corridor in the hall features a kitchenette, laundry facilities, and semi-private restrooms for individual use. The "core" community center on each floor houses a multipurpose room and recreation area. 

LaRiviere Center is a suite-style accommodation option for juniors, sophomores, and seniors. This building has a central area housing a multipurpose lounge, conference room, academic classrooms, and a computer lab. The residents are housed in four suites, each with four double rooms, on each coed floor wing. These suites can accommodate six or eight people, and each has two private bathrooms, as well as a "living area" with couches, tables and chairs, built-in cabinets, a full-size refrigerator, and counter space. The residents of the suite are responsible for maintaining and taking care of their living space. Each floor wing also has a study room, extra seating, recreational equipment, and laundry facilities. 

3. Junior & Senior Year Housing
For upperclassmen preparing for life after graduation, the university offers Gateway Village Apartments, Evergreen Village Townhouses, and Southwood Hall. These advanced housing options provide students with a more independent living space, including full kitchens, bedrooms, living rooms, and bathrooms. 
Gateway Village Apartments can accommodate two to six students, predominantly juniors, seniors, and a limited number of sophomores. The apartments may have efficiency, one bedroom, two bedrooms, or three bedrooms. Each apartment is equipped with a furnished living room, private bathroom, and kitchen appliances. Residents are responsible for the maintenance and repair of their living space. The apartment complex has an outdoor entertainment area and a communal laundry room. Additionally, a section of flats is reserved for graduate housing. All student units in Gateway Village have tiled floors and are air-conditioned.

Evergreen Village Townhouses is a popular housing choice for seniors. These two-story townhouse apartments have three bedrooms and accommodate six students in double occupancy rooms. Each townhouse has a living room, kitchen, full bathroom, and half bathroom. The rooms have carpeted floors, and the furniture is freestanding. Just like Gateway Village, residents are in charge of maintaining and caring for their living space. The multifunctional building at Evergreen Village has a study area, recreation area, social area, and laundry facilities. The building is also air-conditioned.

Southwood Hall is the newest addition to the university's housing options. This corridor-style residence hall features four-person apartments and is close to the athletic fields. Each apartment has a bathroom, kitchen, living room, and two double or four single occupancy bedrooms. The units have tiled floors and freestanding furniture. Southwood Hall predominantly houses juniors and seniors.

Name: University of the Incarnate Word
Overview: The University of the Incarnate Word is a private Catholic institution offering a diverse range of graduate, undergraduate, and doctoral degree programs. Founded in 1881 by the "Sisters of Charity of the Incarnate Word," the university is located in San Antonio, Texas, with a vast campus spanning 154 acres and serving over 5,827 students. Additionally, it provides online education opportunities for distance learning. With a remarkable student/faculty ratio of 11:1, the university boasts highly skilled and proficient academic faculty. It consists of 11 schools with stringent admission criteria, taking into account students' GMAT or GRE scores and English proficiency. Popular subjects offered by the university include business, music therapy, criminal justice, nursing, medicine, psychology, and theatre, among others. The campus houses a pharmacy school, research labs, and writing and learning centers. With a renowned reputation for organizing various sports tournaments, the university boasts 23 sports teams, including volleyball, basketball, and soccer. After graduation, students are recruited by several multinational corporations. The University of the Incarnate Word also provides its alumni with special discounts on amenities, suites, and hotels. The average cost of living for one year is estimated to be $49,000. Financial aid and scholarships worth approximately 94% of the students receive significant financial support. Students maintaining a 3.0 GPA can avail themselves of scholarships ranging from $5,000 to $20,000.
Eligibility Overview:
University Admissions Information for the University of the Incarnate Word

The undergraduate enrollment at UIW is about 3,958 students, with approximately 90 undergraduate majors available. For the majority of bachelor's degree programs offered at UIW, the basic admission process is as follows:

Where to Apply:
- Freshmen: Apply through the Undergraduate Application Portal
- Transfer students: Apply through the Transfer Student Application Portal.

Admission Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must submit the following documents:

- Completed application form
- High school transcripts
- Official SAT or ACT scores
- Optional letters of recommendation and campus interview/visit.

Graduate Admissions for the University of the Incarnate Word

The Office of Research and Graduate Studies manages post-undergraduate education at UIW. Applicants can check the status of their applications by contacting the Graduate Admissions office. The following general criteria apply to all graduate programs:

Where to Apply:
- Apply through the Graduate Application Portal

Application Fee: The application fee is $20.

Admission Criteria:
- Transcripts
- Minimum GPA as specified in the program requirements
- Bachelor's degree in a related field
- Scores on the TOEFL/IELTS
- Scores on the GRE/GMAT
- Additional supplements such as a resume, letters of recommendation, and work sample.

English Proficiency Test Scores for International Students:
The following minimum English language proficiency scores are recommended:
- TOEFL: IBT 79-83
- TOEIC: 650-700
- PTE: 53-56
- IELTS: 6.5
- Duolingo English Test: 105-110.

Name: University of California - Berkeley Campus
Overview: The University of California - Berkeley Campus is an esteemed university situated in Berkeley, USA. It offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various fields of study, including online degree programs for distance education students. The university's main campus is located in Berkeley, and it provides education in diverse fields such as Engineering. UC Berkeley Campus has a variety of undergraduate programs to offer, along with a rich selection of over 20 postgraduate programs. The estimated cost of attendance for international and domestic students may vary based on the selected course. For instance, for an international student, the average tuition and fees, besides other miscellaneous expenses, amount to around 57,64,976. In order to assist students financially, the university offers scholarships, work-study programs, and other funding options. Moreover, UC Berkeley Campus has a dedicated Career Planning Service team that helps students in creating effective CVs and securing employment opportunities, be it after graduation, for a part-time or summer job, or even an internship. Find out more in-depth details about the University of California - Berkeley Campus on Leap Scholar, and discover the perfect course to fulfill your academic goals. UC Berkeley excels in several fields, ranking first in chemistry and environment/ecology, third in physics and space science, fourth in economics and business, fifth in biology and biochemistry, and seventh in engineering, along with the arts and humanities among 22 topic ratings.

The University of California Berkeley (UCB) is home to more than 32,000 undergraduate and 10,000 graduate students. The university adopted the color scheme of Berkeley Blue and California Gold, with blue representing the Yale University graduates who played a vital role in establishing UCB, and gold symbolizing the "Golden State" of California.

Name: University of Louisiana
Overview: The University of Louisiana, located in Lafayette, USA, offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs as well as online degrees for distance education students. Its main campus is situated in Lafayette. Tuition costs may vary depending on the chosen program for both domestic and international students, with an estimated average of INR 2854808, excluding additional expenses. The university provides scholarships, work-study opportunities, and other funding options to support students financially. Furthermore, the Career Planning Service team assists students in developing their CVs and finding suitable employment, whether it be after graduation, part-time, or during the summer or internship periods.
Eligibility Overview:
Guidelines for Admission: 

The University of Louisiana offers a range of Bachelor's degree programs including Business, Computer Sciences, Agriculture Business, Biology, Arts, Psychology, and others. The admissions process and mandatory requirements for the university are outlined below. 

Undergraduate Admissions:

Students must submit their high school diploma or completion certificate along with their original transcripts. The minimum requirement for grade point average is 2.35. Students can submit scores from standardized tests such as ACT (code 1598) or SAT (code 6482). Additionally, an English proficiency exam is mandatory. 

Graduate Admissions: 

The University of Louisiana at Monroe provides over 20 graduate degree programs, some of which are popular in Business, Biology, Music, Criminal Justice, Nursing, and Psychology. Please contact gradadmissions@ulm.edu for further information on admissions to ULM's graduate programs. 

To apply, candidates are required to submit a complete proposal, a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution, and official transcripts in English. Other requirements include scores from standardized tests such as GRE/GMAT, a minimum GPA of 2.75, and a statement of financial position. Candidates must also provide proof of a valid visa. 

English Proficiency Test Requirements:

International students whose first language is not English must submit test scores to demonstrate their proficiency in English. However, exemption is granted in the following cases:
- Students for whom English is their first language
- Candidates with a minimum score of 100 on the TOEFL IBT, 600 on the TOEFL PBT, 250 on the TOEFL CBT, or 7.0 on the IELTS
- Students who have completed a four-year college degree in the United States

The university accepts scores from the following tests: 
- IELTS with a minimum score of 5.5
- TOEFL IBT with a minimum score of 61, TOEFL PBT with a minimum score of 500, or TOEFL CBT with a minimum score of 173 
- Duolingo with a minimum score of 85.
Placement:
At the University of Louisiana, students have a plethora of opportunities and employment options available to them. With a range of festivals and events organised on campus, the university aims to attract potential employees and help students achieve their career aspirations. Additionally, the university has partnered with the Handshake portal, enabling students to easily search and apply for suitable jobs and career prospects.

As a means to supplement their income, students can also work while studying at the university. Internships are a popular choice for students, as they provide valuable hands-on experience. Moreover, the university offers internal career opportunities, allowing students to take a break from their studies and gain practical work experience within the campus.

Upon graduation, students can expect to earn an average annual salary of $94,700 in the United States. The salary range in the country is between $24,000 to $423,000 per year, providing a wide scope for earning potential after completing studies at the university.

Name: University of Dayton
Overview: The University of Dayton, a private and Catholic research university located in Dayton, Ohio, was established in 1850 by the Society of Mary, making it Ohio's second-largest university. With a 72% acceptance rate, it has become a top choice among students. Its academic structure consists of five colleges: the School of Education & Health Sciences, the College of Arts & Sciences, the School of Law, the School of Business Administration, and the School of Engineering. The university offers a wide range of programs, including over 80 undergraduate degrees, 50 postgraduate degrees, and 10 doctorate programs, as well as several minor degrees. Its most popular and highly ranked courses are in the fields of Art Education, Cyber Security, Aerospace Engineering, Communication, and Marketing. On average, the annual cost for tuition and accommodation is approximately $61,000; however, the university provides numerous scholarships and grants that can bring down the cost to $32,000. With a vast network of highly successful alumni in top industries, the university has an impressive 93% placement rate for its graduates.
Eligibility Overview: At this university, applicants must meet certain requirements in order to be considered for admission. Specifically, they must have a minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 2.30, equivalent to 77-79%, in order to be eligible. Additionally, letters of recommendation are highly valued by the university and can significantly improve an applicant's chances of being accepted. It is important to note that the length of your GPA should be above 2.30, or 77-79%, and recommendation letters are crucial for admission. In terms of English proficiency, there are various options available to applicants that are acceptable at this university.

The data provided pertains to the housing options available for students at a university, both on and off-campus.

1. On-Campus Accommodation:
All students, including undergraduate and graduate students, are eligible to avail accommodations provided by the university. The university also offers on-campus food facilities that are accessible to all students. Detailed information on on-campus housing can be found on the university's website.

2. Off-Campus Accommodation:
The university provides a range of off-campus housing options for students, all of which are located within a convenient walking distance from the University of Dayton or Wright State University. The average monthly cost for these accommodations ranges from USD 550 to USD 850, with the rent not including meals. These off-campus housing options offer various amenities such as furnished rooms, kitchen with modern appliances, including a dishwasher and microwave, central air conditioning, full-size washer and dryer, and common spaces. For those looking to opt for shared or single room options, as well as apartments with multiple beds, there are plenty of options available. Course Description: University of Dayton is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Dayton was founded in 1850. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Dayton is ranked 912th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. Name: Louisiana Tech University
Overview:
The Louisiana Tech University, situated in Ruston, USA, is a prestigious educational institution. It offers a range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs across various fields of study, including Science. Students can also opt for online degree courses, making it a convenient option for distance learners. The university has its main campus in Ruston, providing students with a diverse and inclusive learning environment.

At Louisiana Tech University, students can choose from a wide range of programs that suit their interests and career goals. The average cost of attendance may vary for international and domestic students according to their selected course. As per our estimates, the average tuition and fees, excluding additional expenses, are approximately 1234688. The university has numerous scholarship opportunities, work-study programs, and funding options to support students in their academic journey.

Apart from academic excellence, Louisiana Tech University also focuses on aiding students in their career development. The Career Planning Service team assists students in building impactful resumes and finding suitable job opportunities after graduation. They help students secure part-time, full-time, summer, and internship positions, enabling them to kickstart their professional journey with confidence and direction. For more detailed information on Louisiana Tech University, visit Leap Scholar and explore their diverse range of courses, tailored to fulfill your academic aspirations.
Eligibility Overview:
Below are the entrance requirements for Louisiana Tech University, which includes minimum ACT and SAT scores. Please note that to be admitted for the fall semester, remedial courses must be taken during the summer at a school that offers them, if required.

ACT: A minimum subscore of 19 for Math is needed.
New SAT: A score of 510 for Math (ERW + M) or an old SAT score of 460 (CR + M).
Old SAT (pre 2016 test date): A 500 for Evidence-Based Reading and Writing (ERW) or 450 for Critical Reading (CR).

It is highly recommended to submit an application for admission. The university may still consider students who do not meet all requirements, based on their potential for completing the degree and adding diversity to the student body. Factors such as age, experience, cultural background, and creative abilities will also be taken into account.
Placement: No text provided
Accommodation:
The form for faculty and staff accommodation at the university should be completed and submitted to the Human Resources department, either in person or via email. Submitting the form to strammel@latech.edu is the recommended method for submission. Human Resources will review the form and determine if further information is needed to support the stated condition. In such cases, the employee will be required to provide additional details.

Furthermore, the form will be shared with the relevant dean or division head, after any necessary redactions have been made to protect the confidentiality of medical information. For more detailed information on this process, visit the university's website at https://www.latech.edu/coronavirus/return-to-campus-plan/accommodations/.

Name: New York Institute of Technology
Overview:
The New York Institute of Technology (NYIT) is a renowned university situated in Old Westbury, USA. Located in New York's Old Westbury region, NYIT attracts students from across the globe, offering a diverse range of undergraduate, graduate, certificate, and online degree programs since its establishment in 1955. With over 25,000 enrolled students, NYIT boasts 11 undergraduate programs and 14 postgraduate programs, covering a variety of fields, including engineering.

Housing is available at the main campus in Old Westbury, as well as at the Manhattan residence hall. The residential rooms in Manhattan are equipped with essential amenities, including private toilets, comfortable beds, roomy closets, study desks, full-sized refrigerators, microwaves, and individual air conditioning units.

While NYIT offers top-quality education, it also values the importance of career development. The university has a dedicated team that focuses on career planning, assisting students in creating impressive resumes and finding suitable employment opportunities, such as internships, part-time jobs, summer positions, and post-graduation positions.

The cost of attendance may vary for different programs, and both domestic and international students can avail financial aid, work-study opportunities, and scholarships to fund their education at NYIT. The spring term fee for the year 2023 is estimated to be $19,980, making it an affordable option for students seeking quality education in New York.

If you want to learn more about the New York Institute of Technology and its offerings, visit Leap Scholar. Browse through the website to discover the perfect course that aligns with your academic goals and aspirations.
Eligibility Overview:
1. Admission requirements for the university's graduate program include a Bachelor's degree or equivalent from an accredited institution in fields such as computer science, engineering, management, mathematics, information technology, and liberal arts. 
2. Applicants must have a minimum undergraduate GPA of 2.85 in order to be considered for full matriculation into the program. 
3. It is also required to submit GRE scores as part of the application process.
Placement: New York Tech prioritizes the career paths of its graduates. Six months post-graduation, all alumni receive Final Destination Surveys. These surveys are cross-checked against US Department of Labor reports and quarterly Placement Council updates. According to the surveys, 95% of New York Tech alumni secure positions in their respective fields or pursue advanced education within six months of graduation. Continuous involvement with New York Tech's Office of Career Success and Experimental Education provides alumni with ongoing opportunities for professional development. For job-seeking alumni, Handshake, the university's online career platform offers various features such as scheduling consultations with career advisors, submitting resumes, researching potential employers, and applying for jobs.
Accommodation:
1. Discover the vibrant and stimulating learning environment of New York Tech by choosing to live in our on-campus residence hall located in the heart of the bustling city. Become a part of the millions of ambitious individuals who seek to leave their mark in New York City by residing in one of its most lively areas. Experience convenience and security at our Manhattan residence hall, just a short bus or metro ride away from the university. Our residence hall is managed by a graduate hall director and resident assistants, ensuring safety and support for all its inhabitants. 

Why Choose On-Campus? Immerse yourself in the energetic community of the Upper East Side of Manhattan, one of the most coveted districts in New York City. Our building at 1760 Third, situated at 97th Street and Third Avenue, provides round-the-clock on-site security and maintenance services. It also offers a variety of communal facilities such as a shared kitchen, fitness center, and social and study areas for the convenience of our New York Tech students residing on designated floors. Each room is equipped with essential amenities including a bed, closet, desk, full-size refrigerator, microwave, and individual air conditioning control. Plus, all of our rooms have private bathrooms for added privacy and comfort.
Course Ranking: New York Tech is made up of five schools and two colleges that have a strong focus on technology and practical scientific research. The university's business programme has received high rankings in subject evaluations. In fact, in 2021, US News & World Report placed New York Tech at number 273 in undergraduate business rankings. In the previous two years, the university was ranked 292 (2020) and 312 (2019) respectively. US News & World Report takes into account factors such as student selectivity (25%), input from business school administrators (25%), and post-graduation job outcomes (21%) in their ranking methodology for business programmes. This data provides valuable insights into the performance and reputation of New York Tech's undergraduate business programme.

Name: Northern Kentucky University
Overview: Northern Kentucky University, located in Highland Heights, USA, is a renowned institution offering a diverse range of undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various fields of study. The university also provides online degree programmes for students pursuing distance education. It is known for its exceptional education in multiple disciplines, including Business. The main campus of Northern Kentucky University is situated in Highland Heights. The university boasts of 19 undergraduate and 6 postgraduate programs, attracting a diverse community of students. The cost of attending the university may vary for international and domestic students, depending on the chosen course. On average, the estimated tuition and fees (excluding miscellaneous expenses) for an international student is approximately INR 21,18,260. Northern Kentucky University offers a multitude of financial aids, such as scholarships, work-study programs and funding, to support students in their academic journey. Furthermore, the university offers career planning services to assist students in building a strong CV and securing employment opportunities after completing their degree. This includes part-time jobs, summer jobs, internships and full-time employment opportunities. For more information on Northern Kentucky University, log on to Leap Scholar and discover the perfect course to fulfill your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview:
The criteria for admission to our university include: 
- A satisfactory score on the TOEFL taken within the past two years, with a minimum of 500 on the paper-based exam or 61 on the internet-based (iBT) exam. For post-baccalaureate programs, a score of 550 on the paper-based exam or 79 on the iBT is required.
- Evidence of successful completion of freshman-level English writing at a regionally-accredited American college or university, with a satisfactory overall GPA. Non-native English speakers may still be asked to take the TOEFL if several years have passed since their last English classes or if they have returned to school.
- A satisfactory verbal score on the ACT or SAT taken within the past two years, with a minimum of 18 on the ACT or 430 (until 3/15/16) or 25 (effective 3/16/16) on the SAT.
- A satisfactory result from the International English Language Testing Service within the past two years, with a minimum overall score of 5.5 and sub-scores of 5.0 or higher in reading and writing. For post-baccalaureate programs, a minimum score of 6.5 on the IELTS is required.
- Completion of the American English Language Program at NKU with an average of at least 80% in each class.
Placement: No text provided
Accommodation: The primary mission of the Office for Student Accessibility (OSA) is to ensure that students with disabilities who qualify have equal access to all academic and extracurricular programs. Our goal is to facilitate a supportive and inclusive environment where these students can reach their full potential by providing reasonable accommodations and personalized assistance. We are committed to empowering students with disabilities by promoting self-advocacy and fostering their independence. Additionally, we strive to promote a greater understanding of disabilities and accessibility among all members of the university community in accordance with federal laws. For more detailed information regarding our services, please visit our website at https://inside.nku.edu/osa.html.

Name: University of North Dakota
Overview: The University of North Dakota has a long-standing history, established in 1883. Located in Grand Forks, North Dakota, USA, the university has four main campuses: northern, central, western, and eastern. UND provides various programs for undergraduate, graduate, postgraduate, doctoral, and professional students. With an academic focus on subjects such as Engineering, Human Development, Business and Public Administration, Medicine, Nursing, and Education, the university offers a diverse range of opportunities for students. Students can expect to pay an average tuition fee of 25,000 USD, with an additional cost of living expenses that can reach up to 37,000 USD per year, including the cost of housing, textbooks, and technology fees. In order to assist students with financial burdens, UND offers scholarships and other means of financial aid, based on academic performance. With a strong track record of student success, UND graduates can anticipate an average salary of 67,000 USD upon graduation, making it one of the leading universities in the state.
Eligibility Overview: The English language holds a significant role in achieving successful academic progress. It is imperative that international students possess proficient skills in both written and spoken English to excel in courses taught solely in English at the university level. As such, to be considered for admission, non-native English speakers are required to complete a language assessment. The UND Institution Code, 6878, must be provided when submitting test results. The minimum scores required for undergraduate studies are as follows: 525 for the TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) paper-based test, 195 for the TOEFL computer-based test, and 71 for the TOEFL internet-based test. IELTS (International English Language Testing System) score of 6.0 or higher, completed within the last three years, is also accepted by UND. Retaking the test is necessary if the results are older than two years. A Duolingo English Test score of 95 or above and a PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English Academic) score of 50 or higher are also accepted. Alternatively, completing ELS Language Centers' Intensive Level 112 will result in the College Entrance Exam Board issuing a certificate. These language assessment measures are essential for UND to ensure the academic success and progress of international students.
Placement: No text provided
Accommodation: UND's student life includes a wealth of housing options, both on and off campus. Details and resources for housing can be found by following this link: https://und.edu/student-life/housing/. This link is the best location to find information about housing for those enrolled at the university, whether they plan to live on campus or off campus.

Name: East Carolina University
Overview:
East Carolina University (ECU) is a prominent public university, established in 1907. Located in Greenville, North Carolina, the campus spreads over 1600 acres. The institution has been ranked 28th in the Best Medical Schools category by US News and World Report. Its overall acceptance rate stands at 79%. Along with a highly regarded medical program, ECU also boasts a reputable College of Business, accredited by AACSB - placing it among the top 5% of business schools worldwide. Its extensive range of programs includes undergraduate studies, master's degrees, 15 doctoral programs, 50 graduate certificates, and 6 first-professional courses. In addition to its traditional classes, ECU also offers over 100 online courses in fields ranging from business and healthcare to education and technology. Among the most sought-after courses at ECU are MBA, Accounting, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, Anthropology, Biology, and Biomedical Sciences. 

Student housing is looked after by the Division of Student Affairs, with on-campus accommodation available for all students. There are 15 types of college residence halls and an exclusive College Hill Suites (CHS), designated for upper-division students. All rooms in residence halls have been equipped with modern amenities, such as adjustable beds, air conditioning, and a small fridge. Additionally, the university has adopted a tobacco-free environment, promoting healthy living on campus. 

ECU has a lively campus community, with over 500 student organizations, including groups focused on tourism, hospitality, and sports management. Students can also participate in outdoor adventure trips, fitness classes (yoga, pilates, etc.), and various sports events. 

The total fees for an undergraduate program, including tuition, room and board, books and supplies, personal expenses, transportation, and loan fees, come to $39,592 USD. For graduate programs, the total fees are $34,758 USD. Financial aid opportunities are available to students in the form of scholarships, such as the Gamma Iota Sigma Scholarship, the Daniel Gluckman Scholarship, and the Page Family Scholarship.
Eligibility Overview:
The following requirements must be met for freshman admission: 
1. You must have taken these courses during high school:
4 English courses focused on grammar, composition, and literature.
Algebra I, Geometry, Algebra II, and another higher level math course that requires Algebra II.
Natural Sciences: A living or biological science, a physical science, and a science with a lab component.
2 social studies courses, one of which must cover US history.
2 courses in a language other than English, both in the same language. American Sign Language and Latin are accepted at ECU.
It is recommended that you take a foreign language, math, and science course in your senior year to better prepare for the first year curriculum. 
If you did not meet these requirements, refer to the Transfer Admission Guidelines to learn how to apply to ECU.
If you attended a Cooperative Innovative High School (Early College), please see the Supplemental Notices for further application information.
Placement: No text provided
Accommodation: ECU has implemented a policy to boost student retention by requiring freshmen to live on campus. This has been proven through statistics, which show that students who reside on campus return for their next year of study at a higher rate and attain a higher GPA compared to those who choose to live off campus in their first year. By submitting a waiver, students are choosing to live at home under the "freshman residency exception" and are obligated to enrol in a section of ECU's freshman seminar class, COAD 1000, during their first semester. Additionally, they must also purchase a Gold 450 meal plan (or greater) each semester of their enrollment to better engage with the school and their peers. For more details, please refer to ECU's Campus Living website:https://campusliving.ecu.edu/

Name: New York Medical College
Overview:
New York Medical College is the top educational and health research institution in the Hudson Valley. It was founded in 1860 and is one of the oldest and most respected private universities focusing on health sciences in the country. The college has a student body of over 1,400, with 1,300 residents and clinical fellows, 3,000 academic staff, and 15,000 alumni. Its location in Valhalla, NY, in Westchester County, is just a short 30-minute drive from New York City.

In 2011, New York Medical College joined the prestigious Touro College and University System. It offers a range of graduate programs, including a Master in Public Health, M.S. in Speech-Language Pathology, M.S. in Biostatistics, M.S. in Biostatistics, Doctor of Public Health, and Graduate & Advanced Certificates. The picturesque lower Hudson Valley region of New York State provides the perfect setting for students to pursue their academic and professional goals.

New York Medical College provides a Career Planning Service team to assist students in building their resumes and securing employment opportunities, whether after completing their degree or for part-time work, internships, or summer jobs. The university has on-campus housing available for full-time students.

For international students, the estimated cost of tuition and fees, not including additional expenses, is approximately $29,175. New York Medical College offers various scholarships, work-study programs, and funding opportunities to support its students.

For more information about New York Medical College's programs and offerings, visit Leap Scholar. Discover the perfect course to help you achieve your academic goals with the help of this renowned institution.

Name: SUNY Polytechnic Institute - Albany
Overview:
Founded in 1966, the State University of New York, known as SUNY Polytechnic Institute, is a distinguished public college with multiple campuses spread across New York, particularly in Marcy and Albany. It is a vital component of the prestigious SUNY system. This esteemed institution is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, ensuring the highest standard of quality education. Previously a major department of the University of Albany, it was officially established as a separate campus in 2003. As one of the five polytechnic schools in the nation, SUNY Polytechnic Institute has the distinction of being the first college to offer degree programs in the field of nanotechnology. The institution is also recognized by the Board of Regents of the State of New York, and all of its academic programs are certified by the State Department of Education.

SUNY Polytechnic Institute offers a diverse range of degree programs, including 25 undergraduate degrees, 18 graduate degrees, and 5 doctoral degrees across five distinct colleges. The college attracts students from all over the United States and 20 other countries. Some of the popular fields of study at this university include business, communication and behavioral sciences, computer science, engineering, arts and sciences, nursing, and nanoscale engineering and nanoscale science.

Apart from delivering a rich classroom experience, SUNY Polytechnic Institute also provides exceptional internship and employment prospects through collaborations with various corporate organizations on its campuses. These partnerships not only offer students practical exposure but also present them with lucrative career opportunities. With a student-to-faculty ratio of 13:1, the average class size at SUNY Polytechnic Institute is approximately 18 students. The dedicated faculty members conduct interactive sessions, providing students with a personalized learning experience. Moreover, the Albany campus of this college houses a pilot-scale semiconductor research and development center. In addition to this, research on nanoscale science and engineering, commercialization efforts, and development, there is a wide spectrum of research projects undertaken by students, faculty, and staff at other campuses.

With an acceptance rate of around 69%, SUNY Polytechnic Institute follows a moderately selective admission procedure. According to the QS World University Rankings, this university is ranked between 751-800 globally.

Placement:
1. To obtain course credit for an internship and validate the experience by adding it to your academic transcript, you can search and apply for internships using the Handshake system or on your own. You must evaluate your academic achievement as an intern and communicate any changes in status at your internship site to your internship course instructor and the Office of Career Services. There are three documents that must be used for this process in order for your internship course teacher to submit your final grade for the course. 
2. The Internship Learning Contract is a crucial document that must be completed jointly by you and a member of your program's faculty, chosen with the help of your program advisor. This contract establishes the academic significance of your work experience and serves as the curriculum for your course. You will work with your internship course teacher to determine the amount of contact and academic coursework necessary based on the number of credits you are seeking for the course. Your site supervisor will also outline your responsibilities as an intern. 
3. At the end of your internship, your site supervisor will be asked to fill out a Student Internship Employer Evaluation to provide feedback on your performance. You will also be required to complete a Student Internship Evaluation to share your thoughts on the value of the experience. 
4. Another opportunity for SUNY Poly candidates is through Parker Dewey's launchpad, which offers non-credit, paid Microinternships. These are short-term project-based work experiences that allow you to develop your skills, network in your field, and determine if your academic program is the right fit for your professional goals. Microinternships range from 5-40 hours and are always conducted remotely. 
5. If you need assistance with your internship, whether it is for course credit, non-credit, funded, unfunded, online, or on-site, SUNY Poly is here to support you. You can always reach out for help and guidance, and the main platform used by both students and employers is Handshake.
Accommodation:
SUNY Polytechnic Institute offers an extensive range of programs and activities for students. This includes academic counseling, extracurricular opportunities, and resources such as the Career Center which prepares students for their future. SUNY Poly also has a wide variety of modern facilities, including state-of-the-art research labs and recreational options like sports facilities and dining halls.

Our student services aim to support and guide students in their academic and personal growth. We believe that well-rounded individuals emerge from a balance of rigorous academic studies and engaging activities outside of the classroom. Our Career Center provides students with valuable resources and connections to ensure their success in the job market.

SUNY Poly also boasts impressive facilities that provide students with a truly dynamic learning environment. Our state-of-the-art research labs offer students hands-on experience with cutting-edge technology. For recreational activities, our sports facilities are open to all students and our dining halls offer a variety of healthy meal options.

For off-campus accommodation, we provide a comprehensive list of nearby lodgings for the convenience of our visitors. We also include information on other bed and breakfast options for a variety of choices. Some nearby places include Albany, CrestHill Suites, Hilton Garden Inn, Fairfield Inn by Marriott, and Utica. Additionally, we have a list of accommodations available at Hampton Inn and Holiday Inn & Express Suites.

For further details, please visit our website: https://sunypoly.edu/university-conferences-events/accommodations.html.

Name: Anderson University
Overview:
Established in the year 1917, Anderson University is a well-known private Christian institution, located in the charming city of Anderson, Indiana. With an average acceptance rate of 63%, it caters to a diverse student body of 3,000 individuals and boasts a faculty count of 112 full-time members. The university offers a plethora of courses including Biochemistry, Business Administration, Physical Science, Journalism and Worship Arts. 
Situated in the heart of Central Indiana, the university campus houses the prestigious Nicolson Library which is stocked with a vast collection of books, journals, articles, electronic resources and various study areas. In addition to this, students can also enroll in the university's highly sought-after Honors Program, which is a selective and competitive program exclusively for students with excellent academic performance and extracurricular involvement. 
For on-campus accommodation, students can choose from a variety of options such as Martin Hall, Myers Hall, Dunn Hall, Smith Hall, and Morrison Hall, to name a few. These residential halls offer single, double and quadruple occupancy rooms. Fair Commons is another popular option among students, which provides apartment-style living. Apart from academics, students can also participate in a wide range of academic, social, service and interest clubs such as Alpha Chi, Dativus, and College Democrats. 
The university also boasts a vigorous Intramurals Program, which offers 16 different sports including spike ball, volleyball, basketball, and Wiffleball, among others, along with four annual tournaments. Additionally, the university campus is home to three art galleries - The Jeeninga Museum, The Wilson Gallery, and The Warner Sallman Collection. 
According to recent statistics, about 98.9% of Anderson University graduates have been successfully employed upon graduation. For individuals aspiring to study at Anderson University, the estimated undergraduate cost of attendance is USD 42,310. Financial aid is available in the form of scholarships, grants, loans, and student employment opportunities such as the Frank Bannon Grant, Minority Teacher Scholarship, Esports Activity Award, Legacy Scholarship, Federal Direct Subsidized Loan, and Yellow Ribbon Program.
Eligibility Overview:
The following documents are required for high school students to apply to Anderson University:

1. Official high school transcript
2. Essay addressing educational goals, faith journey, and reasons for choosing Anderson University
3. SAT or ACT test scores (for undergraduate programs)
4. GMAT, GPA, or two years of relevant work experience (for masters)
5. Recommendation letter, if applicable
6. English proficiency test scores

These are the necessary requirements for high school students to complete their application at Anderson University, along with some other important factors to consider. These documents include a student's academic performance through their high school transcript, an essay stating their educational objectives, personal beliefs, and rationale for selecting Anderson University. Also, students are required to submit their SAT or ACT scores for undergraduate programs, and for masters, they may provide either their GMAT, GPA, or two years of relevant work experience. Additionally, a recommendation letter is optional to include in the application, and students must also submit their English proficiency test scores. Ensuring that these requirements are met will greatly assist students in their journey to join Anderson University.

Name: Morgan State University
Overview: Situated in Baltimore, Maryland, Morgan State University is a distinguished public research university, known for its historical significance as an institution that promotes equal opportunities for students of all backgrounds. Established in 1867, it boasts of being one of the foremost universities in the United States, with a classification of R2: Doctoral Universities by the Carnegie Foundation. As a proud member of the prestigious Thurgood Marshall College Fund, Morgan State University offers a diverse range of academic programs, each designed to instill core values in its students. Some of its top-notch programs include M.A. in Economics, M.S. in Psychometrics, M.P.H. in Public Health, B.A. in Multimedia Journalism, and MBA. The university is committed to providing its students with ample internship opportunities, allowing them to gain hands-on experience and develop essential skills. These internships can be pursued on either a part-time or full-time basis, enabling students to build valuable connections in their chosen fields. The average tuition fee at Morgan State University is an affordable CAD 18k, and students can also apply for various scholarships and grants offered by the institution. By choosing Morgan State University, students can benefit from a well-rounded education that focuses on practical learning and prepares them for success in their future careers.
Eligibility Overview:
These are the preliminary criteria for admissions at our university. In order to be considered for admission, you must meet the following requirements:

1. Completed application with all required documentation.
2. Pay the application fee.
3. Official transcripts from high school or college.
4. Qualifying K-12 diploma or GED, if applicable.
5. Demonstrated proficiency in English, specifically reading, writing, and listening skills.
6. SAT or ACT scores, if available.
7. *Transferable credits with a minimum of 2.0 GPA.
8. 2-23 *Transferable credits with a 2.0 GPA and meeting the standard freshmen requirements.
9. 24 or more *Transferable credits with a 2.0 GPA and a minimum of 2.0 high school GPA.

English Language Requirements:
All applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English by providing one of the following:

1. TOEFL scores with a minimum of 80 on iBT, 213 on CBT, or 550 on PBT.
2. IELTS scores with a minimum of 6.0.
3. Pearson Test of English scores with a minimum of 58.
4. Completion of English Composition I and II with a minimum grade of C.
5. Successful completion of the ELS English for Academic Purposes program.

Name: Youngstown State University
Overview: Youngstown State University, located in Youngstown, USA, offers a diverse range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs both on campus and through online distance education. The university prioritizes providing high-quality education in various fields, including the popular stream of Business. Its main campus in Youngstown offers 0 undergraduate programs and 5 postgraduate programs. The cost of attendance for international and domestic students may vary depending on the course chosen. Typically, international students can expect tuition and fees around INR 23,97,609 - excluding miscellaneous expenditures. The university offers scholarships, work-study options, and various funding opportunities to support its students' education. Moreover, the Career Planning Service team assists students in building their CVs and finding suitable employment opportunities, whether for full-time, part-time, summer, or internship positions, upon graduation. Explore more about Youngstown State University on Leap Scholar and discover the perfect course to achieve your academic goals.
Eligibility Overview:
The following requirements must be met to ensure acceptance into the university:
- A high school diploma or equivalent is necessary for admission.
- For those whose primary language is English, no additional language proficiency test is required.
- Applicants whose first language is not English must prove competence in English in one of the following ways: 
    - Obtain a minimum score of 67 on the Internet Based Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) from Educational Testing Service (ETS) 
    - Achieve a minimum composite score of 6.0 (with at least 5.0 in each subscale) on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) 
    - Obtain a score of 58 or above on the Pearson Test of English (PTE Academic) 
- Applicants can be unconditionally admitted if they achieve a cumulative SAT score of 920 or higher on the evidence-based reading and writing tests, as well as the math test.
- A composite ACT score of 17 or above is required (YSU code: 3368). 
- A high school Cumulative Grade Point Average (GPA) of at least 2.00 on a 4.00 scale is necessary for admission.
- For international students, scanned copies of official transcripts in PDF format are accepted for review. However, if admitted, the original transcripts and degree certificates must be submitted.
- If English proficiency is not waived, the official Language Test Report must be sent directly from the testing center to the YSU Office of International Admissions (code: 1975).

Name: University of San Francisco
Overview: Established in 1855, the University of San Francisco is a renowned private Jesuit educational institution located in San Francisco, California, USA. The university holds accreditation from the WASC Senior College and University Commission, further solidifying its reputation as a reputable university. With a current enrollment of over 10,636 students, the University of San Francisco offers a wide range of programs in some of the most in-demand fields, including Nursing, Marketing Management, Business Administration and Management, and Finance. The university boasts an impressive number of majors and minors, with a variety of choices available through its three colleges and schools: the School of Management, the College of Arts and Sciences, and the School of Nursing and Health Professions. For students seeking to take their education to the next level, the university also offers over 60 doctoral, master's, and credential programs, as well as 34 graduate certificates and two online programs. Additionally, the University of San Francisco provides students with the opportunity to further enrich their education through study abroad programs in more than 40 countries. The university is highly regarded for its exceptional programs, including M.Sc. in Data Science, M.Sc. in Computer Science, E.M.B.A, M.Sc. in Information Systems, and M.B.A in Organizational Development. One of the university's biggest draws is its impressive employment rate, with many graduates securing desirable positions upon graduation. The University of San Francisco is committed to ensuring its students' success by offering various scholarships and financial aid options, such as the School of Management International Merit Scholarship, Academic Merit Scholarship Awards, and Athletic Scholarships.
Eligibility Overview:
These are the qualifications needed for participation at the University of San Francisco (USF) as an international student.

Eligibility Criteria:
In order to apply to USF, international students must fulfill the following requirements:
1. Education Requirements:
For undergraduate programs, applicants must have completed high school and for graduate programs, a bachelor's degree is required. The following subjects should have been studied by the applicant:
- English - at least 4 years
- Mathematics - at least 3 years (Engineering candidates must have completed precalculus)
- Social Sciences - at least 3 years
- Laboratory Science - at least 2 years
- Foreign Language - at least 2 years (Nursing applicants should have taken Physics or Biology during their senior secondary studies)
2. Standardized Exam Requirements:
Graduate and postgraduate courses accept the GRE/GMAT, whereas undergraduate courses require the SAT/ACT.
3. English Proficiency:
For various undergraduate and graduate courses, the candidate must meet the minimum requirements for English proficiency, which are as follows:
- TOEFL IBT - 80, with a minimum of 65
- TOEFL PBT - 580 (for master's students)
- IELTS Academic - 6.5 bands, with a minimum of 6 bands (for master's students)
- PTE Academic - 62 (for master's students)
- 105th Duolingo English Test - minimum score required: 95

For more information on off-campus housing options, students can refer to various websites such as collegestudentapartments.com, sfhousingservices.com, student.com and erasmusu.com.
Course Ranking: The curriculum rankings for University of San Francisco consistently place its business courses among the top schools. The university's Global MBA programme has been given a 2021 QS topic ranking of 141-150, following previous rankings of 131-140 in 2020 and 2018. These rankings take into account all aspects of the courses, including content and job opportunities. In addition, the Graduate Business School has been recognized by US News & World Report, with a placement of 99-131 in both 2019 and 2021. The undergraduate business programme also received a strong ranking of 132 for 2021. US News & World Report's methodology for subject rankings includes factors such as student selectivity (25%), input from business school administrators (25%), and post-graduation success (21%). These accolades showcase the University of San Francisco's commitment to providing top-notch business education and preparing students for successful careers.
University Ranking: Founded in the year 1855, the University of San Francisco offers over 230 undergraduate, graduate, professional, and certificate programs on its main campus. Apart from this, the university also provides programs at various other campuses. In accordance with the QS - World University Ranking, the University of San Francisco has consistently secured a spot between 801 and 1000 for the last three years, from 2018 to 2020. Keeping in mind that Times Higher Education (THE) equally emphasizes on Teaching, Research, and Citations, the university has been placed at the 103rd position in the 2021 edition of the US News & World Report's National University Ranking. However, in the previous years, USF had achieved a higher rank of 96th and 97th in 2018 and 2019, respectively. Interestingly, the US News & World Report considers various factors, including the number of citations, global research reputation, regional research reputation (12.5% each), and other such parameters to determine their rankings. In a nutshell, the University of San Francisco's consistent performance and reputable education have earned its well-deserved place in the global academic arena.
