Name: Drew University
Overview: Drew University, situated in Madison, New Jersey, was founded in 1867. It is a prominent educational institution offering a diverse academic curriculum, with a wide range of courses in arts and sciences. The university comprises three distinct schools: the Caspersen School, Drew Theological School, and College of Liberal Arts, providing graduate studies in multiple fields. The university is spread over an expansive 186-acre campus, offering an ideal learning environment for students. Drew University offers undergraduate and postgraduate degrees, including BA, BS, MA, and Ph.D. in 39 different areas of study. The programs offered cover various disciplines such as science, arts, finance, business, cultural studies, performing arts, and social work. The College of Liberal Arts offers several majors, including social sciences, natural sciences, language, humanities, and literature & arts. The Drew Theological School prepares students for careers in ministry and provides opportunities for theological academic pursuits. The Caspersen School offers specialized and interdisciplinary masters and doctoral degrees. Additionally, the university offers pre-professional programs, combined degree programs, and non-degree certificate programs. Popular majors among students include business, psychology, biology, theatre arts, and economics. The tuition fee for undergraduate programs is USD 39,828, and for postgraduate programs, it is USD 22,248. Drew University has 15 well-equipped residential halls that offer on-campus accommodation options for students. Private rooms with various amenities are available for students to choose from. The campus boasts more than 90 student-run organizations, clubs, and co-ed societies, catering to the diverse interests of the students. It also has a state-of-the-art athletic center offering various sports activities such as basketball, fencing, field hockey, soccer, swimming, tennis, and more. The average cost of living for students is USD 9,246. The university provides scholarships, including merit-based, Drew action scholarships, and scholarships for students pursuing arts programs. The center for career development and internships supports students in finding relevant internship and job opportunities in their chosen fields. It also assists students in their postgraduate research and educational endeavors.
Eligibility Overview:
Drew University has a minimum GPA requirement of 3.0 for international students. The average GPA for enrolled Drew University students is 3.54. Admitted students typically have an average SAT score of 1235 and an average ACT score of 28. Meeting the English language proficiency requirement is also necessary for admission.

International students must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 to be considered for admission at Drew University. The average grade point average of enrolled students at Drew University is 3.54. The mean scores for admitted students on the SAT and ACT are 1235 and 28. In addition, demonstrating proficiency in the English language is a crucial aspect of the admission process.

Name: Wayne State University
Overview:
Wayne State University is a distinguished public research institution located in the vibrant city of Detroit, Michigan. It was established in 1868 and has since grown to become the third largest university in the state. Offering over 350 programs to its enrollment of more than 26,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students, Wayne State University is known for its academic excellence. Some of its top programs include a Master's in Biomedical Engineering, a General Certificate in Child Welfare, a Master of Arts in Art History, a Doctorate in Civil Engineering, a Master of Science in Pharmaceutical Sciences, and a Master of Fine Arts in Theatre.

The main campus of Wayne State University spans 250 acres in Detroit and boasts more than 100 buildings, including state-of-the-art facilities for its students. In addition to its main campus, Wayne also has six satellite campuses located in Macomb County, Oakland, Jackson, and Wayne. The graduate students at Wayne State University have access to outstanding career resources, such as full-time internships and research opportunities in collaboration with renowned institutions like Michigan State University and the University of Michigan.

Tuition fees at Wayne State University vary depending on the program. However, on average, undergraduate students can expect to pay CAD 14,000 per year for their studies. International students may also apply for financial aid and scholarships offered by Wayne State University to assist with their educational expenses.
Eligibility Overview: University requires a cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 68% from its applicants. Additionally, applicants must attain a minimum score of 990 on their Scholastic Assessment Test (SAT) with the combined scores of math and reading sections, or a minimum composite score of 21 on their American College Test (ACT) if their GPA falls between 62% and 67.5%. All supporting documents, including test scores, must be official and attested in their original format. Applicants who do not wish to take the test have the option to submit alternative documentation, such as two letters of recommendation, two essays, and an activities list. It is crucial to submit all application materials by December 1st to be considered for merit-based scholarships.

Not only will you save time commuting, but your campus home will be a short walk away from all the resources you need, from lecture halls to libraries and labs. With affordable student housing options, you can get involved in student organizations and explore the vibrant community without breaking the bank. Don't miss out on this opportunity to thrive on campus. Learn more about housing options at https://housing.wayne.edu/.

Meanwhile, the university's postgraduate Business & Economics courses have been placed in the 501-600 range by THE in 2021, showcasing its continued growth and development in the field. This rise in rank can be attributed to the university's dedicated faculty, cutting-edge curriculum, and strong industry partnerships. Along with its outstanding business programs, Wayne State University has also been hailed for its Engineering & Technology courses, which have been placed in the 301-400 range by THE for the year 2021. These courses cover various fields such as Chemical and Biomedical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, and Civil Engineering, and have been ranked #84, #94, #106, #116, and #119 respectively. Furthermore, the university's postgraduate Computers courses have been placed in the 201-250 range by THE for the year 2021, making Wayne State University a well-rounded and highly respected institution in the realm of higher education.

Although this represents a slight decline from the 2020 rankings, which saw the university drop by 18 points, the global ranking for 2021 stands at a respectable #327. Name: Lewis University
Overview: Lewis University, founded in 1932, is a vibrant, coeducational institution offering 80 diverse undergraduate, 35 graduate, and two doctoral programs, along with accreditation for advanced study certificates. With over 100 student organizations, it fosters a welcoming environment for academic and extracurricular pursuits. As a proud member of the NCAA Division II and the Great Lakes Valley Conference, it offers 20 sports options for both men and women, such as volleyball, swimming, basketball, baseball, cross country, softball, tennis, golf, soccer, outdoor and indoor track and field. Being highly selective with an acceptance rate of 58%, Lewis University also offers scholarships to eligible individuals, cutting tuition fees by nearly 50% for international students. This mid-sized Catholic university is renowned for its excellence and provides a diverse range of opportunities for students to explore their passions, with over 100 clubs and organizations available. Moreover, it offers CPT, internships, and employment opportunities at renowned international companies in Chicago, connecting students with top players in the industry. The university also hosts job fairs each semester, inviting Fortune 500 companies to campus, providing students with practical and real-world experiences to enhance their skills and boost their career prospects.
Eligibility Overview:
The be eligible for admission to the college, applicants are required to submit academic and English language score proofs. Listed below are the necessary documents for undergraduate and graduate programmes.

For admission into undergraduate programmes, candidates should provide secondary school transcripts, school completion certificate, proof of English language proficiency, and SAT/ACT scores (if available). Additionally, a copy of their passport and a letter of recommendation are also needed.

To apply for graduate programmes, individuals must present their bachelor's degree transcripts from their university, transcript equivalency evaluation, proof of English language proficiency, and GRE/GMAT scores (if applicable). They are also required to submit two letters of recommendation, a resume/CV, a copy of their passport, and a statement of purpose or essay (depending on the programme).

For international students, English language proficiency is a vital aspect, and the college requires valid proof for admission. The institution evaluates candidates based on their academic and language abilities, along with their overall potential. The provided documents play a crucial role in the admission process. Hence, it is necessary to ensure all the required materials are submitted accurately and on time.

Name: Maryville University
Overview:
Founded in 1872, Maryville University is a renowned private institution located in St. Louis, Missouri, United States. It comprises six esteemed schools and colleges offering a range of 90 undergraduate degrees, 19 master's programs, and 5 doctoral degrees, including over 30 online courses. The university is best known for its programs in Business, Marketing, Management, Psychology, Visual & Performing Arts, Military Technologies & Applied Sciences, and Health Professions & Related Programs. With its prime location, the main campus of Maryville University is just a 20-minute drive from Downtown St. Louis, spread across 130 acres. The university boasts a student-faculty ratio of 14:1, enabling personalized attention to each student. 

Maryville has six affiliated schools and colleges, including The College of Arts & Sciences, The Walker College of Health Professions, The School of Education, The Catherine McAuley School of Nursing, The John E. Simon School of Business, and The School of Adult & Online Education, all of which offer an array of dynamic and comprehensive programs. The on-campus residence at Maryville is designed to cater to the diverse needs of its students while providing a supportive and lively environment. The university's curriculum is designed to provide students with practical knowledge and theoretical foundations, ensuring a holistic learning experience. 

Additionally, Maryville University has a strong alumni association that cultivates a sense of camaraderie and a passion for knowledge among its current students. The cost of in-state tuition at Maryville University is approximately $26,070 per year, excluding additional expenses. The university also offers financial aid and scholarships to full-time students, with an average need-based scholarship amount of $15,586. With its excellent programs, state-of-the-art facilities, and a vibrant community, Maryville University is a prominent institution offering a holistic and rewarding educational experience.

Name: Silicon Valley Intensive English Program at San Mateo Colleges
Overview:
The San Mateo Colleges' Silicon Valley Intensive English Program is an exceptional opportunity for students looking to study the English language before entering college. The institution is located in the bustling city of Redwood City, California, making it an ideal location for international students.

A unique factor of this program is that students who successfully complete SVIEP Level 4 are automatically granted admission to the esteemed San Mateo Colleges of Silicon Valley, which include Skyline College, College of San Mateo, and Cañada College. This offers students a smooth transition from language learning to college academics.

Moreover, the program also hosts various events and workshops, specifically designed for students preparing for college enrollment. These include Transition-To-College workshops to help students familiarize themselves with the American college system. An added benefit is that applicants are not required to submit TOEFL or IELTS scores and can take these tests after arrival. Additionally, SVIEP recognizes EIKEN scores below 2A.

SVIEP offers flexibility in terms of time and duration, with 10 admission dates and multiple modules available. The program provides 15 to 20 hours of weekly instruction, covering essential skills such as reading, speaking, grammar, writing, and American culture.

The curriculum at the Silicon Valley Intensive English Program at San Mateo Colleges is divided into four levels, catering to different proficiency levels. These levels include High Beginner (ESL Level 1), Low-Intermediate (ESL Level 2), Intermediate (ESL Level 3), and Advanced (ESL Level 4).

Fees for this program vary depending on the course selected. For a full-time, four-week course, the fee is $900, while the part-time course costs $500. The eight-week course fees for full-time are $1695, and for part-time is $900. In case of any dependents accompanying the applicant, additional fees may apply. For students seeking accommodation, the institution offers comprehensive information on private or independently owned housing options.

Besides traditional on-campus classes, the Silicon Valley Intensive English Program at San Mateo Colleges also offers a virtual course option. The Online SVIEP costs $900 for a four-week course and $1695 for an eight-week course.

In summary, Silicon Valley Intensive English Program at San Mateo Colleges offers a highly sought-after English language program, not only for international students but also for those seeking top-quality education. With its exceptional curriculum, multiple time and duration options, and flexibility, SVIEP is a leading program in preparing students for the demands of collegiate studies.
Eligibility Overview: Requirements set forth by federal law allow for the enrollment of non-immigrant students in the F-1 visa category at the Silicon Valley Intensive English Program (SVIEP). In order to qualify for F-1 student status within the United States, it is essential that all entrance standards of the Silicon Valley Intensive English Program are met. By following the detailed instructions below, you can ensure that you meet the necessary requirements set by the US Department of Homeland Security for obtaining a SEVIS Form I-20 Certificate of Eligibility to Non-immigrant Student. With this SEVIS Form I-20, you will be able to successfully apply for an F-1 Student Visa at a US Embassy and enter the United States under F-1 student status.
Placement: No text provided
Accommodation:
SVIEP, like most Intensive English Programs at Community Colleges, does not offer campus housing or assist students in finding housing. However, our program does provide resources for private housing options and highly recommends students to stay with host families. 

For accommodation, we recommend students to stay with homestay families through International Student Placement (ISP). ISP has a successful track record of placing numerous international students with welcoming and secure host families in the San Francisco Bay Area. They carefully select and personally interview each host family to ensure a comfortable living situation for the students. The host homes are conveniently located within a 5-mile radius of our program and offer a diverse range of ethnic backgrounds to match the student's interests and needs. ISP also provides support during the student's stay and offers airport pick-up services at an additional cost.

Name: Indiana State University
Overview:
Indiana State University, located in Terre Haute, Indiana, is a well-known public university. It was established in 1865 by the Indiana General Assembly as the Indiana State Normal School. Over the course of 150 years, it has gained an esteemed position in higher education, providing students with a top-quality education and a fulfilling college experience. The university prides itself on its commitment to learning and innovation, nurturing its students to become ethical and knowledgeable global leaders.

The university comprises six colleges, namely the Bayh College of Education, College of Arts and Sciences, College of Graduate and Professional Studies, College of Health and Human Services, College of Technology, and the Donald W. Scott College of Business. These schools offer a diverse range of courses, providing students with a well-rounded education.

A truly global university, Indiana State attracts students from all over the world, offering them a welcoming and inclusive academic environment. With an acceptance rate of 90%, it is a highly sought-after institution. Indiana State University provides undergraduate, postgraduate, doctoral, and certificate programs, with its most highly ranked courses including Criminology, Business, Technology, Engineering, Liberal Arts, and Psychology.

The university boasts a strong network of alumni who have excelled in various industries, with a 99% placement rate for graduating students. Tuition and accommodation fees average at around $34,000 USD per year. However, Indiana State University also offers a variety of scholarships and grants, which can bring down the cost to $24,000 USD - making it an affordable choice for many students.
Eligibility Overview:
The admission requirements for this university's Master's in Public Administration (MPA) program are as follows:

1. To be eligible for consideration, students must have completed their undergraduate studies from a regionally accredited institution or university, regardless of their academic discipline.
2. A minimum undergraduate grade point average of 2.75 on a scale of 4.00 must be maintained.
3. Prior administrative or managerial experience in the public or nonprofit sectors is preferred, except for students attending classes on campus in Terre Haute.
4. Students must demonstrate proficiency in the English language through a specified proficiency test.
5. The English language proficiency test requirement is mandatory for all applicants.

Requirements for English language proficiency: 

As part of the admissions process, applicants must show evidence of their proficiency in the English language. This can be demonstrated by achieving satisfactory scores on a standardized English language proficiency test. Please note that the minimum required scores may vary depending on the test taken.

Placement:
Here is an overview of our university's internship and employment assistance programs for students. Our goal is to help students gain valuable experience in their desired fields and prepare them for successful careers.

Internships:
We strongly believe in providing hands-on learning opportunities for our students. That's why we offer a variety of internships to support their academic growth. It is mandatory for students registered for a for-credit internship to submit a completed Student Placement Agreement to the Career Center by the fifth day of the semester. Failure to do so may result in an administrative dismissal from the internship course. To ensure a smooth process, we have provided students with detailed guides, including the Internship Handbook and Summer Internship Guidance. Employers looking to host an intern can also benefit from our resources, such as the Host Site Agreement and the Host Site Agreement Workflow. We also have a Student Placement Agreement and step-by-step instructions for completing it. In case of any incidents during an internship, students can report them using our Internship Incident Form. International students can refer to our CPT Frequently Asked Questions guide for more information about internships.

Hosting an Intern:
We encourage organizations to offer internships to our students as a way to contribute to their learning and development. Providing a valuable internship experience can also be beneficial for businesses. Interested employers can refer to our Host Site Agreement to formalize the terms of the internship, and they can use our Host Site Agreement Workflow for a smooth process. We also participate in Indiana INTERNnet, a platform that offers micro-internships, which are short-term, project-based experiences to students. Employers who have internship opportunities can also post them on this platform. To gain more insights, employers can refer to our Indiana INTERNnet Internship How-To Guide.

Finding Internships:
We have multiple resources for students to help them find internships that fit their interests and career goals. Our partnership with Handshake allows students to book appointments with Career Coaches for internship assistance. Students can also explore internships on popular websites like IndianaINTERNnet, Internships.com, LinkedIn, and Parker Dewey. Our university also offers Internship Scholarship Programs with specific criteria to provide targeted experiences to students. We have also introduced a new resource, "Request an Experience" on Handshake, which allows students to apply for experiences, with or without credit, to expand their skills and network.

Employment:
To kickstart their careers, our students have access to top companies through our recruitment programs. These include Amazon, Apple, Barclays, Disney, PepsiCo, Coca-Cola, Rolls Royce, Chicago Cubs, FedEx, Hershey, NCAA, Toyota, Southwest Airlines, Infosys, Chicago Police, Seattle Mariners, Nestle, and many more. We strive to equip our students with the necessary skills and experiences to excel in the job market and succeed in their chosen fields.
Accommodation:
Indiana State University is fully committed to creating an inclusive and accessible environment for students and employees with disabilities. This includes providing necessary accommodations, academic adjustments, and policy changes to ensure equal participation and opportunity in all university programs and activities. Students and employees with disabilities are encouraged to communicate with designated university officials in order to discuss their individual needs and determine appropriate accommodations. Timely and personalized accommodations will be implemented as necessary, with the goal of removing barriers and promoting a level playing field for all individuals.

In accordance with legal requirements and university policy, all medical records and information related to accommodations will remain confidential. To receive accommodations, individuals must self-identify as having a disability and provide documentation from a licensed professional that outlines the impact of their disability on their ability to perform essential job tasks or participate in university activities or services. This is a mutual effort between the university and individuals to ensure equal access and opportunity for all.

Indiana State University is dedicated to providing a campus free of physical and mental barriers. This commitment extends to our websites, which are designed to be accessible to individuals with disabilities. For more information on how to request accommodations, please visit our website. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment for all members of our community. Let us work together to ensure equal opportunity and access for all at Indiana State University.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Bay St. George
Overview:
The College of the North Atlantic, located in Bay St. George, is renowned as one of the foremost educational and technical institutions in Atlantic Canada. With 17 campuses in Canada and a technical college in the Middle East, this college offers a wide range of courses, including 100 full-time and over 300 part-time programs, catering to approximately 25,000 students annually. The Bay St. George campus, encompassing five main buildings, also offers housing for 170 students along with dining facilities. With a strong emphasis on hands-on learning and transferable skills, this institution boasts of low tuition fees compared to other colleges in Canada.

A nationally recognized program, approved by industry experts, is a highlight of this college, allowing students to meet the demands of the industry and expand their horizons through transferable skills. The college also facilitates field opportunities for students to apply their classroom learning in the community. The impressive employment rate of 92% within six months of graduation, speaks volumes about the quality of education and training imparted by the college. As per the US News ranking, College of the North Atlantic is among the top 100 best colleges in National Liberal Arts Colleges.

The college offers a variety of scholarships to deserving students, such as the Country Ribbon Entrance Scholarship, George Baker Most Spirited Award, A. Harvey Group of Companies Entrance Scholarships, Cian Paul and Gerri Charette Bursary, Mary Oliver Memorial Scholarship, and Travis Marche Entrance Scholarship. These scholarships not only provide financial assistance to students but also recognize their academic excellence and dedication.

In conclusion, with its wide range of programs, affordable tuition fees, emphasis on practical learning, and high employability rate, the College of the North Atlantic is not only a preferred choice for students but also an acclaimed center for excellence in education.

Accommodation:
College of the North Atlantic offers a variety of accommodation options to its students. There are both on-campus and off-campus options available, so students can choose the one that best suits their needs.

On-Campus Accommodation at residence halls is available on the Bay St. George, Burin, and Happy Valley-Goose Bay campuses. If you are interested in staying in the residence halls, you can obtain an application form from any of the campuses and submit it to the resident administration office. Please note that due to limited capacity, we cannot guarantee accommodation to all applicants. Applications are processed on a first-come, first-served basis after you have been admitted into your program.

Off-Campus Accommodation is also an option for students. The student affairs office at each campus maintains a list of available boarding rooms in the nearby area. If you are studying at the St. John's campus, you can also apply to live on campus at Memorial University. We regularly update the list of available boarding accommodations near each campus for students to choose from. For example, the Burin campus has MD Property Management, MarystownRogers Rentals, CrestonSmith Realty, and other options on their list.

For more information on student housing, please visit our website at https://www.cna.nl.ca/student-support/student-housing.aspx.

Name: University of Virginia
Overview: Founded in 1819, the University of Virginia (UVA) is a prestigious public research university. The main campus, located in Charlottesville, Virginia, spans over 1,682 acres and has consistently ranked 26th in the nation. In addition to its main campus, UVA also has a college at Wise in Southwest Virginia. The university is composed of 12 schools and research centers that offer 121 majors, 69 postgraduate programs, and 55 doctoral programs. Popular areas of study include Liberal Arts, Humanities, Business, Economics, Health Sciences, International Relations, and Psychology. The College of Arts and Sciences has a strong focus on creative fields such as music, theatre, art, dance, and creative writing, while the School of Architecture excels in Urban Planning and Environmental Design. UVA's law school has a reputation as one of the top 10 law schools in the country. However, the university has a highly selective admissions process, with an acceptance rate of only 26%. Undergraduates must apply through the Common Application, while postgraduate applicants must access specific program pages and pay a fee of $70 USD for undergraduate programs and $85 USD for postgraduate programs. Additionally, applicants must submit academic transcripts, program-specific documents, and scores from English language proficiency tests, as well as SAT or ACT scores. Tuition fees for domestic students are approximately $17,891 USD per year, while international students can expect to pay between $50,000-$62,000 USD annually. It's worth noting that UVA does not offer scholarships, but it does provide need-based loans of up to $7,000 USD per year for international students, along with work-study opportunities. On-campus accommodation options include three residential colleges - Brown Residential College, International Residential College, and Hereford Residential College. These colleges offer single, double, and triple occupancy rooms, and all first-year students are required to live on campus for one year. UVA boasts over 800 clubs and organizations, as well as 17 sports grounds and fields, and various recreational activities such as hiking expeditions on the Appalachian Trail. With an impressive graduation rate of 95%, UVA graduates have a strong track record of securing job placements at top companies, with an average annual salary of $64,000 USD.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria for undergraduate and postgraduate programs vary. All international undergraduate students must fulfill the requirements of the SAT and IELTS exams. In addition to English language proficiency exams, each master's degree program has its own specific prerequisites. Certain courses may require higher academic and English proficiency scores. For detailed qualification requirements, please refer to the respective course page.

Name: Illinois State University
Overview: Illinois State University, founded in 1857, is a renowned public research university and one of the oldest institutions in Illinois. According to the U.S. News and World Report, it ranks 91st among the best public national universities. Originally known as the Illinois State Normal University, it was renamed to Illinois State University in 1964. With a significant enrollment of over 20,000 students annually, ISU ensures that 78% of its students receive financial aid. It also ranks among the top 40 college towns in America, showcasing an excellent quality of life. ISU offers a vast array of programs, including 165 undergraduate degrees, 10 doctoral degrees, over 90 master's degrees, and various interdisciplinary programs through its seven academic colleges. With a strong reputation in fields such as business, marketing, management, and education, these are the most popular majors at ISU. The average cost for a non-resident student living on campus is $43,377 per year, while the cost for an off-campus non-resident student is $43,115.
Eligibility Overview: At our esteemed university, we value diversity and welcome international students to become a part of our education community. To be admitted as an undergraduate student, international applicants must possess a high school GPA transcript of 3.20 - 3.90. In order to be admitted to a postgraduate program, international students must have obtained a minimum GPA of 2.8 out of 4.0 for their last 60 hours of undergraduate studies. We also require all international students to meet our English language proficiency requirements. This includes demonstrating a proficient level of English in both written and spoken forms. This is an essential aspect of the admissions process, as it ensures that students are fully prepared for all academic activities conducted in English. Understanding and effectively communicating in the English language is a highly valued skill in today's global society, and we aim to equip our international students with this key competency to ensure their academic success.

Name: University of Missouri
Overview:
The University of Missouri, established in Columbia in 1839, holds the distinction of being the first public research university located west of the Mississippi River. As a proud member of the esteemed Association of American Universities (AAU), the university remains committed to its motto of promoting the welfare of others. This dedication is reflected in the university's mission to produce conscientious, compassionate and globally aware citizens. Comprised of 14 specialized colleges offering courses in areas such as Agriculture, Arts, Business, Education, Engineering, Health Professions, and Environmental Sciences, the university also boasts a highly acclaimed Graduate School and Honors College. Providing over 400 graduate, undergraduate and doctoral programs with an acceptance rate of 81%, the university is a popular choice among aspiring students. Notable courses include those in the disciplines of Engineering, Business, Education, Law and Medicine. The university has produced many distinguished alumni, including renowned names such as Tennessee Williams and Sheryl Crow. 

With an estimated annual fee of approximately $39,000 which includes accommodation and tuition, the university is amongst the more affordable options. Through the provision of scholarships and grants, the university aims to reduce this cost to approximately $30,000, enabling access to a diverse student population. Spanning across an expansive campus of 1,262 acres, the university boasts a botanical garden featuring over 40,000 plant species. Nurturing a welcoming, inclusive environment, the university provides students with a holistic learning experience. The university facilitates a comprehensive range of facilities including residence halls, libraries, cultural and recreational centers, athletic facilities and conference halls. Moreover, the university boasts an extensive alumni network that greatly aids in achieving excellent placement opportunities for students upon graduation.

Named after the renowned journalist, publisher, and civil rights activist, Lucile Bluford, this residence hall is home to both male and female students. Located on the ground floor are accessible ADA-compliant rooms.

Named after George C. Brooks, the first Black administrator at the University of Missouri. Brooks Hall houses female and male students alike. ADA-compliant rooms are available on certain floors.

CENTER HALL
 
Exclusively for female students in the 2019-20 academic year, Center Hall offers accessible ADA-compliant rooms.

Conveniently located near MizzouRec, College Avenue Hall accommodates both female and male students. Accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available.

DEFOE-GRAHAM HALL
 
Situated near MizzouRec, Defoe-Graham Hall offers accessible ADA-compliant rooms for both male and female students.

DISCOVERY HALL
 
Named after one of the core values of our university, both male and female students reside in Discovery Hall. Accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available.

DOGWOOD HALL
 
Inspired by Missouri's state tree, Dogwood Hall offers both female and male students accessible ADA-compliant rooms.

EXCELLENCE HALL
 
In accordance with one of our university's core values, Excellence Hall accommodates both male and female students. Accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available.

GALENA HALL
 
Named after Missouri's state mineral, Galena Hall offers both female and male students accessible ADA-compliant rooms.

Inspired by the University of Missouri's history as the first public university west of the Mississippi River, Gateway Hall accommodates both female and male students. Accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available.

GILLETT HALL
 
Honoring the university's first female graduate, Mary Louise Gillett, Gillett Hall houses both male and female students. Accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available on certain floors.

HATCH HALL
 
Named after President William Hatch, who sponsored the Hatch Act of 1887 establishing State Agricultural Experiment Stations nationwide, Hatch Hall accommodates both female and male students. Accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available.

HAWTHORN HALL
 
Inspired by Missouri's state flower, Hawthorn Hall offers both female and male students accessible ADA-compliant rooms.

HUDSON HALL
 
Named after the third president of the University of Missouri, William Hudson, this residence hall accommodates both female and male students. Accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available on certain floors.

JOHNSTON HALL
 
Named after the university's first female student dean, Eva Johnston, this residence hall accommodates only female students. A few accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available.

MARK TWAIN HALL
 
Home to Honors College students, this residence hall honors Mark Twain, a renowned author from Missouri. Accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available for both female and male students.

MCDAVID HALL
 
Named after former Board of Curators member, Frank Mitchell McDavid, this residence hall accommodates both female and male students. A few accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available.

North Hall houses both female and male students. A few accessible ADA-compliant rooms are available.

TARA APARTMENTS
 
Designed to cater to the needs of students and their families, Tara Apartments offer various floor options. A peaceful environment and close proximity to campus are just some of the perks.

WOLPERS HALL

Name: New York University
Overview: Established in 1831, New York University (NYU) is among the top-ranked higher education institutions in the United States. It is a prestigious private university with 19 distinguished schools and colleges that cater to diverse academic fields. The university is divided into ten undergraduate and fifteen graduate schools, wherein the Stern School of Business (admission rate of only 8%) and Tisch School of Business (admission rate of 7.6%) are some of the highly sought-after schools. NYU offers an extensive range of over 400 courses that cover various areas, including Accounting, Business, IT, and Public Corporation. It is also one of the few universities that provide specialized courses in domains such as Dance, Film Production, and Tourism Management. To get admitted into NYU, students must fulfill the eligibility criteria, including clearing exams like IELTS, TOEFL, SAT, GMAT, and SRE, and pay an admission fee of USD 80. The university offers three intake sessions- Spring, Summer, and Fall. The tuition fee for undergraduate courses can go up to $70,000, while for postgraduate and B.tech courses, it can exceed $100,000 and $50,000, respectively. However, to make education more accessible, NYU offers need-based financial assistance of $7,500-$15,000 for eligible students. The university boasts a high placement rate, with 84.4% domestic and 90.7% international students securing lucrative employment opportunities. Further, to progress to the next level, students must attain 12-18 credits.

Accommodation:
NYU offers on-campus and off-campus accommodation options for its students. During the academic year and summer session, Residential Life and Housing Services oversees and manages NYU's 22 residential halls and two graduate living communities, housing approximately 12,000 undergraduate and graduate students. Our mission is to foster comfortable, secure, and thriving living environments for all NYU residents, and we work closely with various university departments and student organizations to achieve this goal.

Living in the residence halls plays a crucial role in a student's academic journey, as it promotes a holistic living and learning experience. Our residential facilities include Brooklyn halls such as Clark Street and Othmer Hall, as well as Manhattan halls like Brittany Hall, Founder's Hall, Goddard Hall, Lipton Hall, and Seventh Street.

For students who prefer off-campus living, finding an apartment in New York City may seem like a daunting task. The apartment hunting process can be tricky, even for seasoned New Yorkers. Whether you are an international student, a current NYU housing resident, or exploring new living arrangements, our Center for Student Life has compiled a comprehensive list of resources to assist you in your search.

To aid you in your apartment search, our Center for Student Life has broken down the process into 10 simple steps. These include finding roommates, budgeting and cost considerations, choosing a suitable location, ensuring safety, transportation options, identifying apartment needs and preferences, utilizing online and in-person search methods, working with brokers, understanding the rental process, and arranging for moving, storage, and furniture.

Although NYU does not provide off-campus housing or legal advice, our Center for Student Life is committed to supporting you in your search for suitable off-campus accommodations. We understand that finding the perfect living situation is essential for your overall college experience, and we are here to help you every step of the way. Name: University of Northern Iowa
Overview: Located in Cedar Falls, USA, the University of Northern Iowa (UNI) was founded in 1876. It has achieved recognition as the No. 7 spot in Kiplinger's Personal Finances list of the Top 25 Universities and Colleges Under $30,000 and has been listed among the "Top 100 Values in Public Schools" in the United States. Apart from housing the faculty offices, the campus also boasts renowned buildings namely Baker Hall, Bartlett Hall, Campbell Hall, Bender Hall, Begeman Hall, the Biology Research Complex, the Communication Arts Center, and the Campanile Clocktower. UNI offers a nursing degree program with specializations in health sciences, pre-professional courses, and biology. The university further provides degrees in diverse fields such as communication sciences, family services, gerontology, interior design, textiles and apparel, counseling, art, graphic design, and more. As an international student, you can expect to pay an average tuition fee of $20,565, not including incidental expenses. Financial assistance is available to international students in many forms, including scholarships, work-study opportunities, and various other funding options. Prominent scholarships offered by UNI are the International Excel Award, which can range from $1,000 to $6,000 annually, the International Scholars Award, which can provide financial aid of $5,000 to $66,000, and the UNI Business Scholars Award, which can provide an annual amount of up to $1,000 to deserving applicants with a strong academic background. Get more detailed information about the University of Northern Iowa on Leap Scholar, and explore the suitable course of study to achieve your career goals.
Eligibility Overview:
International students are eligible for admission to the University of Northern Iowa if they meet certain criteria. One of these criteria is having completed a senior secondary or high school education. The minimum grade point requirement must also be met before an international student can be considered for admission. Additionally, official academic records and transcripts must be submitted. It is also important for international students to verify their ability to cover the tuition for the academic year before the deadline.

The University of Northern Iowa offers undergraduate programs in a variety of fields such as Business, Communication & Media, Education and Training, Health, Medical & Social Services, Human Behavior and Culture, Art, Music, Design and Theatre, Literature and Writing, and many others. However, applicants are required to submit their transcripts, which will be evaluated, authenticated, and sent in a sealed envelope from their previous institution.

To be eligible for admission, prospective students must provide the following documents: a high school transcript and certificate, as well as a score on the SAT or ACT. International students are also required to take an English proficiency test.

Graduate programs are available in Arts & Humanities, Behavioral & Health Sciences, Education, Business, Government & Non-Profit, and Science & Technology at the University of Northern Iowa. Applicants must have a minimum general GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale to be considered for admission. Additionally, a three-year bachelor's degree is required to be considered for admission to the University of Northern Iowa.
Placement:
The University of Northern Iowa offers students various job and internship opportunities through its career services office. The office hosts multiple job and internship fairs for students to attend, and also provides assistance in finding suitable internships in their desired location. Students are trained in resume writing and interview skills to help them excel in their job search process.

At the University of Northern Iowa, students can apply for both paid and unpaid internships, with an average hourly pay rate of $12 to $13. Upon graduation, alumni can expect to start their career with a salary ranging from $45,000 to $70,000.

This university provides a wide range of opportunities for students to gain practical experience and prepare for their future careers. With the help of career services and dedicated internship coordinators, students can secure valuable internships and receive professional training that will give them a competitive edge in the job market. Additionally, the university offers various workshops and resources to help students develop essential skills and enhance their employability.

Eligibility Overview:
The University extends offers of regular admission to individuals with a cumulative high school GPA of 2.5 or above. Potential students who do not meet this minimum requirement may still be considered for regular admission if they meet the following criteria: an ACT score between 18-20 (or SAT score between 960-1050) and a GPA of 2.0 or higher. It should be noted that Missouri Western does not require ACT or SAT scores for admission, except for Education or Sport Management majors. However, these scores may also be taken into consideration for course placement and scholarship eligibility.
Individuals who meet any of the following qualifications will automatically be granted regular admission:
1. Graduation from high school with a GPA of 2.0 or higher
2. HiSET score of 75 or above
3. GED score of 680 or above (with no sub score below 150)
4. ACT score of 21 or higher (or SAT score of 1060 or higher)

Name: Augusta University
Overview:
Located in the bustling city of Augusta, Richmond County, USA, Augusta University is a highly esteemed institution offering a diverse range of programs including undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate courses, as well as online degrees for students pursuing distance education. The sprawling main campus of this university serves as a hub for academic and cultural experiences. The average cost of attendance varies for international and domestic students depending on their chosen field of study. At Augusta University, students are provided with endless opportunities to acquire financial aid. Scholarships, work-study programs and other funding options are made available to assist students in their academic pursuits. Furthermore, the university boasts of a dedicated Career Planning Service team that aids students in creating an impressive CV and securing employment opportunities, be it post-graduation, part-time, summer jobs or internships. Eligibility Overview:
The following information pertains to requirements that must be met in order to be accepted to Augusta University. Please note that each requirement has specific guidelines and procedures that must be followed. Failure to comply with any of these could result in rejection of your application.

Completed Application Form - The application must be completed accurately and thoroughly to ensure proper consideration. In addition, all fields must be completed and all necessary documents must be submitted.

Official School Transcripts - Official school transcripts must be sent directly to Augusta University. If the transcript is not in English, it must be translated and accompanied by verified English translations. The transcript must be evaluated and assessed by World Education Services/Joseph Silnu and Associates Inc. on a course-by-course basis.

Proof of English Proficiency - International students must provide proof of English proficiency by achieving a specified score on the TOEFL/IELTS exams. The minimum score requirements vary depending on whether the student's primary language of instruction is English or non-English.

SAT/ACT Scores - International students must also submit their SAT/ACT scores as part of the application process. These scores will be considered as part of the overall evaluation of the student's application.

Note: It is imperative that all requirements and guidelines are strictly adhered to in order to have a successful application to Augusta University. Make sure to provide all necessary documents and follow all procedures carefully to avoid any complications or delays in the application process.

Name: James Madison University
Overview: Established in 1908, James Madison University, located in Harrisonburg, Virginia, is a renowned public research university. It is a top choice for higher education due to its engaged student-faculty relationships. With a wide range of degree programs, including masters, bachelors, and doctorate levels, JMU offers 139 academic programs. Composed of seven colleges, this university offers 78 academic programs. Fresh candidates can choose from 25 residence halls available on campus. The majority of graduate programs at JMU are offered on campus, with additional online coursework available. The university has a lenient application process, with acceptance rates of 82% for freshmen and 66.6% for transfer students as of Fall 2021. Merit-based scholarships are available for eligible candidates. The application fee for JMU is $70, and the annual attendance cost falls between $45,000 to $50,000. According to U.S. News & World Report, JMU ranks first as the most innovative university and as the best college for employment. A remarkable 96% of JMU graduates secure employment within six months of completing their graduation. As per rankings from US News and World Report, JMU holds the third position among Regional Universities in the South in 2021. Wall Street has also placed JMU as the most recommended university. Name: Florida Institute of Technology
Overview:
Florida University is situated in the suburban region of Melbourne, Florida, in the United States. It was founded in 1958 originally known as Brevard Engineering College before changing its name to Florida Institute of Technology in 1966. The university has close ties with the Kennedy Space Center, where it provides education and training for professionals in the space program. The primary campus is conveniently located near Orlando-Melbourne International Airport and covers a sprawling 130 acres of land. Every year, it welcomes an estimated 6,000 students who come to pursue various programs at the undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral levels. The faculty is comprised of highly experienced and knowledgeable professionals who provide students with essential skills and expertise essential for their chosen fields. The university offers more than 200 programs of study, including aeronautical science, aerospace engineering, electrical engineering, computer science, and airport development, to name a few. Other subjects include forensic psychology, animal behavior, biological science, conservation technology, civil engineering, mathematics, and interdisciplinary science.

Florida Institute of Technology boasts state-of-the-art facilities, including lecture halls, a sports arena, computer and research labs, comprehensive classrooms, and conference rooms. It also provides its students with career development services and connects them with top companies for possible job opportunities.

Name: Pittsburg State University
Overview:
Pittsburg State University, situated in Pittsburg, USA, offers diverse academic programs including undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs both on-campus and online. With a focus on Quality education coupled with a wide range of disciplines, specifically in Business, PSU has cemented its position as one of the renowned universities in the region. Apart from the main campus located in Pittsburg, the university offers 8 undergraduate programs and 9 postgraduate programs. The average cost of education could vary for international and domestic students depending upon the program chosen. PSU proudly occupies 98th rank amongst 167 Regional Universities in Midwest and is thoroughly assessed against recognized quality standards. 
Pittsburg State University demands a minimum score of at least 21 in the ACT or 1060 in SAT for freshmen and 2.0 out of 4.0 GPA for all transferrable college credits. Interested freshmen and equivalent diploma holders can attain insightful information from pittstate.edu for entry requirements. 
$35,000 is the estimated expense, education inclusive, for international students, however, PSU has made available multiple grants, work-study, and financial assistance options. Moreover, Career Planning Service, an integral department of PSU, helps students with comprehensive and efficient CV writing and promising job placements, whether full-time or part-time, internships, or even summer employment. Visit Leap Scholar to explore more about PSU and get enrolled in a degree fulfilling your career goals.
Eligibility Overview:
For automatic admission to this university, high school graduates must meet the following criteria:
- Have a minimum GPA of 2.25 on a 4.0 scale or higher
OR
- Have a composite ACT score of 21 or above (or a SAT score of 1060)
- Completed the Kansas precollege curriculum (or the equivalent for non-residents) with a minimum GPA of 2.0 (or 2.5 for non-residents)
AND
- Meet one of the following requirements:
  - Have a composite ACT score of 21 or above (or a SAT score of 1060)
  - Rank in the top one-third of their graduating class
  - Have at least a 2.0 GPA on all transferable college credits (if applicable)
  *Please note that all math units must be at least Algebra I, unless a 22 or higher is achieved on the ACT Math test or 1 college credit is earned in College Algebra.
  *The natural science units must include at least one unit of Chemistry or Physics.

Name: University of North Florida
Overview:
The University of North Florida, founded in 1969, is a well-known public institution situated in Jacksonville, Florida. The campus spans over 1,318 acres and comprises of 18 buildings. The university has six colleges, offering a variety of degrees including one year certificates, associate degrees, bachelor's degrees, master's degrees, and five doctoral degrees. These colleges are the Brooks College of Health, Coggin College of Business, College of Arts and Science, College of Computing, Engineering and Construction, College of Education and Human Services, and the Hicks and Honors College. With 60 undergraduate programs, 36 graduate programs, and five doctoral programs, the university offers a diverse range of courses in liberal arts, science, and commerce.

Some notable flagship programs at the University of North Florida include international business, nursing, coastal biology, music, logistics, and transportation. The university is popular for majors in liberal arts & humanities, research & experimental psychology, communications, nursing, and health service preparatory services. The course tuition fee is USD 21,379.

The university provides on-campus residence services to its students. These residences are equipped with lounges, kitchens, laundry, internet services, and relaxation areas. Special housing facilities are also available for students with disabilities. The cost per semester, including accommodation and meals, is USD 13,869.

The University of North Florida boasts over 200 student clubs and organizations active on campus. It also offers amenities and services such as career services, counseling center, LGBTQ center, military and veterans resource center, student accessibility services, student health services, and the Taylor Leadership Institute. For students interested in sports, summer camps are offered in baseball and basketball.

The university has two galleries, the university gallery and the intercultural gallery, which host a variety of exhibitions promoting cultural awareness and exchange. It also provides students with funding through grants, loans, and merit-based scholarships, based on their individual needs, costs, and available funds. Post-graduation, the university assists students with job placements.
Eligibility Overview:
This information pertains to a college institution. The admission process for non-citizens and non-permanent residents follows the same guidelines as citizens and permanent residents. However, due to varying processing requirements, it is recommended to submit applications and other admission materials promptly. Please note that most US students typically apply for university admission one year prior to their intended start date. 

Transcripts from international high schools and post-secondary institutions will be considered by UNF. However, a limited number of international transcripts will be accepted without a foreign evaluation. For all other transcripts, a course-by-course evaluation (for post-secondary institutions) or a document-by-document GPA calculation (for high schools) is required from an approved third-party credential evaluation firm, as per the Florida Department of Education guidelines. 

All applicants, except for those from countries where English is the only official language, must demonstrate proficiency in the English language. Please refer to "Indicators of Required English Language Proficiency for Foreign Applicants" for a list of acceptable methods to meet the standards. 

Test scores are required for both undergraduate and graduate applicants. Freshman and sophomore applicants must submit scores for the ACT or SAT, with a minimum score of 460 in critical reading and math (SAT) or 500 in evidence-based reading and writing and math (rSAT). The required score is based on the high school grade point average. For graduate applicants, the GMAT or GRE is required, depending on the program. A minimum score of 20 in the verbal component and 22 in the quantitative component is required for the GMAT, with specific minimum scores for the Master of Accountancy and Master of Business Administration programs. GRE scores must be above 1000 (combined verbal and quantitative components), with specific minimum requirements set by each department.

The university has six residence halls named Osprey Cove, Osprey Crossings, Osprey Fountains, Osprey Hall, Osprey Landing, and Osprey Village. Name: Chapman University
Overview:
Chapman University, one of the most distinguished private universities in Woodland, California, has been in operation since 1861. With a sprawling campus spanning 901 acres, this university offers a plethora of undergraduate and graduate programs across its ten schools and colleges located throughout the state. What has now become a top-ranked university was initially established as Hesperian College. However, in 1991, it gained university status, thanks to its exceptional academic offerings and student outcomes. 
At Chapman University, students can choose from a wide range of educational programs, including 53 master's, 60 Ph.D., and 65 bachelor's degree programs. The university is well-known for its diverse subject offerings, such as Business Administration, Advertising, Accounting, Journalism, Marketing, Engineering, and more. Filmmaking, Psychology, Corporate Communication are some other sought-after programs here. 
A notable feature of Chapman University is its stellar placement record. Prominent global companies like Deloitte, Johnson and Johnson, Disney, Netflix, and Google always have openings for Chapman University graduates. The university has a star-studded faculty, which includes renowned authors, Nobel Laureates, Academy Award winners, and other distinguished professionals. Moreover, students also benefit from college internships, which provide hands-on experience in their chosen field. 
Chapman University also offers accommodation options for students. The university's on-campus housing comes equipped with several conveniences like food, laundry, furniture, and more. Additionally, students can seek assistance in finding suitable rental accommodations near the campus. 
Although the annual cost of attending Chapman University can go as high as 79,518 USD, the university also offers scholarships and financial aid to students in need. With its exceptional academic offerings, renowned faculty, and industry partnerships, Chapman University is undoubtedly a popular choice among aspiring students.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements for international students vary depending on their level of study. Undergraduate applicants must provide proof of completing the 12th grade in relevant subjects from a recognized educational board, while some courses may also require SAT or ACT scores. Postgraduate candidates must have a 3-4 year bachelor's degree in a similar field from an accredited university, and certain MBA, MS, and PhD programs may also require GRE or GMAT scores. Additionally, all applicants must meet the English proficiency requirements, which vary depending on the program and may include standardized test scores such as TOEFL or IELTS.

The university also has various communication platforms in place, including an official job board and employment portal, where employers can pre-screen, analyze, train, recruit, and even hire outstanding students for internships. Accommodation:
The data below pertains to housing options for students at Chapman University.

On-campus accommodation is a requirement for first-year students at Chapman University. Typically, three students will be assigned per room during their first year. Applications for housing must be submitted by mid-May. The following residence halls are available for first-year students: Henley Hall, Morlan Hall, Pralle-Sodaro Hall, Glass Hall, and Sandhu Residence Center.

Graduate and law students also have limited access to on-campus housing. Those interested in living on campus must fill out a Graduate and Law Student Housing Request Form. Please note that housing is not guaranteed, and students will be notified in late May or early June if space is available.

There are various off-campus housing options located within a few blocks of the main campus. Students can choose from apartment complexes or rent a room, guest suite, or entire house. Any off-campus housing must undergo a security check. Students should also consider additional costs and amenities when making a decision. It is essential to conduct thorough research before investing in off-campus housing options as they are typically under contract.

Name: Queens College of The City University of New York
Overview:
With a rich history dating back to 1937, the Queens College at The City University of New York has gained widespread recognition for its strong focus on liberal arts, science and pre-professional programs. It was originally established by a committee appointed by County Judge Charles S. Colden with the aim to provide free education in Queens. The university has since then received accreditation from the highly regarded Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE). It currently boasts a student body of over 20,000 individuals and offers state-of-the-art amenities such as advanced laboratories, a six-story Rosenthal library, and a dedicated music room. Attracting students from more than 150 countries, it has established itself as a global education hub.

Spanning across an impressive 80-acre campus, Queens College of The City University of New York has been consistently offering a diverse range of courses and programs for the past 28 years. Divided into four main segments - arts and humanities, mathematics and natural science, social science, and education - the institution is committed to providing a well-rounded education to its students. One of its key strengths is its emphasis on research projects, which has been a major contributor to its success over the past 75 years. The university currently maintains a moderately selective acceptance rate of approximately 53%. With a student-faculty ratio of 17:1, the institution ensures personalized attention to students, leading to an impressive student retention rate of 83%.

Having earned the 50th position in Regional Universities North, Queens College of The City University of New York is well-regarded for its academic excellence. The fee structure for out-state students is highly competitive, ranging between $15,000 to $20,000, making it an affordable option for students seeking exceptional education. To assist deserving students, the university offers a variety of scholarships and financial aid options. Furthermore, graduate students are offered extensive internship opportunities and regular updates on employment opportunities through the university's official website. This has enabled a vast majority of graduates to secure job placements within a year of completing their education, further solidifying the university's success.
Eligibility Overview: International applicants must provide proof of English proficiency by submitting standardized test scores such as TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, ESL, and/or SAT. These are considered as evidence of English language proficiency. The university requires all international applicants to meet the English language requirements, which means they must achieve a satisfactory score on one or more of these tests in order to be considered for admission.

Name: American University
Overview:
American University, located in Washington, D.C, is a highly-regarded private research institute founded in 1893 with a strong affiliation to the Methodist faith. With an acceptance rate of 36% and a diverse student body of over 14,000, the university is known for its academic rigor and numerous accolades. The institution consists of eight schools and colleges, including the prestigious Kogod School of Business and the Washington College of Law, offering a total of 79 bachelor's, 89 master's, and 11 doctoral degree programs. Students have the opportunity to pursue a wide range of fields, including Accounting, Business, Entertainment Management, French Studies, Journalism, and Literature. 

The university's expansive 90-acre campus is situated in the heart of Washington, D.C.'s residential district, providing students with a vibrant and dynamic setting for their studies. Bender Library, the main library at American University, offers an extensive collection of both print and online resources, as well as various study spaces for students. The university also boasts over 1200 Key Executive Leadership Programs, such as the Executive Leadership Certificate and Executive Master of Public Administration, which allow students to develop important management and leadership skills. 

For students looking to improve their English language skills and gain a better understanding of American culture, the English Language and Training Academy offers a variety of programs. Additionally, American University offers more than 20 online professional certificate and degree programs with a focus on fields such as Tableau Data Analytics, Healthcare Management, and International Relations and Business. The university also provides various pre-college programs, such as the AU Gap Program and Discover the World of Communication Program, which give high school students the opportunity to participate in internships, field trips, seminars, and more. 

Students at American University also have the chance to study abroad at partner institutions or one of AU's overseas centers, including locations in Nairobi and Madrid. These programs offer students a unique opportunity to experience a different culture, participate in internships, and attend summer study programs. 

The average cost for undergraduate students to attend American University is estimated at USD 26,855, while graduate tuition costs USD 1,812 per credit hour. However, the university offers various financial aid options, including scholarships, loans, and grants, such as the Federal Pell Grant, Southern Management Scholarship, and Federal Direct Parent PLUS Loan. 

On-campus housing options at American University include Anderson Hall, Centennial Hall, and Nebraska Hall, which offer a variety of accommodations, such as doubles, triples, traditional rooms, suites, and apartments. These residential halls provide students with a safe and comfortable living environment on campus. 

Apart from academics, American University also offers a vibrant campus life with over 200 clubs and organizations for students to join. The university also has various intramural and club sports teams, including baseball, golf, and equestrian. With an impressive 93% of graduates finding employment within six months of graduation, American University provides students with a well-rounded education and prepares them for success in their chosen careers.
Eligibility Overview:
The admission criteria for American University include the following requirements for international students:Requirements for Undergraduates- An official secondary school certificate or diploma must be provided
- Demonstrated proficiency in the English language is mandatoryRequirements for Graduates- A bachelor's degree in a relevant field with a minimum CGPA/grade as specified by the course requirements
- Some schools may require relevant professional experience as well- Proficiency in the English language is required for non-research based postgraduate programmesMBA Prerequisites- An above average GPA in undergraduate studies is preferred
- Official GMAT or GRE scores must be submitted
- Relevant full-time professional work experience is highly recommended
- Proficiency in the English language is mandatory

Other notable recruiters include booz allen hamilton.

The available options for accommodation at this university include both on-campus and off-campus choices. Students who opt for on-campus housing are provided with lodging and a meal plan. Name: Northwest Missouri State University
Overview: Northwest Missouri State University, situated in Maryville, Missouri, is a public university established in 1905. It is spread over 370 acres of land and is governed by the "Board of Regents." The university boasts a remarkable athletic and sports team with an impressive record of 47 national championships. Apart from its academic programs, Maryville's picturesque mountainous setting offers a peaceful and conducive environment for students. The university is also recognized for its safety and security measures on campus. It provides an opportunity for students to go hiking and explore the city. Northwest Missouri State University is synonymous with quality education and offers more than 850 educational programs abroad in 60 countries. The students are accommodated in residential buildings categorized for freshman and upper-class, providing all necessary amenities. The university also has a wide range of sports and student organizations, promoting a stress-free and enjoyable campus life. Popular subjects at Northwest include marketing, agriculture, psychology, business, journalism, education, and communication. To secure admission, students must obtain impressive scores on the GMAT/GREs. Each year, the university offers over 12,000 campus placement opportunities to its students. About 96% of the graduates get internships and jobs, while some opt for part-time jobs to cover their daily expenses. Over 7,000 students enroll annually, determined to achieve academic excellence and excel in their careers. The average cost of studying at Northwest Missouri State University is $15,498. The university provides scholarships to approximately 87% of the newly admitted students, making it a highly sought-after institution for higher education.
Eligibility Overview:
Admissions requirements for applicants not submitting an ACT or SAT score:

To be eligible, students must have a minimum 3.00 grade-point average and have completed a college-preparatory curriculum in high school. Students who have completed the GED or HiSET are also eligible with a minimum score of 660 on the GED or a minimum score of 75 on the HiSET.

Exceptions for applicants who must submit an ACT or SAT score for admission include those who plan to accept scholarship offers based on their admission, home-schooled students, and unaccredited high school graduates.

Students with a GPA lower than 3.00 and/or who have not completed the high school college-preparatory curriculum are not eligible for admission.

Name: Chatham University
Overview:
Chatham University, founded in 1869, is a premier institution located in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania that offers over 60 graduate and undergraduate programs in various fields including arts and sciences, sustainability, health, and business and communication. With a student body of more than 2,200, Chatham University is highly regarded in the US education system and provides both online and on-campus learning options. It is classified as a Master's college by Carnegie Classification and offers degrees in areas such as a PhD or professional practice.

The admission process at Chatham University is slightly selective, with an acceptance rate of approximately 55%. However, the university is committed to ensuring that about 82% of its students receive financial aid or scholarships. This highlights the importance placed on making education accessible to all.

Students at Chatham University can choose from a diverse range of undergraduate courses including Biochemistry, Online Business Administration, Criminology, Chemistry, Biology, Accounting, Economics, Environmental Science, and History. Moreover, the university has been recognized for its sustainable practices and has received a Gold rating by the Association for the Advancement of Sustainability in Higher Education.

In the US News National Universities ranking of 2021, Chatham University was ranked 187th. Additionally, it was ranked 114th as the Best Value school and 29th as a top performer in Social Mobility. The university also prioritizes gender equity and supports women's leadership through its distinguished education programs and outreach initiatives.

Name: University of Alabama at Birmingham
Overview: Founded in 1969, The University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) is a public research university in the United States. Originally established as an academic extension center in 1936, it evolved into a four-year campus in 1966 and gained full autonomy in 1969. UAB is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools and offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and professional degree programs. With 140 programs under 12 academic divisions, UAB has nine schools and two colleges, including the School of Engineering, School of Business, School of Medicine, School of Education, School of Dentistry, School of Nursing, School of Health Professions, School of Optometry, and School of Public Health. In 2010, the College of Arts and Sciences was established, followed by the creation of the Honors College in 2012. Boasting eight libraries spread across the campus, UAB's highest-ranked program is its Master of Science in Health Administration. Its sprawling campus features a state-of-the-art 150,000-square-foot recreation center, complete with basketball and volleyball courts, aerobics studios, cardio-fitness area, game rooms, indoor track, and climbing wall. The university is also affiliated with UAB Health System (UABHS), a private not-for-profit organization comprising faculty from the School of Medicine, formed in partnership with the University of Alabama Health Services Foundation. UAB provides on-campus accommodation options, including six residence halls, with an average housing cost of 7,612 USD and a meal plan cost of 1,660 USD per semester. More than 130 organizations offer scholarships and financial aid to students at UAB, making it an affordable option for higher education.
Eligibility Overview: The admission requirements that a student must fulfill to be eligible for consideration are as follows: In order to be admitted to a graduate program, international applicants must possess a four-year bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in the United States. Additionally, they must demonstrate proficiency in the English language by taking a recognized English language proficiency test. The university expects international applicants to have a level of English proficiency that is equivalent to that of a native speaker. Meeting these criteria is crucial in order to be considered for admission.
