Accommodation:
Kean University is a well-respected institution spread across a vast 121.5-acre campus in Union Township, New Jersey. Within its premises, students have access to cutting-edge facilities such as the Nancy Thompson Library, Human Rights Institute, and Jack Lane Centre for Academic Success, all of which cater to their academic needs. The university has estimated the average cost of attending to be around USD 31,000 per annum, taking into consideration all necessary expenses. Moreover, with more than 160 student clubs, sororities, and fraternities, students from every corner of the campus can partake in various activities and create an active student life throughout their academic journey. Kean University also offers counseling and health services to ensure the well-being of all students during their stay. This, coupled with the university's athletic team, the Kean University Cougars, participating in various sports tournaments all over the nation, guarantees a well-rounded experience for every student. 
The housing application process at Kean University is open only to accepted students, who receive their unique university login credentials and their acceptance packet. To initiate the application, students must visit the Housing Portal and log in using their Kean credentials. Next, they must select "Housing Applications and Requests" and then click on "2022-2023 Application" to begin. The university offers a variety of residence halls, each with its unique amenities, to cater to students' diverse needs. 
1. Cougar Hall: This traditional-style residence hall features suites with two double bedrooms connected by a kitchenette. Each suite comes equipped with a private bathroom with a shower and essential furniture such as beds, closets, workstations, and desk chairs in each bedroom. The building's first floor houses a Great Area lounge, game room, business center, food warming room, and a small Bistro. Additionally, there are two study lounges and one social room on each residential floor, and two resident aides cater to each floor's needs. The suites also have independent temperature control settings for heating and air conditioning, and amenities such as cable and internet are included.
2. Freshman Residence Hall: The newly built first-year residence hall offers traditional-style suites with two double bedrooms connected by a common area. The rooms share a private bathroom with a shower and come equipped with essential furniture such as beds, wardrobes, workstations, and desk chairs. On the main level of the complex, students have access to a big lounge, a game room, multipurpose rooms, and a laundromat-style laundry room with coinless washers and dryers. Additionally, there are two resident assistants and a floor lounge on each residential floor, and amenities like cable television, telephone, and internet access are also included.
3. Bartlett Hall / Rogers Hall / Sozio Hall / Burch Hall:
These apartment-style residence halls offer a living room, fully equipped kitchen, dining space, and a private bathroom for students. Each bedroom comes furnished with two beds, two wardrobes, two desks, and two desk chairs. The kitchens offer a full-size refrigerator, microwave, sink area, and cabinet space. The premises also feature a community center, kitchen, and laundromat-style laundry room on the first floor. The unique factor of Sozio Hall is that it remains open during winter holidays, and the graduate community resides on the 6th floor. Similarly, Bartlett Hall houses the transfer community on the 5th floor.
4. Upperclass Residence Hall: This residence hall offers apartments that comprise either two to three bedrooms for double occupancy or four single bedrooms. Each apartment has its heating and air conditioning settings, and the living room comes equipped with sofas, chairs, end tables, and a TV stand. Furthermore, the kitchen area features a round dining table, four chairs, a full-size refrigerator, and ample cabinet space. On the first level, students have access to a 300-seat "all-you-can-eat" cafeteria, a 50-seat screening room, student mailboxes, vending machines, a computer lab, and a multipurpose and game room. The residence hall also has laundry facilities and a community center for students' convenience.

Name: Auburn University at Montogomery
Overview:
The Auburn University at Montgomery is a renowned institution situated in Montgomery, USA, providing exceptional education to its diverse student body. The university offers a comprehensive range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs across several domains, including online studies for distance education students. The institution's main campus is situated in Montgomery and boasts over eight undergraduate programs and six postgraduate programs with varying costs for international and domestic students. Additionally, the institution extends scholarships, work-study schemes, and other forms of funding to its students. With its dedicated Career Planning Service, the University aids students in developing their CVs, securing jobs, internships, and other opportunities upon graduation, including part-time and summer jobs.

The average cost of tuition and fees is 11,796 USD for undergraduate students and 31,956 USD for domestic students. Undergraduate students typically enroll in 12 credits per semester, while graduate students enroll in nine credits per semester. Admission to Auburn University is highly competitive and largely based on students' high school GPA, with a minimum requirement of 3.85. SAT/ACT scores are also taken into account, with a minimum of 29/1330 required. In addition, the institution considers students' essays, leadership skills, and service histories. Current Auburn students with an unadjusted GPA of 3.4 are also given preference in the admission process.

This requirement is in place to ensure that all students are capable of understanding and communicating effectively in English. By fulfilling this language proficiency requirement, international students can be confident in their ability to succeed academically and socially at our institution.

Name: Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology
Overview:
Located in Terre Haute, Indiana, Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is a private coeducational university with a focus on teaching science, engineering, and math. It was established in 1874 and is currently under the leadership of President Robert A. Coons.

The primary academic emphasis at Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is its undergraduate curriculum, but the institution also offers graduate studies in eight different disciplines. The curriculum places a strong emphasis on engineering and the natural sciences, and all of its programs, including software engineering, biomedical engineering, optical engineering, chemical engineering, and computer science, are accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET).

Spread across 1300 acres, the campus of Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is home to eight social fraternities and three social sororities, with some of them having houses on site. The institute also offers student-centered services like the Homework Hotline, which provides free homework assistance and tutoring to middle and high school students in Indiana. Additionally, Rose-Hulman Enterprises, an annex of the institution, provides internship and employment opportunities to its students and alumni with various businesses, both new and established.

Notable alumni of Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology include figures such as Abe Silverstein, an American engineer; Tim Cindric, the president of Team Penske; Marshall Goldsmith, an American coach; Ernest R. Davidson, an author; Art Nehf, a baseball player; Don Lincoln, an American physicist; Bernard V. Vonderschmitt, an electrical engineer; Jim Umpleby, the CEO of Caterpillar; Lawrence J. Giacoletto, an American electrical engineer; and Matt Branam, the current president of Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology.
Eligibility Overview:
Important Information Regarding International Students:

For international students who are interested in applying, there are certain criteria that must be met. These requirements include the following:

1. Educational Background: All eligible applicants must have completed a minimum of 12 years of education in order to be considered for admission.

2. Transcripts: Applicants must submit official transcripts from all previous schools attended.

3. GPA Requirements: A minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale is required for consideration.

4. Standardized Test Scores: International students must submit official scores from nationally recognized college entrance examinations such as the SAT or ACT.

5. English Proficiency Scores: Proof of English language proficiency is mandatory for all international applicants. The minimum required scores are as follows:

- TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language): A minimum score of 80 on the internet-based test or 550 on the paper-based test is required.

- IELTS (International English Language Testing System): A minimum score of 6.5 is required.

- PTE (Pearson Test of English): A minimum score of 53 is required.

Please note that meeting these requirements does not guarantee admission into our university. All applicants will be evaluated on a holistic basis and our admissions committee will consider factors such as letters of recommendation, personal essays, and extracurricular activities in addition to academic performance. We welcome and encourage applications from international students and strive to create a diverse and global community on our campus.
